This place is the meca of the chain.  It's the original and opened in 1940s.  They have the standard menu pluss a whole other menue.  Which has so many homemade sides.  This is a go to if in ATL.  I will be back everytime I come to Atlanta.

The first ever Chick Fil A! If you are a Chick Fil A fan, and are in the Atlanta area- you need to make a stop here. 

This location offers a drive through, regular quick serve, and sit down service. The sit down service is the best, and draws a line, for the shortest wait and quickest service take a seat the bar. The sit down section offers all day breakfast and other unique menu options that all Chick Fil A's do not offer. 

The regular quick serve is a bit slow, but the people behind the register are the friendliest you will ever meet. You can also purchase merchandise from them such as pens, shirts, cows, coffee mugs, water bottles, etc. I would suggest putting your merchandise order in before you eat since they're a little slow. 

This location is not ideal for large groups as none of the seating can accommodate it unless you are willing to split up.

And yes, you can use the small dwarf door!

This is the Publix of Fast Food joints.......My FA-VO-RITE Chick-fil-A location in the whole wide world is right here in my hometown. Yeah! Hapeville in day house! :)

I just thought I'd say that I still love this place! Although y'all been slipping on the Lemonade lately (Too tart. Add sugar), I still think that this place has been more consistant than ANY other fast food restaurant in Metro Atlanta. Or at least since I was a little girl. :)

I can always be certain that my food will taste good, be warm and that I will be greeted with a smie. The staff here always seems so happy. That's a great feeling to know that you support a company that must be treating it's employees well. 

The drive through can some times be long. Very Long! But they move you along quickly. Inside is going to be busy as well. So come with some patience and know that your meal will not disappoint you. And if you GO INSIDE you will find several items on that menu that you may have had no idea is sold at a "Fast Food" joint. They have the yummy Hot Brown, Veggies like Collard Greens, Brocolli and Cheese and a little cow, like Steak and Hamburger. Yep. BEEF....Now we know why the cows are so dramatic. They are broilin' 'em up in this joint! Who knew? :)

And they always tell you "It's my pleasure!". See told y'all they are in straight Publix mode up in here.  LOL....I'm silly okay! :)

If you want a more detailed report see Chad  E's review. It's very detailed!
I love the fact that their open 24 hours .breakfast is my favorite food ,so the chicken biscuit it my go to .

I love Chick- Fil- a so when my bf suggested we go to the one in Georgia I was so ready! I love a good breakfast spot. I'm a soul food type of girl. I wish the Mac n cheese was creamier and less powdery, and the corn muffins were disappointing. Where's the buttery and honey sweet goodness that comes with real corn muffins.

A couple of months ago someone at work mentioned something called a "Dwarf House" and that it was somehow affiliated with Chick Fil-A. What?! This had to be made up! But Wikipedia and Google promptly confirmed that indeed, Chick Fil-A has its origins in this so-called "Dwarf House" in Hapeville, Georgia. The Dwarf House is still a full service diner open 24/6 - like all Chick Fil-A restaurants, closed on Sundays. And everything I see on the internet about this place indicates to me that I ABSOLUTELY MUST GO.

I did this morning - it's about a mile off of 75 south of the city. From the front, the little red dwarf door looked sort of like it was locked, so I was pleasantly surprised to find that it was not. My friend and I walked through it with glee. We pointed and giggled at the moving wall display of seven dwarfs exiting their house and trotting off to the mines. We looked at the photographs of the Dwarf House through the years. We read the story of its founding in the captions. 

My friend and I seemed to be the only ones delighting in the dwarfiness, however. The rest of the clientele appeared to be regulars or locals for whom any dwarf-related novelty had long since worn off. They also seemed to leer at us, though my friend noticed this more than I did. 

Aside from the splashes of German cottage decor, the place looks like the love child of a Chick Fil-A and a down-home diner. It's full service, with booths, barstools, and an overhead dimly illuminated menu with plastic removable lettering. But the colors are decidedly Chick Fil-A, and the place still displays those abhorrent advertisements involving cows that know how to write, but not spell. These cow advertisements, by the way, are my least favorite major advertising campaign that has lasted more than a year, EVER. But don't get me started on that. 

We immediately took our seats at a not-yet wiped down booth, the only one available at 10:14 on a Saturday morning. I was a bit antsy because the menu said that they were going to stop serving biscuits at 10:30. A busboy came by first to clear the previous occupants' dishes. A few minutes later, someone came to take our drink orders. After asking for water, I warned this person that I fully intended to order a biscuit, and she said that would not be a problem. In fact, she said I had forty minutes left, so perhaps the menu is incorrect as to the no more biscuit time? I didn't care, as long as I got mine. 

I ordered an egg and cheese biscuit, and hash browns with cheese and onions. The hash browns came out first, and without the onions. The biscuit came out seconds later. My friend ordered the chick fil-a chicken breakfast, which consists of two biscuits, grits, eggs any style, and a boneless piece of battered chicken. The wait time was only minutes. I am not shy about grease, and the food was delightful. The biscuit was slightly crumbly but very moist - Chick Fil-a does biscuits a little differently, and not everyone likes them. I happen to love them. The scrambled egg was not quite as processed and perfectly squared as it is when it comes from a fast-food joint. The cheese was, of course, an American cheese single. Mmmmmm. The hash browns were crispy, all golden brown and dripping in oil, just how I like them. 

After paying our bill of $11, we exited through the little door again. I stopped to play with the round door knocker on the other side, knocking several times. No answer. I did not have the opportunity to try either a fried apple pie or the "ice box pie" in lemon, chocolate, or coconut. But that's next on my list. 

So Chick Fil-A managed to trick me into feeling like I went to this cute local diner for breakfast today, when really I just patronized another fast food giant. Nonetheless, I am definitely going back to Dwarf House at every available opportunity.

Chick-fil-a is always good. Several service takers awaiting you at the drive through. Fast preparation. Fun to know you are eating from the original restaurant. Friendly service. You can't go wrong here.

I can't believe I went all these years living in Atlanta without coming here. 

This Chick-fil-A has two separate parts: a regular fast food Chick-fil-A and the Dwarf House sit-down experience. The former needs little to no explanation, but the latter is an experience onto itself. Closer to a Waffle House than a Chick-fil-A but also with dwarf animated decorations and a red dwarf door. 

The sit down portion includes a separate menu including grits, hot brown (casserole dish with chicken, potatoes, gravy, and bacon), and steak (gasp!). I guess the cow marketing tactic only applies to the fast food chain? I had the chicken platter, which is essentially the #1 (Chick-fil-A sandwich with waffle fries) on a plate instead of fast food wrappings. Just as delicious as always. Dining companion M had the hot brown, which was a solid choice as well.

Service is hospitable, fast, and charming. Feel free to grab a Chick-fil-A souvenir on your way out--including shirts, mugs, and stuffed cows.

Great place with great service.  This place is ALWAYS packed, literally morning, noon or night.  I have been here at 3 a.m. and the place was so busy it looked like 12 noon.  It's 24/6 and they close at 10pm on Saturday and all day Sunday.  

The DWARF HOUSE is a different and also same menu.  On the Dwarf House side you can get vegetables like delicious Sweet Potato Souffle (wonderful!!) and fried okra (also wonderful!), as well as chicken finger platter etc.   

The DWARF HOUSE has wonderful iced box lemon, chocolate and coconut pies that you can't get at the Chick fil-a.

I was first here in 1946 after the War when I was three-years-old. Then it was simply the Dwarf House. It is my favourite diner in the world. The chicken salad sandwich was my favourite item and it still is. Mr Cathy used to make them in person in 1946.
Don't tell the cows, he also grilled great burgers back then His breakfast was top notch and the business still pays attention to that meal. This is not breakfast as Café Louis in Baton Rouge but it is more than enough for a Saturday morning late breakfast. 

This is more than Mecca for me though it is indeed the center of the world for diners. M Hapeville is worth seeing just for the history alone. 

Delta Airlines is still nearby though Porsche has replaced Ford Motor Company as the other major company in town. The airport workers and auto workers built this first in the empire place. 

Mr. Cathy always had a flare for design and his first Dwarf was a marvel with much more to come over the decades. Atlanta has many diners who became famous chains but the two iconic fast food places were and still are this little place in Hapewille with its sibling in Forest Park and their neighbour on North Avenue and other places--the Varsity--the cornerstones of pop culture in Atlanta, right up there with Coca-Cola. 

I still go for the chicken salad sandwich but there is always much more to celebrate. I admired Mr. Cathy. He treated me like a regular customer (which I was) when I was a lad. I did not agree with him in all ways but he was a heck of fellow.

Chick fil A  has the best customer service experience, than any other fast food chain. This location fails to meet this high expectation of service. I ordered a #2 meal and the sandwich didn't have a top bun. No problem mistakes happens when I came back to tell them that's when I got irritated, they asked me if I just wanted another top bun or if I would like it to be remade ? This is the perfect example of a stupid question. Any other location would have given me another meal !!, this is the  Last time I come to this location ! Might as well go to McDonald's.

So I came after work on a Wednesday night and surprising this place was packed at 10:30pm! I never waited so long at a Chick-fil-A nearly 30 minutes. The Parking here is very tight and space to get around as well. As the original place I would think they expand or even make it greater and better. Besides the late hours I've been to other location with better quicker service.
The food was really good. The waffle was amazing but my bacon was a little cold. The customer service was excellent overall.

First ever visit to a Chick-fil-A and it happens to be the first ever Chick-fil-A. The chicken deluxe sandwich wad very tasty. Yes I will be eating at this chain again. Its all good and go visit this store.
Monday thur Friday 24 hours. Dorothy Burd was the best. So kind and sweet. Her alone with this place was a pleasure. Thank you guys for all you do. Thots was so rare.
Judge all Chick-fil-A restaurants off the Tulsa Hills location.  The place was friendly, fast, and clean.  Food was consistent.

It's been a while since I was last here, but it's not as good as I remember it. Not sure if it's me or them or both. 

We strolled up to the bar - no wait. There was a wait for tables. The menu is different than a typical Chick-fil-A. I got chicken and waffles (breakfast item but they still had it available). I forgot what the companion got - maybe a fried chicken sandwich with waffle fries and a veggie side. I also tried the peach pie which was not good - like sweet jam in a stale, buttery shell - and the lemon box pie - which was very very sweet and unevenfully thawed. Also tried the lemon drink. The waitress ignored what size we requested. We were also a little grossed out watching the food being cooked... so we probably won't come here again and will stick to the regular locations.

Truett Cathy's first restaurant did not disappoint! Definitely a diner vibe but doesn't lack on the hospitality. Food was a mix of CFA items & classic diner fare, not to mention breakfast all day. Not super speedy but sit back, relax, & enjoy. 

Don't skip the lemon pie- it's excellent!
This is one of the best places to eat. They have the best customer service around. I wish other food chains could be like them. Thank you all for your hard work.

One of my favorite things about visiting Atlanta is the Chick-fil-a Dwarf House. It's southern diner meats Chick-fila; where the grits come with cheese and the service comes with a 'My pleasure'. It's always hard for me to choose between the normal Chick-fil-a menu and the Dwarf House original menu. Last time we were there, I ordered the chicken and cornbread meal with mac n cheese. It was literally the best thing ever. If you're in Atlanta for fun, or even if you've got a layover (CFA DH is near the airport), visit this little place...you won't regret it!

Why did I not go to this place a long time ago. Great and fun. Can order regular menu or do the sit down full service menu . Had the hot brown side salad and coconut ice box pie so good. And yes you are never to old to go through the red dwarf door
As always, CFA is great. But as you know this restaurant is unlike most of their free standing units. Expanded menu offerings, wait service and a local atmosphere. Great for breakfast!

Very cool place, especially if you are already a fan of Chick-Fil-A and want to see one that is totally different. I decided to go the full-service route (on a barstool since I was alone on business), and am glad I did. One review suggested the regular chicken sandwich was bigger & better than other Chick-Fil-A restaurants, but I disagree. It tasted exactly the same as the ones in Texas, and I actually think the chicken was smaller here. So don't order the standard chicken sandwich if you go there -- get one of the unique items. I wasn't able to find a menu of the unique items online (and the lady on the phone didn't seem interested in giving me a comprehensive list over the phone), so maybe this list will help some of you that are wondering just HOW different the full-service menu is:

Lunch/Dinner menu (in addition to normal stuff):
One-piece plate, two-piece plate, chargrilled one-piece plate, chargrilled two-piece plate, steak plate, Hot Brown (other reviews describe this), hamburger plate, midnight sandwich (ham & cheese), ham/bacon lettuce tomato sandwich, giant burger, steak sandwich, dwarf burger, grilled cheese sandwich, kids meal.

Vegetables:
fried okra, fried peas, collard greens, mashed potatoes, sweet potato souffle, cornbread, mac & cheese, kernel corn, green beans, broccoli & cheese. Also note they serve "straight" fries if you ask for them instead of the traditional waffle fries (I only saw waffle fries on their menu sign but was able to order straight fries).

Breakfast (served all day):
Eggs & toast & grits (bacon, ham, or sausage optional), steak & eggs, Chick-Fil-A chicken & eggs, chicken egg & cheese bagel, waffle, cinnamon cluster, etc.

And they have individual slices of pies - some fried and some regular. I had the lemon and it was great (tart but that's how I like it).

I tried the regular chicken sandwich (same as everywhere), dwarf burger (small but perfect when sampling other things too), straight fries (pretty standard fries - medium size sticks -- fatter than other fast food fries), and a small slice of lemon pie (the most enjoyable thing I ordered, which is how it's supposed to work). 

I'd love to go back someday and try some of the other unusual items on the menu -- including breakfast!  The nice server at the bar gave me 3 little stuffed cow toys as souvenirs for my 3 young kids back home -- but only when I asked (like other reviews have said). Thanks to the other reviewers for the tips to ask for straight fries and the little cow souvenirs -- I wouldn't have known about either of those otherwise.
Staff is really friendly and you get everything an average chick-fil-a serves but MORE. Table service, salad with your chick-fil-a sandwich and waffle fries, grits, sweet potato pie. A must visit!

The main attraction of course is this is Truett Cathy's original Dwarf House.  This has morphed into what we now know as Chick-fil-A. It is open 24 hours and serves a full diner menu along with a service counter and drive thru with the regular Chick-fil-a menu.  The Dwarf House is the only Chick-fil-a where you will find a hamburger, and a damn good one I might add.  For me it's all about the Hot Brown - it is delicious.   While not the only Dwarf House, this is the original and worth a visit if you are down near the airport.
This is the place where it all started and thank god it did because nothing make me so happy to be back in the south again then when I pass this place on my way home on 75 form the airport:)

So my friends picked me up from the airport and surprised me by taking me to this original Chick-fil-a. They know I love chick fil a and being from Hawaii, i only get to have chick fil a when I'm on a trip. I didn't even know the OG chick fil a was so near to the atl airport. After taking pictures with the signs, we made the sad mistake of getting into the drive thru lane to get coffee frosties. It took like 20 minutes. It's literally the slowest chick fil a drive through I've ever been to. 

I'm not really sure what the interior looks like or the service inside, but it looked nice. Just don't do the drive thru. Not only is the service super slow for drive thru customers, the customers themselves are rude!! We were honked at not once, but twice! For like not being within centimeters of the car in front of us? Really? 

A cool place to stop for the pics, but I wouldn't recommend the drive thru....

I thought it was so cool visiting the original chick-fil-a. Chick-fil-a is always a good idea but this place is an even better idea. On one side of the Chick-fil-A is the normal ordering menu like any other restaurant. On the other side, they have a diner (with limited seating) which offers more options. The sides alone were delicious enough to get me to go back. The mac and cheese and sweet potato casserole were so tasty. I wish every Chick-fil-A offered them. I have been craving them ever since. I was a little confused when I first entered because there was no one there to seat me. I sat down anyway until someone took my order. All in all, it was a great experience and the perfect pit stop for breakfast/ lunch on my way to Atlanta.

The original Dwarf House in Hapeville is sort of a big deal. I mean, not only is it a proper Chick-fil-A with a double drive thru, but it's also a sit down restaurant with a Truett's style menu. You in the mood for breakfast at 11pm? No problem, just have a seat in the dining area and experience a genuine diner experience with Chick-fil-A prices. It's open late (but closed on Sundays) and the prices are great. It's also a cool piece of Atlanta restaurant history. You should check this off your list of places to go in the city.
The food was amazing. They gave me the wrong order,but they corrected it  and I left satisfied. I will definitely be back. The customer service was very nice and friendly as well.

HOW COOL IS THIS???  The original Chick Fil A!!!   A "sit down" restaurant and a "regular" Chick Fil A at the same location.  If you love Chick Fil A - and who doesn't??!! - stop by here when you are in the area!

Great food and cute locale! I need to come back for a sit down meal. 

Plus if you ask nicely, you can get a free cow toy!

So i've been nice. I have received wonderful customer service from this location, but every time I come to this exact location, something's wrong. The first time I came here, my fries were super soggy and by golly that has never happened in my 21 years of living. I decided to give it a second try last night and they were out of Chick-fil-A sauce. That hurt me on a spiritual level. I honestly felt personally attacked. And then they waited until I was finished with my order just to tell me that they didn't have any chick-fil-A sauce available. I almost passed out. I guess I will stick to the normal Chick-fil-As. This is still my favorite restaurant though!

Thought it would be fun to see. Customer service average when usually customer service is excellent at other chick fil a. Bathrooms and floor dirty. Food options different. Dwarf burger not good. Chicken good chick file a standard. If you come after 9 (we got there 915) they don't guarantee items. Corn bread was out...for a 24 hour diner thought that was ridiculous.

Third time eating here.   And a pleasure as always. Friendly people, lots of smiles and good food.

The Mac & cheese was wonderful it was a great appetizer.
The southwest salad was just the right amount of spicy, the garlic-herb dressing added the correct amount of zing.
And of course the sweet tea was sweet!

Christine did a great job keeping up with my tea drinking, and was enjoyable to talk to.  She really made my dinner great.

Ordered 4 boxes of chicken minis and they ALL turned out all crumbly. The bread was all crumbled, on top of that it was really staled & hard as a rock. The chicken itself was so hard and way over cooked and really chewy. I don't know what happened but you should never serve something that is un edible! What a waist of money and time.

Been going here since this joint opened  and it was  "the thing'  growing up nearby.  Love the waffle fries and will eat the tasty chic-fil-a anytime...especially for breakfast. This crew has professional wait staff and everyone behind the counter is well trained and  not only friendly but organized for efficiency.  About a half mile from I-75 at the Central Avenue  exit.....the people have changed but the high quality has not ! I visit every month or so when passing by.  There are very  few children   living in Hapeville now, where did they go ?  The grew up and moved away like Jeff Foxworthy.  So this Chic fil-A has no playground but plenty of seating....this was the first one built by truit Cathy.

I have been to this location three times: once with a group at the counter walk-away service, once for lunch, and once for breakfast. You have 3 options when going to this location: drive-thru, order at the counter with the normal menu, or sit down and order from the original menu. My favorite way to eat here is thesit down side because you gat to order different menu items than what the rest of the locations have because this location was the original location. There is a counter with barstools or you can sit down at a booth. The waitresses have provided excellent service when I've eaten here. Both times I've eaten on the sit down side they've offered to-go cups for our beverages. 

When a colleague and I ate here for lunch it was because we were at a conference at a nearby hotel and didn't want to eat hotel food. We were so glad to eat here, especially because we got to eat pie and milkshakes for dessert (that's right- you heard me...PIE!). If you're not a big Chik-Fil-A fanatic, at least come here for the experience.

The location is in the actual town so it considerably inconvenient from the interstate, but interesting since it is the original restaurant. The staff was friendly but was not efficient or prepared when they actually had to serve food. The time took VERY long  and about 15 minutes in the drive thru line. Never have I waited that long for chick fil a and people even left the line, when we got to the window things should have been ready but they were still getting it ready. The food was good, but they gave the wrong order AFTER they said the order correctly.

If you're picking up out of town guests at the airport, particularly those that are not from the South, this should be your first stop.

Chick-fil-a's are a dime a dozen, but this is the original.  The decor and the menu are unlike any Chick-fil-a or Dwarf House around, and the "must-try" item is the Hot Brown: a dish full of chicken nuggets, topped in a white sauce, sprinkled with paprika, garnished with bacon slices, and finished with two white toast points.  With a side of waffle fries, you'll understand why this place must be tried by any Georgian.

The service is...eccentric, which is why they lose a star.  But even the eccentricity is part of the experience.

We are from Texas and are big fans of Chick-fil-A so when we randomly drove by this location in Atlanta, we were excited to see it was the very first Chick-fil-A - so I decided to go through the drive-thru. The reviews said it was the original location and also served diner food. The drive through menu was the exact Chick-fil-A menu we were used to, no diner food. So when we got to the window I asked if they had diner food and the girl said yes, so I said but the menu in the drive-thru doesn't have that listed and she said "well I really don't know about that." The guy behind her then speaks up and says the diner food is only available on the inside. Oh well, so I take my food and drive off and then realize they gave me the wrong order!!! I then struggle to find a parking spot to take it back inside and get the correct order. When I go inside, I tell the first person I see that I was given the wrong order and she tells me to take it to the other side because I was on the diner side. Really?!? So I take it to the other side and they make me wait in line to fix my order even though I had already been in the drive-through for 20 minutes. Multiple fails. Really disappointing. And we are Chick-fil-A One Red members.

The first Chick-fil-A lives up to the hype. Half of the restaurant is a typical fast food restaurant and drive through but it's the other half that really stands out. The Dwarf House functions as a modern day diner, open 24/6, and serving the traditional diner fare from waffles, eggs, and grits to steak. The dwarf house has everything you would expect from a down home diner, friendly and attentive staff with delicious comfort food all at just the right price point. 

I stopped in here after touching down at Atlanta-Hartsfield for a business trip. I encourage, nay I demand that anyone flying into Atlanta should stop in here before heading on to their destination.

This chick-fil-a is typically busy due to location and hours of operation. Tonight I stayed in line for almost 20 minutes and ordered an 8 count of grilled nuggets. After waiting another 10 minutes to get to the front the girl at the window tells me to pull up in the box because the nuggets are still being cooked.  I waited an additional 15 minutes and go inside and the girl tells me they are still cooking..... ITS AN 8 PIECE. No apology was given, I am appalled and disappointed in the LACK of customer service here at this Chick-fil-A.

A Yankee visit down south is not complete without a stop at Chick-Fil-A. I stumbled upon this one accidently while looking for a gas station to fill up my rental car. Little did I know that I happened upon the first ever Chik-Fil-A restaurant.

Also known as The Dwarf House, this is a full-service restaurant that screams Americana. Many of the workers have been there for over 20 years, the waitresses have names like Elsie, and if you're a local, everyone knows your name and what you want even before your order it.

I ordered a Chick-Fil-A, sweet tea and ice-box pie. Service was extremely quick, and the wait staff was attentive. They even gave me a free sweet tea for the road.

So, if you're on your way to the airport, get off at the Hapeville exit and stop by - you'll probably leave with a smile on your face.

I grew up in Atlanta but never made it to the dwarf house. This place is a treat! A real throwback! I don't pass out 4 or 5 star ratings lightly but given the history, meaning and significance of the original Chick Fil A, it deserves it!

I ate in the "diner" side of the Dwarf House and could picture my grandfather sitting at the counter having coffee and visiting with the staff. He would have loved this place. The coffee was terrific....not the frilly stuff we have become used to though. Just good solid black coffee! I ordered the Breakfast Omelet with chicken and it was so good. Just a simple cheese omelet with Chick Fil A chicken chopped up and rolled inside. Yum! Of course, you gotta have a biscuit with that which I did. 

I ordered hash browns instead of grits. My inability to eat grits reveals the fact that I was really born in California, not Georgia. I just can't eat those things! 

Was it the best breakfast I have ever had? Nope. Was it even the best diner food I've ever had? Not a chance. However, the food was solidly good and the experience was sort of like a rite of passage. If nostalgia matters to you, be sure to stop by the next time you are in Hapeville, GA or have a little time before your flight out of ATL. You won't be disappointed.
The first Chick-fil-a in the world and they serve hamburgers!  Yes it's true.  Also waffles with the Chick logo on them.  Love this place.  24 hours except Sunday.
best customer service always.... the chicken and waffles are really good... first class!

I HEART THE SOUTH!  On my visit to Hotlanta I made it a point to visit the original ChickFilA.  Yes, ever.  I think my tourist attitude showed and the guests waiting in front of us struck up a conversation with us giving us some background info.  Built when the Disney dwarves were popular, there is a wall that actually has the seven dwarves moving along the mounted picture frame.  The server we had let us know that when the Cathys' opened up, the city tried to tax them double... they refused saying something about they could go ahead and throw a rock through the window instead?  They weren't going to pay?  Maybe I misheard.  I was too busy eating at that point.

About the food: it's normal diner food.  EXCEPT!  Wait, we are at ChickFilA.  And I had a server.  And grits.  And biscuits and gravy.  And a hamburger.  And cheese smothered fries (which I dipped the cheese in everything after I figured out how great it was).  Yeah, exactly!  Am I the only one who finds this fascinating?  Probably.  The food itself is a 3.5 but the novelty of having both a walk up order counter and a sit down diner at my favorite fast food restaurant is awesome to me.

Plus, there is an actual tiny door that is fully operational!  I kid you not, after I was done dorking out with my photos... an actual employee used it as his entrance and exit to do an errand instead of the main door.  

So back to my "hearting" the south, the family we were talking to in the beginning of this review came by our table as we were leaving... let us know that they knew the Cathys personally and even gave us a little eat mor chicken cow.  I guess they must have picked up our check then.  They paid for our bill.  Southron hospitality.  Made my tourist experience that much more memorable.  I may have eaten at some $$$ locations during my visit to the ATL, but this place was by far my favorite.
Always solid service .love the one at Chastsin square sandy stings . Now have my order like I have been there for years.

This was my first time at the Dwarf house and I was really excited to experience the original Chick-Fil-a. It was sit wherever seating and all the booths were full so we sat at the bar. The food was very good I got the chicken and waffle with hash browns and eggs. The waffle was amazing. 

Here's the problem. There was only one person working the bar and she was clearly over whelmed. She was trying her hardest but we waited a while before we could order. Our food came quickly but our waffle wasn't ready with the rest of our food and that took an additional 10 minutes. There were 15 people sitting at the bar and it was clear she needs help in at least running the food to customers. Over all it wasn't the perfect experience but I would recommend coming here. Just be sure to be patient with the service 

Something to note: we came on Presidents' Day around 12pm

BEST CHICK FIL A EVER!!! Not only is it's 24 hours (WHAAAAAA), but it also has premium sides! Mac and cheese, fried orca, and more!! You can also chose to sit down at the "restaurant" side and order off an actual menu with items such as omelette and other specialty sandwiches!! It gets VERY busy because of where it's located, but the team is always able to accommodate quickly and efficiently.
The food was great. The waitress was overwhelmed. They seem to be understaffed on the floor and at the bar. Need at least one other waitress.

Like many have said before me, this is the start of it all, and I imagine that's one of the reason they have an officer directing traffic in and out of this particular chick fil a, unlike other locations.  Much like other dwarf houses, you can order more than typical chick fil a staples so if you want a burger, the cows aren't going to come get you.  

It's split seating wise for chick fil a to the right and the dwarf house orders to the left.  Also, in the warmer months they'll have a woman out by the drive thru window with a card reader who will take your order for you.  I'm not certain if that was because the drive thru speaker was broken or if that was a special added touch for the original Chick fil a, but it's interesting to say the least.

The only other thing different at this chick fil a is they have side items never seen at other ones (broccoli and cheese for example), so there's always a few things you should keep your eyes open.

This is the original Chick-fil-a location. Great selection on the menu. Not the greatest at handling large groups (20+ people) later in the evening, which is understandable. Excellent place and full of history. 

Don't forget to enter through the dwarf door and exit going backwards through it.

There aren't enough words or space here for me to explain what a gem this place is! Every single thing we had was amazing. Not only is the classic Chick-fil-A food excellent, the additional menu items will blow your mind. Fried okra. A sweet potato casserole that tastes BETTER than homemade. Hot brown. (Don't ask, just try it!) Veggie beef soup. PANCAKES ALL DAY. Seriously. You can't eat here and NOT feel the presence of God. Go there & ask for Cherise- the combo of the amazing food and her customer service was so amazing, we went back three days in a row!

Stopped by for a late dinner on the way from the airport. 

It's kinda a must... I mean, it's the original Chik-Fil-A, why wouldn't you. And it's super convenient location between downtown Atlanta and the airport helps. 

Got me some chicken and waffles. Food was, well, diner quality. Nothing to write home about, but no complaints either!

The thing that stood out was how homely and nice the staff was.

This is a unique Chick-fil-A that uses the Dwarf House concept. It is basically two restaurants in one. One section of the restaurant is your typical Chick-Fil-A quick-service that offers typical Chick-Fil-A food and service. Very good for what you get and the portions are huge - there was about 25% more grilled chicken breast than bun, for instance. You get the outstanding service that Chick-Fil-A is legendary more and even the management shows appreciation to their line employees for the hard work they do. Can't ask for anything better... or can you?

The other part of the Dwarf House is a sit-down diner. Here you can order food for breakfast, lunch and dinner and you are not restricted to just chicken here. Want a hamburger? You can get one. The Chick-Fil-A cows may not like it, but you're the customer. Only downside is that seating is limited here, so if you come during the lunch rush you have to wait a while for an open seat or you end up in the fast-food section of Chick-Fil-A.

Speaking of lines, they have a dual-lane drive-thru at this location. Even hours before lunch, both lanes fill up with customers quickly. So, get here early if you want prompt, efficient service. Do so, and you'll have a good time.

Also can't forget about some of the artifacts outside the diner, such as a bench with S. Truett Cathey's statue and a small red door for "dwarves" to enter through. Great restaurant in the heart of downtown Hapeville.

Disappointed....this is chickfila. And the original one. Food is fine...normal. But service is terrible. They seem clueless. No one knows what's going on. I felt bad for them, I hope you all get it together. Granted, they were slammed, but still. You should at least have some kind of plan. Chick-fil-A is slammed often. 
Please do better!

Set-off your experience by entering through the minature red door! Hit up this location if you want to experience the orginal Dwarf House. Located in Hapeville. It's like the "Cheers" version of Chickfila. The staff are friendly and there's many regulars who often visit on a daily basis. I know one of the regulars...a sweet guy who retired from my job. Back to the food...I took my Godfather here after picking him up from the airport for his first Atlanta visit. It was a Friday morning & the place was jumping! They have a well oiled system so don't let the crowd discourage you & miss out. If you go through the drive-tru they often have staff walking-up to cars to electronically take your order & payment. More patience is required if you come inside. We ate at the sit down diner. Once a table is available, just wait your turn & slide in. The breakfast items are basic-nothing fancy. I got 2 eggs, hashbrowns, bacon, biscuit, & added a bowl of grits. Overall, very reasonably priced & friendly environment.

I had no idea this existed, let alone that it was the very first Chick Fil A. We were famished coming home from the airport late at night and ended up here. Trippy place, super cheap, and yes, I walked through the dwarf door. 

BONUS for twenty four/six food near the airport!  (No Sundays, of course.)

I was in awe at how much food they give you for $3.5o in the kid's meal. Two strips, fries, lemonade and an ice cream cone. Dang...

Painfully good coconut cake.

The moving seven dwarfs wall installation is fascinating.

Minus a star for freakin' MSG, artificial color/flavors and additives in EVERYTHING. Really, everything...I know, fast food, but somehow thought they were better than the other guys. 

Cheers~

This is the worst Chick Fil A ever. If you want fresh hot food I suggest you go to Chick Fil A on camp creek. They will literally serve you anything. The food is always old and cold. Why I don't understand if this store is always busy.
Credit card information was compromised by this store. Beware of the employees and make sure that your credit card is never out of sight!

If you are a true Chick-fil-a fan, you've got to pay homage to the Dwarf House! Half of the restaurant is modern Chick-fil-a while the other is a sit-down-and-order place. The experience is what makes this place. The food is really just a notch above your average Chick-fil-a. Still worth the trip!

I was so excited to try this Chik-Fil-A! I mean...a chik-fil-a with waffles and chicken? Sold. It's pretty interesting actually. Part of it is a restaurant and the other part is the usual fast food chik-fil-a. We went to the restaurant side (of course) and sat down and had a whole meal! It was great. The server was pretty quick after we had sat down and our food came out fast. Now, I will say I'm not normally a chicken & waffles gal, but hey I'm in the south and at a Chik-Fil-A. I was super impressed with how good the waffles tasted! They were fluffy and the chicken was just fabulous with it. This chik-fil-a might've turned me into a chicken & waffles gal.

Me and my fiancée ate on the diner side aka the Dwarf House side and it was absolutely amazing! Got the chicken and waffles and they were to die for! The Mac and cheese was the best I've ever had!! Not to mention we got two chocolate chip cookies on the house from a lovely employee. If you're a Chick-fil-A fanatic, you have to stop here!!

If you find yourself in the beautiful community of Hapeville, just a stone's throw from college park and hankerin for a greasy snack do I have the place for you.  

On approach it looks like a little diner with an extra door out front, a kitschy tiny door,  for the dwarves, in addition to the main entrance, but then you see the chik-fil-a sign and have to wonder, what kind of restaurant is this?

Yes folks this is the original chik-fil-A, but it has so much more.  I personally love the chik biscuit with cheese, but it's really tough to beat the chik omelet ( eggs, cheese, and a chik fil a chopped up into it)  add some hotsauce and you're in breakfast heaven.  Also this place is a full service diner, you can sit down and get your fried  chicken brought right out to your table.  

If you're heading north from the airport and need to stop for breakfast on the way to a meeting, you should really look this place up.  You'll be glad you did

Honey who let somebody grandma in the kitchen ?? Baby those green beans lawd ham Mercy. Those green beans was cooked with love hunty ! The Mac n cheese was on point and you can never go wrong with a filet patty. Everything was fresh and season to perfection . Our waitress was a gem . I can't believe I've waited 28 years to come to the Dwarf house . I've been sleeping on them . I highly recommend their soul food options .  Lol look at my plate

I couldn't visit Georgia and not go by the first Chick Fil A. It's cute location in Hapenville.. one side is your regular fast food process, the line gets long but moves along pretty quickly. On the other side it is set up like a small diner. We didn't do the diner because the wait was a while and we had to head back to Florida but next time we here, we coming to this side and updating my review. 

As always the employees are friendly and very nice. Food tasted delicious!!! I swear I want the secret recipe for this chicken because OMG I wanna try it haha. Place stays clean as well. 

Before Chick Fil A it was called Little Dwarf House. On the side of this Chick Fil A there is a statue of Truett Cathy the man who I owe my thanks for some pretty delicious tasty chicken and there's also a small little door, too cute! Perfect size for me haha since I'm 4'10.

The drive thru is the worst I have ever seen. This place is packed all the time and the drive thru is always 15 to 20 min. Cold food when you get there. 
Staff is unprofessional looking and needs better customer service skills. 
This is the original ChicFilA, so it is a shame to see this type of service at this location. 
Cold fries today for the 3rd time.

A Chickfila that's open 24 hours and has a sit down service section!? I mean, what more could you want.... oh I'll tell you, it's the the mac and cheese!

Listen, I know it's no need to write a review for chick-fil-a, we've all been there and love it... but, if you have the chance, the Dwarf House is a must visit. Aside from the regular menu, they have some premium sides and different entrees like mac and cheese, burgers and cornbread! 

Also, instead of meals they have platters, which come with 2 sides instead of one... so grab the beloved fries, and try something new.

oh.... did I mention the mac and cheese?

I LOVE me some Chick-Fil-A. Who doesn't? Come on, those hot, crispy, salty, fun shaped pieces of heaven called Waffle Fries...?Forget about it! So Good! 

As an avid CFA lover, what a treat it was to finally visit the original Chick-fil-A! This location is right around the corner from my house and I've patronized the drive-thru but never got to go inside until this week. 

Established in 1946, this Chick-Fil-A is cool because it is the ORIGINAL Chick-Fil-A therefore it serves as kind of a mini museum. Besides the life sized statue of Truett Cathy sitting on a bench outside the restaurant, there are photos and plaques on the inside that tell you all about how CFA got its start and how the restaurant actually got its name. You also see pictures of the original building and can compare it to how it looks now. The little red Dwarf door is just the cutest thing ever, am I right?! My wife and I had to crawl through it because...I mean, who could resist? Honorable mention for sheer adorableness: The moving snow white and the seven dwarfs frame picture on the back wall of the restaurant...neat!

The restaurant was impeccably clean with comfy booths and ample seating but my favorite part of the whole experience was the service! It felt like we were in an ole-timey diner where the wait staff was so super courteous, sweet and attentive and everything out of their mouths was, "it's my pleasure ma'am." I LOVED IT! I saw on Andrea A's review that the servers' length of service is listed on their badges and some of them have been there for 15+ years! Wow I wish I'd known, that's pretty cool. Next time I'll be sure to look out for that. 

You will also find menu items here that you won't find at just any CFA--such as fried okra and carrot-raisin salad. And for dessert apple turnovers and chocolate icebox pie! I tried the carrot raisin salad and it was okayyy but I probably wouldn't order it again--the carrots were pretty mushy. 

 Overall, this is a very fun location to eat at and every ATLien should visit at least once because it's one of those rare Atlanta gems that just makes you feel like you've had a special experience.

 Since we ate here for lunch, I'd love to come back to try breakfast.

I love Chick-Fil-A so of course when I visited Atlanta I HAD to go to the famous dwarf house! It was just as magical as I had hoped and such a unique Chick-Fil-A experience. The diner side was packed (it was 11am on a Friday) so we just did the traditional fast food side. The food was just as great as every Chick-Fil-A and I enjoyed learning about the history!

Wow. This was the first ever Chick-Fil-A. Pretty impressive place. 

First off, its a sit down diner. With a counter/bar to eat at. Open kitchen with Short Order type cooks. 

I ordered a Hot Brown with Fries and a Home MAde Cherry Coke. The Hot Brown is like a Chicken Casserole. Very very tasty. Im told it's there #1 seller. I can see why.

As par for the course, service is amazing. No fast food place really makes you feel as at home as a Chick-Fil-A and this place is no different. The waitresses were super friendly, checked on my multiple times, made a Cherry Coke with Maraschino Cherries. Very nice. 

Portion was nice. Food was hot and super tasty. Cooked to order. Price was good and I really had a great experience there. Anytime, I'm nearby I will make certain to stop by. 

It is very close to the Airport. So, if you have time swing by, it's worth it.

Given the stellar record of this location on Yelp I was a bit surprised by the lackluster customer service at the drive-through window. I spent approximately $30 and the attendant was discourteous and very nonchalant about serving my food. I'll likely not return to this location. I have not had similar experiences at other venues.

I lovee Chick-Fil-A. In fact, whenever I used to come home from college, my mother would greet me at the airport with a bag of Chick-Fil-A goodness. With that said, I've always wanted to check out the original Hapeville location and finally got the chance to before picking my brother up from the airport.

It was almost 9pm when I walked into this diner-like Chick-Fil-A. There were two people at the counter moseying around and took their time taking my order. I ordered the Hot Brown by recommendation of many friends. It took about 6 minutes for them to make the Hot Brown and strolled around awkwardly while waiting for my food.

The Hot Brown itself had a lot of potential to be delicious, but it had WAY too much cheese. And it was just really salty. You can't help but feel sick afterwards.

The general atmosphere of Hapeville wasn't what I'm used to. From the looks of it, Hapeville is a really quite, small, modest working town. People drive really slowly on a two-lane road next to the railroad. And the service at Chick-Fil-A was noticably slower than in the suburbs. 

Now at least I can say I've been to the original location, but I honestly wouldn't go there again. I'm perfectly content with frequenting the Chick-Fil-A's in Alpharetta that are clean, fast and professional.

I just ate breakfast,it was great..then I orderd a chickenbiscut, it was the worst, I picked it up to eat it, it fell apart in 5 pieces, when I got to the cashied, I told her, her answer was you should have told your waitress, I waited 10 minutes to get the biscut, I was ready to go...bad buisness....

They seemed a little off from what I can tell of previous reviews. We normally have great experiences at Chick-fil-A. Which is why we passed a couple of food places to get to them. 
The woman on the drive thru speaker came across as rude and impatient. (An over all annoyed vibe.) After getting our food we realized to late that they forgot our fries with the meal we ordered. I have NEVER had that happen at a fil-a. I guess I'm just spoiled by them. Too bad. :/

Diana S told me about this place. I got lucky because I was in Atlanta two times over a 2 month period for both business and personal reasons, right after hearing about this place.

It's really convenient as it's off of the main highway that leads you out of the airport towards downtown. 

It's split into full service and self service. I got something to go the first time I visited from the self service side. Service was REALLY friendly. The second time (I was at ATL for an three hour layover) my friend and I had to wait 10 minutes for a table to free up. There is also counter seating. 

I'm not sure if I would love Chickfila as much if I had access to one on a regular basis. I got a plate with eggs, hash browns, chicken, and biscuits with honey on the side. Delicious. I also tried the grilled ham and cheese sandwich... it was good, but unfortunately I did not have enough stomach space to handle it. I loved the coconut ice box pie. Coffee had free refills. They were really busy during the Saturday brunch time so service was a little slow, but the waitress was nice. 

On another visit I tried the fried peach pie... the bag it came in had glorious grease stains. I ended up bringing this home, nuking it, and eating it with a side of vanilla bean ice cream.  

There is a 'dwarf door' which you can exit from the inside...

I enjoyed visiting the Dwarf House this evening for dinner while traveling through the Atlanta area.  It was a bit out of my way but worth it just to see the first restaurant complete with the little door.  The restaurant has both a traditional Chick-Fil-A walk up counter and a self serve area to eat as well as a full service dining room. 

I sat in the full service dining room and service was very good.  I was tempted to order a burger but stuck with chicken - grilled chicken sandwich (not fried since I had Chick-Fil-A chicken biscuit for breakfast on the road :-)  For $7.85, you basically get the same sandwich at a regular Chick-Fil-A plus what looked like a larger order of fries, plus a salad.  The food was just what you would get at any chick-fil-a. 

If you're in Atlanta, it's worth a trip to see the Dwarf House - but have a burger if you go - I regret not having one now since that is what makes the place unique.

Wow! super cool place to be in where this awesome chain started. 
Friendly service and super good food! HUGE portions!
One off the bucket list! 
Love Chick-Fil A!

btw, they serve beef here! ssshh don't tell the Cows!
Chicken omelet, grits, waffle. The omelet was delicious. Eggs were perfectly cooked. Waffle was crisp and full of flavor. Service was ok, due to  busy traffic in and out

So are all Chick-Fil-As closed on Sunday?  No.  The Dwarf Houses are open until 5am on Sunday morning, and then re-opens the next day!

I won't give the mystery of The Dwarf House away to non-Atlanta folk, but there are many items on the menu here that you cannot find at the newer Chick-fil-A restaurants.  Mwahahahaa!

This Dwarf House has the tiny red door at the front that drunks, funny people and children alike all enter through.  It's really a good laugh!

You can sit at the bar and chat up the bar girl or sit at a booth and watch the goings on in the parking lot.  There's a lot of coming and going in the evening due to its proximity to America's (current) largest airport.

Service has always been excellent and with that warm Georgia hospitality that I unfortunately expect everywhere.  :-(

so now they have fried strawberry pies and country style sides, like: collards, sweet potato souffle, broccoli and cheese casserole, field peas, fried okra, mac and cheese and the list goes on and on. 
i cant freaking believe it!!! 

chick fil a, i love you. dwarf houses you are the best!

Now this is the Chic-fil-a I know and love.

Forget the silly "eat more chicken" ads because when you're at a Dwarf House, all bets are off. Everything from the classic chicken sandwiches to burgers to God's gift to world - HOT BROWNS - can be found on this menu. It's also not fast food. You sit, a server takes your order, you wait for it to be cooked. It does come out quickly, but it's not sitting under a heat lamp for hours waiting for you. Prices are the same if you average it all out, and it's classic Chick-fil-a at it's best.

The neat thing about this location, though, is that it's the original. Yup, it all started here, folks. Everything from that tiny red door (which I still fit through, by the way...) to a diner look and feel to those silly paper hats rest inside these hallowed walls.

Don't come here and get what you can get at any location around the country. Come here and get things you can't get elsewhere, like the Hot Brown or a salad with Chick-fil-a's House dressing, all served ONLY at Dwarf House locations which, of course, are only in the Atlanta area.

Of course they are still closed on Sunday, but you can come any other day of the week and satisfy those cravings in the oldest Chick-Fil-A establishment there is. And seriously, get the Hot Brown. The artery clogging is only temporary, promise...
This is a must see and visit for Chic-Fil-A fans. Dwarf Houses had original and former CFA items such as Carrot Raisin salad, chicken salad, lemon pie, cole slaw, etc.  Try the "Hot Brown"

I have been to a ton of Chick-fil-A's before, but there is nothing like visiting the original. We even visited twice, once when it was really busy so we just ate off of the Chick-fil-A menu but the second time that we are there we sat at the stool by the counter and had breakfast. If you go just expect a wait no matter what side you go to and the double drive through is pretty busy too, but well worth the wait to experience the nostalgia.
The dwarf house side was so much fun. There is a fairytale theme on that side which included the red dwarf door. Of course, we had to walk through the door because that's part of the experience! That side also had a movie art piece on the back wall that was the seven dwarfs going to and coming home from the mines. It made me so happy.

The first Chick-fil-A! Normally I wouldn't bother going to a fast food chain I have back home, but this one is seated diner style with more menu options than your standard Chick-fil-A. 

Hot Brown $8.49: They do have the hot brown available for breakfast, but just a la carte. I think this basically just means it doesn't come with a side salad like it would for lunch or dinner. Hot indeed. I was too excited to take a bite and burned my mouth a little bit. I guess it's basically chicken in a casserole dish with mashed potatoes, gravy, cheese, bacon, and served with toast. A good comfort dish worth a try. 

Chicken & Waffle $7.65: The waffle was so good and crispy. I loved it. I didn't even notice until halfway through that it didn't come with butter, and I feel like that says a lot for me because I usually can't do pancakes or waffles without butter. The chicken was the same as from the sandwich I think. If that's the case, it might be worth asking if you can have spicy chicken and waffles. 

Photo Mention: 
- Chick-fil-A Chicken Egg Breakfast $7.15

*****

My Star Ratings: 
1 Star - Terrible. Just thinking about it makes me angry. 
2 Stars - Meh. Unlikely for me to return. 
3 Stars - OK. Open to coming back, but wouldn't go out of my way to. 
4 Stars - Yummy! Will definitely return if I haven't already. 
5 Stars - AMAZING!!! Would plan my day or even a trip around eating here.

A must go! Friendly staff, delicious waffle, incredible coffee, wonderful history, and such amazing atmosphere! It's THE Chik- fil- A!! 
So close to the airport in Hapeville, it will be our first stop when our guests fly in. Of course my son and I used the Dwarf Door. We will be back!
Very very very rude service. I was ordering a chicken biscuit and a meal. She thought I said milk that ok that was misunderstanding. But rolling her eyes at me that is unacceptable.

We were planning on getting out of Atlanta with a drive-thru visit, but when we looked on Yelp, we couldn't say no to the Dwarf House! 
Y'all, it's like Waffle House, but with Chick-fil-a food. I mean, could it get better? I went with a classic chicken biscuit, and my boyfriend got a traditional breakfast. We love Chick-fil-a! I wish I could've gone for lunch and gotten the meat and 3 sort of deal too. Go check it out. So fun!

I've had chick-fil-a a few time but it was my first time at this location and let me say that i was more than pleased with both the service as well as my meal ! Everything came out in an orderly fashion, warm, and correct and our server, Christy i believe, smiled and kept up smiling the entire time. Shawna also made sure that we were taken care of! I wouldn't def suggest stoping by here for any late night craving! Thanks again ladies!

I finally made it here ! The Dwarf House side was full when we came in so i was a lil disappointed but was pleasantly surprised i could order specialty side on the Chic Fil A side !! So i ordered a #1 combo with a side of Sweet Potato casserole. Best of both worlds man !! The Mac n cheese was surprisingly good . Mission completed!

No one comes close to that wonderful taste of  Chick-fil-A. This location is no exception. They also have items on the menu I've never seen at any other Chick-fil-A location. 

This is the original location and I love seeing some of the history of the brand on the walls and in front of the building.  

If you're on a lunch break be mindful that it does get extremely busy, but  Chick-fil-A has done the impossible and masterd the drive thru concept. Literally they are masters of the drive thru.

Dan Cathay complains about blight on the south side of Atlanta .. Stopped here at 8:10 tonight. Went to the restroom then washed my hands .. There were no towels .. Went to the sink outside the restroom ...no towels ... Then came to sit with my wife .. She had gone to the lady's room .. No towels .. The floor in both is filthy and while the people are nice so far, the counter has crumbs all over it. This is the original dwarf house and misses the sense of pride which we experience in many chick fil a's in the South.

We went out of our way to visit the first Chick-fil-A. The history is throughout the restaurant which gave us a sense of nostalgia. The parking lot is a pretty good size, and like all chick-fil-a the drive through was looped around the building. Half of the restaurant is a normal Chick-fil-A with a drive through, order-up counter and booths. The front half of the restaurant (the original half) is a diner. It kind of reminded me of a Waffle House. The menu is larger in the diner, with waffles and special side items. Overall it was a good experience. A must-do at least once if you're a fan of the restaurant.
I eat at Chick-fil-A all over and this is by far and away the longest I've ever waited at a drive thru.  going on 20 minutes and still not done.  close it if you can't do any better

This is the O.G. of Chick-fil-A ,the first chickfila in Georgia. Georgia's pride! Customer's service is super and all the classic Chick-fil-A stuff is still there. SHUT THE FUCK UP OLD PEOPLE (BABY BOOMERS) ,Y'ALL GOT YOUR COLESLAW!!!! This Chick-fil-A is so convenient for late night food, expect Saturday night when they close around 10pm. Closed on sundays which is good for the employees.  IF I SEE A FUCKING RUDE CUSTOMER, I WILL CRUSE OUT SINCE I HAVE THE POWER TO BE A DAMN CUSTOMER, HOW DARE YOU BEING DISRESPECTFUL TO CHICKFILA EMPLOYEES!?!? Then again, there are sassy customers service but give them back. Overall this Chick-fil-A won't fail me down.

Food is always good 24 hours a day 6 days a week. Got seated right away server was attentive fast and accurate. Food came quickly and was delicious. Things can get a little "interesting" in the early hours, never had any trouble but be aware. The peach milkshake was fantastic. Bathroom is small but clean.

My go to chicken sandwich, others have tried to copy but they just don't cut it. I love the milkshakes too. I wish (and am going to get beat up for this) they had another fry option, I am not a fan of waffle fries and never have been.

Home of the first "Chick-Fil-A" my group ate on the dinner side to get the full experience. They were packed but our waitress was very attentive and friendly. Food came up quick and was very delicious. I personally got the chicken and waffles and then a Key Line pie to finish it off.

Went here to celebrate my birthday with a few friends. Went to the dwarf house in forest park prior to this and the service was below subpar. One side of the restaurant you have to make reservations for and the other side is first come first serve seating. We were able to get a booth in the open seating side that seated the 5 of us perfectly. They were pretty busy as it was a Friday night but the service was good. I ordered the Chick-fil-A platter with fries and mac and cheese (i also ordered the waffle but changed my mind as i was stuffed) the macaroni and cheese was delicious (when have you known Chick-fil-A to disappoint). Overall good dinning experience as per usual

Saved our Thanksgiving Luncheon. After our catering order was a fail with another establishment, my coworkers and I needed to supply lunch to 40 people in a hurry. Four of us pulled out our CFA apps and placed curbside orders. Within in 20 minutes we had placed our orders and were picking them up. Everything was correct and fresh. CFA turned our stressful moment into a pleasant one. Thank you

Recently stopped by here after finding out that this is the OG Chick-fil-A.  Great diner type food with an expanded menu more that you would get at your typical mall restaurant.

I had to try the ribeye steak with loaded baked potato.  Notable mention here, they actually put slices of bacon on the baked potato! No bacon crumbles here!

Also tried their homemade coconut cream pie.  For a diner, the food was pretty good.  The staff was courteous and looked genuinely happy to be there.

If you're in the Hapeville area, it's worth checking out.

Terrible food service, went to get 3 spicy chicken deluxe meals and when i received the order i opened up my bag with the sandwich and it was just a piece of chicken with 2 very dry pieces of bread, not even the cheese or lettuce or anything just plain chicken and bread for all 3 meals. I would've never thought a Chick-fil-A would disappoint me so much as this one did.

Came here for a late night meal. They have a drive thru,counter service and a diner type seating along a grill accompanied by a short order cook. The resturant is open 24 hours closed on Sunday like All chick-fil-A's. The resturant is clean. We were greeted with a friendly hello by a busy looking waitress. She told us we could sit anywhere. The resturant has a line of booths along side a window and a counter facing the prep area. The drive thru was busy as well as the inside. They serve a full menu including breakfast and lunch all day. They are the on

Our waiter Brother Leroy acknowledged us within seconds. I asked for a cup of hot coffee with a lot of cream and Splenda, my sister got a hot chocolate. Brother Leroy returned with a very hot cup of coffee(just how I love it) and hot chocolate with whip cream. I ordered the chick-fil-a chicken egg breakfast with a waffle. My sister ordered chicken and waffle with an egg. We had too much food, the table was too small. All of the food was hot and cooked to order. My raisin toast was buttery and good. They have cheese grits. The food was good and the customer service was excellent. I will stop in again for a late night meal.

Getting to come here was a bit of a special treat, especially since it's the chicken magic started, there's a dwarf door, and I'm not usually around this area very often. I'm stoked that I got to visit before moving away. Breakfast here really hit the spot after physically being in 3 states before 7:30 am. After a few pictures, staring at Mr. Cathy, and crouching to get through the small door, we were seated on the diner side.

I ordered chicken minis, with 2 eggs, and grits. Everything was as expected; chicken minis and impeccable service like at a regular chick-fil-a, and the sides like most other diners. The grits were actually surprisingly pretty tasty. Lots of interesting things that you wouldn't normally find inside a Chick-fil-a, including a moving Snow White themed painting!

It's open 24/7, except for that it closes on Saturday night to give its workers the trademark Sunday off. Overall, it's definitely worth checking out for the history and novelty of it, but I'm not quite dying to return.

Good food. Tried the Mac and cheese and the fried okra. I'll be back for sure. Good food. Tried the Mac and cheese and the fried okra. I'll be back for sure. Good food. Tried the Mac and cheese and the fried okra. I'll be back for sure.

What can I say‼ chick fil a is usually all around perfect no matter which one you visit. If they mess up they normally take responsibility & give you a free item. My experience & food has always been good at this site for the past 3 years. No issues & my good is always on point. I'll keep this as a lunchtime destination.
My go to place for a chicken biscuit before catching a flight at the ATL airport.  People are always friendly.  Food is good too.

Terrible customer service. I was incredibly disappointed since this is the original and historic location. Waited more than 15 minutes for an order (on the self-seat side) and noticed at least four customers who ordered after me receive their food. When I checked on the order, the cashier said the hold up was the fried okra. Then another colleague told the cashier "I'm only one person"--not sure what that was all about! When I asked for the manager, the hostess chimed in that fried okra didn't take 15 minutes. I would agree with her! We eventually got our food with no apology or acknowledgement for the delay. I guess Chick-fil-A isn't what it used to be.

This vintage diner is located about seven miles south of downtown Atlanta in sleepy Hapeville, Georgia.  (Is Hapeville still a sleepy town now that the Porsche headquarters is there?)  The place is steeped in Chick-Fil-A history and on several occasions I've seen groups taking tours of the kitchen.

On one side of the Dwarf House is a typical Chick-Fil-A fast food counter where you can place orders off the drive thru menu.  The other side there is a diner counter, retro stools and plush booths so that you can sit down and savor your meal on a plate.  For some reason, the diner side is a magnet for senior citizens, police officers and firefighters.  

Aside from the Chick-Fil-A chicken, the food is amazingly average.  The breakfast items (Grits, Eggs, Toast) are all good but in a standard way.  The lunch items Mac and Cheese, Sweet Potato Casserole, Greens) are on par with standard southern cafeteria food.  Everything is tasty and filling even if unimaginative.

I do like the fact that they display the calorie information right on the menu.  I'm there to consume all things buttery and fried but I appreciate having full information.  I'm pretty sure that other diners like being able to make informed decisions too.  

Three stars for the food with a fourth added for service.  Many of the waitresses have been working at this same location for 15+ years; their length of service is on their name tags.  They have southern sweetness on lock.  No matter which one of them serves me I'm almost guaranteed to be called Sweetie, Honey or Sugar at some point.

The Dwarf House is a good place for a down-home southern meal and courteous service.  If nothing else, stop in to have a meal at the original Chick-Fil-A.

After living in Atlanta for more than 3 decades I happened upon this gem by complete accident.  All I can say is why aren't all chic-fil-a's like this?!?!?  Oh my goodness this is the way it should be... Everything was perfect and now I shall miss this place every time I go to a "regular" chic-Fil-a :(

WOW! This Chicfila just scored a 6 out of 5!
The fries were hot and crispy. The best Arnold Palmer with 1/2 unsweetened tea with 1/2 regular lemonade. Delicious and fresh carrot and raisin salad. All with super friendly and helpful COVID-19 safe drive thru service. But they really went over the top with my first yummy Hot Brown!
Who knew... The Hot brown casserole from Chick-fil-a's Truett's Grill. Chicken with a thick sauce, cheese, bacon and toast wedges. Too delicious too describe! My life was blessed by @chifila today! Thank you @pinchofButter

Great customer service and the food is good and hot !
That's why I love going into the family dining area.
Excellent service and friendly staff. Must try the Mac n cheese and fried pies w/ ice cream.

Forget trying order anything for catering here. It is never ready on the time you ask for it. There is no process at the counter and no one seems to know anything about your order. You have go through the same line as regular customers and they get irritated because of course it takes forever because no one knows anything about it. I've ordered catering several times from here and it is always the same. I learned to order an HOUR before I need it because it is never ready. That is terrible customer service!!!!! Also it is a nail biter everyone because it seems like they just might not be able to fill the order. It's not worth the stress on my end.

This place was amazing!! They have two areas, one where you order at the counter and sit just like most chick fil a's, and another that is the restaurant style similar to the original! We had delicious meals that aren't served in any other location!! The staff was also incredible. We sat at the bar stools! Will definitely have to return here next time I am in Atlanta!

I really like this place... something about it reminds me of being a kid. Maybe it is just the fact that the name is The Dwarf House. Anyway, the food is good and nice local folks work there. It is a nice "hit the spot" deal at any time of day when you need to curb that little thing called hunger.

Came by for lunch on Saturday, very busy! Wanted to do the table service but wait time was to long for our traveling. We did try the collard greens side. It was ok. Will try sweet potato suffle next time.
The store is clean and full of many great pictures and stories. Will have to bookmark for next time we are close by. We had our usual number 1 and wrap and chicken strips. All good and still our fav when traveling.

"Why does it smell like this?!" Before coming to Georgia the dwarf house was a very hyped Chick Fil A. After visiting the Dwarf House I can truly say that this is the worst Chick-fil-A I've ever been to. Not only was it dirty but the employees were also extremely rude. It said Chick Fil A on the sign but it definitely had some McDonald's employees....

Just for the record. The hot brown does not have mashed potatoes in it. It is a thick chicken gravy, with chunks of chicken, melted chedder cheese, topped with 2 slices of bacon and toast. This is my favorite item off the menu and don't forget the house dressing for the salad!

The people working here are so sweet & helpful. If you can wait, I recommend eating in the Dwarf house restaurant, it's so worth it! I've also picked big orders up to go & employees have been eager to help me carry them to my car. Nobody does customer service like Chick fil a, and when you eat here you're getting the original experience!

It was my pleasure coming to chic fil a in Hapeville.  The service was good and so was the food.  It's a cool way to experience chic fil a since none of the other locations offer the type of breakfast style food that they do.  Be sure to swing by here if you're ever in the area.  
I got the chicken mini breakfast platter with eggs and grits.

Only regular menu items available thru the drive thru which is a little sad since I would probably added pie to my order today. Trying to be a tad healthier I paid $1.50 more to get the grilled instead of fried chicken sandwich. Why is this so much more expensive and so tasteless? More sadness Glad to see a paper carton instead of plastic tho. I love their lemonade and probably should have just gotten that...  There aren't a ton of quick lunch options in this area so I was happy to have this option but probably will budget more time to try one of the many other choices next time I'm in the area.
This is the worst Chick fil a I have ever been too. Very unfriendly and the food was cold. I will never come here again!

All the original recipes (peanut oil waffle fries), bigger menu (fried apple pies!), and really clean.
I loved the option of table service. This place is fantastic.
.
No matter where you go it's always good always consistent and for the most part healthy of course its a little more expensive than normal fast food but that's price you pay for good quality isn't it?

This was a dream come true culinary experience! The menu contains more than your average and everything was delicious and fresh. It was awesome to learn about how my favorite chain was created. Our waitress was super sweet and shared my enthusiasm about ChickFilA! This is a must stop for all the true ChickFilA lovers out there.

I went to this Location's drive thru bout 6 months ago for late night hunger cravings. (Literally I was pregnant.) Unfortunately, my food was cold and hard. I was so disappointed. 
Today I went bout 10:15 pm, it was packed on the inside, so I decided to go through the drive thru. I waited at least 20 mins. Again my food was horrible. When I say I am one of the biggest Chick-Fil-a fans and very rarely do I experience such slow service as well as horrible quality in food. I will not make the mistake again of coming to this location ever again. 
The 2nd star was listed for the kind customer service I received from the young lady in the drive they line.

I love chick fil a! I eat it twice a day. This location has great food. My only problem is that I like to use the mobile app for carry-out. This location is the slowest at fulfilling the mobile app orders. I've had people walking and ordered after I've order will on the road there to receive their food before 6 minutes before me. Out side of that the foods great!

This was my first time visiting Atlanta and I love Chick-fil-a already so I was excited to go to Dwarf House and everything was so good that I went again before my vacation was over. Nice employees, great food & not too long of a wait time for the food which is a plus!

A Chick-fil-a opened 24 hours...yes please! This is a great place to come and eat and learn a little Atlanta history. On one side, they have a typical chick-fil-a and on the other they have a sit down restaurant with an expanded menu where you can get things like chicken and waffles!

It's an experience to come see the original place where it all started and eat something different. But the service was horrible in the waitress area. It had a sign "wait to be seated" but everyone was passing by sitting. Note: this is my first time coming to this location. They took about 10 minutes to ask what to drink. Then took another 10 minutes to ask what we wanted. My brother got chicken nuggets. When the food came I asked for the sauces. 20 minutes pass by our food getting cold, who eats chicken nuggets without sauces. How am I going to eat Mac n cheese without a fork. I also needed a to-go box, they took about 20 minutes to get me a box. How long does it take to get a box please tell me? Even my dog can get it faster than these people. In other places, other restaurants I dont complain much but Knowing Chick-Fil-A's standards and expectations from them this was the worst. Chick-fil-A is always one of those places where everything is quick, easy, and the staff always has that Southern Hospitality but this location NO! Even waffle house has better service than this specific location (The Dwarf House) I don't think I would come back.

This is one of the very first locations (I believe the Greenbriar Mall was the actual first one), so there is definitely some nostalgia. The set up is a little different from your regular Chick-fil-A. The parking lot is a maze and tight, so be prepared for that. Upon entering, you can go to the right which is where your typical Chick-fil-A offerings are, along with the typical service. On the left, there is more of a full-serve set-up, with booths along the windows and counter stools near the grill (similar to how Waffle House is laid out). 

The full-service side is complete with fold out menus and servers who are quick. The kitchen staff (which you can watch from your booth or are right in front of you at the counter) push food out incredibly quick. The menu and prices are also displayed along the top of the wall right above the kitchen staff. I noted that the prices at this location are significantly higher than say at standalone Chick-fil-A down the street (i.e. $2.75 for tea lemonade, over $3 for orange juice). The food is great though, with breakfast served all day and with expanded offerings on the breakfast and regular menus. On a Friday morning at about 11:00, we were seated in 20 minutes - several tables appeared done with their meals, but were simply chatting and lounging despite the line going out the door. I got a chicken omelette and scattered potatoes (hashbrowns), and both filled the plate up. The wait time for the sit-down side can be quite long and a bit disorganized, as there was a host taking names, but she also was busing tables - meaning that while she was away, folks were wandering in and bypassing those waiting to be seated. I would recommend stopping by if you're in Hapeville (which is in the middle of nowhere); probably wouldn't make is a regular weekend spot just due to location and the higher prices, but I would come back if in the area.

I grew up in Hapeville and have loved this place all my life. This is the original Chick-Fil-A location, where it all started.
