Lately it's become a tourist destination with a statue of the founder, Truett Cathy out front. He's sitting on a bench out front and people have their picture made with him many times a day. The management at this store has been amazing and kept his legacy of good food and great service as the number one priority. 

Unfortunately that has all changed over the last few years. The service has declined and the food has become very hit and miss. Today, the Saturday before the Super Bowl in Atlanta, we decided to grab some chicken salad as we passed by. The take out counter was not awfully busy with maybe a half dozen people waiting. And waiting. And waiting. There were six people behind the counter. About as many as there were customers. None of them however seemed to notice that some people hadn't ordered. They ignored them while chatting and cutting up. I finally ordered a cup of chicken salad. A dish that didn't need to be cooked, it only required being removed from a refrigerator and placed in a bag. It took 15 minutes for that to happen. After 12 minutes I got the lady who took my orders attention. I told her I'd like either my chicken salad or my money back. She began to get my money and I said, "really?  You'd rather give me my money than open that door and hand me a cup of chicken salad?"  She smirked and went in the back and finally 15 minutes later I got chicken salad.

Yes it's legit. BUT the only way thing is, it's hit or miss. If you go early in the day, everything is perfect. Service, food, timing but if you're going late at night (because it's 24/h) you won't receive the same service. Mac is good, cornbread is a no for me, overall I'm gonna give it 4 stars, if it was more consistent 5 but it's chick-fil-a!!!

If there isn't an ounce of nostalgia or regard for Chick-fil-A history in your bones, then coming here really is unnecessary. But if you really do love Chick-fil-A a lot, are a chicken sandwich addict, want to try items that you can't get anywhere else and have a soft side for their history, then you must make this pilgrimage to Atlanta.

Yes, this is THE original location of Chick-fil-A, where what I believe to be the greatest chicken sandwich was ever created. 

Everything about this restaurant is different from your typical Chick-fil-A. First, this location is open just about around the clock. They also have servers to provide table service and there are a plethora of non-typical Chick-fil-A items to choose from on their menu. They have various platters, lots of sides, salads, soups, special sides, dessert and breakfast platters. When we went, if I didn't know any better, I would have thought I was in some random diner that just happened to specialize in chicken.

As a major foodie, I had done my fair share of research prior to coming here so my wife and I thought we knew what was best to get. Every article and review pointed to the Hot Brown as their signature dish, so I went with that. It came with a salad, but who's getting salad at Chick-fil-A? C'mon. I swapped out the salad for waffle fries. My wife ordered the Grilled Chicken Melt Platter with Waffle Fries and Fried Okra. 

The verdict? Meh and meh. Honestly, I don't know what I was thinking when I ordered. I read the description on the menu and wasn't too excited about the Hot Brown, but I proceeded against my own will anyway. I should have listened to my gut. The Hot Brown was this unappetizing combo of chopped chicken, cream sauce and cheddar cheese. It was a gooey mess in a small tray that pretty much tasted like it sounded. I couldn't get a grip of the flavor of the chicken because the cream sauce and cheese dominated it. The gooeyness of the dish was a turnoff too. My wife wasn't a fan of her chicken melt platter either. It was all very plain and didn't have much flavor to it.

When we first walked in, all I could think about was what I typically ordered at Chick-fil-As (nuggets) and why I loved the chain and my word of advice to any customers visiting is DO NOT DIVERT FROM THAT. Go with your gut and the reasons you loved Chick-fil-A in the first place. Don't try to get fancy and order things that just don't sound good, even if it's their "signature" dish. You'll enjoy your experience a lot more here. I'm not deterring anyone from trying new things, but in this instance, stick with the chicken you know and love.

Besides the platters we ordered, we both also ordered a Frosted Lemonade, which was something we hadn't seen elsewhere. The best way to describe it was like a creamsicle lemonade shake. It was better than I thought it would be, so that's a win there.

The service was decent here and quick. I wouldn't say the employees were friendly, but in no way were they hostile either. Most were young and just did their jobs, but didn't go out of their way to converse with customers.

Like I said, coming here won't be for everyone. It's a nice piece of history whenever you go to the 1st of anything that is now global, but if you're just seeking out a Chick-fil-A meal, then it's better to stay local.
This is my go to chick fil a. Of course the service is great and I've never had anything wrong with my order.
Service has become secondary to profits. It used to be first but I've had two bad experiences in a row at two separate CFs. There won't be a third. I'm done with this overpriced slow food chain.

The Dwarf House Chick-fil-A. The very first Chick-fil-A. Pulled in for a quick bite not knowing the history of this location. Nearly had to fight to get in the parking lot which is always a good sign meaning the food inside is great.

The people are friendly, even the customers. Spoke with Ed, a guy who has eaten here every day for 30 years! The inside looks a lot like the diners of the 60's.

This is NOT your normal Chick-fil-A. You can get most of the food here, but some items are unique. Want a hamburger? They have them. How about a chicken sandwich platter? Milk shake?

A very unique dining experience. If in the area, the have to stop. Breakfast, lunch, or dinner.

I grew up in Hapeville and visited this place quite often. Everything is exactly the same as when I first visited 20 years ago.

Great southern hospitality and the food is good. My hubby ordered a burger just because he couldn't order a burger at any other Chick fil a and he said it was ok. I had the chicken platter ( the chicken breast, corn bread, and two sides) and it was pretty good. I also got cheese dip for my fries ( why not go unhealthy all the way?!??)! 

I love this place because this truly is home to me! Highly recommend it just for he experience! 

I heart this place!

The place where Chik-fil-A all started. Its nice to be in the spot where the popular franchise began. This location is unique in a sense that on one hand its a Chick-Fil-A where you can go up and order. On the other hand, it has a side where its a sit down restaurant where the waitress can come and take your order.

This "diner" Chick-Fil-A has an expanded menu where you can make your popular Chick-Fil-A meals into a whole sit down experience. Its nice to have Dwarf house keep its original decorations of Snow White and the 7 dwarves which served to inspire Truett Cathy to spawn the Chick-Fil-A chain. 

There's a small door in the front, but it was locked when I went. 

Overall a neat experience. Its not much different than other Chick-Fil-A's, but its nice to learn a little history while you eat.

What can you say about Chick-fil-A other than if you been to one you been to them all since they have the most consistent menu and food of any fast food chain. 
The fact that it was nearby and that it had the name Dwarf House is what drew my curiosity. It was a neat and featured a little door that kids could use. The service was warm, friendly, and POLITE. They should teach that  last one to other people in the service industry.

This is the original Dwarf Grill, really close to my house in College Park. I love coming here because it has a sit down area and more options than most Chick-Fil-A locations. They have macaroni and cheese, sweet potato soufflé, and apple pie, among other things! I love to just get an original meal most of the time. You really can't beat it!

I'm a big chick-fil-a fan and it's awesome that this was the first chick-fil-a, but I think I missed the awesomeness that makes this awesome. 

I went in and went to the counter to place my order and all I kept thinking was how aside from the exterior, there didn't seem to be anything special about this chick-fil-a.  Then, after I placed my order and was about to head out, did I notice that there was a restaurant half of this place.  It's too bad, but I don't think I would've had time to eat sit down style anyway.  

The spicy chicken burger I got, waffle fries, and the milkshake I got along with it were great, but didn't seem to be particularly better than what I've found in other places. Maybe that's a good thing, but I guess it made this place seem a little less special to me. I never did get a chick-fil-a sauce for my waffle fries, but I don't blame them because I forgot to ask for one until I was about ready to eat my fries and I was just too lazy to go up and cut the line for some.  (I'm not sure they just give it to you either...)

I want to start off by saying I love chic fil a but I expected better from this location especially since this was the first ever Chic fil a. I went there straight from the airport and I arrived sometime a little after 1am. The women at the registers did not uphold the Chic fil a standards of hospitality, it felt like I was at McDonald's. I ordered the original Chic Fil a sandwich meal, the bread was hard the chicken was cold. I informed one of the young ladies who gave me another sandwich which seemed like the same sandwich and they just switched out the bread. I was so hungry I just ate it, all through the night and the next morning my stomach was very upset. Ugh please do better

Slowest drive-thru in the country. And once you're in, you can't get out and can sit there for 20 minutes, no exaggeration. All for a bunch of bland soggy fries. I guess some people have a nostalgia for this place but it's only for gluttons of grease and gluttons for punishment.

First, my friend was the one who wanted to go to Chick-fil-A. Second, I agreed when I researched this location was the first of its breed.

Private parking lot is huge, plenty of spaces. There is a drive-through, quick fast food express, and seat-in diner. Whatever your needs may be. Due to its age, there are some worn down areas but still maintained well. 

FOOD:
Spicy Deluxe Chicken Sandwich (4/5): These are good. Can't complain much, but they're not as spicy as when they initially arrived on the menu.

Grilled Chicken Melt Platter (3/5): I went for the healthy option and wanted to try this. It's very greasy once you eat it.

Mac & Cheese (2/5): The cheese was lacking. It was like eating watered down mac & cheese. I'd pass on this.

Sweet Potato Souffle (2/5): Too, too sweet. Barely touched.

Carrot & Raisin Salad (2/5): I've experienced better. Flavor was lacking. Luby's salad is delicious.

Cole Slaw (2/5): I've experienced better. Flavor was lacking. The BBQ joints have better slaw than this.

Our server was very friendly. Our water did touch bottom though. I do recommend sitting in the diner to try other items featured in "Little Dwarf House" (prior to becoming Chick-fil-A).

Would I come back? Well.... I never was a big Chick-fil-A fan. I love the Chick-fil-A sauce, but I never go out of my way to eat Chick-fil-A.

Every CFA lover's ultimate destination! This was such a cool experience! The workers were small-town southern hospitable pleasant people and the place was filled with daily locals! So glad I got to experience this!

I had no idea that this awesome place existed until my friend brought me here for Saturday morning breakfast. We stuck to the table service side which had a brief wait until two seats at the counter opened up.

Extended menu beyond what is regularly at CFA including burgers, ham and eggs, grilled cheese and even a steak platter. Lemon pie? So tempting but not on my keto diet today. I stuck with that and just got the CFA chicken breast with eggs and cheese. No home fries for me either. 

We had great service from a friendly and overworked waitress who brought coffee, huge cups of water and even ran over to the CFA side for a buffalo sauce for me (only 1 g of carbohydrates!).

There's a separate queue for table service than for the regular CFA side and there's also an extended menu. If you're waiting for a table, keep an eye on the other side so that folks don't accidentally cut the line.

[Review 10559 overall, 326 of 2019.]

I love me some chick fil a, but while visiting ATL I had to come to the dwarf house. The waffle was everything!!! They gave a variety of food such as different sides. Everything was good, and the staff was polite as always. I can't wait to go back. You can carry out or dine in. Not too far from the ATL airport.

Chick fil a for the win! This location is my go to for the late night munchies. Even in the wee hours of the morning their staff are always friendly and my order has never been wrong. I can't even complain about the long drive thru lines because I know my food is gonna be hot and ready like a Little Caesar's Pizza. Now if I could only shake my Sunday chick fil a cravings I'd be the happiest chick alive!!

I love me so Chickfila and I just can't believe how long it took me to try the chicken and waffles! I must say the waffles were delicious, buttery and fluffy. I was able to come before the busy crowd and sit at the bar to watch the cooks. It's interesting to see Chickfila have so many different items on the menu. (SN: I will be back to try the fried okra, greens and cornbread)

The original so it will always have a draw. Service was pretty basic and does not live up to values of building connections. The store felt very understaffed, no sense of direction with staff and that business was not really valued. The food was good though and it was cool to get non standard ChickFila items.

Chic-fil-a's customer service is always excellent and the experience here does not disappoint. Also, the menu is different  and offers a lot more options than your typical Chic-fil-a if you decide to dine in. They also offer a delicious breakfast buffet on Saturday mornings which I would definitely recommend.

This place is an experience!!! I'm actually vegan , but still enjoyed myself. I had sides: waffle fries, fried okra, greens and kale salad. My friends who do eat meat, were in heaven. They were so happy to have this experience 3 am in the morning. 
When I go back to Atlanta, I will surely try to make a stop here.

What is wrong with you people today in the drive-through people go to the drive-through for speed and accuracy both of which you are failing miserably on and it Saturday is it the B team u got out or you just don't care anymore
Why won't they let you take food to go from the dinner. Sorry but the customer is always right and for that you get 3 stars... now WAKE UP !
Pretty good very quick line that moves they also have the inside seating area for a special menu and they have one for the regular menu. The staff are very nice and helpful with instructions as well.

I'm definitely a fan of this place and will be back again! The service was a bit slow, but still had a wonderful time here. My party and I ordered the sweet potato souffle, mac and cheese, and the waffle fries for our sides and they were ALL amazing. 

The service was a bit slow, but the food was SO very worth it. It is such a fun place to stop by and see the original Chick-fil-a and try the extended menu. So worth a visit!
How cool that this is where chick fil a started!! Love the owner statue out front as well as the fact that you can sit down and order from a waitress.  The collard greens were great also!!
The original Chick fil A what more can you say? Open 24/7 love this place! Definitely historic

It's Chick Fil A. But leveled up. 
I think it's a mistake to come here expecting to be turned if you don't already love their food. 
I'm a fan already so not surprising we enjoyed the food as much as we did. The food here is better than at the regular brick and mortars. 

The fried ocra was seriously the best fried ocra I've ever had. And don't even get me started on the sweet potato soufflé. I mean, I would be perfectly happy just getting those two sides for dinner. 
I had the chicken salad sandwich. It was pretty good. Not my favorite. But if you like chicken salad it won't offend. 

We also got a tour of the kitchen which was super cool! We actually got to see how the restaurant works. 

Service was okay. Our server didn't seem to like us very much but that's not a problem. Drink orders were wrong but you know that stuff happens all the time and shouldn't be held against an establishment. 

The bathrooms were okay too. Not the cleanest. But good enough. 
Overall, I definitely recommend if you're a Chick Fil A fan. Food is good. History is neat to experience. Give this place your patronage if you're in the area.

i love this place but i recently had a horrific experience. i got off work at 11pm. ordered thru the app. called my uber when they called my name. got home, was missing an entree. went back a few hours later w/ food in hand for a refund. all i got from the supervisor and employees surrounding were mean looks, like i was in the wrong. every last one of them had attitudes. like i created a problem when i simply wanted to enjoy my dinner for 2. me and my guy went to bed hungry. they didn't offer us anything for the inconvience either. i will never go back during the 3rd shift. smh straight ratchet and unprofessional. only giving 4 stars bcuz it's a great place and usually are good people, w/ good attitudes. something needs to be done about those girls. they make the company look bad.

The service here was wonderful the time I went. Everyone was very kind and full of southern hospitality. It's kinda like a better Waffle House that has yams , Mac and cheese and Belgian waffle that taste like a homemade egos waffle. It's pretty ok. If you think your getting a southern dinner, think again. The chicken and waffle you can not beat but the southern sides taste like school lunch on fridays . The yams are actually a mashed sweet potato casserole and if your a food connoisseur like myself you can tell they doused the yams with heavy cream, way too creamy for me. Mac and cheese ,eh. But hey! It's a fast food chain restaurant so it's good fora something quick or just a bomb axx chicken sandwich or whatever your craving at the time. You actually won't be disappointed. And it's great for kids and families. They also have a drive thru and serve regular chic-fil-a classics.

I'm in Hapeville for a conference and really wanted to stop by the original Chik Fil A location since it was just a few blocks from where I was staying.  I came for breakfast and took plenty of pictures, probably looked like a crazy tourist which I was.  I loved the small door that kids can go through, and love that it's usable.

It's not a normal Chik Fil A, it has a counter and table, and is more like a restaurant.  They cook the food fresh right in front of you, and have more items on the menu that Chik Fil A doesn't have, including the pies which I miss.  I had a country ham biscuit with cheese and chicken biscuit, and they were amazing.  The food came fairly quickly and was amazing.  I wish our locations at home were like this, I would eat there more often.  I will definitely miss this place when I go home.  Thanks for a great experience!

Food was as good as any other Chick-Fil-A but the service at this location was the least impressive of all my Chick-Fil-A visits. The staff didn't seem as happy to be there as other stores and they messed up my lemonade order.

If I told you that you could get a beef burger at Chick-fil-a, would you believe me? Well, you can! I absolutely love the Dwarf House. I've been to another Dwarf House, as we have a few in GA, but this one, the first, is by far my favorite. 

Food- Great. Not only can you get traditional CFA items, but you can also get Soul food sides like Mac-n-cheese, greens, black eyed peas, cornbread muffins, etc.  I often come here when I am craving sweet potato soufflé or Mac n cheese... however, I don't think I have ever left this location without a side of greens. Breakfast is available all day.... and they do have waffles. Hapeville for the win! 

**Short Story** 
I brought my family here  when they were visiting from Alabama, and they were excited, but they all turned up their noses at the idea of Mac and cheese from Chick-fil-A. Well my nephew decided to order it.... the poor boy couldn't eat his Mac and cheese because it was being passed around the table! My niece and I went outside to take a few pics of the statue and the Dwarf door, when we came back in, most of the family was in line ordering Mac and cheese to go. 

**Ok back to the review** 
The vibe is more like a diner. However you can order to-go, dine in or go through the drive through as usual. Note: You must go inside to order the Dwarf house sides (well at least you do after a certain time). This location is also open later than normal CFA's. They close around 11:45 most days. 

Overall: This location is definitely with the visit.

A must go! Friendly staff, delicious waffle, incredible coffee, wonderful history, and such amazing atmosphere! It's THE Chik- fil- A!! 
So close to the airport in Hapeville, it will be our first stop when our guests fly in. Of course my son and I used the Dwarf Door. We will be back!

For this to be the first chic fil a, this is also the worst chic fil a i have came across. The customer service is poor and they're employees are unknowledgeable of their inventory. I ordered a cobb salad and realized it had no boiled egg after i received it, when i took it back they told me they were out of eggs. I just wish i knew before i ordered because it definitely would've changed my order. I am very disappointed, shame on ya'll.

While in Atlanta I looked up the first Chick fil a. Before I did I did not know that it had an extended menu compared to regular locations. Once I saw that I was fully on board. We stopped in for breakfast and promptly grabbed a spot at the bar and ordered up two unique items, chicken and waffles and a hot brown. The waffle was great, sweet and crunchy. The hot brown was good, but a little too cheesy, I didnt think I would ever utter that phrase. Service was good, the atmosphere felt like a Waffle House, which I say as a compliment. If you like Chick fil a and find yourself in the area of the Atlanta airport it is definitely worth a stop.

Super stoked I got a chance to check this out. If you are flying in/out of Atlanta you can stop by before your flight. You walk in and have the option to go to the original Chick-fil-A, The Dwarf House or go to the Chick-fil-A we all know. I decided to check out the Dwarf House. I sat down at the stools and waited for my menu. Plenty of different options, all inspired by southern cooking. I went with the Giant Burger platter, with the kale salad and collared greens. The double cheeseburger was a great homemade burger. The kale salad was crunchy and savory. The collared greens were... meh. Staff was good, but not as great as I've experienced before. Overall cool, great, unique place to check out.

Used to be a great place to eat in or drive through. Now, not dependable. Do not expect to be treated with anything other than indifference. Always take time to check your order to make sure it is it is right. Do not expect them to open at 6:00am, it's more like 6:15. And when they open, expect to still wait another ten minutes or so for them to start taking orders. 
Wait time is not consistent with other Chick fi la's. You will be in line for a very long time and in addition, often sent to wait for them to bring your order out. Size of items not always good. Have gotten wraps that are half the size of normal and hash browns and fries half full. 
All that being said, 2 stars cause food still tastes good.

This review is based on my collective experiences, because I work in the area and my coworkers and myself come here a couple times a week. Which unfortunately will change. It's not worth it anymore.

I came here prior to the coronavirus pandemic. Since my Chick-fil-A Backstage Home Office Tour wasn't until 9 am, I drove over here to check out the famed original Dwarf House restaurant. Light rain was falling and the place was packed. The drive-thru line was long and the parking lot in the back was pretty full. Since it was my first time, I wasn't aware that the restaurant was split into 2 sides. One side was a sit-down diner and the other side was a regular Chick-fil-A. Unfortunately I had already placed my order on the mobile app, but I wandered into the diner section. Thankfully the waitress told me where to go. I'm sure that they're used to dealing with newbies like me. I ordered my usual Chick-n-Minis meal with hash browns and a small coffee.

On a return trip prior to heading over to the airport for my flight home, I gave the diner side a try. It was pretty packed, but I was able to grab a seat at the counter. I ordered their chicken waffle and a coffee. Both the food and service were great. If and when I return, I would for sure only eat on the diner side.

Went to Chick Fil A and what a surprise, they had waffles to go with those fries also had eggs scrambled on the side (scrambled w/ cheese) because I don't really like them sunny side  fresh off the skillet  I don't want to hear it just pass the maple syrup

I wish a duplicate Dwarf House was planted in EVERY American City. If you ever visit Hapeville you have to check out the Original Chick-Fil-A you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. During my visit I had the Chicken and Waffle can you say YUMMY ! My husband chose to go with a ribeye steak which was seasoned to perfection and cooked at the proper temperature. If you're in the mood for veggies the collard greens and yams are yummy too! Just thinking about the food selection at this location is making me hungry again  Kudos to the staff at The Dwarf house  I am looking forward to my next visit in October.

Who wouldn't like the Original Chik-fil-a Dwarf House in Hapeville, GA?
We drive all the way down from Buckhead in Atlanta just to order their cole slaw and fried okra along with our chicken nuggets/chicken sandwich!  Not to mention, there's a Chick-fil-a just around the corner and even more surrounding us - we choose the drive to Hapeville because only the Dwarf Houses serve that good Chik-fil-a cole slaw!  Mr. Truett Cathy would be so proud how the Original Chik-Fil-A is still drawing crowds!  His statue is sitting in front of the Dwarf House which adds to the Southern ambiance even more.  Let's not forget those wonderful "Chik-fil-a potato chips".  Yes, "Chik-fil-a potato chips" in their own logo printed bag baked just for Chik-fil-A!  Don't forget the Chik-Fil-A sauce to put on your nuggets and the Truett dressing for your salad, as well.  I can't wait for the dining room to open!  A strip steak with baked potato, salad and/or a side of green beans sounds really appetizing!  No dining-in with Covid or ordering off the dining room menu.  They're Covid-conscious, so you can enjoy your food!

During my first visit to Atlanta, of course my very first stop had to be at the original Chick-fil-A aka The Dwarf House! 

One side of the restaurant is set up similar to the usual CFAs with their usual menu so that you can order to go or dine in. The other side is diner style with a different menu!

Service was impeccable! The diner food wasn't out of this world for me but it was definitely worth a try for the experience. The fried peach pie a la mode was a good touch that's not offered regularly at CFA.
I'm a Chick fila head, but this is the slowest restaurant in  the system. Do not go to this restaurant in the morning if you do plan on being in line for over 15 minutes!!!
I got a sandwich then went all the way home, opened  my box and there was no top bun. Mcdonalds don't make that type of mistakes!

Not sure how your flagship store always seems to have the WORST customer service.  I work nearby and sometimes you just have to have chic-fil-a... well DO NOT STOP HERE... if you are in any type of rush or hurry or if you would like to actually receive the food you order.  The only reason there is one star is because zero/negative stars are not an option.  Poor Truett can't be loving this sacralidge.... it's time to close and retrain this entire stores staff.

I fell in love with Chik-fil-A for its fantastic service and excellence in getting the order right. Sadly this location is a miss on drive through execution. They get orders wrong, skimp on napkins and forget condiments all together. It's highly upsetting to get no ketchup with4 orders of fries. It's very frustrating to get 10 napkins for 4 meals. And it's not possible to turn around and go inside to correct these errors because the place is so busy. 
This is the 3rd time these types of issues have happened at this location. I say no more. I'll go to Willys or American Deli next time.

We stopped on New Years Day and didn't realize we settled into a booth about 5 minutes before they were closing.  Our server was super nice about it!  We were the last people in the restaurant, but all the employees were still working professionally. Fun Chick-fil-a!

Oh how I truly wanted to fall in love with this place, but it just wasn't happening.

Since you can only find Chick-Fil-A dwarf houses in a few Georgia locations, my boyfriend and I purposely stopped here on our road trip to Wisconsin.  

This Chick-Fil-A dwarf house is located right outside the Atlanta airport (you can see and hear airplanes land and take off while you eat) and has a fast food (either grab and go or sit down after you order from the counter) or sit down/ full service option.  As this was on my travel bucket list, we chose the full service option.  The restaurant looked like (in terms of layout and cleanliness) a rundown Waffle House and like, Waffle House, you seat yourself.

Our server looked less than enthused to be there and seemed impatient.  I ordered the Hot Brown (as it's apparently their special and you can't get it at other non-dwarf house Chick-Fil-A restaurants and my boyfriend ordered the steak as you also cannot get it at other non-dwarf house Chick-Fil-A restaurants.  I could hardly finish my Hot Brown as it wasn't good on any level.  It contained pieces of old tasting breaded chicken, smothered in white, chunky goop.  All of this was topped with cheese and soggy bacon.  My boyfriend's steak was over cooked and flavorless.  Needless to say, we will not be returning.

There is no in-person dining.  The drive thru is always packed but moved quickly. My food was fresh and hot. Friendly staff. The hours have changed. They are no longer opened all night.  They close at 10pm. 

I'll be back.

I never thought in a million years I would give Chickfila anything less than 10 stars. I LOVE Chickfila! They could never do wrong in my eyes... until tonight that is.  I decided to visit the dwarf house tonight and it just did not live up to the typical chickfila standards. For one, the service was not good. The girl who took our order was not friendly. She didn't smile at all. She was super dry and we thought that maybe she was having a bad day so we tried to make a joke with her and she was not here for it. She continued to look at us crazy and said "I'm just waiting for you to order". She proceeded to ring us up, give our total and left the register. Another employee had to come finish the transaction because she started doing other things. I have no idea what the attitude was about. I wish I had gotten her name. It started with a Z and she had blonde and black braids. 

The other issue was the food. It just wasn't good. The fries were cold. The grilled nuggets and classic chicken sandwiches just didn't taste good at all. Overall I wont be back. For that to be the "original" it does not give a good representation of the chickfila standard that the company prides themselves for. If you want to go to say you've been I get it, just dont expect anything more than McDonalds customer service from this location.

Came by for lunch with a colleague during a training in this area of Atlanta. It was very interesting to come here as it's the first CFA. The seating area is like a diner and pretty spacious. Servers are friendly and food is served quickly. The silverware is a little worn and my first set was a little dirty. The server replaced it quickly though, and she was very nice about it. Love that original offerings are still available and can't wait to come back and try some things I didn't try this time, like the mac n cheese!

The Dwarf House in Hapeville is an institution.  Hapeville prides itself on being the home of the original Chick-Fil-A.

I doubt there's anything on their menu I have not had.  Growing up in Hapeville, we either had takeout or dined-in at least once, sometimes twice a week.  In high school, this place was the hangout for us all to meet up after our dates.

The drive-through options are minimal compared to the dine-in menu, but those with an addiction to Chick-fil-a don't seem to mind.  The place gets so crowded during lunch that a cop has to direct traffic going in and out of the restaurant's parking lot on weekdays.

The atmosphere is nothing fancy--a diner feel with an animated moving dwarf picture on the back wall showing the seven dwarves going in and out of the coal mine.  As a kid, this intrigued me for hours.  I still get excited when I see the picture--ahhh memories.  Most of the waitresses and managers have been working there for many, many years and know their customers on a first-name and favorite dish basis.  I always like to see the number of years serving on my waitress' name tag--it's usually upwards of 15 years. 

Some of my favorites here are the Chick-Fil-A chicken sandwich (fried chicken breast between a buttery bun with a few pickles) chicken biscuits, gravy, coleslaw and hot browns.  For dessert--mmmmmmm, the apple pie, peach pie or chocolate icebox pies are great.  They also have the best soft-serve ice cream EVER.  Therefore, their hand-spun milkshakes will make you think you've died and gone to heaven.

If you come to Atlanta, especially to the airport area, visit the original Chick-fil-a.

I took away one star because their chicken biscuits have gotten smaller over the years.  Other than that, I don't know what I would do without Chick-fil-a, and I think many people can agree.

It's a Chick-fil-A and more! Fun to read the history of a great company. The staff is on point and live up to the Chick-fil-A reputation. I wouldn't make a special trip, but if it's on the way around lunch or dinner, why not? Expect a wait though if you want to sit down.

The history and aesthetics of this place is majority of the hype. Any food item outside of what you can order at Chick-fil-A is mediocre.

I got the burger for the sake of getting beef at CFA and McDonald's dollar menu can do it better. No hate on McDonald's

Went to the restaurant. Greeted with a smile. Waited for a table. Sat. Ordered food. It was delicious. Service was nice also. Had the Chick-fil-A breakfast. Also added a waffle. Also had the two egg breakfast.  With a side of white gravy. Loved it all. I will return for more.

We decided to come here one day on a nice lunch break just so we could see if the dwarf house had a new and interesting menu. Still no beef products at the og Chick-fil-A! We did confuse our drive through lady with trying to pay with two apps and ended up realizing they just covered our meal and we got some nice free food.

I have visited this location two separate times and did not realize this was the original location for Chick-Fil-A. On both visits, I went into the walk-up counter side and took my food to go. 

I have not ever rated a Chick-Fil-A location with less than 5 Stars as the service has always been exemplary at each site. My first issue was with the parking, it is very tight and on both occasions, I had to circle the lot numerous times to find somebody leaving to get a space. 

Inside the place was packed, I was able to use the restroom to wash my hands and then ordered at the counter and ate inside my car since there were no tables open for indoor seating. This is a very busy location and like all other Chick-Fil-A's the service was very fast and efficient with 100% order accuracy. The spicy chicken sandwich and waffle fries were on point as always. 

I would like to return and try the Diner side when back in the area. 

One negative, on both my visits I was approached by several street people who were begging for money. They met me as soon as I got out of my car and as I tried to get back inside. There was also somebody up on the sidewalk outside the door. It can make your visit slightly intimidating. I am not sure if this is something you will always find or if it was just an opportunity during the lunchtime rush.

Thoroughly enjoyed this place. The only thing that could be better was the Mac and cheese. Our server gave us our peace but made sure we had everything we needed without us asking for anything. Definitely a better experience than a regular chick-Gil-a
First CFA.  I mean it's a cool place to visit if you are a fan of the chain.  Diner feel-waitstaff friendly!

I've always felt a connection with CFA because 1) their food is delicious and 2) it was my first job in high school for 3.5 years (different CFA in MD). So, naturally I was super excited to go to the original location.

There is a regular CFA part of the restaurant and the original Dwarf House section. I didn't like that there was no hostess/waiting list because if all the tables are full it's just kind of an honor system and you're awkwardly hovering to make sure no one takes the next free table when it's your turn. We didn't have to wait too long.

The food is typical CFA food with a few different items and a few items that are discontinued in other stores (chicken salad, lemon pie, carrot and raisin salad are a few). I got the CFA deluxe platter with fries and Mac and cheese. We also got a hot brown to share. 

The food was good, typical CFA food. Nothing special but definitely a unique/different experience than normal. My real issue was the service. CFA is known for their customer service... so at the ORIGINAL location I feel like the pressure is 10x higher to represent the company. And it 1000% fell short. Our waitress was short with us and not overly friendly. She got our orders wrong. She brought our hot brown out ten minutes after the rest of our food with no apology. We asked for refills but she only refilled one of them? Not sure why. Three stars for consistent food and unique experience.

Still the best Chick-fil-A in the world. Portion sizes and hospitality are still the same... outsized!!

Food is delicious and Southern hospitality doesn't get better!

The original Chick-Gil-A! It's on a very busy corner,it's fun to go thru the little red door,sit at the bar or be served at one of the few tables. If you love Chick-fil-A (and who doesn't!?!), this place is worth the visit!
The customer service here is always great. The long is always long but the employees do a good job keeping the line moving. Chick-fil-a will always have my heart.

Hey, what can say, the original chickfila? I had to hit it up since I was in the area for work.  It was pretty cool to see the setup, old signs, etc.  They have a diner side which I didnt try which is supposedly like the original.  I used the normal fast service side and the food was average.  There was a statue outside on a bench which was cool.

I have been here several times, but last night it literally left such a bad taste in my mouth I may never go back.  The store was crowded, but that should not be a reason that the floors were messy, tables were not cleaned off and the store overall in disarray. An employee even slipped and came close to falling because the floors were so slippery. The condiment station was dirty and both bathroom needed attention.  

Please Cathey family upgrade your flagship location and make it some place to be proud of.

This is literally the only Chick-fil-A to ever put salt on my fries as I request on my mobile order. The only one....in years! It's the little things. Thanks to them for continuing to provide their historically excellent service during the pandemic

THEY DON'T SERVE BISCUITS BEFORE 4:30 A.M.! That was a huge disappointment. Good food, obviously nothing even close to being healthy in any way. For some odd reason I found the wall contraption of snow white's dwarves very amusing. Order the chicken and waffles.
Extremely slow. Slowest chik fila I have ever been to. The quality of the food was fine.

Today I had the worst experience I have ever had at a fast food restaurant. The management of the traffic flow through the parking lot of the hapeville dwarf house is atrocious. I spent over 40 minutes of my day picking up a mobile order. Once in the line, there is no way to get out without going through the whole process. After spending so much time just getting to the window, I had to wait several extra minutes to receive my food because the employees servicing the window acted like a union road construction crew. I was never offered an apology, an explanation, or even an acknowledgment that I had just spent nearly an hour creeping though the drive thru line. There were three employees standing around watching one other employee prepare beverages in the slowest manner I have ever seen. It was like being in the twilight zone. The entire staff seemed completely oblivious to the wait time happening at their store. After I finally received my food, I had to wait an additional two minutes to receive the drinks on my order. I have always been impressed with the professionalism, efficiency, and enthusiasm displayed by chikfila employees I have encountered across the country and was very dismayed at the attitude I saw and the treatment I received visiting this store today. I am shocked that this situation could be allowed within your organization.

To most people, this place is probably considered just a regular Chick-Fil-A. But to big CFA fans like me, this place is such a special gem because it's the ORIGINAL Chick-Fil-A! 

I actually came to Atlanta for work and this was the first place I went as soon as my flight landed. As the only crazy person going around this place taking pictures, most people probably thought I was a tad odd. However, I have been going to my local CFAs since I was a kid. In fact, my dad told me that he and my mom ate there all the time when she was pregnant with me...so I've technically been a fan since before I was born! As you can imagine, paying homage to the OG CFA was a must-do on this work trip.

As some background, this location was originally called The Dwarf Grill and was where S. Truett Cathy got his start in serving customers. It initially only sat 10 people (it was small...hence the somewhat politically incorrect name) but was unique in that it was open 24/7 and served many travelers going in and out of town in the mid 1940s. 

What's great about this location is that they are still true to their 1940's diner roots, while also incorporating a standard CFA experience. It's essentially two restaurants in one: go to the right and you're in a CFA; Go to the left and you will see booths and a long dining countertop. I am all about that old nostalgic experience, so I opted for the countertop on both of my visits (because yes, I went twice during my stay here...after all, it is very close to the airport!).

The staff here is very friendly, just like all CFAs. I actually spotted a veteran who had been there 23 years (it was designated on her namebadge). They also work super hard--my second time in, it was a Saturday afternoon and the place was PACKED. The servers were really working hard to ensure everyone was taken care of. 

My first night there, it was a Wednesday around 7p. I was trying to take it all in. However, I was caught off guard when I saw a burger and fries on the menu! So off-brand for Chick-Fil-A! I later saw them cooking a big ole steak in front of me as well! Like I said, they try to pay homage to their old roots and believe it or not, Cathy had beef in his first restaurant! 

I decided on Truett's Famous Chick-Fil-A Platter which is essentially a CFA sandwich with two sides. I opted for fries and mac & cheese. It came out in less than five minutes. I love that it comes out on diner style dishes. Makes for such a nostalgic experience! I did ask for Polynesian sauce, which they of course had. That is by far the best of all CFA sauces!

I devoured my sandwich and fries, but left most of the mac & cheese. It was just okay. I should have opted for extra fries. I ended the night with a coconut cream icebox pie! I had been debating between that and the chocolate. It ended up being good, but nothing out of the ordinary. The second time I went, I got the same platter, with fries and cornbread. The cornbread was subpar. Kinda dry. The sandwich and fries were on point though!  I also ordered the chocolate icebox pie. Again, it was okay. To be honest, all it is is pie crust, chocolate pudding filling and whipped cream. For me though, I just tried to envision myself as a weary traveler (which I was just heading to the airport) back in the 1940's, just getting a bite to eat. Then the pie seemed to fit right in! I can just picture these pies spinning in a glass case back in the day as Cathy was serving his customers!

All in all, if you have any affinity for Chick-Fil-A, this location is worth going out of your way for. I'm so glad I was able to make it there once, let alone twice! What a gem! So amazing to see the growth and success of this company...especially now being able to see where it all started!

When in ATL, if you love Chick fila, you go to the original! When you go walk in there's 2 sides. The regular fast food chick fila that we're all used to then the restaurant side called the Dwarf House that is diner style. They have booths and then the stools at the bar. If they're packed, expect to wait awhile for a table. There was only 2 of us so we ate on the stools where we got to watch how they cook.

Ordered the chick fila chicken with eggs and hash browns with onions and cheese! May seem basic but never have i ever got hash browns with onions and cheese and it was HEAVEN IN MY MOUTH. Of course had to get chick fila sauce on the side for my chicken. Also had to get the waffle just cause it had the chick fila logo in it lol. But it wasn't just the looks, the waffle was so good with the hot syrup! Mouth watering just writing this review lol
Standard after the bar grinds. Nothing special about this location, but nothing bad either, except that they run out of stuff a lot.

God I love trashy burritos.  And tacos.

I recently went to TB for the first time since I was in high school.  See I don't really stray from the usual TB menu; I order the same items that I ordered when I was 8 years old.  However they have apparently upgraded the menu dramatically - bacon club chalupas, encharitos, etc, I was astonished.  I ordered it all.  With extra fire sauce.

On my way out a large herd of humans traipsed in, one that fiercely resembled the abominable Beth Ditto (lead singer of The Gossip, and Portland resident) - so I did what anyone who values their life would do - I instinctively shit my pants in an effort to throw her off my scent.  

SHE LOOKED HUNGRY!  AND ANGRY!  :(

Anyway 2 hours later I remembered why I stopped going to TB.  I'll spare you the details.
Ordered a chicken quesadilla box and 2 cheesy gordita crunches. Apparently cheesy gordita crunch reads as "regular taco" on the screen because that's what I got instead.

So disappointed! First the chips and cheese nachos were completely spilled everywhere in the bag. The worst part was the cheese cups were. 1/4 full. No joke.  25% full. Next the crunchwrap was mostly shell. No filling at all. I usual stop at the Johnson Creek location, and will definitely not be stopping here at Powell again. The worst T bell in quite awhile.

This Taco Bell has to be the worst one I've eaten at because they've screwed up both orders we've gotten within 3 days. I asked for a vegetarian salad and they put chicken in it. And my sister ordered a chicken burrito that had beef in it.
Pulled into the drive thru at 7:01 and was told they won't be open for 10 minutes. If you don't open until 7:11, you shouldn't state you open at 7. Poor. No customer service. They don't care.

Homie at the register needs to snap out of it or he gonna lose his shitty job... why would anyone have him work the register??? He literally seems like the worst person to work that thing.. he just  slow at it, he couldnt even have one of the EIGHT other buddies to get my damn drink that they forgot to give me at the drive thru while he took an old man an 3 other girls orders

Seems kind of silly to write a review for Taco Bell, but this location is always a bit disappointing. If you don't wait in the drive thru for 20+ minutes, then you wait inside for the same amount of time. This last time, I got my food and the salad (yes I get the salad at Taco Bell) has black beans in it and the beans were crunchy and way over cooked. My Crunchwrap had a gaping hole where the lettuce and other insides was about to fall out so I asked for a new one (I've never seen my Crunchwrap that unwrapped before...). The cook seemed annoyed but the cashier was nice about it. I wish I took back my salad too, but I didn't want to be that girl (or get my food spit in).

Normally this location always puts tomatoes on my "no tomato" order, but surprisingly they didn't this time!
I also went during dinner hour so it was busy. 

All in all, I'd go to Los Gorditos across the street or even the one down the street next time.

they're supposed to open at 7am, today they waited until 7:10 (with multiple cars in line) to finally tell us they weren't taking orders because there were boxes in the way (???). thanks to the 10 minute delay I was both late for work and will be going without breakfast and lunch today (usually order 2 items)

if you're going to offer breakfast, you need to be reliable. people have jobs to get to :-/

won't be going back, can't afford to risk missing meals like this again

The prices are unbeatable. Plenty of research has gone into making craveable products. Taco Bell wins in the taste-for-price category. We're not talking top notch quality ingredients but considering what you get for the price, nobody could match that shopping and preparing food for themselves. A good excuse to not make your own food. I have not had a problem with an order being confused, then again I only get walk in and not drive through service. Which brings me to the downside and that is walk in service should be 24 hours too, they don't need to keep the tables open, just the counter.

Love the Bell, but they really dropped the ball today. Came through on a Friday evening to kick off a great weekend and was met with disappointment. They had a huge sign advertising a new Strawberry Popping Candy Freeze. I thought I would give it a try, it was Friday after all! They told me they were out of that. I was bummed. Maybe they should take down the giant sign by the drive thru if they didn't want to crush people's hopes like that. I figured I would settle for a classic, the good old Baja Blast. I get to the window to pay and she destroys my taste buds again by telling me they are also out of Baja Blast! So sad. The crunch wrap was excellent as usual but the drink options really were lacking.

I eat burritos from this restaurant. I've never been inside although it looks nice from the outside. The drive thru menu is backlit. The bean burrito came wrapped in crinkly paper. The tortillas are tough. They sell Pepsi products here.
Tried to go through at 3am. Google said open until 4 am. Cashier told us they were closed after we waited in line for 25 minutes. So disappointing!

My daughter applied for her first job at 49th and Powell. She made it through both interviews and the manager offered her the position and gave her the hours she would be working. the next 2 days were very difficult for her, as she had to convince her teachers and school to allow her to change her class schedules. She even pleaded with a fellow classmate to change classes with her. She even bought a new outfit because she was so excited about her new opportunity. They called her under an hour before her orientation and told her i'm sorry we can't hire any one right now! She was on her way there, who does that?!
I am so angry with them! This is unacceptable. Can you imagine how she felt after telling her whole family and all of her friends.
Their claim was that they will call her first. I am very disheartened too.
-Daryl
Very modern and cozy location.  Background classical music is an interesting choice,  considering it's a Taco Bell. I suppose it keeps rowdy kids from hanging out too long, or something.
Where does Taco Bell purchase the vomit they put in their burritos from?  Is it horse vomit? Pig vomit? Or is it dog vomit?

The old lady that works with the young chick after hours *nearly half the time I go here at 2am* totally screws up my order!
I ordered 2 bean and cheese burritos Fresca style and they made me one with beef and the other with the tomatoes..but it still had the cheese!! ??
Another time they gave me a burrito Supreme instead, and the other was made properly. WTF? 
Back through the drive through drunk and hungry with the DD driver to get it fixed is to be expected on Powell. 
I know to always do the "opening of the tortillas" before taking off to the casa.
How are you gonna rate taco bell poorly? It's fast good, not a five star joint! Anyway,  I love tbell.

Workers here are so depressed I feel like I'm causing them physical pain when I order. I imagine it's not exactly great to work here so I don't blame them, I just feel like their frowns make me feel worse for buying crappy food.

Up all night binge drinking? Taco Bell
Kids don't eat meat loaf? Taco Bell 
Late night sex for hours(or minutes)? Taco Bell
These are but a few excuses to punish your body with tacos and burritos containing  "meat paste". The price is right, but I wouldn't eat here on a regular basis. Only as needed. Taco Bell is every ones guilty pleasure.

This is probably the best Taco Bell I have ever been to. Ordering was fast and easy and the employees were super nice. The food was delicious and actually made how we wanted it. I love the cheese roll ups and this location actually put CHEESE in the tortilla!! Usually it's like tortilla with hardly any cheese which isn't cool because if I wanted to eat a shell I'd go by a pack of them at the store lol. Anyhow, crew was friendly, the place was clean, and ordering was fast and easy! 5 hands down
The quality is usually good (for what it is), and the employees are very friendly... but it always takes FOREVER and it's not clear why.

You know, i stopped eating fast food a few years ago, but when my TB cravings overtook me I was politely greeted by a SUPER FRIENDLY voice from the drive through window. I don't know when they became so friendly at TB, but i love it! Seldom do i eat here, but i have and it is always clean. It's cheap, it's easy, you know what you are gonna get.
I used to be a Grilled Stuffed Beef Burrito kinda guy; now i'm a Cheesy Beefy burrito guy (it is only a buck!!)

I would like to tell you that I enjoyed my Chicken Soft Taco, but I can't, because it was a Beef Burrito. But we had ordered 4 Chicken Soft Tacos between the two of us, so a trade was inevitable. Unfortunately, the remaining three were a Chicken Burritos and two Chalupas... Whatever the hell those are. The real excitement came when I discovered that it was the NINTH time in a row that I had paid for guacamole, without actually getting any guacamole. I don't think they even have guacamole. I think it's a bait and switch item on the menu. You order guacamole, but they substitute it with a cup of white lead based paint that they like to call "sour cream," or maybe an extra one ply napkin. I'm giving two stars because we went back and they clearly felt bad, and replaced our items and threw in a free bag of styrofoam rolled in cinnamon and sugar for us to snack on after our binge and purge. Oh, I finally got my guacamole.
Whatever one may think about the food, Deandre at the counter is just great.  He's the best, most proactive, helpful fast food worker I've ever seen.  Thanks!

It was late and I had a few in me.  TB seemed like a good idea at the time.

Of course, it was absolutely disgusting.  I would rather starve to death than eat here again.

So lunch was aight.  It was cheap & quick & satisfying enough in the taste department, but what really sets this TB apart is the amazing conversations I was privy today on my lunch.

The first was a conversation about love & teh ladies between two middle aged D&D wizards.  Favorite quote: 'Its not about how she looks- its about how she looks AT you'...effin hilarious.

The second transpired between a random customer & the counter girl.

RC:  oh, hey cool, you guys don't have to do that up-sell thing anymore huh?

CG: huh?  I'm not sure what you mean.

RC:  you know, it used to be that the minute I walked in the door you would've asked if I was interested in shoving a Crunch Wrap Supreme up my butt & I would've said that I hadn't planned on it, but since you asked, sure what the hell.

CG:  (through stifled giggles) nope, I'm not really interested in up-selling or shoving food in you, I've only worked here for 5 weeks, but I do think that the new Big Taste Taco is pretty awesome.  

RC:  I'll take 3 thanks:)

Totally made my day.

Here's the thing about Taco Bell and with most fast food chains, most folks should know what to expect. Feening for a quick meal fix? Taco Bell works. Drunk out of your mind and looking for ways to curb your intoxication by eating a Mexican pizza? Done. Fantasies of obesity and diabetes for one night? Taco Bell is the place to be. In my case, it's whenever nearby Muchas Gracias (http://www.yelp.com/biz/muchas-gracias-portland-7) decides to suddenly close early, this is the next best thing.

Since I moved to NYC years ago, these sorts of Taco Bells are a bit of a rarity. it's bad that when even fast food is made poorly in one of the greatest cities of the world. It's even worse when a mediocre version of the "norm" is considered solid by abnormally fast food deprived palates.

This Taco Bell location is no exception and while it's far from the perfect tacos that weird critical folks will judge quickly, it's just fast food. If you keep that in mind, this place is as predictable as they come for the crappy food fix that everyone craves once in awhile.

Cheesy beefy burrito for a dollar? Check. Double stuffed tacos? Gross. Mexican pizza? Done and done.

I got helped really quickly which is always a plus but what really blew me away was the state of their bathroom.  I actually ate at the burger king across the street but the toilet seat in the men's room was covered in shit, so I came here.  Not only was their toilet seat not covered in shit, the bathroom was actually very clean.  I'm really impressed.

(Obvious Note(TM): I am reviewing THIS location, not the food of Taco Bell or the chain itself. ) The secret is out. Don't tell anybody, but this Taco Bell is... kind of incredible! They play classical music. The staff is friendly. Every time I've been in here, it's as spotless as a Taco Bell can get. Incredible people, special requests were politely accepted (I like my bean burrito a certain way, see?) and as pleasant as a Taco Bell is ever going to get. So, if you find yourself in a position where this is what you're after, THIS Taco Bell is the place to go.

Let's get down to it.

Taco Bell, oh how I love you. You make me feel so good inside. With your spicy beany goodness, that I love so much. I love you soft and I love you hard. I love you full of cheese cuz I like cheese. The FIYAH SAUCE is so good. I like to put it in the tacos so that they taste so yummy. And I love how when I talk about it makes me feel so good. I should go get some but I won't. I'll TOOT and my girlfriend will kick me out of the house. Yes, the house. I'll go to the couch, but she'll start screaming she can smell it under the door. I tell her to roll up some towels, homeland security style to keep it out but she don't care.
Pretty consistent for a Taco Bell. Chalupas tend to be frozen and they ALWAYS forget my quesadilla (we are on 4 forgotten and counting..)

WORST. TACO. BELL. EVER.

If I could give this particular Taco Bell location ZERO stars, I would. We've been here maybe ten times, and every single time it ends up making us say, "NEVER going back there again!" Yet we did, over and over. Hoping that things would change, but no more, I say! 

The service is slow and rude. DO NOT try to go INSIDE to order. Take the drive thru or sit in the lobby until you grow old and grey, die of starvation, or just give up and leave, whichever comes first. Seriously though, they will take your order, and then they will forget about you in the lobby forever. 

Taking the drive thru is a little bit better. There are always tons of people in line, but at least this route will get you some food. The problem is that it probably won't be the food that you ordered. It's best to check your bag before you drive away from the window, because if you don't you are faced with a dilemma: Enter the Lobby of Eternal Waiting, or get back in the drive thru line from hell... Dun dun duuuuun!

Well, good luck to you, if you decide to face this horrible place, but I'd rather drive to a different Taco Bell to get my crappy "mexican" food fix.
Extremely rude to customers and calling them liers. Slamming windows and slamming down the food they make, breaking taco salads bowls. Attitude attitude
30 minutes to get two soft tacos! It is filled with homeless people too. I don't have a problem with homeless people but I do have a problem waiting that long for fast food!

Slow service, totally messed up the order,had to throw in trash. The employees are very rude and act like they don't care.    Wait in line 15 minutes at the drive thru for 4 soft tacos and they can't get that right.
Thank you, this certain TB, for putting faith back into my Fourth Meal.

This location always seems super slammed day or night. So, just a warning... Make a lot of extra time if you plan to go through the drive-thru. The service and the food don't really stand out compared to any other location... Typical chain.

I made my order at the drive-thru, no problem. I pay for my food and am then notified they are out of things for half my order. I asked for a refund for the items not available and they kept pushing me to order something else. I ask for the manager and get my refund with some hesitation. Being that I do not eat in the car, I get home (10min drive) and my XXL grilled stuffed buritto is cold and is about as stuffed as a quesodilla. There was barely ANYTHING stuffed inside the tortilla. It's 2:00 in the morning, I just got off work after a grueling, stressful day and I do not want to go back and have them remake my order. I do not recommend this Taco Bell unless you enjoy poor service and dismal quality food.

Let's talk about Taco Bell.  It used to be reserved only for road trips and late night meals, but recently I have developed a love for Taco Bell anytime, anywhere.  The cheesy, meaty goodness of the crunch wrap supreme however uncrunchy it proves to be brightens my day in any situation.  Let's move on to the Dorito taco.  Why has no one thought of this sooner? Ridiculously good.  The chicken quesadilla also never ceases to amaze me with it's cheesy perfection and zesty baja sauce, clearly straight from the gods.  My final note is the props I give to TB for continuing to entice my soda pallet with handcrafted flavors like blue and red mixed with mountain dew.  Keep it up TB, if only you were locally owned you would have had that fifth star.

Let me preface this by saying that I have a deep love of Taco Bell. 

That said, this is the worst Taco Bell I've ever, ever, ever been to.  They mess up the food every single time and the wait for counter service has been upwards of a half an hour... for FAST FOOD.

And if you sit too close to the bathroom it really smells.

The people who work there seem very nice but it's just not worth it.  Make the trip to the Taco Bell by the Fred Meyer on 82nd and Johnson Creek and even if you have to dive three times as far for it, you'll probably get your food faster and better.

Went through the drive thru and had the worst customer service ever. She was snotty and rude and argued when I asked about the black beans. Which apparently they do not have, even though it's on half their menu. Anyways Taco Bell, get some damn black beans! Also teach your employees to be respectful. I then called to speak to a manager and she was also very rude. Answers the phone just saying Taco Bell. I told her that whoever is working window is being rude and she also argued with me.

Worst Taco Bell. The last time I was there, they said "long wait"... then the Manager just leaves. Employee has to refund like 20 people. No food for any of us. Then I give them one more chance, a week later, the restaurant part is locked and drive thru line is way too long. Nope.

This taco bell should be closed down, how are u gonna take peoples money and not give them everything they paid for. Ordered a #2 and 2 casadillas and a fritos burrito and they gave me 1 taco for my number 2 and 3 casadillas. Horrible service I wont be going here again nor recommend anyone go there. Tried calling and goes straight to voicemail. This place is garbage

I can't say I've ever been to a worse Taco Bell in my life.
Scratch that, I can't say I've ever gone to a worse Fast Food Restaurant in my life.

Taking in the quality of the place, you don't expect much. That was until the day they RAN OUT OF GROUND BEEF. Can you name anything on the typical order from this place that doesn't include ground beef?
Another time I had walked into the store, stood at the counter for two minutes, then they  told me they were closed and I would need to do drive through, apparently they forgot to lock the store up in time. The question was, why couldn't they just honor my order there instead of making me go back in my car and wait in the drive thru line? I've never seen slower service. Fast (keyword Fast) food people, I could always cross the street to Taco Time and maybe I would but Taco Bell keeps the market on unusually late hours for this kind of greasebucket feeding frenzy. It'll kill me to say that I may once again come back here out of sheer desperation for that late night chalupa but I will not enjoy it.

I never review places 1 star, especially fast food as I never expect the best service but I was absolutely appalled at the service. Don't go here if you don't eat meat. I've been a long time Taco Bell fan and love coming here since it's cheap, yummy, and very vegetarian/vegan friendly. However today I tried to order a beefy frito burrito and replaced the beef with beans and they WOULD NOT do it without charging me extra. Absolutely ridiculous. It left a bad taste in my mouth about the whole company.

This place is fast food at fine dining speeds.

You may have noticed the other reviews saying this place is slow. You might be thinking, maybe it took someone ten minutes to get their food. Maybe they were just a little busy. It's a Taco Bell. How bad can it be?

I like Taco Bell. I won't go back to this one. It's on my banned restaurants list. I called it quits the last time I was here and it took me an hour to get my food. Literally. A literal hour. For a few burritos and tacos. And that's an hour from the time I ordered. The drive thru has always been bad here, but I figured if I placed my order online and walked in, I could get around that. Nope!

From the hour I had to observe the whole process, I think I figured out why. Everyone here seems very nice. But only a few people are working at any one time. And they're not very quick. Everything is made slowly one item at a time.

They also don't make the food in order. Uber Eats orders? Front of the line. They'll work drive thru in after that. Eat in orders last. If they're slammed by Uber Eats? No food for you. You're going to have to annoy them at the counter to even get them to start on your food. Even if you're into the drive thru, prepare to sit for a long while.

And just to be clear, my hour wait was my breaking point. But this place is always _slow_. Half hour, at least, most of the time for drive thru.

I don't know what they need to do to fix this place. But I've literally tried to track down where I could send feedback to Taco Bell corporate about this place which is definitely not something I thought would ever be something I would actually spend time doing.

Oh my god. So my boyfriend went to this location and came home with a black bean crunchwrap supreme for me. Not only was there almost no beans in it, it was basically like 90% tortilla and lettuce, but he asked for guacamole with it. He got charged for it only for them to not put any guacamole in it. Honestly, what is wrong with this location? I've never been to a fast food place that was this bad.
2 stars on a bad day, plus 3 stars on a good day, equals 5 stars every day. They also got that blue Mountain Dew Baja Blast so you can drink that while you fill up your guts, baby!

I came here just to review this taco bell because I've been here 5 times. This, every single time, has been the slowest drive thru line I have ever been in in any state, in any city, in any country, in my life. Each time it seems longer than the time before. I've been in this taco bell line for 25 minutes before and still wasn't at the window. Once, okay, it happens, two, a fluke, but FIVE TIMES....are there not any other taco bells within driving distance, or are they just that slow? I give it 2 stars because at least my order is usually right. This time, I watched an entire episode on Hulu on my phone and still had time to type this review. Still sitting in line, as per usual. I think this will be my last visit to this establishment. Nobody has enough time on their hands, especially when they're choosing a place partly based on it being FAST. FAST. FOOD. I've ordered from big chain restaurants and had chefs finish my order and in the bag waiting for me in less time than it takes to get my food here. Something's gotta change, manager of taco bell on Powell Blvd. Jeez!!! This is absolutely ridiculous!

The worst service. Every time I come here I sit in the drive thru for way too long. This is not fast food. They always have new people working and nobody knows what they are doing and they dont understand that it's fast food or something. It's the closest food to my work so sometimes I have no choice but to come here but I regret it every time after sitting in the drive thru for so long. It shouldn't be this difficult

Thirty mins for 3 tacos! What a joke this place is. Service was the worst I have ever seen. 9 people and only two really working. The rest standing around looking lost. And they want $15 an hour. No way!!!

Just gotta say that Rick (I hope I caught his name right) is the most accommodating, helpful, and friendly employee I've ever had at any Taco Bell location. Not only did he make my food quick and efficient, he also came out to make sure my complex order was correct BEFORE making it. I have had numerous orders, both large, small, simple, and complex be messed up consistently, but not here. Always great for a quick meal. Rick needs a raise.

This is the second time I have been through and order meals for a few people and it's not that the order was wrong, but they have charged me for my order and didn't fill the order. Tried to go to Taco Bell's website but they must have low standards cause you can't send them a message. I was already regretting the dinner choice, but getting screwed over after waiting 20 minutes in the drive through is BS. I'll be sure to find their nearest competition and gladly give them my business. How hard is it to do your job???? Also, big shout out to the corporate side of the business, I'd also hide if I had a failure rate that high.

This is a typical Taco Bell the service is ok and the speed of the order is not to bad.  Sometimes there isn't someone to take your order and you can wait a little while to get it in, but 70% of the time it's usually pretty good.

Worst taco bell of all time.  Been in the drive thru line for 20 minutes without moving. I can't even leave because there are cars in front of me and behind me.  I'm literally imprisoned at taco bell.

This happened last time and I though it was a fluke, why did I do this again?

If you want a 5 star dining experience then go somewhere else, okay. It's Taco Bell. I don't get why so many people complain about fast food because you're not paying for a lavish experience so don't expect one. That being said Taco Bell is my guilty pleasure and the people at this location are generally very friendly. Sometimes when the drive through is packed they mess up an order but if you check it before driving off and tell them they're usually very polite and they quickly fix it. As far as the inside goes the soda fountain area could be a bit cleaner but it's certainly not going to stop me from indulging my craving for Baja Blast.

I only have a 1/2 hour for my lunch break. I drove to Taco Bell's drive through on Powell blvd in Portland to grab a quick bite. I waited in the drive through for over 15 mins behind 3 cars. Two drivers in line behind me went in the store to see what the issues was. One was angry and said " This is bullshit!". He stormed the store abandoning his running vehicle in line. When I did get my burrito it was cold! Gross. I couldn't eat it. Waste of time and money.

I realize no one's coming on Yelp for a Taco Bell review but in case you're the kind of person that checks out Yelp's Taco Bell reviews... this one's for you. 

Everyone in here is so nice... surprisingly nice, but they need to hire about 12 more people to work at any given time. The wait is atrocious, I could order, eat across the street, come back, and still be waiting for my food. When I drive though I turn the car off and push - I'll be in that line 15-20 minutes. They need to drop the "fast" and just call it "food."

But the people are so nice.

I walked into the Taco Bell and the girl working at the front gave me the nicest smile and said "hi what can I gets started for you?" I was so pleased with her manners and attitude I asked for her what her name was and she replied Mellian. If you ever come to this Taco Bell ask for Mellian to take your order, but I must say their nacho fries need some work and they needed to be served with more cheese. Besides that is was great.

Pretty good. For a Taco Bell, anyway. One time the fillings for a taco were on the outside of the taco, but that was  just one time. Fast, convient, and cheap. Just ignore the depressed workers and you should be happy with your authentic Mexican eating.

Waited FIFTY (50!!) minutes in drive thru. Once I pulled up to the window I watched the cook undercook my quesadilla, there's a timer on the machines, it's like 20 seconds and she couldnt wait. The cashier was rude and kept her back towards me the entire time. RUDE. GROSS. Do better!!!
Half the order wasn't in the bag. Half the quesadilla was just straight missing. Brutal.
Such terrible customer service. Dude at register just stayed silent pressing buttons didn't even ask me any questions. I've been waiting almost 20 minutes for two $1 menu items

Besides normal dirtiness, staff was okay with someone bringing in a full bio-hazard trash bag, and placing it on seats. Hopefully guests or staff don't get any diseases. This location also has a hard time opening at posted hours.
They purposely postpone my order making me wait for over an hour l and then decided to cancel it instead of for filling it.
It's Taco Bell, ya know? Lower your standards and it will taste great!

Oh hell no we came here and the worker Mia spit in our food and we seen it then she got an attitude when we said we want our money back she said no I didn't do shit to your food so we asked for her manager and she didn't get her till 20 min later when we said we would tell the boss and then the manager was so rude she said I don't care what happened you don't get refunds. I will never come here again it is so disgusting how disrespectful they were to us(.)

This Taco Bell is absolutely terrible. I went there at about 7:30 pm and it was  about me and 3 different customers and I ordered on the kiosk. And now I'm just waiting to pay cash at the register. There is about 4 workers and all in the kitchen. And I'm still waiting. At this point it's 8:15 and I start hearing this old guy working there saying I'm so done with my job and cursing all over. Finaly I get my order done, but by the time I left, it was 8:45. I waited an hour and 15 min for what, a chalupa box. And they still managed to mess up my order. I asked no sour cream and right when I got my order I saw sour cream. At this point I don't wanna wait any longer. Let me just not, the only good worker their is this Asain lady. Her 4 stars everyone else 1.

First of all, half the employees here are clueless. I don't think they were trained properly. We were ordering with an employee at the register and half way through the order another employee came out of the woman's bathroom and proceeded to have a very personal conversation with the guy taking our order. Literally in the middle of us placing an order. We stopped talking and just watched them talk. The guy told the girl you call tell me later and looked at us and apologized and looked shocked himself that she was so clueless and rude. It was the weirdest thing. I took two stars off for that. Another 2 stars for the eating area looking so dissaray. And finally I did let them keep a star for getting our order right. Which they topically don't. That was the only reason why we even went inside, so we could check our order to make sure it was right. I am not impressed with this location. If there's another Taco Bell close by, go that route instead.

On Sunday's, I wake up late (hung over of course) and somehow drive my a$$ to TB. Honestly, it brings life back to the monotony of the week ahead.  The only issue I have is they sometimes mess up my order, take too long to take my order or leave out hot sauce. Keep up the 4th meal dream and live mas!
Taco Bell is my guilty pleasure. Countertops and soda foundation area could be a little cleaner, but the food never disappoints. Staff is friendly.

You guys I swear are the worst Taco Bell on earth, I wanted pico there is no pico I paid extra for , I don't even know why I go here anymore. This Taco Bell must be broke tortilla with cheese sauce , when I also ordered extra beef and it was 10am
