Your business hours say you are open daily inside until 10pm. It is 9:40pm. Your doors are locked. The drive-thru has 9 cars in it moving at a snails pace. 

Looks like poor staff management and poor customer service and not adhering to your posted hours. 

No thanks. 

I'll go elsewhere.
They shorted the quantity of nacho fries and half filled all of the cheese sauce containers. Low rent dreck Taco Bell!
Took FOREVER to make my food! I've never had it take this line. Been waiting for over 20 minutes. This is TACO BELL...

I have never left a one star review in my life... but this is getting ridiculous. I'm used to Taco Bell messing up my vegetarian orders but this location is something else. I ordered a Crunchwrap with beans instead of beef and it had BOTH I didn't even notice at first because the beans disguised it. Still hungry and wanting Taco Bell I ordered a bean burrito, an item that had no meat. THEY GAVE ME A BEEF BURRIOT!!! Wtf!! I accidentally ate meat twice tonight. my stomach hurts. Bleh.
If you order delivery from this location it is GUARANTEED they will get your order wrong. This is based on years of ordering delivery from this specific Taco Bell location, like some sisyphean fool.

This location is actually a joke. We ordered 3 crunch wrap supremes, 2 cheesy Gordita crunches, a dollar taco, and twists. They forgot a Crunchwrap and the taco. The kid at the window was a joke and needs to check the orders before handing them out because he handing us a drink we didn't order. After waiting 18 minutes we were expecting all of our food and some structure but I guess that's asking too much. Go to the Super Deluxe across the street, they have bomb chicken nuggets and they won't fuck up your order.

For clarity the staff of this Taco Bell are amazing, have positive attitudes and deserve wonderful things in life. Every time I pass through they put me in a great mood. The owners of this company can burn in hell and I hope their hardworking and lovely employees get everything they can from this trash company and get out. Powell Taco Bell employees, you are angels and you make my day!

terrible service and food at this location only. Popeyes is one of my favorites 
Just finished playing softball across the street at THPRD on beautiful warm night last week.
The person who took my order was rude and not helpful at all. When I got to the window I found a guy with a black leather jacket working the window and incoming orders. At first I thought they were being robbed. Then I saw the Popeyes uniform underneath his bad ass jacket. There was no one behind me. He said to me in a thick accent that matched his leather jacket. " do you want sauces ? Yes please what do you have? Instead of just telling me he pointed to the 8 or so, sauces on the outside of the window. I did not have my glasses on as they were in my workout bag in the back seat. So I asked him again " can you tell me what kind of sauces you have? He pointed to the sauce sign again and rolled his eyes at me as if he was be put out.  . " I don't have my glasses COULD YOU PLEASE TELL ME WHAT KIND OF SAUCES YOU HAVE?" He responds Ranch and BBQ. My vision is bad but I see there are 8 different sauces on the sign. Aaaugh! One last time. Are those the only two sauces you have? "Ahh No" this guy reminded me of Vlad in the movie Horton Hears a Who! Dumb and he could care less about me or his job. I drove away. The food didn't taste good after all that. I know the Cold War is over. But it will be a cold day in Hell before I go back to Vlad drive in window.

I have gone here quite a bit since it opened a few years ago. The last 3 time I have gone to this restaurant (in November), the chicken is old, overcooked, dry and grey with this white pussy crud in it I did not know if I should eat it or purchase some monistat for it... I am very disappointed in the quality lately, and do not think it is worth another chance. The employees are great but they need to cook smaller batches so it is not several hours old when you get it. Save you money and go where your chicken has not been sitting until it becomes green grey jerky. I do not know if they have a new cook but this is only a recent thing with them as in the past it was a 4+ star. I hope they can turn it around 15 bucks for garbage, even our dogs horked it up.... I called and they said they would replace the food with fresh, I will keep you posted on the results....

The issue I have with this Popeye's is their drive thru. If you want to actually get what you pay for, go inside.  Ridiculous and they're ripping people off if you don't sit in the drive through and check you order. Missing items every time I've done their drive through. Quality control is terrible, I.e. ice cold Cajun fries.  So disappointed. Chicken ain't cheap here no dollar menu. Done with Popeyes going back to KFC.

So I had to wait for seven minutes however they gave me aside a biscuit and a dessert for free for waiting I think that's great customer service even though I don't know about how they kill the chickens I'm going to dig a little bit more into it I am super impressed with the customer service very polite
Garbage service and garbage workers. Gave these f wads two chances and each time the dipshit drive thru person taking the order can't speak English. Never again.

Literally, a giant waste of time. 

We ordered our chicken tonight and the lady said it'd be right out. After 20 minutes of waiting patiently I asked the counter person if my chicken was ready. The guy said, "let me grab my manager".

Manager said, "Oh, it should only be 11 more minutes or so". That's right folks, 31 minutes for fast food chicken dinner.  

They knew how long it was going to be before they took my money.  Had they given me the option of waiting 30 minutes+ we would have declined, but would have likely tried again someday.  

After making a bit of a stink she refunded my money and we went to KFC.  Sad, because I really liked Popeyes but they will never waste another minute of my time.
One of the worst Popeyes chicken ever.. I ordered a 2 piece meal.. What I got was an over freid chicken with bones and pretty much not much meat..

It probably took about 15 minutes between me waiting on line to actually getting my food.  The cashier seemed to be doing a lot so I understood it, but it just tells me that the place is a little understaffed.  Food was great though, as it always is at Popeyes.

For the most part they do ok. But for the last three trips, the order was either missing something or we get something else. This time we were missing a side of coleslaw. The two previous trips they put French fries instead of the Cajun rice that was ordered. I recommend you check your order every time you go. This has gotten ridiculous.

It's Popeyes. You know what you're getting in terms of product and service. Just remember, large size combo is huuuuuuge. You don't need a gallon of strawberry Fanta that may or may not fit in your car's cup holder.

Probably my favorite fast food restaurant.

The spicy chicken is very delicious, and the biscuits are perfect.

99% of the time the service is great, the only downside is that they sometimes take 5 minutes to make your chicken fresh. Which is great for quality, but if you are short on time can be an issue.

Location always looks very clean and the staff for the most part is very nice.

Hey, y'all. This is bomb-diggity!! Coronal Sanders is glad that "he deeeade". The chicken isn't greasy and the mashed taters don't taste like baby food.
This beach was a sparkling example of extreme OCD and an A++ according to any and all health inspectors. 
I feel bad because I trashed my receipt and didn't note the name of the dude who served me. He was not only an Oregon Duck fan and has plans to go there but he was clearly hating it but at the same time was pleasant and truly cared. 
Plus I went at like 5:30-- rush hour! Went inside and waited only 5 minutes. 
Did I mention how good the food is? I'm eating it cold as I write. 
Plus, it was my first time. I will become a regular. :))
This Popeye's location is a great place to just sit down and eat some good chicken. They always have a clean place and serve promptly.

Very few places you go to nowadays where they step up and show ya how to save a couple bucks on your order when you get up to the window. I was going to call the manager to let him know ....and I found out it was the manager Kip..... that helped  me out.   Good food and excelent service ..... I can't recommend this place enough.
The chicken is greasy and the corn on the cob is the worst. One of the worst Popeyes I have been to.
I'd never been to a Popeye's, so I had to try it...and I like it.  Their chicken is very good, and not greasy like KFC's.  I definately recommend it.

My youngest daughter wanted to try this place so bad....What a disappointment! We paid almost $40.00 for bland crappy food. The employees are rude and don't want to try to assist you at all. If the rest of Popeyes are like this one then the commercials are false advertising their products.  It would take me FOREVER to tell you just how bad my family's experience was today. From dealing with the cashier named Emi  at the location.  Then calling and trying to talk to Irene the management on duty who refused to give me corporates information because she said she was to busy.  I was sitting outside at that time.  They had one car in drive-thru and one in the parking lot. It was our first and our last time there. We will be letting others know not to go there. They are overpriced and the food is cold, bland and portions are small.  KFC has better bang for your buck.  Don't waste you time or your money.

This has got to be the cleanest Popeye's I've ever been to.

Minus one star for receiving a wrong order. Twice but they've always been nice to admit their mistakes and give my correct chicken and side orders.

The chicken is always served hot, crispy and juicy. The biscuits are warm and will perfectly melt the butter. Add a drizzle of honey and you're in heaven. 

Zun: I would recommend Costco chicken instead of Albertson's. Alberston's is nasty.

I really like Popeyes fried chicken every once in a while. It is always consistently good, and the biscuits are amazing when eaten fresh and hot. My problem with this particular location is that too often they make mistakes on my order. Two out of my last 4 orders placed through the drive through were wrong. Like when I asked for MILD chicken nuggets for my kids and they gave me spicy. Or when I asked for three orders of dark two-piece meals and they gave me one that was white meat. That kind of thing. I just don't understand why they can't get it right.

So the female associate "filling in" not from the store was very rude! I immediately called to inform her my order was missing items & she initially could not offer a solution since she was "filling in".   I asked her to drop my info in the safe for the manager & let her know I wanted a credit for my order when she all of a sudden asserted herself to tell me that wasn't going to happen?  My order was incomplete & without my biscuits I can't make my sandwiches for work!  How does she go from helpless to authoritative?  Again, Management, please provide a simple $10 credit for me, it wasn't MY mistake, I feel I'm being reasonable.  And btw, when I called back to get her name 3 calls were not answered. So unprofessional to say the least

I think they have screwed up my order more than they have gotten it right!!! I love their chicken but ordering here is like playing Russian Roulette. And you will have to wait...a long time. To their credit though I have never received dried out crap chicken like I have at the NE Portland locations though - everything is always cooked well...it is just that your order takes forever no matter what time of day or night and you need to look to make sure they gave you what you ordered including sauces and such.

HAIR IN THE POTATOES?!?!
I ordered their special 2 piece and biscuit $2.99 which is a great deal! And a side of their creamy mashed potatoes and the Cajun gravy on the side, so I can dip my chicken in.
Come on guys, please do not try to replace the one that had a hair in with the one in same batch? The proper thing to do would have been to toss the contaminated batch and bring out another batch, but who knows if all the mashed potatoes were mixed in with the same mixed vat...

This is another Popeye's location. It has Popeye's food, drive-through service and ample parking.

It is pretty far from me, but I was in the area when I went and I wasn't disappointed. I got exactly what I expected in terms of service and food, and it was good.

If I were in the area again and I wanted Popeye's, I'd go back. I really have no qualms with this location.

I had such high hopes going in for a meal.  I did the number 2 meal, two pieces of chicken and a side and drink.  While I know I got enough calories, for $7.15, I didn't feel full and wasn't really satisfied.  
The chicken was pretty good (but the breast was bit small and looked like it was missing the tender from it) (I know it couldn't due to anatomy).  The mashed potatoes and gravy, well, that was almost yucky.  The sweet tea was good.  The bisquit was small and ho hum.

So to sum up, yes, the chicken was better that most KFC's, but it seemed pricy and not totally satisfying.  Observing some of the other patrons, yes, you have to ask for dipping sauces.  Really, that should come without being asked.  When I went, it seemed like they got lost in the kitchen area for a bit and it took longer than expected inside.  The drivethrough seemed to be humming along.  

Well, I can say I've tried Popeyes now.  Doubt I'll be back though.  Didn't hit the value proposition for me.

I love Popeyes their food is amazing for fast food. It's just too bad that this specific location is terrible, not the food though BUT the people. 

Every time I've gone there they've messed up on my order. The first time I went there I asked for dark meat they gave me breast meat and some wings.. Uh no.. I returned it and asked for the right pieces I got a look from the worker like I was crazy. The second time it happened again! I again got the crazy look and the worker said with an attitude were not allowed to take those back I left it sitting there til he gave me the right pieces. Is the job that hard though? The third time which happened to be tonight all I asked for was a simple 8 piece meal with dark meat the girl at the speaker box made it sound like it was the most difficult order she'd ever heard. We got it figured out eventually, I also ordered a gallon of their sweet tea because I love their tea the girl at the window told me to wait in front for someone to drop it off to me. I waited for 10 minutes no one ever came I finally go in give me receipt to the worker and he had to ask me twice if I wanted sweet tea I said YES SWEET TEA. There are no labels on the gallon so I go home with it trusting that he knew he got it right.. NOPE! I got unsweetened tea like I DIDNT ask for..

I just don't get it they've been at that location for quite some time and they just can't get it right. I used to be the GM for a KFC so I know how this business works, their jobs aren't that hard. It's just too bad that their service sucks because I love Popeyes but I'll never come back here after 3 times of messing up.

It was the worse experience for me and my family. I ordered at 11:09pm. At 12:10am I was so angry because I kept knocking the window and they kept ignoring me the only reason I kept waiting is because we just came back from long trip and my kids were so hungry and sleepy waiting for the food 
After about hour they ask me if I want my chicken mild or spicy. I told them to give me my money back. Then they promised me that my order will be ready in 10 minutes. So I waited just for my kids. After twenty minutes the order was not ready. I left the restaurant. I left a complain in there website I didn't get callback from them until the third day from the manager. The only thing she said is "we sorry comeback for your order" with a cold voice.  I will never go back to this restaurant again or other location of this restaurant.

The prices of this popeyes keeps climbing and tonight after paying nearly $62.00 for one family meal and one box of chicken strips I don't think I am coming back , very greedy to charge so much in my opinion, the food is not that good, more breading and bone on the chicken then meat ,Also after waiting for a long time in the drive up the guy in the window tells us the food is not ready and to pull around to the front where we had to wait again for about 15 minutes, also he could barely speak a word of English, very frustrating trying to understand him and talk to him and when we got home I found he messed up on our order.

Fast food.  Not my usual review thing, but I will admit I'm a sucker for a shrimp PoBoy!  The staff was super friendly.  And quick to offer my daughter a sample to make sure it wasn't too spicy for her.  The dining room area was really clean!  
This is a fast food chicken place that specializes in "Louisiana" style chicken.  Which by their estimation means spicy.  And for fast food chicken, it's not terrible.  I like the spice.  Kids were ok with the popcorn shrimp and mild chicken tenders.  They also had the Mac and cheese and had no complaints.  While I don't like the stuff, they did, even though it seemed like the consistency looked a bit off.
The popcorn shrimp is nothing crazy, but they are decent.  Biscuits are way better than KFC.  And the chicken wasn't super greasy either.  However, my fries were pretty cold.  And the seasoned green beans, kinda soupy. The place is a guilty pleasure of myne as I like their fries (normally, and hot).  Also their specials can't be beat, sorry colonel. I would say there aren't enough NON spicy things for kids.  But I'll always come by if I'm solo for a quick lunch.

Why do i need to park for 10 minutes everytime i come here . Waited for 10 mins and then come home and have the wrong order !!!. This is not the first time this happen to us . This is actually the 6th or 7th time . And i just had it . i just wish i have enough energy to come back to the drive thru window and rant ! But they might make me wait another 10 mins . So ive been sucking it up and just eat what they gave us. TERRIBLE !!!

Ordered 8 pieces and said I only wanted one breast.  I expected a mix of thighs, legs and wings for the other 7 pieces.  Got home and they gave me the breast and 7 wings- pretty crappy to take advantage of a customer this way.

I just moved to the area and have gotten very used to my old Popeyes. My order is specific and it gets messed up often. I don't really mind. They got it right the first couple of times, but tonight they simply made a mistake I went back in. Immediately they could tell something was wrong and went right to my aid. She gave me my meal plus extra and was very quick and kind to be at my service. I am happy to live down the road from here and call it my new Popeyes (:

Godawful joint. Unless you enjoy expensive tasteless "sea food", don't go here. It's nothing to savor. Very, very small shrimp covered with thousands of crumb-sized particles of batter. Cole slaw terrible. Really, it's shit. The breadcrumbs are boxed in a small container a few inches in volume. For the price, go buy yourself a couple of pounds of REAL prawns, make a little pasta and eat with taste.

Over priced. Because of the location they feel the need to charge a tad more than other Popeye's. Also upcharge for substitutions. The food the service the cleanliness is the same as any other so is it just cause' Nike is right there?

When I learned recently that this place was ensconced deep in the SW, I was immediately about 35% more jazzed about working way out in the vicinity. 


But why not 5 stars, if  you and your colleagues are so thrilled, you may ask?


'cos it's not the Popeye's on MLK and Ainsworth.... ask any locals, they'll tell you, that one is just BETTER. Few can coherently articulate WHY it's better, but hey, 10,000 silly No Po Hos----they KNOWS!   ;p

My husband and I stopped here for something different than our norm. We ordered two #5 meals (popcorn shrimp). 

We paid, were handed our drinks and were asked to "pull around the front" and they'd bring our order out. There was no one else in line to need this. We waited about 15 minutes (enough time for my husband to chat up some guy about an old car he had). 

We drove to a park to eat, only to discover that we got one popcorn shrimp, one chicken something each with a biscuit and mashed potatoes. No butter, no utensils.... So we drove home. 

And then found a hair in my potatoes. 

This will be my first & last experience with Popeyes.

Same as the other reviews: be prepared to wait a long time when you come here. Adding to the frustration, the people who operate the drive through are very difficult to understand. I never understand why these places put people with poor language skills behind microphones.

Great branch. You can always make sure that you get fresh fried chicken. They always give what you ordered (as in detail). Always order popcorn shrimp---and its popcorn shrimp only and they do give me that compared to the other branch they add biscuits to your order to make it look more or heavy but it doesn't have enough shrimps in there.
The service was ok at best... What really threw me off was, the chicken was super dry and super greasy. The kids meal was supposed to come with a toy but they failed to include it... C'MON SON!!

This is less of a review and more of a recommend!

Need a bite of something spicy, crispy, hot, cool, slighty chewy, and very tasty.  Get the Po' Boy!  But wait.....you need a quick addition to bring it to greatness or at the minimum really goodness.  Add your side of Slaw to the actual sandwich and atleast one packet of hot sauce.  Give it a good smash so you can one hand this bad boy and you are good to go.

I am telling you this is where it's at! 

Popeye's never disappoints of course expectations are inline with that of anything from a drive-thru.  Great fried chicken, Great Biscuits, beans and rice, eh...for eating on the run and under 10 bucks you can't beat it.
Rude and non-accommodating.  Makes you wait if you want anything other than their specific combos. They don't even fill up the containers with food.  Picture of half filled container of Cole slaw.
Food was good but I was disappointed when I found a hair deep fried to my chicken.

Yay for fast and friendly! That's all I want really... We stopped coming to this location for a time because they seemed to consistently mess up our order, leave things out and just all sorts of errors. We gave in and came here again to discover perfect orders each time, no matter the time of day. Such a great turn around - bravo!

raised prices again. Food tastes ok, its popeyes. The price for 3 piece chicken tenders has rose to 10.00$ and the 5 piece is now 12.00 dollars. I just ordered and when i got home the 3 piece had ok amount of chicken. The 5 piece was missing a piece so i ended up with 4 pieces of chicken for 12 dollars. I will be going up the road to the new chic fil a

This review is biased and based on ONE visit, so keep that in mind.  They don't devein their shrimp!  EWWWWW.  Got the shrimp po-boy and made it 3 bites in before I realized there was a lot of grit in my mouth.  Took a look and sure enough, shrimp poo.  Seriously gross.  The service wasn't bad, but I really just can't get over throwing a whole sandwich away because of lame corner cutting.  I will not be going back for that.  or the instant mashed pototoes.

It takes a long time, but the people were cool and the place is cleaner than some of the other locations.  Finally got to try the chicken sandwich and I gotta say...I'd rather have the regular fried chicken on the bone!  I guess I was never much of a fan of a chicken sandwich.  It was pretty good, but not as good as a box of chicken with a side of red beans and rice!

When I need a fried chicken fix, Popeye's is my first choice. This is a good one. Clean, with servers who can hold an intelligent conversation, I would go here again.  The chicken is pretty good as well.

For starters, the counter person took my cash and then processed our order without washing her hands or wearing gloves.  Second, for the second time at this particular location something I ordered was left out.  Our order was to go so we did not discover that the item was missing until we got home.  We do like Popeye's chicken but will probably not return to this location.

No customization on order. Would not let me pick dark meat on my order. Would not give me any sauces without paying 50 cents each. I ordered 8pc chicken and 2 regular fires. Seriously, no sauce allowed? Also the employee shoved his face in my bag to verify that the order was correct. Not sure why his whole face was needed in the bag.. especially with covd..

Who doesn't love chicken, especially when it's fried. Not the best thing to put in your temple but I do love me some Popeyes especially their red beans and rice. I like the dark spicy blend the most. $8 isn't bad for 3 pieces and a side. My favorite part is how fast your food is ready from when you order it. One of my few fast food weaknesses.

After a long road trip, which found us getting to our hotel after 10:00 p.m., I ran over to Popeyes for some chicken. Their drive through window is open until 2:00 a.m. Upon pulling up to the speaker box to order food I was told "I'm sorry, but we are out of chicken."  I asked if I heard that correctly, and was told that yes, Popeyes was out of chicken. Three and a half hours before their drive through window closes. There is a sign on their front door that says "CLOSED Sorry Under Staffed". They had two staff members standing around smoking right in front of it. Not impressed.

Really slow service on a Sunday afternoon. Pretty unheard of for a fast food restaurant in Beaverton to have a line that goes to the back of the restaurant. Expect to wait in line for 20-30 minutes just to be able to order. Need faster or more employees.
This Popeyes is much better than the one they have in Aloha. Always love the fried chicken. Hands down better than KFC or Church's. Love the biscuits too.
I really like spicy chicken with those hot biscuits YUM  service is upscale the place is very clean this is my favorite spot now.
Simply the best chicken, red beans with rice, cajun mashed Taters and buttery biscuits. Always clean inside with very helpful staff, we love it here.

Bought food today, it was very good. 8 piece spicy, coleslaw and beans and rice. Super tasty. The place was packed at 1: 45 . Service was perfect and Ja'kila Emaan l was smiling ,helpful, and nice. Will be back very soon.

This specific location its such a disgrace... the only thing i get here are their chicken tenders for $12! And all i get its cold extremely thin pieces of chicken a lot of times with either one side missing or all sides missing like today... I for sure will not be coming back if this is the type of service this place offers...

We waited in line for 20 min and at 1250 we are told they are closed, they are out of food. Disappointed and rude customer service. I will never go back again. This Popeyes is the worst!!! They need to re-evaluate how they treat customers before they get shut down!!  I wasn't even going to order a chicken sandwich!!

The food is what you'd expect, but there is consistently a wait greater than 20 mins in the evenings, regardless of the week day. I can wait, not a problem, but 20+ wait time on various visits is too much.

Piss poor customer service. 

I drive over from the coast and before meeting some buds for beer I wanted to stop for some spice chicken. I just spent most of the day surfing in my kayak and I'm very hungry. 

Two other cars are ahead of me and everyone parks get out and walks inside. So the fist guy was still deciding and passed to the next couple in line. They take literally 10 minutes to decide on what to order. The order taker is answering all their questions and bring very nice. 

The next guy gets his turn and he takes 8 minutes to give his order. Ok, he really didn't know what to get. 

Ok, my turn and I'm running out of time but I know what I want and can a quick order. 3 piece spicy chickens and dirty rice. Well the manager walks behind him and told him to package food up for other customers while I'm ready to pay. Just need the guy to push some buttons on the card machine. 

All this time their were 6 or more other employees plus the manager near the second cash register at different times during the past 25 minutes. None of them saw the line pile up nor how long the cashier was taking to take an order. Then the cashier said, Sorry but I told to do get orders and We need better customer service. 

It's 25 minutes since I walked into the fast food restaurant, I'm trying to pay for my order , my card is in the machine, 6 other employees have no idea that someone should help this guy and the manager tells him something else to to right now!

I pull my card out of that machine and walked out.

The food here is decent if they have it in stock, but they are always out of stuff. I have yet to try a chicken sandwich and today they were out of tenders too. The drive through menu doesn't match the menu inside, makes it difficult to even know what they sell. The time before I tried to order a surf and turf combo that was plastered on their windows and drive through menu, I was told it was no longer available. Really not cool as that is false advertising (illegal), they had everything for the combo just didn't give me the advertised price. I'm done here... too many other options for lunch.

Mischarging customers without batting an eye. 

I went to the Popeye's through the drive-through and was surprised by the total they stated at the window as it did not match the posted drive-through board. When I asked for clarification, I learned that they had increased their prices but not updated the drive-through board with the correct prices. I requested they honor their posted prices, and they said they were unable to do so. I asked to speak with the manager, only to be told that I was already speaking with the manager. I again requested they honor the price posted and do a price correction - they laughed and said it was such a small difference anyway, and that they are completely unable to make any price correction. They tried to tell me how the indoor signs had the correct price - this is irrelevant as the drive-through did not. I have never been to a place that does not honor a clearly posted price, even if it was in error. 

I hope that small difference in price was worth it to the manager. I will never come back to this location again, even though it is close to my work. If a business has a posted price, they should honor it. 

And to top it off, my order was wrong when I got home and opened it.
30 minutes and still no food.  And no reason or refund.  Guess will never come here again.
I see many bad reviews but I had a good experience here. Service was great with the drive thru, food was yummy and the lady at the cash register was very kind too.

The chicken sandwich was fantastic and better and much larger than Chick-Fl-A I think and cheaper! The 11 piece chicken was very good and very competitive with KFC. Service was disorganized and chaotic! I would go back only because the chicken was fantastic!
Nothing like waiting in the longest line ever and the ONLY that they got right is the drink. Ridiculous.

okay I have a friend who loves Popeyes...... I have only ever experienced the ones in N.Portland. I would be driving around with her and she would stop here. First I am not pleased that they no longer carry the catfish po'boys.... so I asked if they could still make one.... the woman rudely said no, so I asked if I could get the catfish basket and then get a po'boy roll....she again rudely said no...... then..... I suggested that I buy a catfish basket and a chicken po'boy minus the chicken..... at this point the woman is just being a bitch and said no she would not do that. REALLY???? I was willing to pay for a sandwich minus the meat so I could play Dr. Frankenstein  and assemble my own catfish po'boy. (You know minus the lightning and the angry villagers coming after me...... with pitchforks and torches) This made me mad so I left. The fact that she refused to sell me food so I could make what they had once...was just ridiculous. 
So I did not come here for a long time, then my friend and I were out driving around and she suggested she run thru to grab her and her hubby dinner, I decided fine I will try somehting there.... as I am not a fan of their chicken, their biscuits to me are way to greasy, the red beans and rice is more like soup.... but I would see what Po'boys they had...... so I order the shrimp po;boy and yea the shrimp was over cooked and like little rocks. Almost like it had been re-fried or forgotten under the heat lamp. 

ugh

so fast forwarding my friend convinced me to give them one more try...... again shrimp Po'boy...... this one was good.... faith restored. so I stop by here every now and then but have questions when I do if I am actually going to get a good one or a bad one.... since it is now 50/50 chance of it being good or not. 

It got two stars just due to when it is good it is really, really good but when it is bad, it is really, really bad.

Clean and sparkly location with quick and polite staff. The spicy chicken was nice and the Mac and cheese was full of gooey goodness. I had a major Mac and Cheese craving that's why we went here. It was pretty crowded for dinner, a couple of families and a couple of teens. I was burnt out and didn't feel like cooking or spending too much money. The food was fresh, hot and satisfying. Cal-o-rific.

I just spent the last 40 minutes trying to call them to let them know they had messed up my order, but noone picked up the phone. I had ordered a whole bunch of large mashed potatoes and when we got home to eat, one was a regular size and 2 of the other 3 were mac n cheese! It seems every time i go there they like to mess up my order. This is so sad, because i love popeyes. But now if anyone asks, i will tell them that that location is at least consistent with one thing: messing up orders.

I just went through the drive-through here and bought my toddler a side of macaroni and cheese and myself a three piece tender meal with mashed potatoes. I parked in the parking lot and proceeded to feed the baby in the backseat. 

20 minutes later when it was time for me to eat I open my meal and it was in accurate. No big deal you think they'll just remake it right? 

I go to the drive-through and I am met with the manager again. The one who originally took my order and got it incorrect. I simply state that there was no dipping sauce and a side dish was incorrect and now it was cold and if you wouldn't mind making it for me again. Mind you this is a $10 fast food meal. 

He proceeded to argue with me and say that he did put the dipping sauce in the bag when he in fact did not. Then he grabbed my food out of my hand through it in the garbage and said something to the woman that was standing next to him. 

She proceeded to walk to the window and ask me what she could do for me. I said that man didn't tell you what I needed? She said no he said to just take care of it. So I clarified again. You mean to tell me that the manager just threw my food in the garbage after I simply asked him to replace the food that he got wrong and didn't even tell you how to help me the paying customer? And she just repeated again ma'am how can I help you. I told her that she could refund my money and that this was bullshit. 

As soon as I swore (bullshit isn't really a curse) She then told me that I didn't get to talk to her that way and she slammed the door in my face and did not refund my money. 

I have since called corporate the owner and I will not stop until that manager is held accountable. He is in charge of customer service for a franchise that the owner pays so much money for. How dare him disrespect another man's dream and business the way that he does. I can't imagine all the customers that he drives away with his attitude and demeanor and just plain nastiness. I will not be coming back to this location. I highly suggest no one else does either. If I heard that a mother had to eat in the backseat after working all day (yes I told him that) with her baby and that when it was time for her to eat her food was cold and wrong. How dare him treat me that way.

Like many others, I had poor service at this location. I went there once it opened and was second in line. I ordered a simple sandwich and had to wait until the people who came after me were served. The people behind the counter were rude. Fortunately, the manager was there and comped the sandwich. Needless to say, not good.
Oh I'm a little disappointed in the fried tender as it was said the chicken here is famous and delicious. However it's just so-so and not so juicy.

Came here because I did not feel like cooking on a Sunday morning. They had a hand written paper sign posted stating they would be opening an hour later than their posted time. This location seems to have a consistent problem with staffing.
Food was good . I order 8 piece ck leg but I only got 7 . Was told there biscuit in there . But there no one.anyway spicy ck sandwich was good.

Worst service. Anytime we go there it's a minimum 30 minute wait going inside or the drive thru. Tonight we got a mobile order but found out after an almost hour wait that they didn't have part of our order. Instead of a refund they offered an extra side and sauces. We had to fight for extra chicken. I don't know what's so hard about a refund but that was not worth an hour wait. We could have sat down and eaten a full meal at IHOP nextdoor in the same amount of time it took us to get only half our order anyways.

This experience has been horrible every visit.  Every worker aside from one cashier here has been horrible and rude. The door was unlocked and we sat inside for multiple minutes without being spoken to. Once we were finally spoken to, they notified us the inside was closed, rudely. The lady then proceeded to inform us they're closed and can't do anything for us. We asked multiple times to speak to a manager and the manager refused. A cook had the audacity to yell out "those black girls" from the back kitchen after we were finally able to order inside. This whole time not once has the manager spoke to us. As this is all going down the manger still has yet tried to rectify the situation. This same lady , the manager on duty, Robin, and the cook all still decided to continue to be unprofessional and talk about PAYING CUSTOMERS.  The same lady who initially spoke to us rude had the audacity to sit there and accuse me of recording as I started typing this review. She continuously attempted to get hostile by accusing me. To sum it up all are unprofessional and RACIST

Worst Popeyes ever. They literally never have what they advertise. The last 3 times I have come they didn't have boneless chicken at all so i couldn't buy their special they were advertising. I would understand if it was late night but tonight they were out before 9 pm. Last time it was 6pm and the time before that 7pm. I went here a lot when i was younger and it only had been the past year they really have become a 0 star place to me. If I could rate lower I would.
Solid restaurant but their hours are weird. Youd get there during their posted hours at lunch time 11pm and there would be a sign when you get there saying they are closed until an hour later.
I used to go to the one in NE Portland and it was sooo good. I'm wondering how this one could be from the same franchise. The chicken was dry, overcooked and tasteless.

So freaking disappointed.  Place my order and its easy to see that i have made your day worse by coming here. $5 meal plus chicken wrap. Get to window and ask for cajun sparkle and the gentleman argues they dont have it...clearly didn't wanna walk over and grab it because after a moment he does go grab it. I get back to my office. 10 minute drive away and my 6 piece is a 3 piece and everything is cold. The biscuit is hard as a rock. The one pack of cajun sparkle cant fix all these issues.

Came at 10pm and there was a line at the drive through of 5-7 cars. I waited for a bit but it took more than 5 minutes for one car to go through. I ended up leaving because I wasn't about to wait a half hour just to place my order. This location needs to get their staffing and organization figured out.

I can't believe this is a certified training store! The service is usually terrible and the food is always cold! I love Popeyes and was excited when they came to Beaverton but this store is a disappointment.

This is my first comment. This restaurant actually close at midnight on Sunday. A Africa American staff just insult me when I walk in the restaurant at 11:50 pm. "Stupid, you can't see there is nobody here? We are closed" Fuck that stupid shit.

ARE YOU KIDDING ME. asked for a damn chicken sandwich and I get served a frozen chicken Patty. This location is a good 30 minute drive and I'm so dissatisfied and grossed out that the chicken was inedible. Cut it with a knife and it barely cut, the girls inside making the sandwiches seem to be more distracted staring at customers rather than making sure their chicken is properly cooked. I would give this location 0 stars if I could.

This place is great...for making you feel like sh**.  They are rude beyond belief.  Tonight, they handed us a bag filled with our family meal and the large coleslaw was spilled all over inside the bag.  They made sure to let me know through their over-the-top attitude what an inconvenience it was to correct THEIR mistake while I waited...and waited... and waited.  However, SOMETIMES they get your order right.  That wasn't the case tonight.  I called to let them know about the mistake and was given an extra helping of snark without any offer to fix the issue.   Last time, I had to throw away 6 brick hard biscuits but they were good tonight (after I used my own butter and honey).  The rest of the food was good even though there was virtually no gravy on the mashed potatoes.  To their credit, they did give us ONE set of silverware for our family meal.  What they won't ever bother you with is an apology.  So, before going to this location I suggest you prepare for horrible customer service and check your order before you leave.  Better yet, make the drive to a better Popeyes location.

I was once a BIG fan of KFC because once I tried Popeyes when they first opened here years ago and I didn't like it.

Recently, meaning within the past two months and I enjoyed their chicken. I'm glad I gave it another shot after all these years. Their mild original chicken is YUM.

Popeyes over KFC any day!! 

Also, the guy who took our order inside was very nice. Gave us a better deal then what was on the menu. Wish I remembered his name!
Went up to the dine in area and it was locked at 9:45, it's supposed to be open until 10!

We have recently discovered Popeyes, and consider it a true gem among fast food places. The tenders, chicken, and chicken sandwiches are done to perfection. Unlike some other places, these folks know how to fry without their food showing a hint of grease. Amazing. Their red beans and rice are really good, I told my husband I'll have to find a "counterfeit" recipe for them! I am perplexed by the number of low reviews and reviews citing impossibilities like moldy biscuits. Then I remembered, this is Chic Fil A's most threatening competitor. Folks, don't forget, when you read a propensity of poor reviews for a restaurant, it is a back-biting business. Some businesses will stoop to anything to get an illegitimate edge on the competition. So, be skeptical. We have seen several good little restaurants run out of business by spurious bad "reviews".  As to poor service, never forget, in this awful Covid season, we are doggone lucky any of these folks are willing to go to work to feed the rest of us, and if they forget your biscuits, cut them a little slack. These are stressful times. If you don't have to work in a fast food restaurant, be grateful someone is willing to, and BE KIND. We will be ordering about twenty-eight pieces of chicken this weekend for my mother's 89th birthday party, because she likes it that much, and requested it.

Blackened chicken strips are good.
Cajun Fries are awesome.
Spicy chicken mixed pieces is good.

But with southern food, you would have to go in leaving aside the diet concerns.  Even the blackened chicken somehow had decent amount of oil around it.

The reason I came in for lunch on August 28, 2019 was to try the chicken sandwich per the competition with Chick-fil-A.  There was a sign on the Drive thru that it wouldn't be available until 2:00 PM.  I explained to the person at the window why I came.  She said that the competition was hyped by the media and not by Popeyes.  I asked if I could expect the chicken sandwich to be there if I came again.  She admitted that it was inconsistent and that they run out of them all the time.  Was forced to eat something else because time was running out on my lunch hour.

Chicken sandwich without the hate, huh? But for that to happen, there really has to be no hate. I visited this restaurant today at 12:56 pm. Drive thru line was crazy, but the inside was open for take out. So I parked and went into the lobby. The manager took my order. He walked away from the counter. A taller skinny African American male was in the back, and a Hispanic female was in the front packing up my order. The African American male made a comment about the drive through PA system being loud to the Hispanic female. He told her that he "wanted to be able to hear the order not have it blasted at him". She replied with, "oh you don't want it to be loud like Carl's Jr.?" The African American gentleman then replied, "All these gay ass annoying white people get on my nerves." I was floored by the remark, as I am a gay white male standing at the counter. I told the Hispanic female that someone should tell him to watch what he says about gay ass white people, when there was one at the counter. She proceeds to tell him this right in front of me. He comes out from the kitchen and just stares me down. I ended up returning to the store with my order because they had messed it up, and just got a refund. I eat at this location a couple times a week, but I promise you, I will not be back
Drive through can be quite slow. You have to ask for dipping sauces,  jelly or they won't just give it to you.
I waited 2o mins in line with 2 cars ahead. They said they were too buy to help me. I'm friends with the cars ahead. The orders are small..... this place always disappoints. I won't come back

This Popeyes had the worst customer service. I waited and no one answered me. It seemed the Drive threw order system was down. Nope the car in front was helped and the car in back of me was helped; I was ignored. I confronted the Asian man at the window he looked at me confused never answered me, and continued to work on the order in back of me. I left; I never had an issue with this Popeyes before until tonight. I went to the Popeyes in Aloha was Awesome the customized service was great
And friendly. The Beaverton Popeyes needs to bring there employees to this Popeyes for training on how to treat customers.

So this is fast food,  not in the high quality of chic fila or Culvers, but definitely southern style chicken and such. Haven't been at this location in years, we came to try the new chicken sandwich.  My daughter had the regular,  i had the spicy.  My take was it is a really good fried chicken sandwich and i liked the spicy sauce.  No cheese here to add on, but I didn't miss it. 
The red beans and rice was just like i remembered,  good taste of ham hock in it. The gravy on the mashed potatoes was different than i remember and i don't think quite as good. 

The biscuits were ok, but they had cooled off by the time i ate it. 

As far as the dipping sauces given, they gave a bunch. 

My wife had a  2 piece meal,  and we ordered 3 spicy chicken tenders extra. There was a miscommunication and we were given  6 tenders instead.  I was ik with that. The other thing was the guy expediting made an extra 2 piece meal and when they realized it gave it to us anyway.  Very nice.

Service was a little slow, but they were crazy busy and they were working very hard.

I love Popeyes, but unfortunately we live too far away to have it very often. Tonight I decided to drive 30 minutes to pick up a meal with my family. They packed a full 16 piece meal with 8 biscuits and 3 large sides onto one paper bag. Unbeknownst to us, in the course of this, they broke the lids to the sides, which caused the green beans to leak and soak the bag, so when we got home the bag burst and we lost 2 of the sides. Because the ride is so far away it was not possible to go all the way back to replace the sides. I feel that the workers should put sides in a separate bag with parger orders. I am very unhappy with Popeyes, especially after spending nearly $50 on dinner.

Horrible!  Waited in line for 25 minutes before we could even place order.  The only reason we didn't leave is because we had cars in back of us.  It was 5:15.  Dinner time.  You know, when you should be ready to serve dinner.  Ordered chicken and two sides.  Chicken was ok.  Onion rings were cold and stale.  Coleslaw just not good.  This is our last time here.  Have tried to give it a shot in the past, but not anymore.

You must give this Popeye's location credit.  They sell the highest ratio of breaking to protein humanly possible.  Their "popcorn 'shrimp'" is vastly more volume of dry breading than shrimp.  And their shrimp are so tiny that many of them could fit thru the eye of a darning needle.  Grade "F."

The catfish component of the combo I had contained a reasonable portion of fish, but the over fried breading coupled with too much salt made it hard to finish the three small pieces.  Grade "D."

My decision to have "fish" was a very foolish one.  Popeye's needed to more correctly advertise crispy breading with some dried protein.  My gosh, the tiny shrimp had the consistency of leather shoelaces!

Stick with the chicken pieces, I think.

The chicken was good but everything else was gross. Went with 3 friends and decided to eat outside family style. Had to fight with the manager for paper boats to eat from and sporks after explaining we were eating outside (no dine in due to Covid). Had to wait while chicken cooked and that would be ok except that everything was slowed down because ppl from drive thru kept coming in complaining their orders were wrong. Same with some online to go orders. Manager was lazy and cheap. Teenager cashier was high on mj. Other manager wearing mask below nose. Two employees with mask below nose. Kid in back with big shaggy black hair needed a hair net. Order mashed potatoes, biscuits, Mac n cheese, cole slaw, green beans, beans and rice--none of us had ever been there so wanted to try everything. Cole slaw was meh, all other sides gross and I grew up in south. Tasted like nasty overcooked cafeteria food. Will not be going back.

The hours state they are open until 3am. It was 1:30am, the lights were turned off with one worker who saw two cars (including us) in the drive thru. Instead of acknowledging us he just looked and walked away. At least tell us if you're closed. Or how about adjusting your hours online to reflect the true hours of operation.

I really like chicken and want to like Popeyes so I thought I'd give them another chance but I was wrong I ordered a 3 piece two sides one which was red beans and rice for $3 when I got back to work and opened my sides the serving of red beans and rice was not even half way up the container it took me about 5 spoon servings to eat it all at .40 cents a spoon what a rip off I called three times to talk to someone but nobody answered the chicken was okay there but the whole lunch was somewhat ruined because I felt ripped off

Came here because I did not feel like cooking on a Sunday night. Ordered the 3 pc dark with a biscuit. The service was decent and the food was decent. Went through the drive through and did not have any problems.

Location: Convenient 

I came to this specific Popeyes after a long trip from the coast. Drive thru was crazy long because HELLO, chicken sandwiches duh. 

We decided to go inside and maybe waited 5 minutes in line. Awesome! Ordered 4 [ 2 Classic/2 Spicy ] chicken sandwiches and also the $10 tender box and added the 2 drinks to that combo. 

Flavor of the spicy chicken sandwich was my favorite over the classic yet my fiancé loved the classic. 

Tenders box was also delicious and was filled. 

I actually came back to this same location this past Wednesday and was surprised the drive thru was EMPTY. Winner winner, having chicken sandwiches for dinner. 

I like how there's a lot of parking here and I have yet to have a bad experience at this location. This spot wins for me.

This location has a fundamental misunderstanding of their own ordering system, and on top of that, they were plain rude. Given the pandemic, I'm patient with folks, but they were just rude.

I ordered using their app, which said I should go through the drive-thru line and tell them my name at the ordering menu. After I waited in line for quite some time and gave my name at the ordering menu, as the Popeyes own app (not so other app) instructed, I was rudely told "no" in a sharp tone and that I could come inside the restaurant and wait on the 20 online orders ahead of mine. Now notice that if I had just ordered at the ordering menu instead of ordering ahead of time, they would have obviously made my order immediately. Despite politely explaining this to them and showing them my phone screen, they refused to make my order.
Went for lunch today.  The spicy chicken sandwiches were cold and looked like someone had stepped on them prior to serving them.  French fries were also cold.  Will not be returning to this location.

This Popeyes just can't get it right. Don't get me wrong; this is not a bad place to get food. It is not a great place either.

Came here for my lunch break. There was a line and 15 minute wait. 

I got the Spicy Chicken Sandwich, tackle box with cajun rice, biscuit, and apple pie. The Spicy Chicken Sandwich is great and one of my favorites. The tackle box is 8 pieces of fried shrimp and comes with a sweet sauce. The cajun rice looked burnt and lacked taste. Apple pie was decent.
Ordered a surf and turf combo with spicy tenders and dirty rice. Blacked ranch as the sauce. Got regular tenders, soggy fries, no sauces at all. Overall not a great experience

This used to be a good place to eat but has gone waaaay down hill in the last few years, dinning room is dirty, employee s look tired and uniforms and name tags are a mess. the two times I've gone in lately both orders were wrong even with me being the only person ordering. Not a very friendly place and unless you have to I would refrain from eating here

I've been to this location a few times. Yesterday, I came in and ordered a 12-piece meal to go. I walked after receiving my order. When I got home, I took everything out of the bag only find out that they forgot to put in the biscuits. So I drove all the way back to tell them that I never received the biscuits. The lady at the register looked at my receipt and told one of the employees to grab the 6 biscuits and handed back my receipt. As the employee handed me the box of biscuits, he says "there you go, thank you." Really? Thank you? For what? I wasted my gas to drive back because they forgot a part of my meal. I know that we're all human and we forget stuff. I also admit that I'm at fault for forgetting to make sure everything was in the bag. But what bothers me is that I didn't get one apology. Instead, I got a thank you. When I worked in fast food, I apologized to the customer anytime something was not right about their order and wish them a great day.
Anytime you order from here, be sure to check everything in the bag.

Unprofessional, disrespectful, and unhelpful staff. I went to the drive thru to pick up my order. A guy tells me it's not ready yet and to wait inside. I go inside, but a staff member refuses me to help me and tells me there are over 6 people in the building even though I walked in before there were more than 6 people. He says I'm "welcome" to wait in the drive thru. Ok so I'm welcome to wait in the drive thru when I was just told to go inside the building? I'm welcome to make 10 cars behind me wait for my order?

Terrible customer service. I was confused with the promotion. The cashier did not want to talk to me and took blame to my baby. She said it is because I m pregnant and this makes me can't think fast. I found this quite offensive. 
I feel if the customer is confused with something, she/she should explain it or have manager to explain. She shouldn't say I can't think fast enough and it is because of baby.

Food... is just fast food, so so. 


Never visit again.
I had a mobile order and they made me wait though the drive though and then come in side to get my food was ready but made me wait now my food is cold and they were all very rude

I will not be coming to this location anymore. I ordered my food asked for everything to be freshly dropped because I know they give you food that has been sitting longer then it should be. I got a 2 pc with thighs. I won't say it was spit on but only 1 spot on both pieces of chicken was wet a soggy. With the 2 pc wings it was like they just warmed it up in the microwave. Nothing was freshly dropped. My shrimp Po boy was cold. Only thing that was warm was my daughters chicken nuggets. We tried calling nobody answered. Went to the restaurant the next day to complain the manager was rude as hell told us he wouldn't give us our money back but would give us new food. Please tell me why I'd want your food again after my last experience. I def will not be coming to this one. They should have just left Popeyes in Portland.
Yum! Hot spicyNew Orleans style friend chicken! The best chicken you can get in the NW.
I love this place. The workers are extremely helpful, and the orders are always perfect. I have been there many times anywhere from 3am to noon. I will continue to go there any chance I get.

This starts out minor, but hear me out. My fiancée ordered an "Arnold palmer", which I asked for a half lemonade half tea since I don't assume everyone is Chic Fil A. 

The individual helping me at the time was Cristian. When I handed my fiancée her drink, she tasted it and said it's 100% tea. I asked Cristian if he could get us a half tea half lemonade, and when he asked a question to the lady behind him he said "sure but I'd have to charge you because we don't usually do that."
So, Cristian took my order of a drink I usually order from Popeyes, and even though "they don't usually do that", he accepted the order and said I'd have to pay for another drink because they got it wrong.

Long story short, the lady who made the drink never put lemonade in it, and after realizing Cristian refused to apologize because "it wasn't his mistake". I called back to complain and of course, Cristian answered, so you can guess how that went.

Don't get me wrong, I love Popeye's & will continue to eat with them but their drive girl needs to learn manners & not be rude, each time I have come through drive through, I have to ask for my card back because she will not give it to me.

July 4th I went through drive through to order food, $10 for a big box, she she said it kept saying declined, it only declined because she did not take the card out of reader when she was suppose too. I told her she charged me & I wanted my money. I had used my card not 3 minutes before at McDonald's, I went to get cach & had to come back, reorder & asked for my money back. She kept mouthing off about it being pending & I would not be charged, the night manager who was standing waaay on the other side of the room said he saw it decline. Really? you must have better eye site than me Son & I wear glasses, to see that far, while you are serving up food & NOT looking at the card reader that is laying flat on the counter!  

Even when I went in calmly & requested my money back for a meal I ended up paying cash for, I could get no satisfaction, they could see I was charged for food I did not get, I got no receipt for the decline so they would not give me my money back. I was told to call the day manager but the phone was broken & the same girl was there & they removed her from drive through & she kept going on & on about the transaction being pending. I know my bank, I banked with them for 25 years, if it is pending, I will be charged for it, Could not get hold of the day manager, tried 3 times to call him the next day as directed, no one answered phone.

I love Popeye's but when you know you have staffing issues, fix it, retrain people & tell them not to keep going on & on when the customer is standing in the store showing you proof THEY WERE CHARGED. It's rude, I nearly said something to her in a very nasty heated tone but refrained because I was hoping for satisfaction which I got none & I will not say anything bad about her other than she is rude & needs retraining, not to lose her job but retraining & needs to learn that when a customer shows you proof, DO NOT CALL THE CUSTOMER A LIAR.

They lady friend and I went here to chicken toast Anthony Bourdain as it was one of his guilty pleasures. Sure was what it is. Decent chicken at fast food prices in a fast food environment. 

It has it's place in the world and I am glad it exists.

my complaint is about a shorter than average hispanic male working the front. he is slow, incompetent and does not care at, ive seen this on various occasions all as a regular customer. i came in to pick up a web order and it was for 16 pieces. i saw him put 8 pieces so when he handed my food to me i asked him if he was sure it was 16. he said yes. i trusted him and thought maybe i saw wrong. get in my car, gut tells me it's wrong. open box and check and there was only 8 pieces. go back to tell him and he didn't even apologize. just grabbed my box and added 8 more pieces. i asked him why he lied to me and he mumbled something under his breath and turned around and walked away. super unprofessional. very angry about this. he needs to be retrained.

Unbelievable wait time in the lobby, guy ahead of me took 47 minutes to get his order, I'm at 35 minutes. Management here is not doing a good job. People behind the counter had no idea what order they are working on.

I don't think COVID is a good enough excuse for us getting NO CHICKEN with our order. We went through the drive thru, which took forever, and then drove home. No one even said for us to wait for any chicken. Got home and nothing. Drove back and told them there was not chicken and the employees were laughing about it thinking I couldn't see. And then they weren't going to give us everything else fresh after almost an hour. Not only that, but the customer service was atrocious, no apology and no asking if we wanted a bag. And it seemed we weren't the only ones with messed up orders. I would give this 0 stars if I could for how much of a hot mess the store was.

Good food and nice people, but the last 4 (FOUR!) times I used the drive through I've asked for salt and pepper and butter for the biscuits; not once have they ever come through--and with COVID, I cant go in and ask. Not cool people; I know these are stressful times and you're trying your best, but..... (and no, I will NEVER eat at Chil Fil'A).

So we ordered 30 drumsticks. We expected the wait to be around 15-20 minutes because that's how long it takes usually to fry new ones. However, we waited for like 50 minutes. Ok. Then when our meal was about to come out they were like "oh we are out of drumsticks" like wtf? Couldn't tell us that from the beginning? We also ordered fries but nope. Didn't get them. Really disappointed. They are just getting worse and worse.

Very friendly service! 
And when I'm lying on my death bed and they ask me if I have any final requests... I'm going to ask for these biscuits.

Loves: (and worth the taste)
Chicken
Biscuits

Likes: (will get as my side
Mac and Cheese

Can live with out:
Cajun Gravy (dont care for the flavor)
Coldslaw (lacks flavor)

30 minutes for fast food. Ridiculous! Call our number... sorry for the wait... going to be another 5 minutes for you to get what you actually ordered.. want some wings? Is it just this location or the franchise??? Never again.

Stingy with the sauce. I bought 2 spicy chicken sandwiches and the manager (bald brown guy with glasses) wanted to charge me extra for asking for 1 blackened ranch sauce saying it didn't come with my meal. I'm not asking for 50 but just 1 to share with my gf cause I already know he's stingy but it vexes me that when anyone else is working but him they're happy to meet my request. Call me Karen but this guy had the audacity to give me one sauce for a 20 piece meal one time...I'd be fine paying but the inconsistency between charging and not charging is stupid. Either be consistent in your "sToRe pOliCy" or give me a sauce. Just hope you don't get him when you go and please double check your orders! I forgot to check a couple times and he forgot my biscuits but that's on me.

I waited for 37 minutes in your lobby for 2 apple pies.  I get it that you are busy.   If you can't do any better than that, you need to close the door.  No apologies, the manager had no contact info for the general manager.  She wouldn't even give me their name.  How do you keep your franchise?

There wait times on the drive thru orders are horrible. I had to wait for 20 mins in the car to get my sandwich. Popeyes needs to get this fixed as this isn't the first time I've experienced this. The food is good though.

ZERO - straight up. 

1) got an empty box which should've had biscuits. I've posted missing signs around the neighborhood, hopefully they show up. 

2) ordered an 8 piece spicy with dark meat, but got 8 piece mixed of regular. 

3) took 40 min from waiting in the Disneyland line to get home to disappointment. 

The only highlight was I was able to try the overhyped spicy chicken sandwich, which was good, but not break the internet good. 

Couldn't be more utterly disappointed. It's not like my order was complex, customized or anything. Terrible execution. Today dinner was chicken with a side of disappointment.
This place is by far the worst Popeyes location. Food is cold, the tea is watered down and people at the drive thru no mask no gloves.

I do not do a lot of fast food ( we gave up Chik Fil  A again on moral grounds and Don Chilito does not count)  but my teenager, who was burger deprived for much their early years,  has developed a taste for cheeseburgers from the evil Golden Arches Place ( after  actually working at one for a while , can you imagine? meh) and begged me for a burger . 

 I had plans to make dinner but I am weak and was tired and the teen  when hungry is  powerful force of nature like a tsunami. 

I drove thru  the evil yellow arches place to get the stormy one  a burger, iced coffee , and cinnamon melts (do not ask) but could not bring myself to order food. 

I just cannot/could not/will not. 

I am not saying I thought the next door Popeye's is better healthwise, but at least it is not the soulless arches situation. The drive up line was long  ( as was the one inside) which both concerned me and gave me hope ( maybe it is good like Tony Bourdain said??)

Nope. 

It was disastrously slow. And I am not being ageist, ok I am, but it was staffed by 5 elderly people, not a teen in sight. And some of them appeared lost, and they all seemed tired. 

The car ahead of us gave up and left without getting any food. The nice lady at the window seemed quite stressed and  offered me something but not my food. Eventually I got a  not breaded blackened chicken po' boy ( it looked nothing like its photo but it tasted ok. It was edible, with ok lettuce) and really really bad old cold hard disgusting old onion rings. Did I say old?

In the bag I also received all kinds of weird packets of honey, sauces, and an opened up already Cajun seasoning packet I am hard trying not to think about. I threw all those away, said a prayer and ate the sandwich. 

I am still alive. 

But I am NOT going back there.

P.S. The whole ordeal took 30 minutes.

Delivery service through their app is horrible. Ordered and paid for a combo. Food delivered cold and no drink. Driver who already got the tip didn't care he just said call the restaurant. Total rip off. No way to complain on the app.

This place is still horrible. I wanted to give it another chance because I love Popeyes chicken. Again I waited in line almost 30 minutes. To get an incorrect order. Ordered 1 so icky chicken sandwich and 2 classic. They were all spicy and couldn't be eaten!
Good food they just get my order wrong I ordered a cheesecake raspberry pie and got apple pie instead

Shout out to Meg + Team for handling our order of 20 chicken sandwiches, largest family meal, 5 large fries 20 biscuits so quickly and providing service with a smile. Meg + Team working hard behind the counter to ensure our order comes out hot & fresh. Thank you for your service and for being the only Popeyes in the area with chicken sandwiches in stock!
I see many bad reviews but I had a good experience here. Service was great with the drive thru, food was yummy and the lady at the cash register was very kind too so I left happy.

I was so glad to move back to Oregon, but very sad not to be near a Chick fil A anymore.  I'd never been to Popeye's, but they claim to be so fantastic, I was hoping it would cure my cravings for awesome chicken.

It didn't.  

It was alright, but nothing special.  I was excited about the low prices, but I don't think I'll be back, unless I REALLLLY need some chicken.

I'm not a fan of fried chicken so I'm probably not the best person to be writing this review. I went to Popeyes for the first time with a group of friends and they were all shocked that I had never tried it. I ordered the 2PC set with a side of cajun fries. I chose the spicy seasoning but it wasn't spicy at all and just felt overall very greasy. The Cajun fries also weren't very good and I couldn't taste much Cajun flavoring nor potatoes.

If I could rate it zero stars I would. The guy gave us a completely different thing than we ordered. He only gave us 10 fries even though we ordered a large and when we asked for tenders(without bones) they gave us wings and drumsticks.

"Can you park please." is becoming this locations catch phrase, and I am tired of waiting ten minutes for a "fast food". I come here once a week because it is on the way home on the night that I am out late, and over the last several months I have had consistently poor service. It seems like the fries are never ready, and yet when I do get them they are usually cold. They get my order wrong sometimes and I have to go back, and they never even apologize or offer me anything for my time. The food itself is usually good, but sometimes it is cold and sometimes they will give you the wrong thing.

I like Popeyes as a whole, but this place has the same problems consistently. I think it is a training location, but still it seems like they aren't being trained in the right things.

This rating is purely for the chicken sandwich, more specifically the spicy version. First of all, the spicy isn't really hot, fairly mild, don't expect anything burning. This sandwich, for $3.99 is well worth it. I went during normal weekday lunch time, everything was fresh, crunchy and juicy chicken, the bread was perfect, and the pickle was just enough to give a bit more complexity to the taste.
Wait time was around five min in line and five min for the food. Now I am just concerned that I want to return more often.

Let me start this review by stating this is one of my favorite places to eat. I come in at least every week if not more. I do have problems with this place that I can't keep overlooking and will eventually have to say something. ENTERED AND LEFT DISAPPOINTED. I called in and the manager picked up, I wanted to put in an order online but what I wanted was not an option. He told me "oh." So I asked if I could place an order over the phone to pickup. He said that because too many people have bailed and so they won't do phone orders anymore. Take payment first! I told him I was on my way and I would appreciate if they could start my order. He hung up. If what I want isn't in your menu how is that my fault? I came in - order was not started. It takes them about FIFTEEN minutes to make this particular menu item. I'm tired of waiting 15-20 mins EVERY time I go in. WTH...

SECONDLY there is a lady that makes sandwiches all day. She always looks at me with disgust, never smiles, and looks like she couldn't care less. Very off putting to always have someone looking at me like that when you I'm just here for the chicken. You're at your place of business- Grow up!!

Always great chicken (obviously), but leadership can ruin everything :-(

Regarding the lead promo on the app as of tonight: Get a Free Chicken Sandwich with Purchase of $10 or more (one per day)

I got a pop--up on my phone this morning that said I could get a free chicken sandwich with $10 purchase. I planned my entire day around it, did my FM shopping across the street timed perfectly to get me in and out by 6:30 before they got crushed. I ordered on the app. I use it all the time. We experienced no hiccups ordering. Except I picked the 3 piece dinner with biscuit and one side (beans and rice) and no drink, so the total was only $9.39. Proof that I had added the promotional sandwich to my cart came when it said I couldn't check out using that promotion as it was under $10 total. So I added an additional $3.99 chicken sandwich to the order, and it worked fine. I had the 3 piece chicken, one biscuit, and one beans and rice (which by the way was never included in the order once I got it home), and one $3.99 chicken sandwich on the "ticket" (receipt). The promotional sandwich was not visible, but that didn't bother me since it is free, and therefore not in the total charged. And because, not only did I start the entire order by clicking the picture of the promotion on the app, but I was denied checkout before hitting the minimum requirement of $10 in order to get the promotional free sandwich.

The order was ready so fast that it was sitting in a bag on the counter when I arrived 3 minutes later. But no one ever called my name. They were all frantically busy, but I thought they'd call out my name. I only waited 13 minutes before someone asked me my name, and they said it was already sitting there the whole time.

But the free sandwich wasn't there & I was told they wouldn't give it to me. So I asked to see the boss man.

I can't remember his name tag now, but he said he is the franchisee, so the owner.

I explained what happened, and to my shock, he said his store was not honoring that coupon. It stinks for him that corporate would have the #1 leading add on their country-wide app be a promo that certain stores cannot honor. I fully believe him, BUT as a company owner of a retail store, I also understand that, while it sucks, you just HAVE to honor the corporate coupon. I said he could just write it off. And he said that he could not, that "they" take it out of his profits. That blows (if it's true). But I calmly (at first) explained to him that if he could just think from my perspective: Even if it costs you $3.99 (cost would actually be only a buck and change or less), that the reward is the loyalty of a repeat customer (which is evidenced by my order history), and that customer will tell others, etc.  That is the ONLY "Right" thing to do. It's literally common sense. If you're a business owner, it's 101.

Instead, he just kept showing me the ticket and saying that if it's not on the ticket, it's not part of the order. Makes sense. But it's not my job to understand how their POS system works or receipt printers.

At this point, I was SO flustered that I said I wanted my "free f**** sandwich". I wish I had not stooped so low! He now changed his story that NOW he wouldn't because I cursed. I apologized, but also told him his mask was positioned well below his nose. Common sense is not his strong suit. So he told me, and I'm quoting, "If I touch my mask I have to change my gloves, and you're the one keeping me here". This gross flaw in logic had me stymied, so it didn't even occur to me to help him. (i.e. of course you can just change your gloves. You'll have to anyway.) Also, if it slips down just from standing in one place talking with one person, then it MUST be slipping down all the time. This means that not only are his Popeye's employees at risk all around him, but customers certainly are as well.

Disdain for customers aside, he needs to understand how business works. He didn't "lose" me because the chicken is great. But it ruined my previously perfect first day off in months :(
Never had good service at this location, can hardly understand them and get rude responses back. Also something has gone wrong the order with every time we've visited.

I'm only giving it one star because you can't give 0 stars. I just had the most awful experience. I usually eat here every couple of weeks, but I can honestly say after tonight I will never go back. The staff was completely incompetent- I have worked in food service for ten years, and i have never seen food service staff move this slowly in my life. After waiting 40 minutes for my food I tried to get someone's attention to ask for a refund. After 20 minutes of trying to get someone's attention I finally was able to ask for a refund, and instead of giving it to me hey turned around and finally started putting my food together. Of course, I paid extra for extra breasts and did not receive both breasts that I paid for, but at that point I was so exhausted I left. When I got back to the car after nearly an hour and a half inside my sister, who had been waiting in the car, was crying because she felt so sick from missing her medication (which she was supposed to have taken an hour ago with dinner). If they are going to make people wait over an hour for FAST FOOD, they should be turning people away, or warning them before allowing people to order. I have never had a worse fast dood experience in my life, and I will never go to Popeyes ever again. I sent an email about this to corporate, but if this is the kind of service this company condones I doubt I will ever hear back.

COLD FOOD! I eat here all the time, because I love the chicken sandwich. But the sides are ALWAYS COLD. Onion rings, and the fries seem like they have been sitting out for hours, not even slightly warm.

The worst waiting time for a drive thru I've ever experienced. I've lived near this Popeyes for 13 years lately the drive thru wait ring has been 20 minutes plus. No awareness of management or shift supervisors and no apology for the wait time I'm a fast food drive thru!
