Prices were higher and food took longer to get! My son was exciting see this Mc Donald's as we passed by the last 3 days and I regret finally stopping and eating here!
Slow service. Very. For this landmark mcdonald's in Orlando at I-5, featured by the travel channel, I expected more. Food is the same as any; at least there is QC there.

The service was slow and the people were rude. I ordered the pasta to give it a try and it was nothing but pure oil and water mixed together! They got my order wrong and gave me a problem over it. Also, this Mc D's is a lot more pricey than the standard ones. I don't recommend this place. It's overrated and a tourist trap.

I went there based on the claim to be the #1 rated McDonald.

Sadly, the experience was a bit let-down!

I am not sure if it was the promise of a gourmet menu was the reason, but  was expecting something better..  

Something cleaner, friendlier and more knowledgeable.

My first impression was of a loud, dirty and unfriendly first floor.
The order area was something out of the lines at a Quick Service restaurant from the theme park.  Service was unfriendly and uninspired.  The order taker did not know about the promotional card for this restaurant, although the address and names were printed on the information pamphlet.  My order was taken incorrectly, twice - causing back up and unnecessary charges and reversal of changes to my credit card.

Food was slapped together - reflection of the uninspired and uncaring staff.  Don't let the slick website fool you, this is fast food, not gourmet.  

When I asked one of the staff where were the napkins, they shrugged their shoulders and said they didn't speak English.

We sat near the back of the first floor and was disgusted by the smell dirty wet dish towels.

The place is a glorify arcade that sells McDonald.
It sound great with all the claims, but falls short on the delivery.
Go to a regular McDonald and save yourself the headache.

Whoever the cerebral Olympian was who designed the ordering system at this place should be water boarded. What a disaster. Had I known I was going to have to deal with this mess I would have definitely gone someplace else. I'm writing this as I'm standing in line waiting for my order. No telling how long this is going to take.

The largest McDonald's in the world! I love going to this McD when I feel like having burgers and fast food. Their decor is outstanding and very well designed. A lot of different variety of items that are only exclusive for this location. Can't get them anywhere else. Yup they sell pizza! Will be back when I am in Orlando next month.

Well where do I start. This is the biggest McDonald's on the planet. This is a McDonald's on steroids.  It was very nice inside but the staff needs to get organized.  How do you get a Happy Meal wrong! Please no excuse and for a McDonalds.
This is the bistro concept for the menu.  They have pizza, pasta and specialty deserts with their regular menu so parents can pick something nicer. The second floor has an arcade that is quite pricey.  There are beautiful aquariums on the first floor,  elevator as well. One thing get your drink filled before you go upstairs there is no refill machine on the second floor.   I wonder who forgot that detail or was it on purpose. 
One other thing if the owner is reading this  teach your staff to sell the atmosphere of being in a trendy tourist area. Why do I say this.  One of your staff coments to me was hey this is the only place you will pay $3.00 for a large order of fries for your son. I told him well I have to pay for your salary and this place to make a profit with so much overhead cost. 
Wish your business well but get your staff organized and teach them some business etiquette and customer service. You pay what you get.

Dont believe the hype avoid this place  like the plague... horrible service overpriced and overrated.  A lady spilled a drink it took 15 minutes for anyone to clean it or even put up a sign. It's loud dirty and outdated.

Indeed this is the best, nicest, contemporary McD I've ever been!   This is not an ordinary McD!!   I absolutely went "WOW"!  
On the first floor you can self order from the kiosk and they'll bring you the food like the ones in China.  There's a very nice separate dessert bar which I think it gets very popular during summer.  Plenty of dinning area.  Up on the second floor there's a very nice kids play area and tons of games at the arcade area.  My little got plenty of prizes with the points he exchanged.   We were short 10 pts for the last item but the nice lady gave it to my son anyways.  Hey it's this kinda little things that put a smile on the kid's face!  I left the table in between to check on my son, the employee was cleaning and thru away my drink.  I mentioned and he went to grab us 2 new cups.  That's very nice of him.  
Besides all hip things in there here comes my favorite part:  the toilet seat is covered with plastic and changes as you push the button!  Check out my picture below.  
I'm telling ya  what more can you ask for from a McD?? "I'm loving it!"

I can't believe that I am reviewing a McDonald's but this place is just too cool not to mention.  I was attending a conference at a hotel down the street from this restaurant.  A friend and I were walking around trying to figure out what to do for lunch when we saw this McDonald's.  After we walked inside I realized that I had seen this place on TV.  It is kind of a madhouse and you can suffer from sensory overload.

There are lots of quirky things that make this McDonald's different than your father's Mickey D's.  The menu is vastly expanded including meatball sandwiches, Panini sandwiches, wraps, cheesesteaks, pizza, hand scoop ice cream and a whole lot more... I had a cheesesteak which was just okay.  Upstairs there are video games, an expanded kids playhouse, and the types of games where you can win tickets which are exchanged for prizes.  Downstairs you can get your hair braided, watch fishes swimming in huge tanks, listen to the animatronic moon dude playing the piano and play some games.  Even some of the seating is non-standard with fanciful tables and chairs.  Plus, the trash cans say "thank you" when you use them ;)

My nephew is a a fanatic of arcades and play centers! He saw this on another kid's youtube channel and it is the world's largest McDonalds. It has three stories and offers customizable food items. I saw many selections that are different from the typical McDonalds menu.  This McDonalds has everything!  From a dessert bar to a super-sized play center; it is a truly a kid's dream.  Belgian waffles, customizable pizzas, touch screens, and Coca-cola Freestyle all are foods/items you can see at this location! The waitress/waiters even bring your food to your table.  What an experience!

Service - Nice but not very enthusiastic.

Restaurant - Slightly messy and dirty because the turnover is so fast and there's so many people.  Food was downstairs, gaming upstairs.  Don't expect a huge arena.  It's a bigger playground upstairs, mixed with arcade games for tickets which can be turned in for a prize. Still fun for the kids.

Food - Typical menu but it was pretty cool to have an ice cream area and a bistro with pizza and pasta.  We tried both and it wasn't amazing but a nice change.

I normally wouldn't review a McDonald's except for the fact that this particular McDonald's is very large and unusual because there's a legit ARCADE inside. What? Yes. You read that right.

This place is huge. There are two floors -- the dining area is downstairs, and the arcade area is upstairs. Now, the arcade isn't super big, but it's got a good amount of video games to spend a decent amount of time playing games. You can get a card so you can play games and then trade tickets in for prizes at the end. It's like Dave and Busters but not as intense. 

The menu here is a little bit more expansive than your regular McDonald's menu -- think paninis, pizza, etc. in addition to the regular menu offerings. 

I'd definitely stop by even if it was just for a soda and a quick round of PacMan. It's a touristy stop, sure, but that's part of why it's so fun.

Ordering and receiving food is a nightmare. Came in on 8/22 at about 630 and wasn't very busy. The young man who took our order was pleasant but the girl who provided our food was no help at all. No direction on where to pick up food and generally the employees don't seem that happy. Still trying to figure out how they think the ordering and receiving is efficient.

I usually don't like posting bad reviews, but my recent experience was pretty rediculous.  If it wasn't for the big menu selection and the novelty value, I would have rated this 1 star. Why such a low rating?  I had extremely poor service from a manager (Stephanie) not honoring an active coupon from the local "Enjoy Florida Magazine" that was created for this specific location.  This place surely isn't the typical McDonald's.

I would give this no stars if I could. I spent over an hour waiting for my food for starters. The manager was walking around doin nothing to help the situation as orders continued to pile up and people started to ask for their money back and leave. It was by far the worst service I have ever received.
This places BLOWS, I've been sitting at the drive thru for almost 30 minutes! Will never come back here!!

Don't let the size and attempt at grandeur fool you, the Super Mcdonalds on Sand Lake and I-Drive is nothing but. Sure you can get different foods at this Mickey D's but the service was well and beyond the worst I've ever experienced in any restaurant I've ever been in. The place wasn't overly busy but the staff all seemed to just limp along and had absolutely no pride in their work. They grabbed my food and left it sitting on a tray for 3-5 minutes behind the counter despite me being the only one there. They were anything but friendly in fact I would describe the counter staff to be completely socially inept, not to mention flat our rude, the worst part was the manager was just as bad, in fact he cut me off on the way to the soda fountain to refill HIS OWN drink, also everything on the menu is at least a dollar more.  If you're in Orlando on vacation and want a cheap meal where kids can play games go with Ci Ci's pizza or Chucky Cheese. I'm giving this a one star rating, but it doesn't even deserve that! Avoid it.

Best One i have ever gone to. Clean and very entertaining. Great variety on different types off foods especially the gourmet bistro. I remember playing all the games upstairs enjoying a memorable time with relatives. Great place to go to if your on a budget :) You got to love it!!! yay for MCD's

It's sad that a practically brand new location is being run into the ground. The staff is terrible and slow.  The food is overpriced and much higher than a typical McDonald's. They don't fill the fries (check your large fry!) My daughters happy meal had EXPIRED apples in it. For a place that sells so much food, how can they explain serving expired food. I know! Poor management and lack of attention to details.  The arcade games are not worth playing and a few don't credit the right amount of tickets to the card.  Just avoid the place and go elsewhere

Let's start with the positive. The only reason I didn't give this McD's 1 star is because of the better food selection compared to regular McD's. Not to mention the entertainment for the kids, and just the fact that it is a roadside attraction

With that being said, let's get to the negatives. The service is awful here. It makes me wonder if this McD's is exempt from McD's employee customer service training, because I've never had worse customer service from other McD's. Here's a list of my gripes:

1. It took 25 minutes to get our food, (uhrm, last time I checked, McD's is a fast food place???). 
2. I asked if they have the advertised $1 any size coffee (I badly needed an XL cup), the order taker (different from the cashier, take note) rolled her eyes and scoffed "we don't have anything for $1 here!" as if I needed to be scolded for being ignorant of this info. 
3. She then asked if this was "for here or to go?" which I answered "for here," so I was specially irritated to find a "to go fee" applied to my receipt (which I didn't realize till I already paid). 
4. They seem to have a shortage of change in this restaurant, because my change should have been $1 and some change, but they only gave me a dollar (while the cashier looked away). I didn't mind, because it was just change, but I just think the cashier should have asked for it, if she was so broke & needed to ask for chump change.
5. Let me reiterate, this was supposed to be a fast food place, but it took  25 minutes to get my food. It wasn't even complete, I had to go back and ask for the salad that I paid extra for, and I never heard a single "sorry" for their mistake and slow service.
6. Their 'taco salad" was just that, a garden salad inside a (burned) taco, instead of the usual taco salad ingredients you see in mexican restaurants, or even taco bell. It was fresh but tasteless. The chicken was bland, rubbery like it was frozen then microwaved. It was so bad, I asked my hubby if we could switch, he ordered a turkey wrap which was also bland but better tasting than my taco salad.
7. While we were inhaling our lunch (which is what you do when you're hungry because it took forever to get your 'fast'food, and when you have bland food, there's no reason to savor and enjoy every mediocre bite), the bus boy hit my chair while he was rearranging the chairs behind mine. It had an impact  strong enough, that I almost dropped my turkey wrap. Still, not an apology from him, like I was invisible & he didn't think it was worth saying sorry for.
8. It was loud and hot inside. I know, they cant control how loud those arcade machines beep (or can they?), but can they at least control the AC temp?
9. This was the most expensive (relative to other McD's)  I ever spent on lunch for 2 people at McD's. Worst value for the dollar

There it is, 4 out of 4 (100%!!!) McD's employees made our lunch miserable, ain't that something to write about?
Ordered 2x burgers (no fries) and 1 pepperoni pizza... 55 minutes later and still no food. Spoke to the manager and she said pizza usually take longer than the burgers but 1 hr to make a pizza.

Only getting a 2nd star because the food from the bistro was good.

They completely messed up our order inside and in the drive thru.  Games at the arcade weren't fully fuctional.  They are also more expensive than a regular McDonald's.

I'll be back when visiting Orlando only because it is sort of a landmark, but service wise, you can skip this one if you want.
This McDonald's is total trash. All the workers speak Spanish so they get your order wrong no matter what. Their ketchup was disgusting. It is extremely filthy and just overall disgusting.

I've raved about taking my boys to this place since I first discovered it a couple years ago without them and I was highly disappointed this visit.  The menu items are way overpriced best bet is to order the pizza.  I was sad to see they took the chimichanga off the menu.  It's a madhouse but to be expected.  Maybe I am just burnt out from McDonald's. The extra fee must be for the use of the play area it's uber loud in here!!!

Found out this was the biggest Mickey D's in the US , so of course I had to go. First impression, it was big!...with a lot people. We decided to use the self serve machine where you can pretty much customize everything yourself. Ordered some mc double cheeseburgers and fries along with o d of their specialty pastas. Yes, pasta at McDonald's. Got the chicken Alfredo nothing fancy. Overall, the pasta was really good! Actually was impressed, food came out in an orderly manner also. I wouldn't go again though, I would find one that's less crowed.
Largest McD! Only got a vanilla cone but they have a lot of other foods you can't get at other McDs. Only went for the atmosphere.

The new place is awesome. Very modern and technologically advanced. You order at a touch screen kiosk, either pay there with card or pay cash to a human cashier, wait for your number to be called, and then fill your drinks with a Coca-Cola Freestyle machine. That is, if you want regular McDonald's. If you want pizza, they have that. Pasta? Got it. How about if you just want a coffee or some dessert? Head over to the McCafé. There's a huge upstairs play area, they still have an arcade like the old location had, and there's aquariums all over. If you head upstairs refill first. There's no soda machines up there. Everything was clean and the staff was very friendly and all smiles. Not like any other McDonald's you'll ever go to.

This is probably one of the nicer McDonald's out there. I've been coming here for years to eat breakfast before heading to Disney.

I have mixed emotions about the renovation. I really liked the old look because it made the place seem bigger and more attractive to kids. The modern style looks good, but not as welcoming for kids until you go upstairs. 

The arcade upstairs is fantastic and it adds value to coming to this McDonald's that not many other places have the combo.

There is also a bunch of options for food if you don't want the same McDonald's food. They have a Bistro for you to choose for breakfast and lunch.

From the outside this location appears to be huge. While it is 2 stories,the only thing that really separates it from other Mickey D'S. Is their arcade room. Would I come again,  ummmmmm probably not. Concept is kinda cool thougj.

The facility is impressive, unfortunately, it stops there. We had two fo the signature chicken sandwiches, I guess, Very, blah, two meals 19.30, I think it was. All of it, was less then stellar. I had the sweet bbq crispy chicken, the wife had the dijon honey bacon. When hers arrived it was dry, no sauce. So, she asks the girl, could she get some sauce, and got pointed to the front. Wife continues "to the front" and gets tolds she has to ask for it when she orders. BLINK -  they call it a dijon honey sandwich, but the thing that makes it so , is OPTIONAL...... Umm, ok.... anyway, my local Mickey D's blows this place away. Novel idea, extremely poorly executed. And, oh yea, it would be nice to be able to understand the staff as well, QUE, what??? ......... Again, awesome place, blah food, AWFUL SERVICE ....... Twenty bucks goes further elsewhere,
Worst service I've ever had at McDonald's. Rude staff and had to wait with an empty drive through.

Icky icky icky! It's pricier and the lines are ridiculous. First you wait in a long line to order of a menu that makes little sense. It's not a regular menu but offers artisanal food. So I placed an order for kids meals and I ordered a wrap . When we paid for our order it was $24 for two kids meals and a wrap! Twice the price! Argh so we found seats and to my dismay realized they gave me a breakfast burrito instead of a wrap. I don't eat eggs, so I had to get the kids up, re-pack their meals and head back to the counter. I tried to get someone's attention but was told to wait in line with everyone else. The line was even longer than before. When I got to the front they argued and said thats what I ordered. I showed them the receipt and they said it showed a breakfast burrito. I told them I would have never ordered a breakfast burrito as I do not eat eggs. They never made my order right and said the manager was too busy. I will never go here again. After the kids wanted to play upstairs so I let them. It was dirty and we left. Gross gross gross!
only for the experience. the bistro is over priced and false advertised. don't go and expect the best food from the bistro. the regular McDonald's food is the same as ever

The biggest McDonald's in The World!?!  Of course we had to go!  It was crazy! A huge arcade, and a menu that included all the regular McDonald's choices, along with pasta, wraps, quesadillas, full breakfast (including waffles), and pizza! The food was NOT gourmet (it's still McDonald's, after all), but with the cheesiness that is the touristy part of Orlando, this was fun and fit right in. Were we glad we experienced it? Yes. Will we go back? No. Were our stomachs glad we ate the pizza? Not necessarily.

Amazing customer service, the speed of the drive-through was pretty damn impressive. And a tourist driven Rome, they tend to go the extra mile and exceed your expectations. As far as McDonald's go this one is pretty damn good

I am in Orlando with my daughter on vacation.  It was raining buckets outside.  We made a go at a Disney Park but it was just too wet. So, I looked around to find something fun and indoors for us to do.  i was so excited to find this McDonald's and give it a try.  
I will say there is one great thing there and that's the play house.  The set up is nice where it's got one entrance so it's easy to make sure kids are safe inside. 
My daughter and I were both excited about the gaming area as well, because she loves wining tickets and getting prizes.  Well, they are paperless there and you buy this credit card where you add money to buy games (no problem) but it is also supposed to culminate your total winnings on there to go and get prizes.  IT DID NOT!!  The worst part is my daughter won the jackpot on this one game where you hit the button and a ball drops down and lands in a hole with a point value.  she was sooooo excited to win the jackpot because she could get a bigger prize.  Plus she did pretty well on others too.  50 points here....25 there...
But when we went to gift shop our card only showed 200 points and not the jackpot. The guy looked at the card in the computer and saw there were several places where it just didn't accrue the wins.  He told me he would credit me back so she could re-play the games.  I was so mad!  I said that wouldn't work because the odds of her winning the jackpot again were pretty slim and asked him to add the points won to the card.  he said no, he couldn't do that.  Then he proceeded to tell me there was no manager after 4 pm.  (which is ridiculous)  Anyway my daughter was really bummed she ended up with a few sheets of stickers.  
The other reasons I am marking this with low stars was that it's just so dirty.  Not the play area in general but the restaurant and bathrooms.  Of all the empty tables there was not one clean.  The staff is not friendly and it's set up so poorly for ordering and pick up it's just awful.  
I say boooooooo to McDonald's for the underhanded way they get away with not giving people points on their cards.  I say booooooo for upsetting my daughter on her birthday vacation and I say get a mop and some cleaning supplies and by gosh if you work there please smile once in a while!!!!

This McDonald's is like something I have never seen in my life. The ordering process was confusing for both the customers and the workers. The girl took the order, you go to the front wait for them to call your number which no one tells you, and then you pay and wait for them to give your food. Soooooo confusing and it's so many people in this place service would be 10 times better if one person was taking care of you.

I am not a fan of the new restaurant look. Too much was taken away. Now it seems smaller by comparison of the older version. Except it still serves waffles and pasta.

The new look is just odd and not inviting. It's just a normal bigger version of every other McDonald's...except the upstairs games.

"Woohoo! As good as it gets!" for a McDonalds.  Compared to others, this is probably the bets one I've been to.  They have a full on arcade in the restaurant on both the first and second floors.  The play credits are cheap!  This also has a bistro section that you can order sandwiches and paninis from...

McDonalds food is always consistent.  Definitely try it out if you are in the area.  its a good time!

I'm not surprised this location only average 3 stars.

The midnight manager was hardworking and seemed like he was doing everyone else's job. The rest of the staff were either rude, grumpy or acted like they didn't want to be there.

One of the staff was even confrontational.

The wifi signal seems to work for laptops but DOES NOT work for smartphones for some reason, even if you agree to the McDonald's terms of agreement.

There's only 1 electrical outlet in the entire place and it's 2 stories.

On the outside, the size and it's unique menu and decor gives you the impression the signs are right but the more you look around you see It's a bit run down.

For it's size, parking is limited.

You're better off going to another 24 hour McDonalds further down to 7344 West Sand Lake Road location about 1 mile t past the Wholefoods, it's not great but I didn't have a negative experience there the 3 times I went.

So I'm not a McDonald's fan at all, but wanted to try this place based on the epic menu. 

I got the Belgian waffle with whipped cream
And it did not disappoint. It was light yet crispy and had great flavor. Most things are self serve.

The upstairs has an arcade and play area. The area for toddlers is pretty limited. The arcade was great, but the redemption center wasn't open when we visited so we asked the manager and got. Big long story. Finally just as we had given up, they opened it for us.
Hardly your ordinary McDonalds. A bakery / desert station and an Italian pasta and brick over fired flatbreads too?! Of course the regular menus too. Open 24 /7. Pretty cool.

Prior to our visit to Orlando, my boyfriend and I were watching World's Best McDonald's on Travel Channel late one night. We're not big McDonald's fans, but it was interesting to watch. To our surprise, this one was named one of the best and it was located right next to where we would be staying. I was ecstatic, like a little kid in a candy store. I thought it would be so cool to visit a world renowned eatery. I made it a mission to visit this McDonald's. Who doesn't want to see a McDonald's shaped like a french fry box!?

Inside the actual restaurant, there is so much going on for kids. There was an arcade area, but it was closed while I was there. There were two seperate menus. One was filled with gourmet food that consisted of wraps, pasta dishes, deli types of meals. The other menu had the traditional burger, etc items that every McDonald's has to offer. Hershey's Ice Cream was served here, as well. The only downside was the prices were pretty steep for some fast food. It was my first time ever having a Big Mac and this was my first meal in Orlando -- a cheerful way/place to start out our vacation! :)

3 stars for the awesome decor, inside and out.
Get the pizza. Its expensive for pizza but for McDonald to serve pizza is a weird option and pretty good. I was surprise by this little gimmick.

A friend told me about this McDonald's while we were in Orlando. "Did you know the McDonald's here sells pizza and pasta" she said. I replied, "why aren't we there?"

And the next day we were.

So this is the largest McDonald's in the country or world, not sure, but either way, it's enormous. I never even made it to the second story play place area because I'm a single guy who isn't trying to look like a pedophile taking photos for Yelp of kids playing in a playpen. 

ANYWAY...

My favorite thing about this place is there is minimal interaction, if you want, with their employees. You can order from the board in the middle of the restaurant, put your number into the system, and they'll bring you the food.

My friend got the pasta. I got the pizza. The pizza is probably a medium-sized pizza which starts at $7.99. Adding meat will raise it or if you want to add extra cheese to your pizza. I added bacon, ham, and pepperoni to mine bringing my total to $10.99. My regret is that I didn't have something from their dessert bar but I was too full after the pizza.

Probably took a good 5 minutes to get it but it was definitely worth it. I was surprised by the quality mainly because, well, I'm at McDonald's. The only bad part was that it was pretty greasy to many napkins were used to save my arteries by not ingesting all the grease. Was it the best pizza I've had? No. Was it good. Absolutely. Would I get it again? Sure!

They had a few other menu items I've not seen elsewhere like some onion burger, guacamole as a side, and strawberry shortcake.

For me, there is no reason to come here unless you're going to try something that's not at your regular McDonald's. It was a good experience for sure and definitely worth your time.

It was very cool inside had a whole arcade and a huge play place. I would never return again. We ordered our food, filled up our drinks, and went to sit at the fish tank. When we went to wipe the table over and cockroach crawled up the side of the fish tank. I went straight to the manager and told her. I asked for a full refund and left. She told the other manager it's by the fish tank and he could care less. If there's cockroaches out during the day when's there's almost 100 people maybe more in the there that means there infested.

This is billed as the World's Largest McDonald's and I believe it. It is two floors of food and dining on the first and a giant arcade and kids play area on the second. They've have more than just traditional McDonald's good here as well.  A fun place to go that is different without breaking the bank.
I ordered 20 nuggets but they gave me 18. Either they tried to be slick or they really cant count to 20

Came here about 10:30 pm after a Orlando Magic game.  They were giving away free french fries. We decided to go to this location being this was the biggest McDonalds in the world.  When I came here I was amazed to see the different food they serve (Bistro Gourmet) .  From pizzas, burritos, gourmet sandwiches and burgers, turkey and veggie wraps, philly cheese steaks, panini, make your own pasta, and desserts.  This section was closed so I couldn't partake but was wowed as I have never seen something like this at a Mcdonalds.  I have even been to locations in New Zealand, Japan, and South Korea but nothing like this.  Also they have an arcade room upstairs for kids to go and play.  It was a good experience seeing something out of the ordinary at a Mickey-Ds.

Long gone are the days of the humongous french fry box of Orlando; this McDonalds was demolished and then rebuilt and is now the best looking McDonalds I've seen in this area.  Literally this building is 19,000 square foot and 2 story that features the latest technology fast food has to offer with HD menu screens and touch screen kiosks to order your food items.

As far as menu goes, I really miss the old Bistro menu which is now no longer available but they still offer pizza and pasta along with other non-regular menu items.  They offer different ways to order your food inside the restaurant ; with a real cashier person or with the kiosk.  You pick up your food items at the separate designated counter areas.  Pizza and pasta at one counter and desserts at another.  They offer more dessert items and salads.

I was curious to know what was upstairs and they offer an extreme play place with games and arcades.  No other place offers anything like it.  A cool interesting place that's fun for the whole family and perfect for tourism.

Used to be the world's largest McD's!  Now they've changed it to the world's most unique McD's.  

They serve gourmet food!  We had the Pastrami sandwich and Fresco burger.  They were very good! 

The dining area was very large.  There was an arcade inside and an upstairs gift shop.

This place is CRAZY. Showed up at 3:00 on a rainy Monday afternoon... Must have been 100 people IN LINE to order food. It looked like they have an amazing menu but there was no way I was waiting in that line... The upstairs is a 10 yr olds kids dream. Video games and a huge Play-Place... it was also packed... we went up and played for a half hour but when the kids became hungry enough to leave we went down the street to a much less crowded McDonald's. Its a fun place, but way to busy to actually enjoy... Also, the free WI-FI was maxed out... I got slower speeds than I was getting on my 3G connection...

Went here 2 weeks ago for our annual DW vacation, but never went here before until this year.  This place is great for kids.  We came here twice to let our 3 year old blow off some steam in the play area, which is huge.  You could come here just to let your kid play for free and have a cheap happy meal.  I saw a lot of kids having a blast running up and down and through the tunnels, which were two stories high.  

We never bothered playing the arcade games, which were a bit much, and we can always get a bargain at Chuck E. Cheese's. 

We ate the normal fare, and not the bistro food, but I did get the banana splits, which were under $4.  We went twice and each time I got it.  So good with the whipped cream, bananas, and shaved almonds.  Freaking banana splits at Baskin Robbins in the D.C. area are $7.  Ate in front of the beautiful aquariums.

Can't go wrong with Mickey D's and a three year old.  We haven't been to a fancy restaurant since the kid was born.

This is my 1st bad review. I normally don't write a negative comments but this McDonalds was horrible. We are on a family vacation & went through the drive through. They charged us for an extra drink when we got to the pickup window. Though it was raining, they told us to park & come inside for a refund. When we got back to the hotel, we noticed that they messed up our order again. We ordered a plain two cheeseburger meal. They confused plain with no cheese & didn't take a moment to realize we would've ordered a two hamburger mean if we wanted no cheese. I called them and spoke to a nice manager named Stephanie. She told us to come by the next few days & she will credit our meals. We came back a few days later & let the customer service helper know. She went to speak to the manager on shift named Andrew who stared me down. When he came over to us, he acted like we were making the story up & didn't even apologize. He didn't even credit our meals & only gave us a new cheeseburger meal for free. It wouldn't normally be a huge deal but his attitude is the reason I am writing such a lengthy & negative review. I'm in the customer service industry so I understand people have bad days. I was just so taken back by Andrew's bad attitude & poor service that I had to write this review.

This was a nice McDonalds with a big play place and an arcade. I found it interesting that this one served up pizzas and pasta as well as the normal McDonald's menu. The downstairs was normal Mcdonald but then you go up the stairs there was an arcade and oversized play place along with a area you could rent for partys. Something I found out after we ate downstairs there are places to eat upstairs but it is very limited and noisy with the play place and arcade. If we decided to eat Mcdonald again I would come back.
Amazing McDonald's!!!! Fast service, plenty of seating space. Very kid friendly. Has an huge indoor playground and arcade.

As a random tourist stop, I guess this place is OK. But as a McDonald's it is horrible. The point to McD's is to get in, spend a buck or two for some cheap grub, and get out. That will not happen here.

They have an extended menu which includes many restaurant style items that I would never order at a McD's. It's a bit confusing, with seemingly multiple places to order ( regular line, a deli or cafe style area, etc )  The line is theme-park style (you'll know what I mean when you see it) which just makes a bottleneck of confused people. 

There is a lot of stuff there to entertain children, an arcade area, random play areas, etc. But for an adult looking for a typical quick, cheap, McD's experience, keep on until you see another location.

Lots of food choices, seating was plentiful. Lots of games upstairs for the kids. Points and tickets are kept on a Credit Card so it is easy to play a game, swipe card and your good to go. My only complaints would be, the guy walking around the floor soliciting time share opportunities while you eat and the other would be the rude visitors.  WARNING: people cut, push, do not say excuse me.  But I guess it takes all types on earth.

Awful. Waited 25 min for a 6pc nugget meal. 
If you're a local, avoid this place during busy season. Or just don't come at all.

Never seen a McDonald's like this before. Variety of food (in addition to the traditional US McDonald's Menu). There's an upstairs that has a huge play place & an arcade. Very clean and lots of space for large groups. Recommended spot to stop at before leaving town for a quick bite (and if you are driving with kids a place to get them tired before hitting the road.) OH! And the ice cream machines work! No wonder they call this the "Epic" McDonald's.

2 floor McDonald's doesnt get better has really cool stuff, like an arcade, huge climbing structure , the ordering touch screen is really easy to use. Even though is huge, there service is really fast, the restrooms seem to be pretty sanitized they have automatic sit covers and they are pretty neat 


Best mcdonalds I ever visited, i was surprised to see food like waffles, pasta , & pizza in there menu!

Would definitely recommend this place to everyone

Horrible Disappointment! Skip this tourist trap all together! Not worthy of even one star. They renovated the original Worlds Largest McDonald (which was amazing) and replace all the classic relics with Wall Stickers. Ruin the nostalgia ! No history, no "McDonald's " just a very blah . You can barely recognize the place. The exterior is already fading and lights are out. Inside was really ghetto broken chairs, toilets, empty dispensers . Very dirty. Ruff crowd of individuals hanging around. Rude and unhelpful service. The prize counter was run by a girl who spoke broken English and was shoving food in her mouth, playing with her phone. She rolled hers eyes and could not answer our questions about the arcade. The arcade games are 3-6 games for $10! Then you win maybe 15 tickets ...or lose everything. The menu items are twice and three times as much. We bought two drinks two personal pizzas one chicken sandwich total was around $50!!! Will never ever visit this joke of place again !

The modern renovations of this McDonalds are amazing and that is why I give them a Star, but that is the only nice thing about this place because the customer service is NON existent and worse of all is that there is Nothing FAST about this fast food place.  You can make your order in these awesome computers but then you have to wait for ever to get your food, aside that they give it to you incorrectly. They also give you the option to bring te food to your table, but that didn't happen, we selected this option when placing our order and waited over 30 minutes for nothing. We had to go to the counter to get our food.

Poor parking lot for people to go in. Ordering was quick. If you dine in they give you placard to locate you and bring food. We went upstairs and that was a mistake. No drink stations or napkins or ketchup. Large arcade. Cleaning staff did not speak English. Worst McDonald's even though it is supposed to be the largest

Worst customer service ever in Florida!!! Our order was wrong as well as missing items. Went back to get order corrected and they still messed it up. They caught an attitude because I requested them to give me fresh fries after allowing mine to sit out in the open waiting on a burger they gave away to another customer. The wait was at least 8 minutes. They don't fill up your ice cream because they say they leave room so you can take your cap off, what about the big hole in the center of the lid? Avoid if you can to order anything and just go to the play area with the kids. Employees have horrible attitudes!

This is the largest and most beautiful McDonald's I've ever seen. It is brand new, has kiosk to order and an amazing upstairs area with games and a playground. Now, I haven't had McDonald's in about  15 years. Today, broke that streak. I had an egg white sandwich with a hash brown. I put the hash brown on the sandwich and it has made my morning. My boyfriend ordered the French toast sandwich, and he loved it. My brother ordered the pizza ( yes, McDonald's makes pizza) and it was quite good. Nothing like pizza from NY, but overall decent pizza. The reason why they didn't get 5-stars is the overall service. Everyone was super kind, but my sandwich came out cold, we waited forever (10 minutes) the night before someone even walked over to help the people waiting for their dessert.  Overall, I hope they make more like this.

The Place is beautiful and so different compared to any McDonald's I've visited. I am traveling from New York and heard about the arcade, bakery and other cool amenities located at this McDonald's. I gave it three stars because of the horrible service and workers. It's convenient that we get to sit and workers bring the food over to our table. But our worker was so rude when we asked where the drinks were? How should we know if this is our first time? Workers should be a little more friendly and treat customers with respect.
Dirtiest Mcd's store ever. Nasty, rude employees, sad really. The floors are slick with grease and the tables are sticky with unidentified fluids. Go somewhere else if you can.

The McDonalds delighted my children. They had typical McDs meals but my husband and I tried the veggie wrap and Philly cheesesteak off the bistro menu. They were pretty good for fast food. The lines and pickup were slightly confusing but the staff was good natured and directed us with a smile. Didn't like the salesman lying in wait for us to sell park tickets but that's everywhere. The kids loved the play area but there isn't much seating and no tables. You can't eat there.  All in all, fun place for lunch though.

This is probably the nicest McDonald's you'll visit. The downstairs is divided into several nice eating areas, and the upstairs contains a large play area and many redemption games. 

I'm not a frequent fast food eater, and especially not at McDonald's, but we went here to check out their touch screen ordering system. It worked great, and allowed us to customize our orders of Bistro Burgers and Pizza. 

After selecting the desired ingredients, you select a numbered "hockey puck," enter its code, pay (I used Apple Pay) and find a seat. Then your food finds you. 

The actual food was no different then other McDonald's. The burger had good ingredients, but the beef patty itself didn't distinguish it. The pizza toppings were good but the crust was limp. 

If you're looking for a decent environment for a fast food meal, and want to entertain the kids, this is a good choice.
World largest McD playarea - maybe... but worn-down and an absolutely terrifying experience! (However the kids loved it)

We were a party of 10 and 5 being teenagers we had to do a stop.  The kids enjoyed the typical  McDonald's food as for the adults we had to eat out the box. We had a custom made pizza and a pasta dish and we all enjoyed. Even the kids had some of the pizza and pasta and said they would order.  The line was long but once we had order we sat at our table and waited for our to come to us. Upstairs was a game room/play room for the kids and only our two younger ones enjoyed.  In all, we will be back....me more just for the pizza.

I have never seen employees more absolutely miserable at their workplace than I have seen here...talk about apathetic!!! Everybody looks like they just had to bury their dog before they showed up to work after getting four flat tires while their home was foreclosed on!! Everybody is MISERABLE!! Ordered food for two adults and a child and it took 40 minutes!! And then it came out wrong!! I couldn't help but laugh..  The phrase "fast food" apparently isn't applicable here because it's the world's largest McDonald's...So prepare for the world's longest wait!!
I wish I would have checked ratings before coming here. Twice as expensive & twice as chaotic as a typical McDonalds. Build your own pasta was good. Everything else okay.

OK, I never thought I'd give any fast food place more than a few stars.  However, I needed to grab something quick for lunch, this place was close by and let's face it, who among us hasn't "slummed it" at least a few times in our lives and done the quick and nasty BK or Micky D's run when needing to grab something to fill you up in a hurry?

This McDonalds, however, was different than any other I've ever been to.  Suffice it to say I never thought I'd be "impressed" by a McDonalds until I saw this one.  Not only is it the worlds largest Entertainment McDonalds & Playplace and was ranked #2 on the Travel Channel's list of most unique McDonalds, but the menu is what made this particular location stand out to me.

While they do have typical Micky D's fast food fare here, they also have a bistro gourmet menu that you won't find at just every McDonalds...Pizzas, wraps, gourmet sandwiches and paninis, a pasta station, etc. and everything there is made to order, it's not just pre-cooked burgers and greasy fries.  Prices are not out of line, either; I had the roasted turkey club meal with fries and a soda (served on proper plates..Not the usual styrofoam containers and boxes) and I paid under $8.
The food was good. Took a bit to come out  but cool place I suggest everyone checks it out. One of a kind

A great place for the kids!!
If you are tired of the regular menu, they also have pizza and pastas, and it tastes really good.
Worth the visit!

Man I love the coffee at Mickey D's.....probably the reason Starbucks is closing 500 locations.

Go Mickey, Go Mickey, Go, Go, Go Mickey!(while doing the cabbage patch)

It might be the biggest and most busy McDonald in the world!
This is located at the International Drive in Orlando, just remodeled and have 2 floors, upstair has game room and children playground.
This week is Spring Break, my kids request McDonald, so I bring them here so they can enjoy the breakfast and have little fun. The store is extremely busy today and like they have self order machines, after we ordered the food, we went upstair and the staff brought our food to the 2nd floor quickly, later one of the supervisor stopped by our table and ask if everything is ok, that is very impressive for their service, fast and friendly, they try to go above and beyond to make sure guest enjoy the food at their location. A lot children enjoy the playground and while others enjoy playing the game at game room with their parents.
If you visit Orlando, I highly recommend you to visit this McDonald's, I am sure you and your family will enjoy it. Our children have great time and enjoy their Spring Break here today!

Newly renovated World's largest McDonald's play place. Serves pizza & pasta. Touch screen self order. Very busy place with lots of kids. They do birthday parties. Toilets self change seat covers. Must see at least once.

People with sensitive taste buds don't usually give any thing of a praise in their reviews of the big M but this location is different. It is huge with plenty of free parking in one of the busiest intersections of the city.The drive thru is used by city dwellers to parade their collector and antique vehicles.

Inside it is a three story mega food court and introduces you to the Big M's other than Burger selections. There was a pasta and pizza counter that was an amazing surprise. Upstairs there is a huge play area that rivals any Dave and Buster's play space.

The only setback is how upsettingly loud the place is. If it is not the sound of the play machines then it is the little kids running around happily while their parents yell calling their kid's name across the ocean.

It is worth the visit if for the novelty because if you are in the city for a vacation chances are that you will drive by it anyway.

The worst place to eat I'm sorry if i knew the food was this terrible i would of just came for an ice cream snack and the kids to play. I have had better McDonald's food else where. The food was terrible cold and burn, the place is nice and exciting for the kids. The service was horrible not only did they ran out of bbq sauce they forgot some of our food. Seriously i regret spending my money here such a waste. Never again!!!

Motion activated trash cans! What!!!! Seriously though, if you're on vacation this is a must visit. Sure the standard burger and fries might be a few cents more than the regular ones around town but the experience is worth it. They have build your own brick oven pizza and nothing beats a fresh baked pizza! Just had to get the standard McDouble and medium fries for comparison and of course what makes McDonald's so great is there consistency. The only thing NOT consistent at this McDonald's vs all the ones I've ever been to is the effort they put into customer service and table service. On our order, jalapeños had been left out and they made an effort to not only correct the order but redid our fries too while we waited. Again, a wonderful experience.

We were excited to visit the worlds largest Mcdonalds. From the outside it looks enormous and like an adventure to be had. Inside is packed with people. Definitely a tourist destination. They have the touch screen computers to order or you can go and talk to someone to place an order. Only thing on the computer screens you can not customize your order so beware. 

After ordering you grab a number and get your drink if you bought one from the self service area and find a seat. Good luck on that. It seems that there is not enough seats to go around how many people go to this place. They have booths of various sizes and high top tables that you can share with others and single tables all laid out. There are 3 floors but the 3rd floor was not open. The elevator was also not working either. Once you grab a seat someone brings out your food after they find you which I'm assuming your number has like a gps in it lol. Food is the same you would buy at any other McDonald's with the exception of having pizza (one size), pasta, and a sub (philly cheesesteak). There are a couple of different burgers on the menu as well but nothing crazy different. 

One thing I noticed that everyone that works there looks miserable to be there. No smiles, your welcome, can I get you anything else, thank yous. Just miserable faces so that sucked to see. 

Also there is an arcade on the 2nd floor as well as the giant playplace. The parents just let the kids run around to do whatever and I noticed some pushing and not so nice playing between some kids so gotta keep an eye out. The arcade is fun to do for a little bit and they have a prize counter as well. 

This would be a one time experience for us and not a repeat for said reasons.

Just stopped by to try out the "Bistro Gourmet at McDonalds." This is McDonalds...known to be one of the most fatty fast food chains. However, they serve a magnificent breakfast here with a wide variety of items. I was really wowed. The employees all know what they're doing. I still can't believe I had a great breakfast at a f****ing McDonalds. The place is huge too. With an arcade on the 2nd floor. Check this place out if your ever in Orlando.

Food was overpriced for a McDonalds. Mainly came here cuz we seen it on Travel channel as number 1. It was like a run down D&B with Mcdonalds food. Half the arcade games didn't work but took your money anyways. Couldn't find anyone to fix them. The prize shop had hardly anything for small amount of points and according to travel channel, it had a huge tube area. There was nothing huge about it to me! Very disappointing.

this mcdonalds it the best!!! mcdonald's selling cheesecake and pizza? oh yeah. it's awesome. coolest mcdonalds around. pizza is super good too and the cheesecake is awesome! totally recommend buying off menu. so cool!

This is one of the largest McDonalds in the world and they have a large selection of Gourmet food.

The breakfast here is far superior to standard McDonalds.

There is a huge game room inside and lots of games for kids.
The new building is nice and clean. Staff were courteous and friendly, order was well prepared but be patient, food will take a while to come. Noise level is high.

Victim of its own success...
Keeping it short as possible, I love the food/selection.  My daughter loves coming here and I can have a decent meal too.  The playland is the biggest one I have ever seen.  The video games are pricey and occasionally out of order...now for the expanded view...the people at the front are overwhelmed.  Many people don't know how to order using the crowd control system in place and frequently crowd the area that is being controlled.  This location could easily be twice the size and frankly it needs it.  McDonalds does try to keep order with plenty of employees in the front areas and with tiered registers.  Its just a popular location and undersized even being twice the size as most McDonalds.  Since it is such an exciting location for the kids its a complete madhouse.  I always get hammered with a full tray of food by kids running unescorted and my daughter frequently leaves with headaches because the music is so loud.  If its your first time or on vacation, stop by-the food on the expanded menu will help make your McDonalds visit a memorable experience.  Personally, I like the pasta bar and the pizza. If you are 5-6 trips in like I am, bring aspirin, patience and a time limit...

Okay it is big inside, very modern, staff seems detached from human contact.    Clean, good place to let kids blow off some steam.   Only 3 stars because I do not the food.    I am here for the coffee.
HUGE McDonald's. Must see for any tourists or even locals. Arcade on the second floor. Extremely hard working young staff member named Mac needs to be recognized! He did a great job.
Many people might like this location but it was soooooooo overcrowded that I didnt even feel comfortable eating. I am not a germaphobe but it was pretty intense.

This place is our must stop everytime we go to Orlando. It's located in the corner of Sand lake and International drive. It's not your ordinary Mcdonalds, it's the biggest McDonald's in the world. It's 2 stories with dining area on both floors. The top floor has an arcade and big place place. We're so pleased to see this place got renovated! It's so much nicer and cleaner than before. Our kid's like to go here because it's Mcdonalds and because of the play area. We like taking them here because after a long day at the parks and spending  $$$ it's a nice cheap meal before we head home to our hotel or condo. 
I'm trying to stay away from fast food as much as I can so if you're like me, this Mcdonalds serves other food like pasta, pizzas and gourmet sandwiches. They have 2 separate kitchen and you can actually see them make your pasta or pizza. Since they remodeled they also have a dessert area too where you can get shakes and ice cream. When ordering, skip the little kiosk. It takes long to put in your order and then you have to get into the regular line after to pay the cashier even thought it has the option to pay on the kiosks. 
Next time you're in Orlando and especially if you're with kids, take them here. They'll have fun and think this is the coolest Mcdonalds!

They are open 24 hours a day but try getting service after leaving Disney at one in the morning... Employees are untrained and unorganized. Took 20 min for our order... Nothing custom... Just a basic cheeseburger meal. Will not go back!

If I can give it zero stars I would the service at this mcdonalds is horrible mind you we came in when it wasn't busy and we still had to wait almost 45 mins then they got our order wrong 4 times my mcdoubles were undercooked I'm never coming here again I always came here as a kid and now that I'm older I've learned that New isn't always better.....

So, you knew it was going to happen. When they reopened, they had awesome service, delivered food to the tables, etc. Now they don't deliver the food (even though they still ask you take a locator), the service is mediocre at best (had my food ready but didn't call my number, had to ask if it was mine) and the store is dirtier every time I come. Had high hopes at first that it was going to be a great McDonalds, but once again the managers don't take ownership to make it a great experience.
Epic McDonald's??? Do they mean epic failure!!! This place is an example of how automating can ultimately fail. Never seen so much chaos in my life. Good luck McDonald's your gonna need it.

New signature, epic McDonald's. I remember when the location had the largest play place, but the times are different now. It needed a refresh badly and I am happy it underwent one. More automated kiosks make ordering easier. A pizza oven serves to provide the atypical McDonald's gourmet flare.

Such a unique experience at a McDonald's! Don't forget to take a buzzer to your table so you can truly be treated and served. Servers find and come to you! Different food here too, pizza, pasta, cakes! If you're in the area, you MUST try it!

This McDonald's is an accident waiting to happen.  Who the heck designed this thing?  I went to the drive-thru for breakfast and trying to figure out how to get to the line was annoying.  Once I placed the order and went to pay and pick up my food, things didn't get any better.  It is poorly designed and one of these days someone is going to have an accident or get run over.  Oh and the service was pretty crappy as well.

By far, the most horrible experience in Orlando!  

I decided to swing by here and pick up breakfast for the kids.  Chose the drive through, cause it wasn't busy at all.  Ordered two Belgian Waffles with banana and strawberry.  Got to the window to pay and they were SUPER FRIENDLY /Sarcasm.  

Was told to pull to the next window, and I greeted the person at that window, who told me to pull up while they got my food.  WTH?  I am the only one in line!!!  

Some rude lady came out and told me pull into the #1 Parking spot and wait for my food.  10 minutes later, she brought it out and rudely handed me the bag of waffles. 

I am very patient and understand sometimes there may be a wait for things.  But, c'mon; at least be friendly.  

Will never go to this craphole or recommend it to anyone!  BOOOO McD's!!!

As McDonald's go, this is one of the best. I call it a High-Tech McDonald's.

Techy Stuff: You enter and are greeted by a self-service Order Screen. In the bathroom they have disposable plastic covering the toilet seat. Before you sit down, you can scan your hand over this green button and it will spin around and give you a new seat cover (see attached pictures). This was awesome to me because if there aren't any seat covers, I make the with toilet tissue. While in Florida, only the airports had seat covers, so I was so elated when I stumbled on this in McDonald's of all places.

For breakfast they have it where you can order an omellete. You choose the type of egg and quantity, then add the meat and veggies toppings of your choice. They have a brick oven, so perhaps they offer pizza on the lunch/dinner menu.

They have a huge play area with additional tables and seats upstairs.

And last, but not least, they sell icecream - butter pecan caught my eye, but they had at least six different flavors. Next to the ice cream was a chocolate cake with nuts. They sell what appears to be homemade cake. No way! Maybe it was purchased frozen and they just thaw it.

If you're in Orlando, check it out.

If I were allowed to give negative stars, this place would get -infinity x infinity.  Usually when you order at Mc D the menu is just above the cashier's head.  Here, the cashier is 30 feet away from the menu.  At a normal McD this may work since you know the menu by now.  However, at the "world's largest"  they offer a completely different menu.  I had to ask if I could go foward and look at the menu and then come back.  So after we ordered 1/2 the order was picked up at the counter and the other 1/2 was picked up at a different location in the resturant, because we ordered off the regular menu and the gourmet menu.  I had a sorry excuse for a cheesesteak and my daughter had the worst ravioli i've ever tasted.  I mean I usually eat store brand ravioli out of the can without heating it up.  
Just to add more insult, I once ate at a McD in New Orleans during Mardi Gras.  The restroom was so horrible that I was afraid to even touch the soap dispenser.  I gagged when I opened the door.  No I did not use it, I just left.  In the parking lot I also found hollow tip bullets, if that tells you anyting about the location.  With that said, this McD in Orlando is worse.  Do not go here...I may not eat at McD for the rest of my life.

The atmosphere was AMAZING! I've never seen a McDonald's like this in my life! It was beautiful! The menu options were insane! That being said - I got the a salad and it was still normal McDonald's salad. My husband got the Philly Cheesesteak & it was excellent! The other items we ordered were normal menu options. 

The women's bathroom had the coolest toilet seat cover system I've ever seen! It was clean and well maintained.

Neat to check out. But expensive stinky and crowded. And the lines are weird
 You cant see the menu.

Uhhh.. for the world's biggest McDonalds, my expectations were definitely let down. It's simply a bistro (not sure if it's from mcdonalds or not), a mcdonalds, and a game area upstairs. Only food difference is the bistro, which is completely separate from the mcdonalds. 

A few games on the first floor as well.. definitely very filthy place. Garbage cans say thank you and a crushing noise when you throw your trash in.. I was too amazed or anything.

Neat place. Fun for the kids.  

However: prepare to pay Olive Garden prices for McDonalds food.  (You are taking part in your own robbery)  also you have to order by Kiosk.  Very little employee interaction.  The employees that you do meet seem angry. 

Just my take.  Very creative attempt by the company, and I applaud them for that.  But the price point is way past what I want to pay for fast food.

Lastly, as for service speed: it's not just the world's largest McDs it's also the world's slowest. Plan on about 40 minutes for your meal.

Okay, I admit it...as someone who tries to stay away from McDonald's whenever possible (except when I'm out and about and get the craving for a shake or some fries), it feels a bit unusual to be reviewing a McDonald's, but this is no ordinary Mickey D's joint.  It just so happens to be the biggest McDonald's on the face of the earth.  Around 3am one night, some friends and I stopped by after leaving a screening of the Rocky Horror Picture Show at Universal City Walk, and we were amazed that this McDonald's, in addition to its standard menu offerings, served pasta, ice cream, gourmet cakes and pies, and then some!  More than what you'd ever expect to find at the average McDonald's, right? Not only that, it's a bi-level building, complete with a downstairs seating area and an upstairs arcade/kid zone and birthday party areas on each floor!  For the first time in my life, despite the fact that it took quite some time for my friend to get her Happy Meal even though the other 2 of us received our orders before she did, I never thought I'd say this, but I'd come back!

The worst McDonald's service ever and considering this is the largest McDonald's ever supposedly you would think they would have some of their best employees working but not the case. The manager "Marquita" was rude and had an attitude after I asked to speak to a manager after waiting 15 mins for my food after I was told to park my car to wait. Not like I had a difficult order, it was a chicken mcnuggets combo. And Marquita even said it takes 3 mins to cook chicken mcnuggets so why I had to wait another 12 mins I have no clue but apparently to Marquita my time didn't matter to her as she closed the door in my face. These fast food workers rally for 15 dollars an hour pay and I laugh at that now, give 15 dollar an hour service and maybe you can have it than Marquita

Due to the busy nature of my job, I tend to eat at McDonald's too much.   But that being said I've also learned to appreciate the fact that most McDonald's adhere to a high-level of standards for a good price.

That being said, today I had one of my worst experiences at a McDonald's in a long time. This McDonald's has a new ordering system plus their counters are all over the place.  The wait times for getting the food that you already paid for seemed to take forever.   Plus they made you sit down and wait for your food at a table even though you were doing take out.  When I went to someone who looked like a manager about the status of my food and that I have been waiting a long time, I was told to go sit down at a table it would be out. There was no addressing my concerns about the time and how long it was taking.  When I finally got my food my hamburger look like it has been slopped together (see the photo attached) and my fries were cold.  I did not have time or patience to sit and request my food get redone.  So here I am writing a review and telling you to avoid this McDonald's.

I truly believe I know what the underbelly of hell looks, sounds and smells like after visiting this McDonald's. Yes I understand it is fast food, but is it too much to expect somewhat fast service, remotely clean restrooms, ice in the soda fountain? There were people literally walking around without shoes. The bathrooms made a level five toxic waste site look clean, that's if you are able to get around the two drug addicted looking bums. One of the workers packing the food was scratching her ear like a rabid dog, thank goodness she wasn't the one packing my order. To top it off outside two cars crashed on purpose trying to get ahead in the drive through lane.

Came to treat the kids to a pizza and icecream. Service is great, food was good and it was busy but not insanely crowded. we sat at a table by the aquarium on the first floor. I was finishing my pizza and turn to see not one but a handful of roaches on the wall below the aquarium. No lie, check for yourself  if you ever end up there.  The one thing that is traumatizing when I go out to eat. Never again!

Ugh.

This place is billed as the worlds largest 'entertainment' McDonalds.  Not sure what that means.  This is basically a normal sized McDonalds counter with a 2nd restaurant inside.  You order at one place and can pick from standard McDonalds items or something else from the bistro menu.  The McDonalds food is picked up in one area, the other food in another.  This other food is NOT McDonalds food, the gourmet burger I got from the bistro area was just OK.

They have a large play area on the first and second floor.  It is a mish mosh of everything, arcade games, tourist booths, hair braiding stations.  It all really did not go together.  What sums this up best is the Bill Cosby cutout leaning against a wall (picture attached).  He was popular in the 80's and hardly funny then.  Why they have him up in the McDonalds makes no sense.  I guess he fits in with everything else that is out of place.

Topping it off, the place was rather dirty.  I rarely eat at McD's, but if I had the craving in Orlando I would go elsewhere.
The prices are inflated because its in touristy area. Not my mcdonalds of choice. Drive thru does not know the definition of fast food. Workers are unenthusiastic and don't even speak.

I usually avoid this tourist trap like the plague, but it was on my way into work and I needed breakfast. The woman working the drive-thru was super nice even with the car in front of me filled with tourists who didn't quite have a firm grip on the English language.

This place claims to be the biggest entertainment McDonald's in the world,  I don't know if this is the same one I used to take my kids when they were little but if it is, this place got much nicer and cleaner than I remember,  This place has pizza, deli food like Reubens, Italian food and more,  Open 24 hours which helped me as I came in on a late flight.  Kids would go crazy here.
Awesome location, worth stopping in, food was fresh and delicious, 2 cons include very long wait time and no dollar menu. All the prices are slightly higher than usual.

9814 international drive, Orlando Florida 32819 is the McDonald's with the bistro gourmet.  Some pictures that people posted from 4 years ago are not this MacDonald's, but this McDonald's is nice too. I just step in here by mistake thinking it was the international drive McD's

I was having one of those fabulously random nights with total strangers who quickly became friends.  We started out at Parliament House and then found ourselves several miles down I-4 at someone's hotel room for an after-hours party.  Several drinks later me and my crew were starting to wind down and needed some food to absorb all of the liquor we'd consumed.

First, we found a cab.  Then, we saw those Golden Arches and I unintentionally found myself at the world's biggest McDonald's.  It reminded me of the dining options at Six Flags.  Clean enough to feel comfortable eating, but so many places to form a line that made it awkward.

I didn't see any of the crazy fish tanks that I had heard about (although, I wasn't looking).  I can appreciate anyone that serves me food at 4:30 AM and trusts me enough to enter the dining room instead of waiting in a never-ending drive-thru line.

This is the largest McDonald's I've ever been to. They had their normal McDonald's menu plus a plethora of other foods that you can enjoy like pizza, pasta, and Mexican food. They also had a wide assortment of soups that you can eat as well. Since we've never been to a McDonald's like this before we decided to try the Mexican food and the soups. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised it was very good and the soups were hot. They don't serve their menu on paper plates or cups but they use actual silverware and china. Also they have an upper-level filled with arcade games for the little kiddies to enjoy.  The service was pleasant and accommodating.  Our cashier was very nice and he had a funny side to him. The restrooms were clean and the outside of the restaurant was well kept. They are also open 24 hours. Next time I come to Florida I will definitely stop by this McDonald's again to enjoy a nice meal.

This is the biggest McDonalds and their menu has more variety than the typical McDonald's menu. I chose to be different and try something you cannot get at a regular McDonalds and ordered their Philly Cheesesteak. Surprisingly it was cheesy good and the meat was quite flavorful. Make sure you check your order when you pick up your items though. We were a party of 6 and there were things that were wrong and had to go back up to get fixed.

This place has two floors where the dining is downstairs and the play area is upstairs complete with video games and a large play area. Our nephew played with a few of the games while the rest of the kids played in the playground area..I attempted to have fun and play along with them but the place needs a complete cleaning. I went up for a few minutes and had to get out because of how incredibly filthy, sticky it was. Seems to need a full wipedown or something. Felt the need to grab some hand sanitizer immediately after going through. 

One annoying things for sure is after ordering, sitting down trying to have your meal or just trying to get a refill of your drink, there is always someone coming up to you to purchase theme park tickets for a low price. We had at least 6 people asking us in less than 45 minutes about buying tickets! If I want to buy tickets I will come up to you! Don't come up to me trying to work me up to buy tickets when I'm trying to have lunch with my family..once was okay but after that one time..ENOUGH! ugh.

Obviously, the owners were trying very hard to create something special, but what resulted was pretty confusing. While you order in one place, and pay in another, where you pick up your order depends on what you ordered. I had standard McFare and got my order where I paid, but my wife ordered a specialty salad and it was only after a while and asking some questions that we realized she was supposed to go around to another counter.

It's noisy and confusing with a lot of kids running around. If I had been looking for "an experience" I suppose I might have enjoyed it more, but I was just hungry and this was close to the motel.
Fish tank has dead fish in when brought to management attention they laughed. The tank doesn't have enough bubblers in the thank.

This is probably the best McDonald I have ever been in including the ones from China. Personally I am not a fan of McDonald foods but they made their pasta and pizza extremely good. It was as if you got it from a mom and pop restaurant. Also I have never seen such a fancy McDonalds ever. If only they can make their chain to all look like this. I don't think I've been to a McDonald's where they deliver food to you. Never! The touch screen menu is extremely high tech and better than wawa from New Jersey. Service was good. If you have little kids, they would be entertained by the arcade upstairs. Overall a very nice experience at the worlds biggest McDonald's.

One of the most unique mcdonalds. This is a must place to visit on visiting Orlando. They have real fresh French toast & it is unbelievable. You even see them make it with the open kitchen. Nothing frozen here. They even have pizza, panini sandwiches & pasta here. You can spend a whole day here with the bowling alley, huge arcade & play area for the kids.
Truly the largest and best McDonald's in the world. I loved the service and the manager was very helpful and kind. She immediately resolved my issue.

Terrible food at this location. Super loud if you dine in! and the lines are crazy from all the tourist and can be a bit confusing. 

I often stop here for lunch or dinner since my office is around the corner.  I wish I could say something good about the food here.  However, nothing I've ordered tasted even close to the standards I've been use to for a McDonalds. My first order here was a breakfast sausage biscuit and the biscuit was undercooked leaving a funny taste in my mouth.  I returned it immediately and the manager on duty gave me a refund and a new sandwich. I actually told him to keep the sandwich but he insisted that I try it.  The second sandwich was much better.  I just wish the 1st one was just as good.  The next time I ordered a big mac with fries.  That was even worse. Fries were cold and soggy.  The big mac was tasteless.  I felt like I wasted calories on this meal. 

In a way I'm glad my experience was bad. I probably wont return to this McDonald's ever... and it will be a while before I visit any other McDonald's. My brother suggested visit the Dr Phillips location just 5 minutes up the road.  Much better quality, less tourists...

Had to wait 35 minutes for a McChicken, McDoubles and a cup of coffee. This place is crap I would never recommend anybody coming here. It's a big building that gives horrible service. I only put one star because they refuse to let me post this without selecting at least one star. It's 0 Stars.
This one of the nicest mickyDs I have seen, and the playground is super sized too the staff was very nice, Orlando ain't like Atlanta lol

This place has some major shock and awe factor being the world's largest McD's with playpen.

It's also a gourmet bistro, your order cooked when ordered.

Bfast for regular items (egg mcmuffin, big breakfast) end at 11.
Bfast for gourmet items (omelets, belgian waffles and the like) end at 10.

Ordered the ravoli w/ meatballs. Quite oversauced and too salty.

The 4 stars is definitely for its shock and awe and because you can only expect so much from a McD's....rate accordingly! :)

I'm confused when I see the positive ratings for this place! We came in at 11:00 pm after a full day at Disney just to have some Big Macs before bed and the place was a disaster. They must have only been taking care of the drive thru because there were around 100 people waiting for orders inside and nothing was getting done. Even when asked about the status of an order we were shrugged off with "I have no idea what happened to your order" I get that busy happens, but if this is the biggest McDonald's in the world shouldn't you be used to volume and be staffed accordingly? After waiting for 30 minutes we asked the cashier for a refund and went to the Burger King across the street. Seriously, corporate should be ashamed if this is one of their flagship locations.

So, giant Mcdonalds with double drive thru.  
After the lunch hour rush- about 1:20 
I spent - not kidding- nine minutes waiting at the window after paying and getting a drink.   One quarter pounder meal- nothing special.  
When you can finish 6 emails and a game of candy crush while waiting at the window- it can't be called "fast food" anymore. 
Food was hot and to standard- just the slowest one I've ever been to

This may be "the world's best" but the service is not. My husband and I came here on a Sunday afternoon, and it took us 30 minutes to get through the line, and then once we ordered, we got our fries and then had to wait a whopping FORTY FIVE minutes for the rest of our food. It was infuriating to say the least, but luckily we got a full refund after complaining to the manager.

This place has a huge playplace, and some pretty awesome videogames, but if you are coming here for the food, be prepared to wait and complain, at least if you go on a Sunday.

Let's be clear right now, i won't mention the food for one simple reason, obvious... It's McDonald's, i'm pretty sure everybody knows what they sell ! I just wanted to pass by the largest (as mention everywhere in Orlando) McDo. Well... It was horrible and disgusting looking. The decoration is just heterogeous... In the oddest way. between statues that don't belong together, the poster of Bill Cosby (RIP), the jungle themed painting on (some parts of) the walls and the statue of a moon head guy playing piano... I really did not understand what they tried to do in there. It was more scary than anything. I forgot to mention the two ladies trying to sell me a $40 room in their hotel... At the price it is not a good deal... Bref, Don't bother going, save yourself the time. Largest ? Probably. Ugliest ? For sure!!

Omg this is seriously the coolest McDs ever!!

An upstairs, a downstairs, shows, fish tank, so many things!! Watch my
Video

My panini had tomatoes on it and I specifically asked if there were tomatoes due to my allergies I was told no.

The food is good. I brought my son here and he loved it. The staff moves the lines along well and it's more than just regular MCDS foods, it's pasta, waffles, paninis and more!

McDonalds is a McDonalds so they need no review. This one however is amazingly huge complete with climbing tunnels, game arcade and dinning on 2 floors. It is not your normal run McDonalds. They don't just serve normal McDonalds food but a much larger variety including cheesesteaks.  Definitely a must see if you have children or are a big kid yourself.

So what makes a McDonalds the largest in the world? Two separate ordering counters, a giant dining room, a huge play area upstairs, and a video arcade full of fun redemption value type games.
