I'd never been to this location until we had our son's birthday party there today. The crew assigned to make my son's day special was on the ball and right there with anything we might need. 

Food choices were great. Better than you'd expect from a McDonalds. After the party they gave us cards pre-loaded with tokens and we got to explore the game area upstairs. 

I would totally recommend this location as a birthday spot over that other place with the pizza and the mouse.

Nice place to check out once, but not a place that I would become a regular.

There is a regular menu and a bistro menu.  I'm still a little miffed that they did not tell me that pick up for the bistro menu is at the ice cream area (yes you can also get ice cream here), not next to the register.  I stood there for a while until I figured it out.  The bistro menu includes sandwiches like philly cheese steak, which is what I got, and burritos/wraps/etc.  Honestly I should have stuck with the proven McDonald's menu, but I was feeling adventurous.

The Philly Cheese Steak wasn't bad, but it wasn't great.  The meat was ok and the cheese looked like two pieces of American.  I really would suggest sticking with the regular menu.

For some reason, I found the decor very unappetizing.  The weird mannequin with the crescent moon for a head playing the piano creeped me out.  It definitely has unique decorations, but I'm not sure if that is a good thing.

Upstairs there is an arcade that reminds me of Chuck E Cheese.

Even though my food wasn't great, it wasn't bad either.  I would check this place out once, but I don't think I'll be back.
。Ama！。

We have been wanting to try this place out. The concept is pretty neat. You have the option of ordering on kiosks or with a person. While I was ordering a nice man in a suit came and asked me if I needed any help. I saw several over people in suits helping other customers as well.

All the employees were very friendly.  They have more choices of food here like pizza, pasta, and scoops of ice cream. They also have an arcade and indoor play area. There was a spot upstairs that was blocked off for a birthday party.

I liked the seating on the first floor. The tables have benches with four additional pull out stools to sit on. This place was extremely busy so the stools came in handy as we found ourselves sharing a table with strangers.

This is a tourist area so the prices of the food were more expensive than other McDonald's.

I am at the McDonald's, the wait is long for your food, but despite the fact that the only Coke, dr pepper, and Sprite are on the menu, they don't have Dr pepper and they have many others. Otherwise the food seems fine

So bad I don't want to waste anymore time writing the review.  I'm heading to lay down.  Sick to my stomach.  Worse than worse.  Dirty, small.  Food is nasty (even up-scale side of the establishment).  No bigger in terms of play area than 50% larger than ones around us.  Such a waste of time.  Even the kids didn't enjoy it.

I've been to McDonald's in Italy, New York City, my hometown, and various other states around the country.  Never before though have I been to the "World's Most Unique" version of this infamous restaurant.  I actually had no idea that Orlando held the title for having the largest "Entertainment and Play Place" in the world.  Or that they have many flat screen TVs, an eating section that replicates a 1950s style diner, or a Juke Box that is located in the front lobby.

And before I went inside, I had no idea that McDonald's was capable of serving items like this: Shrimp Alfredo Tortellini, Tuscan Sausage Pizza, Grilled Chicken Burrito, Hot Pastrami Sandwich, and Peanut Butter Explosion Cake.  To my utter surprise, they are in fact very capable, and willing to serve you many dishes outside of their norm.  They do carry the timeless meals we all know, but they have upped the ante with their special Bistro Gourmet Menu.  And for all the visiting tourists, I imagine this has to be a real treat for you as well.  

Their menus describe this new fare with passion and excitement, take for example the Roasted Turkey Club for $6.39, "Fresh carved turkey breast piled high and stacked with smoked bacon, American cheese, lettuce and tomato.  Served with herb infused mayonnaise on Italian sliced bread."  Call me crazy, but that doesn't sound like the Mickey D's I know.  

And should you arrive during breakfast, which is served here from 7am until 10:30am, despite being open 24/7, you'll find more than just an Egg McMuffin.  Check out the Eggs Benedict Panini or the Ham & Cheese French Toast which starts with foccacia bread and is served with a hash brown and sweet maple syrup, all for $4.69.

If that's not enough, they have taken dessert to the next level.  Again, you can still purchase your favorite McFlurries but you can also try their specialty sundaes made with Hershey's ice cream.   They have a list of about 11 options such as Carnival Crazy, Reese's Going to Pieces, Build-a-Birthday Cake and Deep Dish Apple-Pie-Ala-Mode.  They are priced from $3.69 to $4.29 for the Banana Split.  They also have gourmet pies and cakes on display that look too good to be true.

As they so proudly proclaim, not only are they proud of their revamped menu, but they are super proud of the arcade/extreme play area upstairs.   Almost every kid I know would go nuts if allowed to roam around here after eating.  They even have a gift shop if you want to forever remember your time here.  Ronald McDonald, you have outdone yourself.

Its a typical McDonalds...with a slight twist.. The 2nd floor play area!!!! My toddler had so much for $11 vs. $95 for Disney!!!! Unlike Chuck e Cheese that still uses tokens, you load and reload a card. The tickets also go into the card so u dont have to worry about losing a token or the ticket... Very convienent. When you get hungry, you can choose from the regular McD menu or opt for--pizza??? Yes, they serve pizza and a variety of different food.

We went tonight with a 3 year old who was entirely happy with the play area and overall environment. The staff was amazingly helpful and accommodating.  The food was absolutely terrible.  Almost everything we had was cold, stale and my food was almost inedible.  3 year old hardly ate anything. I ate because I was hungry. There is a much better McDonalds a mile away. Unless you want your children to play there, don't bother.

You can mix the ingredients and create your own dish.   Omelettes are huge!   You order yourself by machines and  just wait until
They call you.

This is a wild McDonald's..If my kids were young again, they would be in heaven. It is 2 levels of games and fun..a Dave & Buster's for the wee ones!!! The food is a little price, but I guess you are paying for the Atmosphere...but regular Mickey D food!!!

This McDonalds is different than any other McDonalds I've been too. They serve pizza and pasta!!! The one major difference is the prices. Never in my life have i ever wasted $27 dollars at McDonalds, but i enjoyed the experience.

2 stars for the food. Loved the fact that I could 'customize' my order but not a lot to choose from. Same 'ol same 'ol. Fries not hot and fish sandwich overlooked. Nothing new. I actually don't like McD's. But such a novelty as the biggest McD's in the world and the arcade was the lure (for the kids). 5 stars for the fun the kids had and the smile on my teenaged son's face.

Since this was a bistro, my son had the pasta and I had the cheesesteak. Had to come here after hearing this was the world's biggest mcdonalds. Food ok considering it is a mcdonalds. Game room upstairs and had a rustic feel downstairs. Glad I went for the experience.

As a couple of Canadians visiting Orlando, we did not expect to encounter the world's biggest Mcdonalds right down the street from our hotel. Once we found out how big it was, we dashed to it after our long day at Universal Studios.

 Let me tell you, this McDonalds was indeed large. The building consisted of multiple stories/levels, and the food selection was vast. 

They had your typical mcburgers, mcnuggets, etc., but they also served waffles, pasta (with an exclusive white sauce, only offered at that particular location), oven-made pizza like back in the 90's, and an array of desserts consisting of: cakes, pies, build-your-own Ice cream, etc. It was truly a spectacular sight for all the foodies out there, such as ourselves.

So my boyfriend and I ordered two buttermilk chicken sandwiches, and made it a combo with fries. We poured our drinks from the super-cool drink fountain which had basically every drink you can fathom. I tried the lime fanta, which was ok. Though, the buttermilk chicken sandwiches were absolutely delectable! Literally the best Mcdonalds burgers/meal we have ever had. The sandwhiches were very fresh and warm with steam coming out of the bites of chicken. The chicken piece was huge, like two normal sized chicken pieces in a sandwhich, and it was very moist and juicy. The bun was a wonderful potato bun with a butter glaze ontop. The sauce had a prominent buttermilk taste to it, as suggested by the name, the burger was well-presented and definately not sloppily assembled. 

Overall, the buttermilk chicken sandwhich from that Mcdonalds location was a solid 5/5, and I recommend you all to try that sandwhich from that particular location.

Yes, I am giving McDonalds 5 stars. Why you ask? Well this is not your typical McDonalds. They serve other types of food. Pasta from Mcdonalds? It sounds nuts but its really good. Inside this place is like a theme park. Tons of arcades upstairs and some cool things on the bottom level. I like that this place is 24hrs. 

::BATHROOM UPDATE::: This has to be the cleanest bathroom I've seen at this type of place. The cool thing is that there is tons of mirrors inside the bathroom. It's really fun. They have this plastic thing that is on the toilet that you press and it disinfects every-time for people who actually sit on the toilet.

If you have kids I would highly recommend you bring them here. Also there is a spot where you sit on a bench and you can take photos w/ a fake Ronald McDonald.

The clown blew it with this one. They had an opportunity to do something really great in a hot tourist town and great location but they can't get the basics right. STANDARDS! Even fast food must provide a clean place to eat and a welcoming environment. This place has not been cleaned in years. Tables are dirty. Drink station is dirty. Game room games are dirty. Customers are a bit dingy too.

Kids will love this place, adults will endure it. Ordering and receiving food is chaos. You can't even get close enough to see the menus. They'e closer to where you pick up your food rather than where you order. That said, this location offers the McDonald's Bistro menu. One member of our party said she enjoyed the shrimp and pasta she ordered. I'm not sure I'm ready to trust McDonald's with shellfish...

Other than that, the games are fun. Standard selection for a place like this. They have staff who play games with the kids like limbo and musical chairs. That was a nice surprise. i'd come back here only if I had some kids with me to make it worth the chaos.
Super clean, large inside and perfect for your kiddo to burn off some energy. Friendly workers. Quick service. No complaints!
Well, at least we can say we've been here. We can also say we'll never go again. Bleh! Filthy, disorganized, overpriced, dysfunctional McChaos.
We pulled away with a bag. Got to our hotel & had 2 salads with no forks, no dressing & no receipt. Complete fail McDonald's.
This had to be the biggest McDonald's I've ever seen. Even if your not a big fan of mcdonalds this place will grab your attention.

If you're a tourist or even a local, do not visit this location if you do not want to be up-charged. I ordered the same meal here and at the Central Florida Pkwy location and there was a big difference in prices. If you're going there to let your kids run wild in the PlayPlace, then you're essentially being charged for that perk when you're buying food.

I would give them negative 5 stars if I could.  We visit there every couple years while visiting disney and watched it get worse every time.  We went there today and OMG, what disgusting excuse for a tourist trap it has become. The food was cold, the bathroom smelled worse than a dead animal in the sewer for a week, the drink dispenser barely worked.  RUN AWAY - NOW.

This is the greatest Mcdonalds known to man. It was made with the American flag on its back and caters to all this American.

I ate a Grand Mac and a Mcpizza. It blew my mind. It changed my life. It changed how I voted. It changed the way I viewed the world.

Who would have thought..a pizza..from mcdonalds? Nobody thought it could be done. They said it was IMPOSSIBLE. They say man landed on the moon and invented the iphone, but the mcpizza..nah son, IMPOSSIBLE.

I believe in all things can be done in life. I cried when I saw it. 

Best mcdonalds ever. Five stars

Every year me and my family will go on vacation to Orlando Florida. We take our kids to McDonald's,they have arcade room and a playground that's upstairs.Downstair where you order your food. You can order from the cashier or the kios. They also served pizza,pasta and sandwich. My kids loved the dessert section they have(cake, Cookie's and ice cream). If you ever visit Orland Florida,bring your kids here they will love it...the only thing they don't have dollar menu, they're more expansive.

Dear people:
I order the new egg white sandwich in this McDonald very grease dint look nothing like the one on TV never again so grease that runs from your fingers.
Sorry but and is so expensive to , means white eggs cheaper than the full egg.
Sonia e.

Your staff are so busy checking their phones that you have to interrupt them to get your onscreen order correct in the bag. Kids can't get help upstairs because they are on their phones

I stood in front of an active register for 5 minutes trying to order at mc cafe before a duty manager came to tell me that section was closed and she couldn't help me. 

Less than one star

I went to the mega-McDonald's because it is next to the hotel my conference is being held.  I found it to be depressing on many levels. This review is going to be wholly negative, but keep in mind that I'm only in a bad mood because this McDonald's has temporarily sucked away all of my happiness.

Some of the recent reviews mention how this McDonald's serves gourmet food like "pasta and pizza." It makes me sad to see it described as "gourmet."  It's the same sort of sadness you feel on Christmas Eve when you go to Walgreens and see a procrastinating parent buying a bunch of last-second, crappy Christmas presents.

A different reviewer mentioned how the "workers are unenthusiastic." Of course they are. What is there to be enthusiastic about? They work at a giant and abnormally loud McDonald's. I actually appreciated their lack of enthusiasm. It helped me form a real human connection with them, and it gave me the feeling that we were in this thing together.

There are multiple videogames on the ground level and the upstairs level. It is just like Dave n Buster's only a) there is zero excitement b) nobody is smiling c) the customers are all big, slow, and have no peripheral vision, so you'll feel like young Marshall Faulk weaving through a crowd of linemen. 

Having spewed all that negativity, let me say that this isn't the worst place in the world, and it is actually a great restaurant for those who enjoy being overcome with profound sadness. :-(

Actually pretty cool mc donalds! I'm not huge on fast food but there's so much to choose from. I got my usual BEC BAGEL just as good and unhealthy as always. But it's mind blowing how much food there is. There is even NY cheese cake. Lots of games up stairs for everyone. Even a four way air hockey!!!!! They have candy crush too can you believe it!! I meant to get a picture but I was in awe maybe one of my videos have it. All in al pretty chill place to go to. Lines are a bit wonky. Restrooms are rather interesting the women's toilet seat has a plastic film on it that moves...????  I didn't understand that so.. I lined it it up with tp!! Hah.

This place was dirty, nasty, overpriced games.  Nasty Stinky Playland, dirty window floors, tables.  Sleazy sales people trying to sell us condos as we walked in.  The games were soooo expensive.  There were kids without their mothers, walking around carrying their baby brothers and sisters (Did there parents just drop them off?  What the heck?) and what I'm certain was pimp with his his very young "girls"  (spaced out on crack or something) eating there; so sad.  Children without parents tending them.  Stay away.  We had so many great experiences in Orlando; this was the only bad and one and it was really bad.  I felt like we all should be soaking in anti-bac when we got back to the hotel.  Don't go. Yuck!
Absolutely awesome coming from cincinnati.   Cheesecake was amazing.  Very clean, and as typical fast casual pricing.
My children puke day after eating at this place so this say all about the place! stay away from this place

This specific McDonald's is known as the "World's Largest McDonald's". I'll hate to admit this, but I really do have a soft spot for Mickey D's, and when I learned that this was a thing in Orlando, I knew I had to make a stop here before leaving the city. 

Upon entry, you'll see someone serving up some pasta, pizza, and steak sandwiches! Definitely not something you see at a regular Mickey D's joint. Of course, being the foodie that I am, I decided (with my fiance) to order the pizza and pasta. We really wanted to order the sandwich as well, but we felt like we were already going overboard. Plus, we still wanted to order our usual suspects like our coke, fries, and a burger...but what the heck! We were on vacation! 

The pasta came out to almost $15 and the pizza was about $11. Our total bill was about $40. Probably the most I've ever spent on McDonald's! 

To be honest, the pizza and pasta were just okay. I probably would've rather spent a few more dollars indulging on pizza and pasta elsewhere, but because this was a unique experience, I had to try it! 

P.S. They have a whole floor dedicated to arcade and huge play area for kids. This is a great place to bring your kids if you're broke after spending money at the theme parks! The kids are sure to have a good time for a few hours here!
Unique experience. Would probably have been better but there were 3 buses there at the time. Pizza was yummy though the wait was a little long. We stopped in for the novelty of it.
Small story short, Went Drive thru ended up inside since I received the car in front of myself order...

McDonald's food is meh but I only went so my kids can see the biggest playground McDonald's....... they enjoyed it. Place is kind of dirty but how can it be expected to be sparking when it's so busy here. The arcade section is pretty good, except for the claw machine, my son won but the machine wouldn't let go of the prize......... and then it reset after a few minutes and dropped the prize back in the middle. We were only given that 6 credit refund :/

I ordered a waffle cone ice cream but there wasn't any details on the screen. When the cone was made I noticed that o just paid 4 dollars for one scoop of ice cream! No thank you, never again! Too expensive for one small scoop of ice cream.

Very unique McD's.  This place has tons of games, and it's own cafe with a completely different menu.  If you have smaller kids and are hoping for a nice play area, this particular McDs is not for you.  Unlike your typical Playland, customers *cannot* eat anywhere near the play area!  With that, you cannot let the kids blow off some steam right before lunch... and it's so busy, crazy, and loud, it is simply far from ideal for smaller kids who need closer supervision.

Now, older kids will love this place.  On another positive note, I did enjoy the McDonalds shrimp alfredo!

A very high tech, touristy McDonald's. Definitely a place to visit just for the experience. Very clean & organized. Pasta, craft burgers, oven baked pizza w/separate dessert station. Good sized arcade & prizes to win w/indoor playground. Plenty of seating and high tech experience throughout, especially in the bathroom. Was told that the toilet won't flush & toilet "seat covers" was a unique kind of warm wet that I didn't want to use the bathroom. I finally gave in & it was not bad at all. I can see why many would have a difficult time flushing. There's always a button to flush and seat cover was really, really cool. Be ready to spend $$$$ for McDonald's but given the experience & other food choices, is reasonable.

DO NOT GO HERE! TERRIBLE MCDONALD'S! We (3 of us) waited over 45 minutes for our order, to which we had to go up to the counter and ask why we did not have our food yet. The food was sitting behind the counter. The employee turned around, added the fries we had with our order, and handed the tray over, but without the drink. The food was partially cold, like it was sitting there for a while. There was an employee in the back on her phone (she was also on her phone when we ordered at the kiosk). It looked like another employee was potentially scolding her. The entire time we were there, there was only one employee taking orders at the cash register with a long line, which is why we went to the kiosk. The people around us also had to approach the counter about their orders, which were just sitting there. We didn't even bother ordering dessert because we were so angry with the wait time. Never going there again!

I'm not a fast food person. I hate it, actually. My children wanted a snack and I just had to check this place out. Upon walking in there's many screens where you can place your order or walk to the counter. There's a dessert & McCafe area, regular ordering area and area where you can see more former items being made.

I'm unsure if the day we went was typical or not but a Chef ( Yes, a Chef! ) had made some dishes and had them lined up with what looked to be important personnel tasting and discussing the items. One of the items was grilled chicken on a bed of sliced tomato and lettuce with basil sauce. They were discussing adding new menu items, marketing, ect. It was really fun to see a different side to the same restaurant that we are all used to. Just something different to witness! 

The entire area was super clean. In fact, the trash cans automatically compact. What!?! Cool! Upstairs is an arcade and a play place. I was terrified of my children playing in a nasty old play place but it was so clean and well kept. Bravo McD's..... I only wish every location was as up to standards as this one. Seriously!
20 minutes to order a "Patty Melt" off the Bistro menu.  Was told it takes so long because it is a special bistro item.  Received the sandwich and it is a Big Mac on toast.

Bottom line - Wow.  This is like, the greatest McDonald's ever.

That claim doesn't say mean much these days, but I completely understand why my niece wanted to have her birthday here.  This certainly beats the rinky dink playland my McDonalds had when I was growing up.  

Overall, this place is definitely more for the kids than adults, but it does provide a pretty good place to host a party for them.
Order the food at 10:32. Got the food finally at 11:58. Workers just decided to leave leaving others stressed and customers waiting for too long.

It's the world's largest McDonalds and they were totally right. It's humongous!! I didn't know where I was supposed to order at. They have a special bistro menu which includes eggs benedict and french toast I believe. 

Upstairs is a huge arcade area for the kiddies. You could totally throw a birthday party there for a little kid. Think of it as Chuck e Cheese's but without the pizza and mouse. I think there is pizza though, but it's not from Mcdonald's. There are other vendors in there. 

I didn't like this place very much because you can tell the people here do not care about their jobs very much. The people were talking amongst themselves while we were waiting. Obviously we wanted to order. Also, I asked to have no cheese on my breakfast sandwich and they couldn't even do that. It's not rocket science. I'm also trying to save you money for telling you to keep your ingredients.

Ordering from a kiosk was convenient especially for customizing your order.  The pasta was a decent size portion with Alfredo sauce and broccoli. However,  adding protein like grilled chicken bummed up the price to $11.99.00.  The pizza was fast and tasty if you like thinner buttery crust. It would be nice to add an ordering kiosk upstairs to add to Order or even a coffee and desert. Also, it would be great to have a drink refill station upstairs or at least water and coffee.

McDonald's Land
My son loves going to the McDonalds at Mc Donald's Land.
He calls this restaurant Mc Donald's Land, because he said it's just like Disneyland with a happy meal.
It's the largest McDonald's restaurant and fun place in Orlando Florida.
The food is so amazing and freshly made.
Even the happy meals, for kids has a better quality of taste in food.
This location is our favorite, family Mc Donald's Restaurant on earth.
https://youtu.be/LUuy8NQPnL0

EPIC MCDONALDS. No, really. This is what this place is called and epic it is!

From the outside, you can't really tell how massive this property is until you get inside. There is a pizza oven, self serve kiosks, a regular Mcdonald's counter, tables/booths, and a whole upper level with more seating, a decently sized arcade, and play area for the kiddos. What more could you ask for? 

UHM, SO MUCH MORE. Make your own pizza. Make your own pizza. Make your own Belgium waffle.Take your time at the Coca Cola Freestyle soda machine and make your own drink. Don't have enough hands as you're wrangling your little ones after, I bet, a looooong day at one of the parks? Don't worry, take a number and sit down and smiling employee will bring your food to you!

This truly is a very special McDonalds. For someone who will indulge in the occasional Happy Meal because I don't feel so good post McDonald's, I could see myself being VERY HAPPY if this place were to replicate itself closer to my home ;)

Had to come by because our uber driver told us that this location was the largest in the world. To start off with, they have multiple ordering areas: human cashier and an electronic tablet area. I selected the dine in option and grabbed my number and waited for my food to be delivered. 

The food took awhile to come out and the person who delivered my food kept circling one section of the restaurant before ever walking to the opposite side to deliver. Then when he came over, he questioned, "Do you really need 4 honey containers?". He had no intention of giving me my requested amount as the tray only had 2 containers. If I ordered that and inputted 4 obviously I wanted the 4 right? I really didn't appreciate his attitude. 

Other then that, the location is bigger than what I have been to with a pastry/pasta/pizza area, arcade/children play room upstairs.

Alright guys...this is a McDonald's and although it's the one with the largest entertainment section, we can't expect gourmet meals! Lol. This review is specifically for the more specialty items they have. Traveling from out of state, this was on the list of places I wanted to see so I was really excited coming in but the food was definitely not up to par and tasted like frozen meals. I got their pizza, ravioli, and Belgian waffles. The pizza was customizable so there was no going wrong for that but it was very greasy. I felt a bit sick after eating a nice. The Belgian waffles had super soggy strawberries so that wasn't that pleasant. The only good thing I enjoyed was probably the ravioli. It tasted pretty good and the chicken was well seasoned! I probably wouldn't try any of these items again though. 

The inside was extremely nice. Tons of tables around and the entertainment section was at the upper level. Plenty of arcade games. It was a very fun environment. Staff were nice and brought food to your table. It was a cool one time experience but I probably won't come back again.

This McD's location is the most impressive one that I have been to so far.  I was blown away by their offerings and how different things were in this McD's compared to the ones back home that I was so used to. For starters, there was a guava and cheese pie that they had.  We had to get a few for our group.  They were so tasty.  They were fresh, flaky and so yummy.  They're like nothing that we have at home, in Los Angeles, CA.  More often than not, anyway, we don't have the pleasure of indulging in freshly baked pies from McD's.  It's a rare thing.  

Another thing about this location that was so different to me was that they pretty much had a show kitchen for their pasta making.  I thought that was pretty neat.  I mean, really, what other McD's have you been to that offered pasta. . . not to mention pasta that you could stand there and watch them make to your specifications?!?! After all, it's not like this is a Vegas buffet line or something.  I was impressed. 

I admit, I've always wondered why the Mc D's chain has their Mc Cafe "section" if you will.  I understand now.  At this McD's, they have a section of their store that is an ice cream stand basically.  They make their speciality drinks, ice cream cones, sundaes, etc.  This particular section of the store wasn't available or open when I was there but that was because they'd just welcomed three bus loads of hungry tour groups into their store and they'd just come in.  And you don't want hungry people to become HANGRY people. So, I understand that the managers asked the all hands be on deck to help people order and what not.  They also asked that their customers be open to their food being delivered to them as they'd be a tad behind in making as much food as was being ordered.  Sure. I didn't mind that at all.  I was actually really interested in watching this restaurant help THAT many people. 

Later on during our visit the McCafe section of the store opened.  We were able to order desserts of different kinds, cake and other dessert pastries included.  It was amazing how many people flocked to their station and ordered up everything that they could get their hands on.  It was crazy but it was awesome I must admit. 

I was missing a portion of our order that was supposed to be delivered to our table. I immediately let one of the managers know as he was touring the floor to be sure that everyone got what they needed and what they'd ordered.  I was really impressed at home efficient he was in getting his staff members to kinda fetch what was needed to make the experience that much better. The manager made sure to quickly get what we needed and to be sure that we received everything that was going to make our experience that much better. 

I didn't have any real issues while I was here and I have to say, I wish that more stores in my area would model themselves after this store and how they worked so well like a brilliantly well oiled machine. I'd love to return sooner than later but the fact remains, this store is not just a lil ways away from me. . . it's all the way on the other side of the country from me. Damn it!

I'd love to come back during a time it isn't so busy.  My lil one would have loved to have the opportunity to play in their kids play area upstairs, yeah upstairs. I forgot to mention that this is a multi-level store.  I didn't have the chance to go up there myself but my husband told me it looked potentially amazing.  Again, potentially only because our lil one wasn't able to play up there with all the big big big kids up there, most of them just coming from the tour buses. 

I really liked that this store had their own hashtag but also tons of dining space, clean dispensers for things like drinks, napkins, etc.  My lil one enjoyed looking at the aquarium.  She loves fishies. This was quite an experience for our family. Awesome!

We went to this location because it's the largest McDonalds in the world! 

The food was mediocre. We ordered fries and bigmacs. The big Mac seemed like it was dried out. The fries were undercooked. The apple pies were cold. 

I firmly believe the best McDonald's can be found only in small towns with no other food options. 

This locations is 2 stories. It has a fish tank, indoor playground (loud!), arcade (with prizes), and cool art. It was nice to visit but I would never return.

They also have 2 coke 365 machines with constant lines. The floor around it was sticky. 

It was nice to have the food served table side rather than awkwardly standing by the register with strangers on their phones.

World's Biggest McDonald's! Game fl upstairs!
Went 1 yr ago.  
I looked at the menu (on the side of restaurant) in shock & amazement reading things like quesidillas, pasta, belgian waffles, peanut butter explosion cake...  And even display cases! Where the eff was I?! 
I ordered tri-color tortellini(!) alfredo w garlic bread & a wild berry smoothies (smoothies weren't MCD staple back then)!! They trew in shrimp for free! I didn't even know they HAD shrimp!

Hope it wasn't from The Gulf...

Tasted GREAT! If I am to be picky, slightly salty-tasting, BUT this is MCDONALDS, so I'm sure it had much more bad stuff, incl sodium than I can imagine.

Most majestic bathrooms you'll ever see.
I passed some fat white lady on the way on the phone saying she told someone not to prostitute herself. Weird.

This isn't your typical, or average, McDonald's. This, IMO, is a step above it!

I remember as a kid in the late 90s, going on a family vacation and being brought to the "biggest McDonald's in the world". While I have no idea if it is the biggest Micky D's, it sure is a pretty swell one.

But what separates this location from the thousands of others all across the world? Fast forward to my recent visit, and here are a couple of take aways:

First off: It's pretty high tech. Rather than order from a cashier, you order from a machine. Unfortunately when we went, the machines were out of order, so we were unable to actually try out the high tech feature of this place. Turns out that after we had finished eating, the machines were back in order. Sucks, but we'll give it a try next time.

Second: Arcade upstairs. I don't see many arcades around, especially in fast food joints. Nowadays, fast food joints prefer you to keep a time limit on your stay. This place encourages you hanging out with your family. After eating, we went upstairs and played a few games. It was a fun time! They also have a Play Place available for the younger kids.

Third: The food. Now usually when you think Micky D's food, you think dollar menu, Big Macs, chicken nuggets, etc., but this place is a step above the regular McDonald's food. This place has a bistro that serves gourmet burgers and sandwiches, create-your-own pizzas, pastas, and other things! The pizza was pretty good. I can't really compare it to any other McDonald's pizzas, because let's face it, they don't exist in many other places. The gourmet burger was pretty much the best burger I've had in a McDonald's, while the fries were just as any other McDonald's: delicious.

Overall, if you're in the Orlando area you should give this place a try. If you like McDonald's, you should definitely give this place a try. I do plan on checking this place out whenever I head back to Orlando.

You know the bovine growth hormones that they give cows to produce more milk? There was a genetic mutation of it which found it's way into this McDonald's and made it supersized. Yes, they let you know everywhere that this is the World's Largest Entertainment McDonalds.

Do you want a pizza? A "gourmet sandwich"? A "gourmet burger"? A panini? Spaghetti? Omelet? Belgian waffle? Yep...those are all here on a menu board which is the size of most McDonalds themselves. 

Now that you have your order figured out, where do you sit? In one of the retro-style chairs? At a table where you can be serenaded by Mac Tonight on the piano? Upstairs? 

This entire experience is sensory overload including the play area which occupies the majority of the second floor with their arcade games and McDonalds merchandise store. 

I might have given them 4 stars because it does look cool from the outside. But I had to actually go inside. Twice. I'm giving myself 5 stars for that feat of bravery and 3 to McDonalds.

it was cool to eat pasta at mcdonald's. the pasta was pretty expensive for being mcdonald's and it was not that good, it was okay. the sauce was pretty bland, i think i would've made a better pasta than mcdonald's. but we got the food quick and the service was pretty good!

This McDonald's is very unique due to not only the size of the restaurant but the fact it also offers the "Bistro Gourmet" menu to go with the shop. The main menu is the same as a normal mcdonalds and the quality of the food is on average as well. The Bistro Gourmet menu offers items such as pizza and special sandwiches, I ordered a burger from that menu and it was very different and delicious. Only downside is inside they have one of the tourist kiosks and they like to be pushy.

Customized Omelette breakfast. Never had it at other McDonald's location. Spacious Area. Staff are super nice and check in with us. They help to clean out the table. Best of the best! Restrooms are considerately designed too. Highly recommended!

This is my kids' favorite McDonald's ever. We have been coming here for well over a decade. It's basically the Chuck E Cheeses of McDonald's. It has gone through many building and menu renovations over time. We miss the larger menu that included burritos but we still had a good time.

This restaurant relies on ordering kiosks. You can have their classic menu, but we opted for the build your own pizza and make your own pasta. We also tasted the peanut butter chocolate cake and hand scooped ice cream. For a McDonald's the food was fun and unique.

The games are located on the upper level. You purchase and load a game card. They featured a nice variety of games you would find at an arcade. The decor is fun and nostalgic. My daughter loves Mac Tonight moon at the piano. 

Unfortunately we found many of the workers unfriendly and unhelpful. They were not knowledgeable about our food questions or concerns. When getting one of our cakes half was missing and it was difficult getting it rectified. When the kids tried to redeem their game tickets there was a long line and only two workers who assisted one child at a time and waited for them to make their minds up on prizes before moving on to the next kid. We almost left, several other people did in fact leave prizeless. It took almost an hour for prize redemption. 

Regardless of the negative, we enjoy this location and will be back. True it's a big tourist trap, but if you are a Micky D's fan and are working your way around the Micky D world, this is a must not miss attraction for the entire family.
It's pretty big and they have a really nice playroom on the second floor. The only issue was that they didn't have ice cream. To be the biggest one on the world that's unacceptable.

I came in a bad mood... I was hungry and dealing with other things.

This place made me happy.

I wasn't pleased to be coming to a McDonald's BUT this one is no ordinary McDonalds.

First, our cashier was so friendly and didn't get angry when we kept changing things.

Second, the food is great... we ordered waffles, pasta, omelette... soooooo good!!! 

And the shift manager was sooooo nice and brought the kids toys and had the top floor sing Happy Birthday do my niece celebrating her first birthday in a few days.

Glad we came
Very nice interior, a lot more food choices, super helpful employees, lots a arcade video games. What is there more to ask for?

Well. If you're looking for a subpar tourist trap, then this might me the place for you. Crowded. 2nd floor area is loud and smells. Out of 5 orders. 4/5 were wrong. And it took 20 minutes to get the order fixed. Staff is alright but they don't talk. I'd say I was disappointed but that barely scratches the surface. I'd like to pay at least one compliment. The exterior covers up the shiftiness of insides well. Oh. Yeah interesting variety of food.  Use the drive thru...and be prepared to come back three times to get the correct food.
The setup and location for this drive-thru is the worst I've ever seen.
OMG, I see their hiring.....you guys don't need more employees,  you need efficient ones!! Stop talking and work. Have your employees trained by chick fil-a, they know their stuff!!!

This McDonalds is better than most McDonald's we have been to. A two story building that has the play area upstairs and games. Downstairs you would figure they'd have the same old McDonald's food which is burgers and fries. To our surprise it was much more. 
From the original McDonald's menu, u can create your own burger or chicken sandwich. That was nice. They also have a fresh pizza and pasta station.... What?! Not at McDonald's?! Yes it's true. The chefs (yes, chefs) cook the pizza in a coal burning oven and make the pasta in front of you. We were impressed. Not enough to give it a try tho lol. 
The only negatives are the new ordering system. You don't order thru a person. They have large touch screen ordering to speed up orders and a do it yourself way to pay. To me it takes the customer service out of ordering and the touch screen kept having issues to where we had to use a different one. They do have people there to help you while you are ordering but I think the old way. That's just me.

I am giving this place 3 stars, but not for the food, the food is exactly as it would be at any McDonald's and to be honest, I am not really a fan of fast food.  However, I am giving this place 3 stars, because it was sort of cool to visit the World's largest McDonalds and the kids had fun in the entertainment area playing games and winning prizes.  Also the fact that they have brick oven pizza, cooked to order pasta, gourmet burgers, and a full bakery is pretty cool.  Just don't get your expectations up too high on the food, just because they make it doesn't mean it is any better than the rest of their normal menu.  Food was just okay.  It was, however, the most money I have ever spent at McDonalds.

It was cool to visit, but if you're looking for good food, this isn't the place.

This is the biggest McDonald's in Florida the food is great, they offer a lot of great options that other McDonald's dosent offer like pasta, brick oven pizza ( which is AMAZING) but the arcade games don't work they stole my money,when I told the attendant about it she told me the tech would not be back for a whole week.

Bottom Line on Top: Triple the cost, half the quality.

Breakfast at Micky D's? No brainer! Um... no. The food was not *bad*, just... meh.  But when I pay nearly $30 for two people, "meh" is not what I expect.  RUN, don't walk, to any other Orlando location. Not even the monstrosity on LBV at Hotel Row is as ludicrous as this.

PS: if you are really so impressed by a second floor, please go ahead and pay. I mean... sheesh.

Yes, I know what you're thinking! Rating a McDonald's! Mmhm. That's right! I thought the one in Vegas on the strip was nice, but nah. This one right here takes the cake. Being from up North, you'll never see one like this in Philly... Like ever! No, I'm not exaggerating either. 

I heard about this particular McDonald's through social media and thought to myself to pay a visit when I'm vacationing here. Dragged the Mister out of bed to get breakfast and you know what? Better than what we both had expected. Besides the eye catching fish tank. This place is clean, nice, but yet simple decor with plenty of playroom on the upper levels. It does get crowded, but not overwhelming.

No need for interaction as you can order from a kiosk and also customize your order(s). I opted for the Belgium Waffle with Strawberries and Banana with topped Whipped Cream. The Mister stayed with his usual Sausage McGriddle Meal. Place in your order and find yourself a seat because they will bring your meal to you. Not only that, this place also serves Pizza and Pasta plus their Dessert Bar. We'll be back to experiment more!

For the largest McDonald's in the world the building itself was impressive. It was definitely cool to see a new side to the classic McDonald's with model architecture. At the McDonald's they have multiple ordering stations a separate counter for mcCafe items, a play place, and an arcade. There are also more options at this restaurant too, they have Belgium waffles, pizza(ik weird right?), pasta, omelets, and cake. Service was great the workers bring the food to you. I ordered the pasta tortellini with chicken to be specific. I know I shouldn't expect so much as it is just a fast food restaurant, but the meal reminded me of a cafeteria lunch. Chicken was definitely frozen then cooked and overall meal was quite bland.

This place is way better than the average Mc Donalds because ...... They serve gourmet food from pasta and pizza (plus their original) and also have an arcade! The interior is really fun because you feel like you just stepped into a whole different place. We sat by the jungle/pond looking area and went upstairs for all the fun. If I had this as a chid I would have wanted my birthday here. 

This is like the Busch Gardens for a 4 year old. It's so cool here! It's a really cool experience even for a college student myself.

kitchen workers should be wearing their masks properly!! one worker came in and walked back to the kitchen not wearing a mask at all and another girl had her mask uncovering her nose the whole time i was there. service was pretty slow. i know right now is a hard time for us all but don't come here if you're worried about covid because they obviously aren't taking proper precautions.

Your average McDonalds. What the difference is is the huge building area in the front compared to other ones.

I went through the drive thru to get small fries, caramel iced coffee, and a strawberry banana shake. All three were good, as they should be from McDonalds. Their drive thru was pretty tight, even for a small car I was driving. I definitely had to check my right side many times so I wouldn't hit the curb.

Very poor experience at night. Every aspect of our order was done wrong, and the coordination of the employees left us waiting at a 2nd window with no sign of any employees. Utterly disappointing service.

Probably one of the nicest Mickey d's ive been to. I'm not a huge fast food lover, but we came here for breakfast on a road trip since we didn't have time for a sit down place.
They have made-to-order omelets; I got an egg white omelet with ga bunch of veggies & turkey sausage...so yummy! Didn't taste like fast food at all.
They also have pizza & pasta options. To be honest the pizza looked below average quality.
They also have a separate cafe cashier, computerized self order screens, a huge play area with arcades, tablets at most tables, an elevator, an area where you can watch them cook, etc.
Same prices as other McDonald's. A little slower, but what can you expect with a busy crowd & made to order custom omelets?

I have to say this was probably one of the best parts of my vacation, sounds weird, I know! Until you actually experience this McDonald's you really can't judge, it's awesome! They have the regular mcdonald's side and the bistro cafe side. There's also an arcade and playplace upstairs. Each day they have an activity for guests which range from face painting to a reptile show. Yes, there was an alligator inside this place while I was eating!!

Me and my friend both ordered different items and split them. The food is surprisingly not bad. We tried a turkey wrap, ravioli, bistro burger, and philly cheesesteak. 

There is a really cool machine where you can record your own songs, we did a duet and though we sounded horrible, it made for great laughs. I also played a game where you had to operate a claw that had a razor on it to cut the string of your prize. I won three of these and each prize was a stuffed animal, silly bands, and a generic Ipod that looked like the real thing. 

If you're vacationing in Orlando this should definitely be on your list.

I've been to this McDonald's many times over the years, but I have always used the drive thru.  We always hit up this location after leaving the club because let's face it...it's the only place that's open that time of night.  Plus, who can say "no" to McDonald's fries after a night of drinking and dancing?

At the request of my friend's daughter, we came to this location because of the arcade.  The place was a mad house, and a little dirty.  It's McDonald's...what can you expect?

Please be aware that there is approximately, a 50% markup compared to the prices you are used to at your local McDonald's.  I recommend that if you are dining inside to please say your order is "to go," to ensure that your food is warm.  We told the cashier we were dining in and by the time table runner brought us our food, it was stone cold.  I never return my food, so I just endured the chewy fries.  

Also, if you are bringing children do NOT leave them unattended or use the elevator.  We noticed a "gentleman" that was lurking near the arcade, and made us very uncomfortable in the elevator.

Well, I cruised thru there after work tonight, and was directed to the second window for ordering. No problem, pull up and wait 10 minutes to order. Ok. I get it. 

1/4 cheese no onion meal, small with a coke. 

Pay, and pull up to get my food. 
I get to the next window, and my order isn't present, and nowhere close to what I ordered.  I repeat the order and they go on a hunt. She comes back with the next bag and it's correct, quarter cheese no onion, and a small fries, but no coke.    She finds a coke and I'm on my way 15 minutes later than when I pulled in. 

I get slightly down the road, and reach in for a hot fry, and I get cold nasty fries. Not even room temperature fries.  Why if they were so busy with all of us customers could they even possibly have cold fries???


Being in the middle of the tourist district and many people barely speak our language, maybe they think they can do that late at night, but McDonald's Corp is a stand up business, and they frown upon that. Especially in the tourist areas. 

I don't see how, if you can't hold up the standards  your employer, you're ever going to be worth $15 an hour.
Get ready to wait a while. When you are done the order is not right. They gave my order to the person if front of me . It's also very expensive for a McDonald's.

Pleasantly surprised. I've lived in florida my whole life and have avoided this McDonalds on purpose. My son wanted to go so we went on the last day of his spring break. The games were surprisingly inexpensive. The menu has a large variety of food. We got pizza, which my son loved. The service was amazing. They bring your food to you even on the second floor and whole place was very clean. I will definitely come back.
Go up the road to a different McDonald's, this place cost twice as much as any other McDonald's I've been to, not sure why but I drive a couple minutes away and pay regular price!

I'm generally not a fan of McDonald's at all. Their food is gross and unhealthy, their stores are usually dirty and the customer service is hands down the worst. This location, however, is fantastic. The world's largest McDonald's has an arcade and games and a huge play place. My kids had such a great time. They even had a healthier food section and a bakery where they made legit desserts. It is a pretty cool place that is fun for the whole fam. Worth stopping by when in the area.

Had to drop into what claims to be the biggest McDonald's in the world to see what it was like these days, and if anything had changed since I last went in this branch 15 years ago. 

As it is such a large branch the menu is extensive and the service is fast. However I found it difficult to see the menu from the ordering point. The decor including fish tanks looks very dated and the interior is quite gloomy and not a pleasant place to enjoy (or is that endure?) your food. 

There's some construction taking place next door. Hopefully this is a replacement McDonald's because this one needs bulldozing. 

Serves its purpose in a haphazard way. There are better options nearby. And it doesn't look any different to what it looked like 15 years ago.

World's largest McDonald's play space. Where could you go wrong? By adding an arcade that doesnt have standard or fair time limits. Let me elaborate.  We played air hockey and the game cut off before we even had 3 points.  It was already hard to play because of the low quality puck. 
Outside of this, the McDonalds has a pasta pizza area where you can watch your items prepared over the fire. We go to the 2nd floor where the seating ranges from standard, bench, lounge seats, etc. The stairs and elevator are near each other so even if you cant sit where you can watch your kid (very few seats can), you can at least watch the exits to make sure they aren't leaving. The play space is awesome two story taking up the 2rd and 3rd floor. The arcade is almost a plus if you have, if you dont, still go but give your kid clear expectations beforehand. The machines take a card not coins. The card comes with purchase. The machine takes cash and card. Make sure to follow all the prompts on the machine and card reader. There is a slot to insert in the card reader. If you try to swipe you will get the transaction cancelled.  Delivery to the tables is nice but I wish they had pop refill upstairs.  Regardless,  worth a visit for the yummy pizza and playspace.

The Manager Perlin of this McDonalds is amazing. He is SO friendly and personable. I'm literally still sitting at the restaurant eating and decided to stop and write the review. I've been watching him walk around and talk to every guest. It's my kids bday and he made sure to greet her and say Happy Birthday. He's very very nice. If I'm ever back in FL - I'll be here. GO PERKIN.

Went through the drive thru at 2am, waited for 25 minutes. Messed up a hot fudge sundae, and messed up 2 McDoubles, also didn't give sauce for nuggets, fries were cold and soggy, biggest waste of $30 didn't eat barely any of it.

World's Largest and "Most Unique" McDonald's. More like HELL ON EARTH.

I was so looking forward to this place. I usually can't stand McDonald's because 3-4 hours later, you'll end up really regretting that Hot N' Spicy you just couldn't live without. And this McDonald's was one of the worst I've been to.

Yes, it does have a whole upstairs floor of video games like 4-person air-hockey, guitar hero, connect 4, deal or no deal, ski-ball, and car racing games. You'll also find plenty of perfect picture moments like the stand-up Bill Cosby, Ronald McDonald on the bench and the artwork on the outside of the building. They do also have other food than the usual greasy, heart-stopping McDonald's gourmet, like waffles, panini sandwiches, and plenty of good desserts. You can also get a balloon animal or a face painting from the people in the corner for 10$.

Now onto the bad side; This place is in such bad repair. Whilst buying a new game card at the kiosk, I was being rained upon by the hole in the ceiling above the tacky alligator head. 6 games were broken including (face place, two ski-ball machines, the water-shooter game, connect 4, etc). Two of the card kiosks were broken so the line for the only working one in the back was enormous. The manager had to be pretty much wrangled from his comfortable chair in his private room near the elevator to bother to lift a finger to fix it. 

The ticket service representatives in the front near the deli are ridiculous. Do NOT fall for their "reduced tickets" scam. They want you to go and stay at their resort, which includes a 2-hour, extremely boring and dull presentation. You CAN just buy tickets here without the resort scam, but the minute you tell one of these people that you aren't interested, you'll be treated like dirt on the bottom of their shoe. 

The staff in this place really, really ruined the experience for us. The teenage girl who was manning the "gift shop" was a total brat. She was totally put out that she was having to wait around for the kiddos to pick out their gifts. Well, guess what? THEY ARE KIDS AND THEY ARE INDECISIVE. Get off of your SMARTPHONE and do YOUR JOB. 

This place was a definite tourist trap and was such a waste of time even though they had some really cool video games and picture opportunities, I will never, ever be back. Keep your wet, dangerous ceiling with all the holes and your cardboard pizza.

We took about 40 minutes to get ou order. Some of the staff are really rude and the restaurant is terribly dirty. Also, we ordered one happy meal with "teenie ty" toy and we got a key chain Dice shaped. Why they showed the option at the kiosk if they don't have it? I asked to change and the man just said: that's all we have. And I said: so why we have to choose?Could you just check, please? And he said: ask at the counter. So I went there, and a boy brought 5 options of the "teenie ty" so my daughter could pick one. 
I mean... seriously dude? You looked into my 4 year old daughter and said "that's all we have". Shame on you. 
Seems like we are asking for a kidney. 
Also saw rudeness all over the place.

Ok the worlds largest McDonalds. Now that we saw it and ate there I can say yes I have been there. They have pizza and pasta here. This McDonald's was busy for Thanksgiving. We ate on the second floor and ordered from the kiosk. Even after taking a number and the screen locator telling the person bringing our food where  we were I still had to go get our food after a 25 minute wait. Then it took 10 minutes longer for the food. By the time we received it, most of it was luke wam at best. They have video games on the second floor and a play area. Again this is McDonald's  ... had it before. Only thing is not at the Worlds Largest McDonalds.

The nation's largest McDonalds. I came here for the novelty of it. It's just a large restaurant with a whole arcade on the second floor. It should be noted that this restaurant has all the regular food that any other McDonalds would have except it is more expensive. I came here for a Chicken McGriddle, which is normally $2 and it was about $3 here. It was a good McGriddle and did taste fresh. 
What's special: they have pizza (did not look too appetizing to me), pasta, pies and cakes.

We saw this gigantic McDonald's while on a Uber ride and thought geezbageez we have to check it out. And so after dinner at a local seafood boil, we walked to it. It is quite impressive when we walked in: there was an aquarium on the first floor and an arcade room on the second. On the menu, there was make your own pizza / pasta so we made our own $11 pizza, which turned out DELICIOUS. All McDonald's needs pasta and pizzas. For dessert we got their special waffle cone, which was pretty rad. Overall, a special McDonald experience!

The GREATEST McDonalds hands down.  If you don't like McDonalds, check this place out.  They will impress you.  This is not only unique, but raises the bar.  They are so well staffed.  They have multiple pizza chefs, pasta chefs, dessert bar employees, food expediters, bussers, drive thru attendants, the usual chefs, cashiers, omelette chefs, arcade attendants, someone to verify all orders before they are brought out.  And a roaming cleaning crew.

You can order omelettes, pasta, pizza, cakes such as cheesecake, subs, and a customizable traditional menu.  The facility is constantly being cleaned, volume is high, arcade is state of the art. And play place is the largest I have seen.

After this location all other MC Donald's are mediocre.  They received deliveries from Sysco and of the many items being brought in were bottles of ketchup and mustard like Heinz.  

Definitely try this location.  Enjoy the self serve ordering kiosks and be catered.

Ok I have to give this McDonald's 4 stars. I must say for a McDonald's this place impressed me. First it's the worlds largest McDonald's. It's 2 floors. With a huge playplace and full arcade you can redeem tickets for prizes. Easy to use touchscreen kiosks to order food. You place a number on your table and they bring your order to your seat. Their menu has pizza and pastas as well as typical mcDs menu. Like make pizza right there in put in wood fired oven. I was shocked. They have a whole dessert counter with cakes and pies and pasteries. They have many different types of seating all over. Lots of parking. People are walking around cleaning the whole time. Sweeping and wiping down tables. They offer to take your trays from the table when your done. They are very helpful and nice. They offer large tables and stools for big families even. Bathrooms have an auto seat cover that moves and puts new ones there for you. Only down side is it's so loud because every kid wants to come here.

This is a great place to do a kid exchange.  This place is always busy and I've come here many times over the years.  When my nephew has to go with his dad every other weekend, this is the McDonald's that is most centrally located between where we live and where his dad lives.  The service has been fine and never had issues.

And although I do not eat at Mickey D's regularly, I will admit that I love their Filet-O-Fish sandwich and their fries dipped in their signature Sweet N' Sour sauce. 
And their McCafe Coffee (black) and McCafe Iced Coffee are really great for the price.  Overall, food and drinks at this McDonald's location is pretty consistent.

Ok but be prepared to wait a long time for your food. Management does not care, asked him and no time given for food, just you have to wait. Games and stuff for kids but you will be waiting forever. Crazy full of to many people. Be prepared! They need a better system, like a screen that shows your order in process like other McDonalds.

A McDonald's with an arcade and serves "gourmet" food?? WUTTTT. I had to check it out for myself. My family and I decided to check it out for breakfast. In addition to the normal McDonald's menu, this place also serves waffles, pizza, pasta, omelettes, and has a variety of desserts that include cheesecake and cakes. Since we came to breakfast, we decided to try out the waffle and omelette. You can order everything including the "gourmet" items off the self-serve computers located in the middle of the restaurant. If you were paying cash, you would have to go pay at the counter. If you are using a credit card, you can pay directly from the computers. The waffle and omelette was okay. The quality wasn't outstanding but again this is McDonald's. It was cool to have a McDonald's that is different from what we are used to. Service was okay. They brought our food to our table. There is a huge arcade and PlayPlace upstairs. It is definitely cool to check out this McDonald's if you are in the Orlando area. If you don't like McDonald's, come check this place out for the arcade and PlayPlace. Great place for families!

Terrible! I'm not unrealistic. I didn't expect the most incredible place or experience, but even setting the bar kinda low I was still utterly disappointed. My kids wanted to go see the world's largest McDonald's. I'll say the one thing good up front and I only found one. The pasta was pretty tasty and a good portion for the price. Aside from that, what a failure of a system for service, efficiency and a sub par effort at making this place special, given its a premier McDonald's location and listed as the largest in the world. Ordering is a self service process that is time consuming. Food was received out of order, inaccurate and an hour after ordering and it was not busy at all. Probably 15% capacity at most, mid winter on a Wednesday in Florida. Customer service sucked. People were unfriendly and not helpful. Eating areas are upstairs and downstairs, yet there is no condiments or soda machines upstairs, or areas for suppory, so anything you need you have to go downstairs. The additional entertainment you don't see at all McDonald's was a small arcade and an automated fake 50s music figure. In all, a failure. I didn't expect a lot. Still, bad enough that I downloaded this app just to write this review.
Hair in cheese on burger. Quarter Pounder not cooked all the way through (pink). Don't eat here.

This is probably the worst McDonald's I've ever been to. The service is terrible I had to wait a long time for my food and when I got it it was undercooked. There was even some blood in my Quarterpounder. Went downstairs to complain and nobody seemed to care they had long face and were not nice at all. I would think this place had good service considering is in I-Drive. Never coming back here again.
Great vibe & decent food! Had a blast in the arcade. It's a great experience for all ages.
The service is horrible every time I go here. The workers are not friendly and barely acknowledge you.  Worst of all, they got rid of their dollar menu!!

Big and modern didn't make it a good place. After 49 minutes of agony, since I ordered icecream to be served in the table, no one ever showed or faced tired customers. After asking two employees that couldn't careless about a simple ice cream order, I had to walk myself to the counter where someone told me they were still working on the order that suddenly appeared from the back with all the ice-cream melted. No explanations, no apologies, no one really cares! Next !

More expensive than other McDonald's and the inside is so chaotic you can't even turn a corner without something running into you. Tried to use the self order screen inside and it wouldn't allow us to get take out so we had to do the process again three times. Waited forever to get our food and there was no sense of urgency. Eventually a manager came over and helped us. So all in all, same bad service you can expect from most McDonald's but you pay more for it. You're better off going down the highway to a different mcdonalds.

Worst McDonald's restaurant I've been to. Three people in my family were double to triple charged. Then the manager told us we would have to cancel our cards to deal with it rather than refund those charges. It took 15 minutes for me to get an egg McMuffin where one of my members it took over half an hour to get his meal. When going up to ask about it they said they forgot about his order. I love McDonald's but this place is horribly ran.

I am not a fast food person but my children LOVE McDonald's so when we took them here they did not want to leave ! They serve pizza, pasta, cakes, cheesecakes, etc. They also have an arcade on the second floor which my kids did not want to leave from lol. But it's a great play place to take your children for a quick bit and play.

This may be one of the largest McDonald's but bigger isn't better.  The restaurant is filthy, floors and tables.  The place is chaotic and not a pleasurable environment to eat in.  Dont waste your time.

Wow just simply an amazing place to take your kids to eat and run around while the parents are enjoying their Big Mac's. There is plenty places to eat and sit, but there might be a language barrier so ya just might be best to order from the screen.

I can't believe I'm Yelping about a McDonalds, but it IS the World's largest one as stated on the Travel Channel. The kids demanded it. 

If you go late at night (which is what we did), you're not going to get anything but a McDonalds with a Chuck E Cheese type play experience. All the other kinds of food were not available (those close at 11pm) and -- I swear to you --- they'd run out of McDonalds food too. The guy at the counter was apologetic like "yeah, we just ran out of ice cream, a lot of things ... it sucks." No, really? Why don't you re-open the ice-cream non-McDonalds portion as a courtesy then? Because technically dude, you really DIDN'T run out of dessert.

Sigh. Anyway, the kids can now say they went there.

Amazing building.  However customer service and price is far from amazing.  Prices seem to be doubled, even compared to other tourist area.  We just wanted ice cream.  Told 4 different managers, the one was extremely rude to the poor cashier who was the only one trying to get us help, that we had paid and needed someone at the dessert bar to get us our ice cream.  20 minutes later a girl comes and tells us that the flavors we want are in the freezer and they can't go get them.  Finally got a refund and an insincere apology from a manager.  A nice building is useless if you have such poor customer service people don't want to come back in it.

Rather large McDonald's with a huge product offering.  Tried the pizza.  Not too bad.  Not east coast pizza but it's not frozen pizza either.  Pasta looked good as well.  Place could use a good cleaning..
Extremely slow service for having so many employees around.  Tables were not wiped down. Nothing extra that is worth it to go to this location.
This is one of the nicest McDonald's I've been to. The staff is extremely friendly!! They seem to actually care about their job at this location and they do a great job.

OMG, I see their hiring.....you guys don't need more employees,  you need efficient ones!! Stop talking and work. Have your employees trained by chick fil-a, they know their stuff!!!
We waited over 30 minutes for our food, when we finally got it we were missing a milkshake,  hamburger, a childs drink and fries. For real people..... this is totally unacceptable!

Could have been a 5 but I waited after placing my order on the kiosk for a 6 piece chicken tender combo 26 minutes and it was only after I went up to the counter they rushed to get it ready. 
No manager came over nor did they even apologize. 

The restaurant was clean, and has a lot to offer. If they improve their service level could easily be a 5.

The cashier's customer service was excellent and very patient even though serving a crowd. She said if we didn't like the (mango-pineapple) smoothie we could exchange it. 

Most impressive of all, there was a 17-year old young man in there dressed in a sharp looking suit. I thought he worked there, but he was actually waiting for an interview!

This store is known to have the world's largest play place, but I suspect it's also one of the busiest  ones considering it's location.

Not to fear as the lines are quick and they have a 2 step ordering system. This is the ideal play for the kiddies. Two floors of games, playing and having a grand old time. There's even a separate place to have birthday parties w/a stage and an MC.

This seems to be a test model as they serve "bistro" food here also. Everything from paninis, pizzas, wraps and pastas. I just wanted something small and quick and the happy meal sign w/the football teams toy looked perfect. When I got to the counter I asked if they had a particular football team that day and the manager looked and said yes. Goody!!! My hamburger and fries were fine....typical McDonalds...nothing special. But when I opened my toy, it was the wrong team. I went back up front and asked for a manager and she said there was no way of knowing which team was in which package. Then PLEASE don't tell me "yes, that's the one we have today". She was apologetic and even started opening other packages to find the one I wanted but I asked her to stop. I said what I wanted and hopefully it won't happen to others.


current health inspection: 2-high priority, 4-intermediate and 4-basic violations.

I never thought I'd YELP review a McDonald's but this place deserves it!
It appears it's a New Flagship property... all sorts of new menu choices. I'd just popped in for coffee and was hungry so using their app (it's great - I use it all around the country) I was checking out the special offers... say wat?! $1 for any sandwich and they have a new Philly Steak?! I'm in! Well worth it!
Jamielle (sp? - sorry ) thought I was waiting too long (I hadn't) so she comped me a large fry for my wait... WOW. Talk about going the EXTRA distance... very friendly, very clean, tasty... just what I was looking for... thank you McDs!
KUDOS to all those working hard and taking care of your customers here - it does get noticed. Thanks again!!

I wanted to order at the register. The employee there told me I HAD to use the machines. A) employees there, you should GLADLY welcome customers that refused to give your job to a MACHINE. Wait until they downsize and fire you.  B) McDonald's corporate, your machines are HORRENDOUS. As an IT professional, go hire better geeks to fix this. They are very unresponsive, you should have SLAs for how long it takes the dumb screen to respond when I select an option. C) this is fast food, right? It took 12 minutes to get my order, and it was WRONG. Maybe they should fire the employees that refused to take the order at the counter?  D) hire employees that care. When I went up to get my order corrected, the employee that went to get missing items had already moved on to the next customer. E) serve fresh items. At this point, I was too frustrated to go up to the non caring employee to complain that my food that it tasted like it sat for the past hour. F) all this, after paying over $11 for a VALUE MEAL! Really? If you're going to charge a premium and make me wait, at least make it worth the wait.
World's biggest McDonald's is super interesting but unbelievably filthy. Sticky floors, dirty tables and chairs, trash and food on the floor. Really disgusting. I'm disappointed.

I grew up in Orlando, so I remember this location since way back when . . . over 20 years or so ago. First impression of the renovation? Well, as stated in my check in, "whoa, über modern!" 

First off, you order on a machine. After that, you have to get in another line to pay. After that, there's an additional line just to actually get your food. As my husband said, "it's way more complicated than it has to be!" I'd definitely have to agree. 

Personally, I've never been a huge McDonald's fan, but I was surprised to see their menu includes pastas and pizzas made in brick ovens. We just went because our son was begging us to check it out and he loves the idea of a "happy meal" (even though he usually doesn't even eat half of it) but maybe one day I'll actually eat something there, too! 

Update: While I found myself initially wowed by the shiny new renovation, new technology, and expansive menu (compared to other McDonald's), it's all worn off, now. This is my second Friday night in a row here because my 4-yr-old loves the place, but customer service is almost nonexistent. I mean, once you order, you stand around in a cluster of other people who are also waiting for their orders, while you wait to hear your own order number obnoxiously shouted at you. Yes, there's a lot of people, it's a big place & already loud enough, so the employees have to be loud, as well, in this scenario. But couldn't they just put up an electronic sign or something, indicating which order number is ready, instead of shouting like they're herding cattle or something?

The biggest McDonald's was not as I had expected.  While it was unique among other McDonald's franchises, having a large staircase, an elevator that led to the second story, extra seating and a humongous play place and arcade, the place was also super crowded.  Naturally, because of the available amenities on the second floor, it seemed that people would've rather visit to play than purchase a meal.

The bottom area was filled with the standard seating and menu that the other establishments have, but it also included a separate section dedicated to McCafe.

While you could order on a screen that had more choices of food than normal, the amazing additions were undermined with the loudness of the crowd and the somewhat lack of upkeep to the restaurant.

Also von aussen hui aber von innen pfui. Wollte schon immer diesen Mc besuchen und heute war es soweit. Riesenrestaurant mit sehr sehr vielen Mitarbeitern. Allerdings hat keiner von denen von Freundlichkeit oder Sauberkeit gehört. Restaurant war nicht sauber obwohl genug Mitarbeiter da waren. Angebote sind anders als in anderen McD. Pasta und Pizza steht zur Auswahl. Preise sind was mich sehr überrascht höher als bei anderen McD. Nur weil es an einen Touristenmagnet liegt gleich höhere Preise finde ich etwas Abzocke. Jeder miss selbst entscheiden.

Literally the WORST McDonald's I've ever been to. Not only are the menu prices inflated to hell and back, but I was just served some rancid ass disgusting ass "caramel iced coffee" and terrible over cooked and dried out "chicken snack wraps". Complete waste of money. And time. To top it off , the worker and the window was beyond rude.

I was very generous with my stars!  The only reason to come to this McD's is to say you have been to THE WORLD'S LARGEST MCDONALDS!" After that then leave and go eat somewhere else.

My family had just eaten the best pizza supper we could have asked for, so we were visiting this McD because the kids just had to see it and we had promised! {Watch what you promise parents --- you may regret having to keep it!}, So, we opted for ice cream and milkshakes.  Sounds simple right.  NOT HERE.

First you have to decide if you want the usual McD shake that we know and love; or if you want one made with Blue Bunny ice cream and if so which flavor, in order to know the flavors you have to look in the freezer, and remember which one, so you can tell the cashier.  (Who didn't speak English! and had to get an interpreter to understand us!!! That is just seriously wrong!!!) 

Finally we get our orders placed, go to the pick up station and wait.  I decide to go find a table, no problem at 9:30 pm there was plenty of tables, but still had lots of people like us inside (this place is huge!!)  But feels cramped because of all the game tables, low black ceiling, huge signs everywhere, super big fish tank, and other junky stuff around.  The upstairs is like Chuck E Cheese meets Ronald McDonald.  Loud, flashing lights and kids out of control.

We were going to allow the kids to play a couple of games, until we found out we had to use a credit card (no cash accepted), the games are played on 'credits' and you buy the credits and they give you a credit type card for the players to put into the game slots.  When your card runs out of credits you keep the card as a souvenir or fill it up again. What a load of non sense.  We were expecting to have to give the kids a few dollar bills, maybe 10 at the most and they get to play a couple games, nope, not if we have to put it on a credit card (we don't use credit cards, only cash or debit).

So, you have been warned.  Everyone who has kids and go to Int Drive should at least go inside and let the kids see the largest McD's in the world, but if you can avoid this place.  

The restrooms were horrible!    We girls would not use them, we went to the gas station across the street, it was cleaner and smelled 100% better!!  And, I am not usually a "girly girl" when it comes to bathrooms, this was just the worse public restroom I have ever seen or smelled.  Even some port'a potties are cleaner!
