The worst service ever! The workers don't smile, they don't understand English and don't want to work. This McDonald's is overrated. Never again!
This place is so bad bad the workers are not even given good  cleaning supplies .99 cent broom sticky nasty gooey  yuck smells like pee bad upstairs. Go to a smaller McDonald's so bad run

Meh. Went here for the first time to check it out. Was loud and lots of people inside. Two elevators to get upstairs to the arcade.  I did a 10 buck card and played some games for ten minutes. I hit the 500 bonus tickets and it wasn't applied to my card.  When I went to tell the person behind the counter that I wasn't given the tickets and she just stared at me. I asked her to see how many tickets I had and it only showed her 89... was angry that it wasn't applied to my card. And more angry that the problem wasn't fixed.  If you have a game that isn't working please put a Out of order sign on it -.-  didn't eat there.

This is the biggest McDonalds in Orlando and it is pretty busy during the day with tourist but if you come in late at night it is pretty empty and you will get your food served pretty quick.'

 They are open 24 hours so when ever you are hungry you can stop by and get a bite.

They have two floors and in the second floor they have arcades and enough space to have private party's etc.   The food is fresh most of the time but like most place it depends on the time you come in.

Honestly, not that special compared to your average Mcdonald's unless you're a kid / want to be served. You order and then grab a little table number sign to place on your table. Your food is served to you and that's pretty much it. You can't tip the worker and if you're a kid, you'll love their arcade and playground set up

This is the coolest McDonald's I've ever been to never seen anything like it custom waffles dessert bar pizza come on .....
The gentleman this morning was so nice and friendly made me feel welcome definitely recommend this McDonald's

I love and hate this place. We got legally panhandled by a timeshare guy before we could even place an order. We then waited several minutes to pay and had to ask twice for the full amount of change owed to us -- and it was a manager who shorted us twice through inattention. 

On the plus side, you can get pasta (ravioli, tortellini, or angel hair, tossed in marinara or alfredo sauce), wraps, pizza, and other things you don't usually see at a McDonald's, and the whole place is open 24/7.

But what really ticks me off is the arcade upstairs. Sure, they've got an elevator so that kids can bring their wheelchairs and give the arcade lots of money... but when it comes time to cash in those Skee-Ball tickets for prizes, the redemption room is up a half-flight of stairs with no ramp. Sorry, kid, we can verbally describe the prizes to you, but you can't look at the prizes in person.

I came here for breakfast one of my vacation days. We went inside to eat. This is definitely one of the better McDonald's I've been too. They have special items on their menu like waffles and French toast. I ended up going with my usual sausage, egg and cheese McMuffin combo. The food was hot and tasted fresh and also it wasn't greasy like McDonald's can sometimes be. I also got an iced Carmel macchiato. That had a little too much Carmel for my liking but it was still good. 

The inside had plenty of seating and a cool fish tank too. This is

I just left... ordered an oatmeal, and sausage bagel meal... first they don't give me my oatmeal... I had to go back... then I leave and decide to check my coffee and it's black.... I don't do black coffee... I asked for 5 creamers... where the hell is it????
I don't care how short handed you are... get your shit together... get managers who know how to manage
When going to McDonald's know one expects good food however what you expect is fast service!and to get what you ordered however Service is very slow and order wasn't correct

This is the largest McDonald's in the world. On the first floor, where you get your food, they have those neat self-service kiosks. You choose your food and pay directly in the machine and, when its done, they deliver your grub directly to your table. Amazingly, in this location, they also serve pizza. Unfortunately I did not have the chance to try one and see for my self what a McDonald's pizza tastes like, but maybe in a future visit to Orlando. There are some arcades and kiddie stuff on the second floor if you are into that. They do have a drive-thru. The location is quite convenient if you are a tourist visiting the city, since this McD's in right on the busiest and most touristy stretch of International Drive. 

One thing, tho, that I disliked about this location is, despite its novelty, it was just too crowded, and what is worst, most people just left their garbage all over the place. So, overall, I much prefer just going to a regular sized, neighborhood McDonalds, as opposed to this one.

We used the drive thru 3 days in a row on our way to the parks.  The first 2 days went without a hitch.  The 3rd day they did not give us a receipt from window 1.  When we got to window 2 there was confusion and they asked to see our receipt.  (Note: This did not happen on the first 2 days)  I had to get out of the car and walk to the first window to try to get the receipt.  At that point all hell broke loose and the entire McDonald's universe was shifted.  After some "discussion" we were on our way, but wow!  If you take anything away from this experience, ALWAYS TAKE YOUR RECEIPT!

My complaint is that they charge a 1/3 more or higher than any other local McDonald's would.  Yes they are in the heart of the tourist area but that is no excuse to charge the prices they do.  It's McDonald's so there was no real difference between it and any other McDonald's in terms of food quality.  They do offer a nicer McCafe with a selection of Ice Creams and other desserts.  In addition they offer pizza and pasta but again the prices they charge are on par with an actual sit down restaurant for pizza or pasta so save your money and go to a nicer and better restaurant.  The place is a novelty and so go and visit but just get a small coke and save your money for much better food elsewhere.

First of all, this is a really awesome looking McDonald's.  It has an ice cream parlor. It has pizza. It has an aquarium. It has an arcade on a second level! It bills itself as the world's largest entertainment McDonald's. And that's pretty cool! Sadly, they still serve McDonald's food. We ordered a bunch of nuggets, some fries, and some ice cream.  The ice cream, as expected, was delicious! The nuggets, however, were far from fresh. They were edible, but disappointing.  Made for an ok late night snack, but I wish it had been tastier.  I'll McClose by saying it's worth stopping in, just to experience the place! Just remember, it's still a McDonald's.

I haven't been inside of the McDonald's in years,
 I have made it to the drive through every now and again,but it's a clean McDonald's , maybe due to high volume, they are actually really fast,Only reason I went in here is because I saw a giant arcade sign outside,And as you can see there's only a few ticket machines but it's whatever.

I don't review often but today I had pretty decent ravioli and my husband really enjoyed his pizza! - not food we find at our McDonalds in So. Cal! 
Upstairs looked fun too!

It's an average McDonald's with good food, usually fresh and staff actually happens to be pretty decent at this location. have fun and know that you'll get a clean bathroom as well. You will be making loving it unlike others.

I was excited to visit every since I saw it on some tv show years ago. So yesterday I had to go to Orlando and pick up my nephew from the airport. Thought it was now or never since I am relocating back up north from Florida in a week. It has been a longgggg 4 years down here. Anyway we stopped by. I have to admit I was underwhelmed with the outside. As soon as we walked through the glass doors it was as if we entered the Wild West. Sweet baby Jesus, kids were running rampant, out of control unorganized line up at your risk lines, frozen touch screen menus that didn't work, and to top it all off the food was overpriced. I know it's business I get that but come on at least serve something good. I had the pizza where they up charge you for EVERYTHING my pizza was over $13. I could have gotten 2 medium pizzas  and a soda  for that price. My nephew had bacon  cheese   and Belgium waffles. Plus we ordered 2 large . Food was almost $40. Smh! So the taste? But, of course you want to know....it tasted like a frozen pizza from the supermarket. I was not thrilled. I'm from NJ and I know a thing or two about good pizza . For crying out loud they cooked it in a authentic brick oven. It taste like it came out of my microwave back 1996. I expected more. On the upside my nephew enjoyed his waffles & fries . It took about 20 minutes before we were served. Staff was nice and friendly. It's a great place to take the kids . Just be aware it's very busy and it's going to cost ya.
THE longest time I have ever waited at a McDonalds! The food is good but absolutely no organization. BEWARE! However, the game room upstairs is awesome.

As a novelty, the "World's Largest Mcdonalds" is worth the visit. Besides a few exclusive options, such as pizza or spaghetti, the menu is largely the same for any Mcdonald's- cheap fast food, which is underrated in my opinion but you either love it or hate it. Aesthetically it has more of a "classic" feel, with Ronald predominantly featured  in addition to an old "Mack the Knife" animatronic the plays hits from the 60s-80s (a nice touch!). The arcade a wide variety of games, though the rewards a bit lacking, and while I wasn't able to try out the play place (for obvious reasons) it seems like a good distraction for your kids while you eat.

I don't know why this location advertise like 24 hrs if every night between 2-3 am they don't take any orders and when they do like last night it took 35 minutes for a double cheese and while I waiting on line between a car in front and one in the back I thought to cancel and leave but there is no way to get out because of a build sidewalk and a bush barrier so you can't , it make me think if it was a real emergency to leave there will be no way ...not good and safe on an emergency situation.

I grew up in Orlando, so I remember this location since way back when . . . over 20 years or so ago. First impression of the renovation? Well, as stated in my check in, "whoa, über modern!" 

First off, you order on a machine. After that, you have to get in another line to pay. After that, there's an additional line just to actually get your food. As my husband said, "it's way more complicated than it has to be!" I'd definitely have to agree. 

Personally, I've never been a huge McDonald's fan, but I was surprised to see their menu includes pastas and pizzas made in brick ovens. We just went because our son was begging us to check it out and he loves the idea of a "happy meal" (even though he usually doesn't even eat half of it) but maybe one day I'll actually eat something there, too!

Oh yeah, I did try the chocolate and PB cake! Oh my! If you're a dessert lover and/or chocolate lover like me, it's worth a try! :)

MARIO the manager here is awesome!!! He goes above and beyond for the customers and his staff. He is an awesome team player! He's a manager yet you can see him mopping the floor to show to his team that titles should not limit u to do other responsibilities. My family are from New Jersey and we visited this place for a midnight snack. There's an arcade on the second floor and the kids won some points but could not avail any prize since the booth was closed but Mario who was the night manager went upstairs to let our kids claim their prize. What an awesome manager! He made sure that customer experience is exceptional!!!
This place is huge. The whole upstairs is like a chuck e cheese. Lots of video games and a huge playground. My kids love this place and the location is great.

I was SUPER excited (I know - sad) to check out this McDonalds that is known as the "World's Largest"  I watched a bunch of youtube videos to get myself pumped and when we pulled in, I was.  We went in and its not like any McDonald's I've ever seen.  They had like a billion (well like 4) soda machines that you can add your flavors and everything (we have those) and the normal counter to order.  But they also had kiosks that you could go up to and order.  They had an ice cream case and a pretty yummy looking dessert case too.  We used the kiosk.  I wanted to be able to take my time and peruse the menu.  In the end we ordered some old favorites, Big Mac, Quarter Pounder, Cheeseburgers; and some new fun things like a McPizza and some McPasta.   We took our number and went to find some seats.  You can sit upstairs or downstairs and there are many seating formats.  You could belly up to a counter, hunker down into a booth, or gather around a table.  The chairs were all different and each little area was themed.  We went upstairs (There are elevators too!) and sat down in the Mac the Knife room.  I then wondered how would they find us with our food.  Well my answer came pretty quickly when I looked up and saw a TV screen with the various pager numbers up there, how long they've been waiting, and what room they were in!  Soon our food was arriving.  The old favorites were what you'd expect.  The pizza wasn't as good as I thought it would be considering they have these pizza ovens that looked legit.  The crust was doughy and the cheese and sauce didn't have much flavor.  It was just eh.  The McPasta was okay as well.  Reminded me of what you'd find on a buffet.  Edible, but not blowing anyone away.  After we ate I checked out the bathroom because I heard they had those automatic seat covers.  I never trust those things.  Is that really a new wrap on that toilet seat or does it just go round and round.  Hmm.  I didn't go. But they were clean and bright!  Then we let the kids each have $20 to play in the play area.  The games are fun but they're pretty stingy with tickets.  If my son hadn't won the Angry Bird Jackpot my kids would have had $40 chinese handcuffs.  Instead my son got a mini nerf gun and a paddle ball thing and my daughter got some sort of slime and a Grimace pin.  lol.  $40 well spent.  There was a play area too which I would never let my kids in because it is so large and intertwined I'd never find them, or they'd get sick because I am sure its never cleaned.  And while we were there a kid decided to experiment with the round windows by pulling down his pants and sticking his $#!^ onto it.  Nice.  The management did jump in and talk to the parents about this but it went on for awhile before that happened.  
All in all glad I could say I did it but don't need to return unless I just want McDonalds for some reason and I happen to be standing right here.

I quite like this place. This is King of McDonald's. I heard the biggest in the nation? I think we had a relatively pleasant experience because when we were visiting, it didn't have the crazy crowd situation. Ordering was easy, the seating was easy, the food came out early, quickly and correctly. I do think they coffee condiments section could be better managed and away from the fountain soda drinkers. There's a bit of choke point there. 
FYI - I'm a coffee drinker. I really like McD's coffee-- it's Lavazza beans from Italy!

It was late and near the hotel so this seemed like the best choice. Reading other reviews, apparently it is the largest McDonalds. Put it down as one of the most expensive McDonalds also! $2.19 for a small order of soggy and cold fries; $5.59 for a quarter pounder with cheese no fries or drink. I'm sure there was a resort fee tax along the way as well. At any rate, if you have any other options take them!

The pizza looks better than it tastes. The dough wasn't special and neither was the cheese. I did like the ravioli with marina, probably because the sauce is slightly sweet. The service wasn't fast but not unreasonably slow. However, the second floor was a mess and very loud from all the kids, and the first floor tables weren't clean and still noisy from the disaster upstairs. This place is probably great for kids, but I prefer a more relaxed setting.

For my first time here, it wasn't a great experience. It was early in the morning so it was packed. We ordered our food at the kiosk and found a table. We had two separate orders. One came right away while the other we had to go the counter to ask why haven't we gotten our food. We asked a server he said the food was on the way, the employee at the counter said he would make it personally. We waited 30 minutes for food that wasn't being made yet which almost cost us to miss our flight.

This is the biggest McDonald's in the world standing 3 stories high with around 19,000 square feet of space. They have lots of seating, multiple ordering kiosks, a huge play place, and an aquarium to up the classiness. They serve all the classics in an efficient manner.

I had to get a me a McDonald's pizza. They have a brick oven and you can watch the highly skilled chefs do their work. I got a pepperoni and mushroom pizza and it was actually pretty tasty! It was super-hungry maybe post-drinking tasty though, not NYC-thin-slice-heaven tasty. I heard the pasta is also good. Of course I may be back someday! My all-time favorite menu item is the Filet-O-Fish.

McDonald's food is not good for you so hopefully you're only getting a saturated fat food fix only a few times a year. It's not a cheat day if you come here a few times a week! In all seriousness though, make sure you frequently eat whole foods, preferably plant-based.

Ahhh Mcdonald's. The worlds biggest too. I hadn't been to a Mcdonald's in years, but worlds biggest? C'monn, even I'll break for that.

And it is pretty big, but I was expecting it to be a just a little bigger.

Neat-o ordering system though. Big touch screens were you order and pay. Take a number and sit down. The only human interaction you'll have is when the server brings the food to you.

It was breakfast so I had to get a breakfast sammich. Got a steak and egg McMuffin.

The steak was basically a burger patty. Has the classic semi-rubbery texture that I remember from my childhood. That generic recently unfrozen beef patty flavor. Carmelized onions bring a jammy texture and sweet complexity to the party. Some cheese in there to add a creamy quality and a cheesy tang. And an egg, which was mostly tasteless, but there--and that's the important part.

The McMuffin bread is actually an English muffin. 

Anyway, this is indeed a situation where individually lacking ingredients coalesce into a sum greater than its parts. But, I'm not going back to get another one.

Okay folks, you're gonna want to stop here.  This is the WORLD'S LARGEST MCDONALD's, right here in the good ol' USA.  As you walk in, you see bald eagles soar against a backdrop of American Flags while 'God Bless the USA' plays softly in the distance; your soul swells with American pride as you quietly whisper to yourself, "If the Founding Fathers could only see us now."  All jokes aside, I don't know why the reviews are so terrible. It's a McDonald's... not a Michelin starred restaurant-- expectations should be adjusted accordingly and I was thoroughly impressed with the place!

I came early in the morning on my way out of Orlando. We were greeted by the manager who was extremely helpful, friendly, kind, and an overall a great person to interact with early in the morning. He assisted us in ordering and made us feel very welcome!

You order at self-serve kiosks and then have a few minutes to marvel at this behemoth until your food is ready. This place has a bakery (with cake & cheesecake!), scooped ice cream, a full arcade, a massive play structure with a giant alligator inside (?), a pizza oven (!!), a fish tank (!!), and a whole plethora of specialty items you can't find at any other McD's. For breakfast, the specialty items are the Belgian waffle & a customizable omelet-- I knew I had to order both to really take advantage of this once-in-a-lifetime opportunity :)

Once you place your order, you sit down & they serve you. If you order regular McDonald's food (i.e. egg McMuffin, Hash Brown, etc), it comes in the normal McD's wrapping. However, if you order the specialty items, they serve them on real plates with real cutlery!! *insert clapping emoji here*

In terms of food quality, the regular McD's menu items were the same as always. The homemade omelet was a bit on the greasy side, but it was just as good as any other diner. It did come with a hash brown, but was a bit small for the price point (~$8). The Belgian Waffle however was excellent. We upgraded ours to get blueberries, strawberries, & whipped cream added and I'd definitely recommend you do the same! The waffle had nice little grooves that allowed you to easily pull off pieces which made it convenient to share. We were pleasantly surprised to see that the berries weren't in any kind of sugar syrup. They were probably frozen and had a bit of a juice on them, but it wasn't sweetened at all which was pleasantly unexpected.

Overall, if you're in Orlando, you have to go here, even if just to say you did. Fun experience and food McDonald's food that you won't find anywhere else!

This new McDonalds is a joke! Half the Order kiosks don't work. Employees standing around daydreaming. We stand in line to order our food and then stand in another long line to get food. We ordered it as eat-in, our food was given to us in a bag, told them we were eating here and we were told we are out of trays. Had to ask for cups for drinks, had to ask to get tea because they were all empty, had to ask for forks because they were empty, had to ask for butter and syrup for pancakes because they didn't put any in the bag. Just a complete mess, we won't come back to this anytime soon!

Am visiting FL from out of town with husband and 1 yr old son. Husband has daily work commitments here, so I have been on my own with my son. Came to this McDonalds because I needed a quick easy option for food and entertainment for a 1 yr old. 

Ordered our food at the touch screen menu. After waiting for almost 20 min, and my son is getting irritable at this point, I saw another family get their order. I asked them how long they had been waiting - they said about 8 min. I asked one of the cashiers if she could give an ETA on the order. She rolled her eyes at me and said sort of under her breath  she's been at the register, hows she supposed to know. She went to one of the other employees and the response was they are still working on it. 

Kept waiting. By this time, my son needs a diaper change. I went to do that. Came back, food still not there. It's now been over 30 min. I went back to the counter and told them how long we've been waiting. Just as I said that, someone dropped off the food at our table. The woman I assume was the supervisor also gave me a dismissive glance, no comments on the situation. 

They were missing a drink order, and one of the items was cold. At that point, wasn't worth bringing it up to them. 

While I was feeding my son, employees were walking past me handing out trays. Not one person apologized, acknowledged me or even attempted to reconcile the situation. 

I work in a fast paced environment as a nurse on a trauma unit. I understand the pressure of having multiple people make demands from you all at once. If there is simply too much going on that service will inevitably be less than ideal, customers will likely be empathetic. But communication is key. I talk to my patients, I tell them I know they are waiting, and I apologize, even if it's not my fault. 

The employees were absolutely rude and unprofessional. Their attitude made me feel as if I were imposing on them. 

Had I been alone, I would have been more patient. But trying to appease a 1 year old who is hungry and bored is a whole other situation to manage. 

Like I said, I'm from out of town, so they won't be getting any more of my business anyway. But this was awful service. Would not return.
One of the staff members sneezed in her hands and another scratched her left armpit right in front of us. Both continued to serve food.

I came to this McDonald's in hopes to have a good experience for my first time being here in was not and experience I shall be doing again. My fries are cold they aren't warm in the slightest the price gouging here in terrible I get it a tourist location but if you go and do that make the food good at least. I ordered my food all I got was a simple 20 piece McNuggets thinking it won't be that hard of a order to make but they proceeded to get my order wrong and I was furious. Do not go here don't waste your time go somewhere else. 1-17-2021
This place is ridiculous. 30 minutes in the drive through and they can't find a large coke, large fries and water order. And some useless woman said we're being difficult?!

Stoped at this McDonald's to get my daughter a happy meal. Found a live roach nestled up with in the napkins. Absolutely disgusting.  Not a little roach it was a bigger roach.Clean your kitchen , clean something! Imagine finding a roach in your kids food. Don't go here. 1-2-21  is the day I went  they won't be roach free for a good minute use your judgment

Very rude. After sitting at the intercom for a couple of min to order I pulled up to the pick up window. Didn't want to take my order because it was 3 in the morning. I'm confused because it says the restaurant is 24/7 and it is in a tourist area near international right off i4.

McDonalds Sand Lake & international Dr. , has won my heart. My daughter, grandson and I celebrated my 9 yr. old grandson passing to the 4th grade. We stopped here for a meal and some arcade fun. I love this place, service with a smile, and a lot of activities for the kids to burn off energy. The staff of employees made us feel like family. My hat goes off to them and special thanks to Swing Manager Perrin, your customer service personality made our day!

State of the art McD's. Walk to the kiosk to order the food. They even have pasta dishes, brick oven pizza, cheesesteak heroes and breakfast all day. Once you done ordering and paying, you get an alert medal, sit anywhere you want, server will track you down to bring you the food. 

This McD's also has an arcade room and the largest habitrail for kids, ever seen. Bathrooms are super clean and even has an automated seat cover that renews to a clean one with each person. There's music and elevators to the 2nd food dining room. This is one of the most impressive McDonald's I ever been to, and I really did love using their kiosk to order my food, the way I want it, without asking anyone to repeat my order.

Absolute worst McDonald's I have ever experienced.  Ordered our food online and got in the drive through, has another order to add and then they could never find our mobile order after sitting there for 10 minutes. It's like all 5 people i sode the window were just standing around. Couldn't even be bothered apologize when they could do anything. They just wanted to throw their hands up in the air with a "what do you want me do to about it" attitude. Absolute garbage.

This Mcdonals is too cool to not speak about it!  this place is like a theme park. Tons of arcades upstairs and  cool things in the  first level! Is not your averege Mcd this place offers bistro style food and ice cream shop! and is huge!! a lot of fun for kids and parents! We have a good time here! Clean bathroom and yummy food, wraps, sandwiches, pasta , waffles and desserts ( chocolate cake and cheese cake) even the coffee taste better! I'm not a Mcd fan but i gave this  5 stars because inside you forget you are in  Mcdonal's!

Pretty much worst McDonalds location I have been to.  Employees were super rude, charged me an extra dollar for a large coffee I didn't ask for.  Didn't see the upcharge until I got my receipt and obviously had paid at that point.  Very shady to upcharge peoples drinks after they order at the window.  Really just poor business practice.  KS#13, working side 2 on 11/23 at 7:33am, you suck.

To top it off, THE PRICES.  Imagine spending 15 dollars for a coffee, two small breakfast sandwiches and two hash browns.  Unbelievable.

Fat and away this is the best McDonald's experience I have ever had! Besides the well prepared food and availability of French fries during breakfast (upon request!) and super awesome waffles or custom omelets. But one man absolutely made our day - both mine and my 2 year old daughter - with his warmth and his outstanding attention to customer service, the shift Manager Perrin. I cannot thank him enough :)

Holy moly this place sucks! The girl had to have been on drugs when she took our order. I don't expect much from this establishment anyhow but it was incredibly painful trying to communicate with her. She couldn't comprehend anything. It literally took 7 minutes just to put in two orders with no special instructions. When we pulled around to the window it became obvious why this simple process was so difficult. She was sharing videos on her phone with another coworker. She didn't even look at us once while we sat at her window to give her money. I get that this is a McDonald's and the whole point of going here is to grab a cheap QUICK bite, but I at-least expect their employees to make eye contact and have the ability to understand how to take a cheeseburger order. Spend your dollars somewhere else... You couldn't pay me to put an order in with this girl again!

In case you didn't know, this is World's Largest Entertainment McDonald's. This is a three-story building and is open 24 hours.

This place is HUGE. It even has a elevator inside in case you can't take the stairs. 

They of course serve the regular McDonalds menu. Burgers, fries, but they also serve pastas, pizzas, sandwiches and more... definitely not your usual McDonald's. 

Upstairs they have a huge playground and arcades perfect for kids and teenager. Definitely stop by if you're in the area.

ESPAÑOL

En caso de que no lo sepas, este es el McDonald's de entretenimiento más grande del mundo.  Este es un edificio de tres pisos y está abierto las 24 horas.

 Este lugar es enorme.  Incluso tiene un ascensor en el interior por si no puedes subir las escaleras.

 Por supuesto que sirven el menú regular de McDonalds.  Hamburguesas, papas fritas, pero también sirven pastas, pizzas, sándwiches y más ... definitivamente no es un McDonald's habitual.

 Arriba, tienen un enorme parque infantil y arcadas perfectas para niños y adolescentes.  Definitivamente pase por aquí si está en la zona.

This McDonald's is billed as, "The World's Largest Entertainment McDonald's". I'm not exactly sure what that means but I know it used to say, "World's Largest McDonald's". I do know that they try to make it out to more than it is. They go so far as to have video of a chef-like person playing on Tvs while you wait in line touting the expensive bistro food sold at this location. Besides the McD's counter there is a side area that makes the bistro specialty items like panini, pizza, pasta and wraps. 

But first you have to order. You wait in one line to plae your order. The worker prints up a ticket where you wait in another line to pay for the food. Then you wait for your normal McD's food in one line. And then you wait for your specialty food in another. What a process! My son had a happy meal, which was one line. Before our food was ready (specialty line) my son had almost finished his meal. Then he wanted ice cream so we had to: 
1. Wait in line to give order (behind huge family of tourists who had no idea what they wanted)
2. Wait in line to pay 
3. Wait in line for ice cream
Way too complicated, it's a McDonalds! And the food was a huge let down. I ordered the shrimp ravioli in a tomato sauce but the ravioli and shrimp were swimming, no DROWNING, in an oily "tomato" sauce. The shrimp were small and had tails, which were hard to deal with when covered in sauce and using a plastic knife. Remove the stinking tails!! My husband quesadilla was bland and just unappetizing. I would not waste the extra money on this specialty food. Stick with what McDonald's does best, burgers and fries.

I guess this is the biggest McDonald's here in Florida, 
Its regular like McDonald's but because of its location prices here a little bit higher than in regular McDonald's location.
Place is clean and big
This establishment is very busy, usually wait time. Once you order it still takes time & when the food isn't prepared properly makes you not want to return.

You get charged more here than your normal McDs...Im assuming due to the the tourist location and playground setup. (Which was closed due to "maintenance") $12 for large combo and COLD fries!    9PM on a non-busy Monday night.

If there is any McDonald's world wide that deserve a five star rating then this is the only location that must get it . McDonald here offer pizzas , subs , desert bar , kids playing area with arcade, amazing service and so many activities for the kids to keep them busy . CHeck the photos out .

i think his name is was Guerry idk he had a fro but he was really helpful. 

I asked for sauce and he asked me "how many?" and when my nephew got some lame toy instead of an avengers one, he helped switch it out for another one. 

the guy in charge of the drinks and the girl w white-dyed hair was nice too

I usually don't care for McDonald's but I had to check this one out. Apparently it's the largest McDonald's in the United States I'm not sure if it's the biggest in the world. It was super nice when we went inside, there was a small fish tank and they had an upstairs area. The menu is different from any other McDonald's they had pizza, pasta and other different menu items. My husband got a small cheese pizza and to our surprise it was actually pretty good. I just got small fries can never go wrong with fries. Upstairs they had a play area for kids most McDonald's don't have that anymore and they even had a small arcade! It was a really cool McDonald's if you're in this area definitely check it out.

Worst experience ever!!! I visited this McDonald's twice within 4 hours and both times, the customer service was horrible. It's so unorganized...after waiting 15 minutes and placing my order, I pull up to the window and the girl said "what you want" so I had a confused look on my face and she said "you wanna place an order or something" and I replied, "I've already placed my order". She yells and asks one of her fellow coworkers if I placed an order, her fellow coworker replies "yes" and she shuts the window. She then comes back to take my cash and never brings me my change, someone else ended up bringing the change and then asked me to pull up and wait for my food. I waited 12 minutes for them to bring my food out. Worst experience with a McDonald's that I've ever encountered!!

I brought the family to the largest McDonald's in the world in Orlando, FL.  It's a 3 story 19000 square feet flagship facility that competes for tourist dollars with Disney.  Upon walking in, you can't help but notice how large it is.  There is a separate station for desserts and a station for pizza???

We made our way upstairs to where the arcade was.  The number and quality of arcade games is on par with a typical Chuck E Cheese.  The redemption center on the other hand is a little bit lower in quality than the one at Chuck E's.  The 3 story playground on the other hand blows away anything I have seen at Chuck E's.

Considering that many McDonalds want to turn over tables every 20-30 minutes, its unlikely that we will be seeing many more of these as customers would be hanging out much longer.

Ambience / Decor:  flagship McDonalds with everything turned up to 10.

Food:  Consistent McDonalds quality.

Value:  Food seems a bit more expensive than an average McDonalds.

TL/DR:  Come for the novelty, but if you're here for the food, go to the other McDonalds 4 blocks down the street.

Overall, like 90% not impressed. Now that observation is coming from an adult over 50 with no distractions.  I've been to McDonald's in Paris, France just to get the "Royale with cheese" and a Le Big Mac. (Thank you pulp fiction) 

I came to this "epic Mc D" because I had heard so much about it. They have Kiosk Island" with people standing there to assist you with questions. () All employees wearing masks.. But to be fair that is at every McDonald's.  How is this place different?

If you are under the age of 10, which made up the majority of the ruffians tonite, well, it doesn't get any better. The second floor arcade looks like a scene from a frenetic Chucky Cheese with tickets being spit out at every game. Of course you can get prizes in exchange!

The 2 story playground was closed due to covid so  but I understand.

This is an expensive McDonald's.  Be prepared to shell out some bucks esp for the unique menu items.

Now the 10% and some tips:
They have food here you can't get anywhere else.  I ordered a French toast sandwich and custom ordered it. It was not prepared by McDonalds per se.  It appears there is a station that makes pizza, Belgian waffles, omelets and my French toast sandwich.  If you order a specialty item, be patient because they take time to prepare. So yummy! I saw the guy with the bread in the pan toasting it, Not spitting out of a machine!

I think that station is subcontractors for McDonald's because they don't act like employees but more like short order cooks.

Ok. Here is the big tip. If you want to try different hot foods, don't order all at the same time. Food gets cold quick. (I'm talking to you french fries!!) Instead over in waves.  

Hope this was helpful.  Of course if you go with a big group of friends at 2 am thats always fun but that goes without saying.
Attitude for days. Asked them to repeat the order and he literally said "oh my god" and walked away....

Ew. Ew. Ew. Ew.  I absolutely freaking hated this place. We were so excited to go into the "Biggest McDonalds in the World" and to play the arcade.  Ugh... biggest mistake of my two weeks in Orlando.  The bathrooms were disgusting, absolutely unbearably disgusting.  The employees were grumpy.  The arcade was half functional.  The real downfall of our trip, and this isn't even really the fault of McDonalds.... there was a woman on a roller coaster simulator, holding a new born baby. The second we saw this, we had to tuck tail and run.
I was on vacation in Florida and just happened to stop at this McDonalds.  This manager was walking around asking people if everything was "ok".   This was great

Yo these jive turkeys forgot my bacon on a bacon McDouble. Atrocious. and THEN when I asked for Mac sauce they tried to charge me?!? This isn't a five star restaurant. Since when did they charge for SAUCE. We need to rise up and fix this monstrosity.

We took about 40 minutes to get ou order. Some of the staff are really rude and the restaurant is terribly dirty. Also, we ordered one happy meal with "teenie ty" toy and we got a key chain Dice shaped. Why they showed the option at the kiosk if they don't have it? I asked to change and the man just said: that's all we have. And I said: so why we have to choose?Could you just check, please? And he said: ask at the counter. So I went there, and a boy brought 5 options of the "teenie ty" so my daughter could pick one. 
I mean... seriously dude? You looked into my 4 year old daughter and said "that's all we have". Shame on you. 
Seems like we are asking for a kidney instead just junk food.
Also saw rudeness all over the place.

I figured I'd be attending what looks to be a flag ship McDonald's. I usually would steer clear from a McDonald's this late, how ever I figured maybe this one being so large and grand would set a better standard. After waiting 10 minutes to even place an order. I was greeted by an employee with a phone in his hand with an attitude. I placed my order then waiting another 20 minutes to receive it. Once I had food in hand I was pleased to be consuming some medium Raw burger. I really hoped even a place like this as big as it is could do better than the others but I guess I was wrong. Please do better.

I went here last August while I was in the Orlando area.  This place is so large that there is a second floor.

It is not your typical McDonald's.  This is the only McDonald's where you can order pizza, pasta and even dessert.  There is the kitchen where you can see them make food.  I can't think of any other McDonald's where you can see them make your food.

There is a very large entertainment center upstairs.  Dozens of arcade games that one can play.  It is the only one there is a prize wall in the back.  Just make sure that get a card before you are able to play any games.

It is the best place to bring your kids.

I plan to return some day.
Quite possibly the largest McDonald's we had been to. They have pizza, pasta and desserts. They also have an arcade on the 2nd floor!

Out if the three burrito places on Huntington by Northeastern, this "fast food" is my favorite. They have pretty high quality amazing-tasting food, and always change up their menu so you aren't always ordering a normal burrito. I love the burrito bowls, personally.

When Qdoba came to Huntington and replaced Stars (did anyone even go there?), it was pretty awesome. The food was fresh and delicious. But somewhere along the way, Qdoba lost it's way and things just aren't the same anymore. Most of the workers there seem incompetent. The food is continually getting more expensive, and the food isn't as fresh as it used to be. It is a bit pricey considering you can get a massive wrap over at Boloco that tastes better and is bigger for less. Qdoba does have some pretty good nachos, but in the Southern US you get these for free with your meal, which really sours the deal here. Qdoba is a place you can probably visit a couple of times a year and not feel too bad about it, but it's by no means great.

HUGE burritos...you may be paying a little bit more here, but you get alot of food for what you pay.  The queso chicken burrito is good, as are the quesadillas and the taco salads. For the healthier eaters, try the naked burrito (probably my favorite) which is a burrito minus the tortilla (which you can get on the side if you'd like). The option to have some beers with dinner is also nice, although I've never taken advantage of this.

Don't forget to get your Qdoba card, which gives you free chips & salsa, etc after you accumulate enough points.

This place is quite tasty.  It's an affordable mexican place.  I guess it is a chain, but this is the first location I've ever been to.  Their taco salads are really good and they come in a yummy edible shell.  Burritos are also very good!  I haven't tried other things there, but I'm sure they are the same.  If you get the Qdoba frequent buyer card, you get a free order of chips and salsa after your register your card.
Fake "mexican" food (again, picture me making air quotes), made by underpaid white people.  It's trying to be an upscale version of taco bell.  Totally gross.

Qdoba is a good place, but I have some serious problems with it:

1) At a restaurant like this everything should come with free chips, and it doesn't.

2) They do not have tofu.

If qdoba made those two improvements it would instantly be 4 stars. For now, walk just a little farther down the street to where the burritos are better ....

First off, I enjoy my Qdoba very much, but this specific establishment is always a disappointment. There are always ingredients that have "run out". Today, they were out of white rice, queso, and the corn salsa (my favorite!). The service here is subpar, and the employees are hastily making everyone's meals. Not my favorite Qdoba to go to.

Eh, I thought my burrito was pretty good. The portions are really big, but I wasn't blown away by the quality. It feels like a college joint- which it is. I thought it was a bit expensive for my burrito, at over $8, but at least they give you a lot of food. 

I'd go again if I was in a rush, but I wouldn't seek this place out.

Really Great food, I think that if you were to compare Qdoba to the likes of Chipotle Qdoba fares better. I likes the variety that Qdoba offered, and the portions and price were excellent. I thought the food overall was fresh and had a lot of nice combinations. Now I can only speak for the steak bowl that I got with cheese, jalapenos, lettuce, guac etc. But I think that overall this is a great option if you are in the area and want a nice sized meal for 8-10 bucks.

I like the casadilla of qdoba but today I have been in 393 Huntington ave branch. I met one of the staff called meranda. she was rude I always have the same order from different branches but she refused to add my favourite sauce then I asked her to put it on a side 3 time but she ignored me at the end one of the staff gave me the sauce.

While the burritos do taste awesome, I guarantee that in an hour or two you will be either praying to the porcelain god or taking a 3 hour nap. Go to El Pelon on Peterborough st instead if you can. Otherwise be prepared to sleep away your grease induced saturday afternoon.

Qdoba's often overshadowed by Anna's, but it definitely holds its own. The line is often long at lunch time, but it moves fast. The ingredients taste fresh-- the burritos are great. Get a annoyingly named "Q Card" and get pretty good rewards--a free chips and salsa just for signing up.

Everyone raves about the burritos, but I go there for the TACOS.  OMG the best tacos ever, made just right, I highly recommend the shredded beef.  I have also sampled the chicken quesadilla, and ground sirloin nachos.  I had a nice qdoba obession going, then I ran out of money.  It's really sad
:(  I can't wait to get paid so I can go back and eat more!!!  The one on Huntington is really nice and practically brand new.  Staff is great.  I've also been to the one in the Pru, not as nice (it's in a food court, what do you expect?) and the staff isn't as great either.  For a better overall experience, go to the one at Northeastern.  Cool bathrooms too!!

I love coming here to get a burrito bowl because it lasts me two meals. The guac is really salty but we don't have to pay extra so I can't complain. Their burritos aren't the best because the contents don't mix together and tend to stay on one side. Tacos and salad are good but not worth the price. Queso sauce is not worth the hype--it's salty and its flavor dominates the dish. This food is more authentically Mexican then Chipotle.

There are some good things about Qdoba. For example, there are lots of flavorful options and they serve beer. Downsides are, it tends to get a little bit loud inside and it's not as authentic as a place such as El Pelon. Prices are pretty much the same as most other fast food Mexican places in the area.

The food is delicious, but one lady works over there and she is quite rude. Qdoba should definitely consider terminating her job. She was there working at Monday 21st April 10 pm and I went there and she was very very rude.

They wrap their burritos poorly, theyre somewhat expensive, and the ingredients aren't the freshest. Regardless, they are my favorite burritos in Boston! I'm a sucker for the queso burritos, can't help it. 

They win in overall taste in my opinion. Plus beers. And sports on the tv.

Its quick, its tasty. If you want classy, or tightly wrapped burritos, find somewhere else.

Great Burritos, great tacos, and great fajitas.  I love the food hear all around.  Small beer selection but that's probably because they are mostly Mexican beers, one or two I had never heard of which I think is pretty cool.  I sometimes wish it was slightly cheaper but that's possibly because I'm a poor college student.  Think... Au Bon Pan but Mexican food.  You even get to direct every ingredient that goes into your food. YUM.  Also the only place on Northeastern campus that sells alcohol to my knowledge and they have lots of TVs and one huge projector screen for sporting events.  Check it out.
Decent. Nothing super extraordinary but decent for a burrito fix. Watch out for mundo fillings squirting out. Napkins are a must.

Quick and easy.... great burritos.  Beats out any of the other chains (remember this place falls in the fast mexican food category).  Burritos are plenty big and are made in front of you.  My two favorites are the Chicken Mole burrito and the Queso Burrito with steak.  Grab a beer or two and a filling burrito and chill out in front of one of the TVs while watching the T go by.  If you frequent the place, make sure you get a Q-card so you can get freebies here and there.

I'm sorry folks, Qdoba is simply the bomb. 

Yes, it's bastardization of Mexican cuisine, but they're not trying to hide it and you know you secretly love it. Look in your pocket dictionary: ain't no definition of Qdoba up in there. 

This place is great for a lunchtime burrito - now they even have a pulled pork burrito - "ancho chile pork" and it is deeelicious. Their taco salad is a lighter choice and just the right amount of food. I'm always wary about eating too much at lunchtime. Their burritos threaten overkill, so be warned. Their chicken quesadilla is excellent as well, with a side heap of some of the best guacamole I've ever had.

Maybe Anna's is better priced and more authentic, but Qdoba tastes and- don't shoot me- seems fresher.

I love it, I love it, I love it!!  Not truly authentic, but miles in front of Taco Bell.  This is a great campus eatery.  It's conveniently located and the food ain't half bad.  The portions are very generous and while it isn't the cheapest place around you can really get some bang for your buck by ordering a kids meal which comes with a small quesadilla, a fountain drink, and a side of chips and salsa.  FYI: the staff really gets annoyed when you try to be all cool and pronounce the L's in quesadilla like Napoleon Dynamite (trust me I know from experience).

Perhaps the worst burrito quality to price ratio in the United States. Much worse than Taco Bell (forget El Pelon, Boca, Anna's, and even Chipotle), but about 5 times as costly. Flavorless burrito that falls apart from the watery beans.

Never a bad experience here but always some downers. I out a 3 but I think they could go for 3.5 stars. I went in and I usually like to order off the kids menu because I feel like the regular sized portions are too much for me. But unfortunately they were out of the kid sized bowls so I went over to the regular menu. I got the Three Cheese Nachos since that's what I always go for. I got chicken as my meat, although I was skimped on my amount of chicken so I'd suggest you ask for extra considering extras are free here. The order continues with regular salsa, regular queso, guac, and sour cream. I forgot to get any beans which I regretted. One problem I always have with Qdoba no matter the location is how BIG their chunks of salt are on the tortilla chips!!! It makes it feel like you're biting into a spoon of salt while eating my nachos. I hate how now their sour cream comes out of a bottle though. I got a soda for a drink and called it a day. They were about to close but the manager took down some of the chairs so that me and my friends could sit which I thought was quite nice.

This is a "creative burrito" place - not an "authentic Mexican restaurant" and as such it's great, IMHO. I went in for a quick burro, with no preconceptions and got a very tasty, huge, burrito with fresh ingredients and extremely friendly service. I'd never been in a Qdobo before, and I live in Arlington, so I probably won't be back to the Huntington place -- but it was so good that  I did a search to find one nearby and will go there for my next quick lunch... and will bring a friend.

While I was in college I ate here all the time... Not because it was good, but because it was right across the street from where I lived. The burritos are just OK, but it's a ton of food. The chicken or steak queso burrito seems to be most peoples favorite.

I miss this place..a lot.  I've been to three or four other qdobas and this is still my favorite.

Their 3 cheese nachos are FANTASTIC.  You can't go wrong with any topping, but I prefer the pork or steak.  Burritos are awesome as well. This is 100 times better than Chipolte (which is still decent, but can't compare).

They also have Dr. Pepper as a fountain soda choice...very nice.

I signed into my years-neglected Yelp account just to complain about this place. How depressing. So... please, do not bother. I ordered on their website with 30 minutes of lead time. When I arrived, it wasn't done... it hadn't even been started. The cashier didn't seem to be aware of how to process online orders. Having worked in the food industry before, and knowing mistakes happen, I accepted that it could be made on-the-fly. I hung around for five minutes, but then the cashier approached again, still inexplicably confused by a pretty straight-forward order of 2 Bohemian Veg knockout tacos and a tortilla soup (no special requests for either). 
Knowing this was a lost cause, I futilely asked for a refund. The manager mashed some buttons, said it was "done," which I guess meant voided, and quickly handed me what I thought was a coupon for a free taco or something (it was just some card promoting a product I would never want to purchase at this point). 
I wasn't given a refund receipt, so I don't know if anything went through. I'll have to vainly stare at my online banking site, waiting for the transaction to be voided, which will probably never happen. What a waste of time and money. This review has been catharsis more than anything else, I know it won't affect their business. They're a low-quality, faux-Mexican chain restaurant and they'll still be around thanks to the indiscriminating patronage of drunk college students. 
tl;dr Make your lunch and bring it to work, there are no decent fast food joints around the Northeastern T stop.

Chewy yet crunchy chicken -- HOW on earth do they do that? It's amazing to me how one bite can ruin an otherwise average burrito. If I wanted gristle, I'd go to Mexico where it's normal. Satiate my American palette, dammit! Even though the chicken wasn't great, the rice was flavorful. Too much cheese for my taste, and it overwhelmed the delicate poblano pesto flavor that I thought I would really enjoy. I asked for the fiery sauce, and the sauce they put on was pretty darn mild. 

Prices are a little high for what you get, but it was the lunch rush, so maybe they were rushing to accommodate the hoards of people lined up for their grub. One bonus: They seem to be very aware of dietary restrictions (vegan, low-carb, etc) and offer a lot of options for picky people. It's nice to know that Qdoba cares about my preferences. *sigh*

Qdoba Mexican food attracts most of Americans too. This place is always crowded around lunch time but the waiting time is pretty short. Manager is a cool person from PR and always engages in conversations. Make sure to try out different foods there, specially the Tacos and Burritos. Plus the interior of this restaurant is neat and fun.

This place is good and cheap, but it doesnt even compare to boca grande or Anna's.  To some it may seem the same, but to the taste buds of a true boston metro area tounge, this place seriously lacks.  But it is good if you have only five bucks and a growling stomache.
Food is good. However, the most unwelcoming staff ever. Rude is the word for them. They stopped kids gumbo and I stopped going to this place.

Best mexican in town. I love there prices, the employees are friendly and great. The food is always fresh and it never feels frozen. The seats and tables are always clean and I have a blast eating at Qdoba

I love Qdoba, mostly because I could walk there from studio. No seriously, great burritos. You will leave there feeling very full. Good quality food for cheap. Poblano Pesto is my favorite burrito and I also love the tacos. They have catering and stuff an a burrito eating contest which is hilarious to watch. Go to see a man stuff an entrie burrito in his mouth at once. Well not quite... but almost...maybe this year...

Is Qdoba authentic mexican food?  heck no, and it doesn't pretend to be , either.  But, they make a damn tasty burrito for what it is.  Unfortunately Qdoba is nowhere near as good as the original pseudo-mexican burrito place, Chipotle, but I'm pretty sure the closest Chipotle is in NYC.

I don't know about the meat options, but the veggie burrito never disappoints- especially if your hungover.

Quick stop after visiting the MFA. Don't like the fat burrito style, but it's nice you can order mexican beer with your burrito. I guess amanda hate it, but The Burrito Beer style is pretty cool! Most people there are students from NEC and Northeastern.
If you want cheap, tasty, commercialized, food court Mexican, this is it.
Thanks for the food poisoning! 8 hours of non-stop vomiting! It was awesome...

I don't know why people are getting so bent out of shape; Qdoba is a fast-casual, Tex-Mex restaurant. My point- it's not that serious. Also, why bother posting a 1 star review and then not bother "getting into specifics"? What does that say about the substance of your review? 

The food here is great and the staff for the most part are kind and genuinely care about your meal. I can support that claim because just today, the man serving the guacamole recognized me and gave me extra! As for the owner, he's also a pretty cool guy. I was dissatisfied with my meal once and he apologized to me 100 times and gave me a voucher for a free burrito. 

I usually get the chicken burrito or taco salad; I can't vouch for the nachos or quesadillas as I've never tried them. However, the burrito is always fantastic and very full.

In short, for $7 you can get a pretty solid meal that will definitely fill you. I can't complain, I love it here at Qdoba and I'm sure a lot of people do, too!

While not my favorite place in Boston for quick Mexican food (Anna's, El Pelon, and Boca Grande all rank higher), Qdoba does at least provide a step up from Taco Bell and more generic fast food options.  I agree with other reviewers that they're a little on the pricey side.  However, if I get one of the enormous vegetarian burritos for lunch, I don't need to eat dinner!  Bonus points for having bottles of Cholula around for those of us not afraid of spicy food.
Great burritos and taco salads. You get a lot for your money. Don't forget the guacamole and cholula hot sauce.

Insert the "whaaant-whaaant-whaaant-whaaaaah" sound here.

Your rice is over-seasoned Minute Rice and your burritos are loosely packed and poorly rolled. Get with the program or get out of town.

Plus, in the universe of Boston burritos, these things are overpriced--even if they were good, which they are not.

Qdoba has pretty solid "Mexican" food.  Generally doesn't have too bad of a line, and besides sodas, has Snapple and such.  The food is pretty good, they have tacos and quesadillas, burritos and such, but it's kind of pricey overall.

Authentic? No. Here's where the attraction of Qdoba lies:

Red Sox home games.

if you're coming in from the suburbs, park in the Prudential Center garage ($15 w/ Sox ticket stub for evening/weekend gfames). Stop by the food court and load up on a burrito and some bottled water before heading into the park.

Is it as tasty as El Pelon? No, but it's not as crowded-- and it fills you up good before the game.

The name, the look and even the food make Qdoba look so incredible- especially when good tex-mex options are not anywhere close. Let me start by saying- this is my favorite kind of food- burritos, quesadillas, chips and salsa! I have not ordered a burrito, quesadilla or chips and salsa that I have actually genuinely enjoyed. Even the taco salad lacks any flavor. I never leave the end of a burrito uneaten- it's my favorite part! But.... when I leave Qdoba, the end of my burrito sits sadly in my basket as I walk it to the trash can. What disappointment. What dismay. 

Anna's anyone????

Mexican American fast food

It seems that there is something wrong at this place... The Soda machine was malfunctioning and needed to reboot, several times and then got into a funk with it's peripherals.  It might Have been a fluke, but it resulted in waiting 10 minutes for something to drink and then begging for something from the refrigerator.  I watched a young man struggle with the machine for another 10 minutes, opening it up, calling on the cell phone and struggling.

The food was OK, ingredients OK, but something not right about preparation; everything was too watery and fell apart.

Then there were the bathrooms... I did not go, but heard the most outrageous things...  It was not recently cleaned, someone left TP on a toilet seat, someone else left a used tampon - unwrapped in anyway and on top of the overfull trash... and the floors were sticky.

I get that this is a city restaurant and there are lots of questionable folks about... but management needs to deal with things like this in a timely manner.

I had my first Boston burrito at Qdoba and come here almost every week. Their burritos are huge, good enough for two meals if you want, but more likely than not you'll overstuff yourself with one delicious burrito. Although not the biggest draw, their other menu items like gumbo and tortilla soup are tasty as well.

I have a confession. I wish I could re-do college as a business major just so that I could create some sort of business/marketing plan for why Qdoba should produce smaller burritos. But I can order a naked burrito you say. No, I want a tortilla! I just want these delicious burritos to be a little bit smaller! I love Qdoba's burritos with all my heart, but the fact that I feel physically sick after eating one forces me not to buy them anymore (and no, I don't have enough self control to just eat half). If anyone with an MBA/whoever created Boloco's mini burritos wants to steal this idea, be my guest!

Anyway, I've had to resort to ordering some new items at Qdoba and I've become obsessed with the tacos (ALMOST like mini burritos...but not quite), tortilla soup, and the kids meals! The new "choose two" menu is pretty cool and a nice way to try some different items. I also love the fact that there is unlimited Cholula hot sauce. I can down that stuff like it's water! As a Northeastern student and resident of the surrounding area, Qdoba has become a staple in curing my weekend hangover. And I wouldn't have it any other way (except with a smaller burrito of course). 

:)

The manager starts vacuuming any uproots the chairs and tables 1 hours prior to close every day. It's pretty unhygienic unhygienic to sit in and eat. She even starts moving seated people for cleaning. Lame.

Cheeeeese.  Qdoba is all about its cheese.  

Their Queso sauce is among the guiltiest pleasures in the business.  The 3-cheese, artery-clogging goo is the perfect nacho accompaniment.  Its the main reason why I come here and the only reason to stop here instead of lets say a Chipotle's (which has much better burritos).  

Anyhow...I digress.  Bottom-line: their cheeeeeeese is gooooood.

The new manager sucks. Rude and irresponsible. My quesadilla was not crispy at all, and they tell me they cannot do anything about it, because I've touched it. Well, I touched it and then I saw it disintegrated in my hand, that's why. Unlike the previous manager, the new one is unfriendly and, worse, unprofessional.

They nevwer have all the ingredients for my taco bowl. 
Every time I have been in this Qdoba there is always something that they run out of.

I've had my first Qdoba experience here...and ever since then.. if I'm hungry and there's a Qdoba around.. I will go!
This location is on point. Never had any issues..
If you're looking for some burrito, taco, quesadilla goodness.. forget those new crappy Chipolte joints.. GO TO QDOBA!! 
Chipolte doesn't make anything else but burritos.. at Qdoba you have so many more options.

Do you like cheese?
How about black beans?
Do you drown things in sour cream?
Do you like the taste of Mexican food, but fear the tang of true hot sauce?

Needless to say, if you answered 'yes' to any of the above three, you will enjoy Qdoba.

I am a Northeastern student and I would pick Qdoba over Boloco any day.  Yes, they're a bit pricier, however their portions are also MUCH BIGGER.  Really, the burritos they serve easily weigh half a pound and are usually drippy and pretty delicious.  

In addition to all this, they also serve beer.  Good beer.  Winter Lager good.  And let's be honest, even the cheapest, greasiest, most sub par quesadilla tastes much better when washed down with a cold cerveza (corona with lime anyone?)

So, all in all, if you want the most bang for your fast food buck near NEU, hit Qdoba, you won't be sorry.

Qdoba, how dare you call yourself a Mexican Grill if you don't even have jalapenos!

Other than that, their burritos are decent - huge.  They aren't really like long, cynlindrical burritos.  they're kind of short, stout, and shaped as a rectangular prism.  But good, and filling... but not as good as a burrito with jalapenos on it.

What's not to love about things covered in cheese--like their nachos? especially during finals, great location for them during them...the burritos are also great, but that's overall for Qdoba. As for this one, they have never messed up an order of mine and have always been quick.

The server at the beginning of the line had such a thick accent and quiet voice that I couldn't understand a word she said. So, I was not really surprised when I asked for a regular steak burrito, but was given a chicken bowl instead. The bowl was just all the ingredients of a burrito dumped into a bowl without the tortilla. At this point, I have no idea how to order a burrito the way I understand it to be - with a tortilla.
She was confusing everyone because no one in line could understand what she was saying. The manager had to step in several times to get the line moving. 
However, that manager was incredibly nice and amazingly fast. He certainly made it all better. Apparently 90% of the staff is new and all were training on that day. Not an efficient way to run a business...
Overall I can't complain too much because the "burrito" bowl turned out pretty decent, and the manager was awesome. (I still want my burrito though.) 
Good (not great) experience- decent taste, fast-ish service, mid-range prices. I'll try them again.

Seriously?

I don't know where to begin.

Yes I do.

What would make you think it's okay to put the cheese on the burrito last?  The art of the burrito clearly states that you put the cheese on first so it will melt into the rest of the delicious pod of yummy while you make it.  Qdoba must have missed this memo.

And what do they season their chicken with?  It tastes vaguely like chemicals... kind of like Diet Dr. Pepper tastes a little funny, so does their chicken.

And finally, pricing. It is a sin to pay almost $9.00 for a burrito and a small drink.

Sorry, I'll be spending my time at Anna's.

So I went to Qdoba because we already had Boloco that day (rough day) and decided to go across the street. The prices are a bit high for some items, like the nachos which you should never get unless someone is forcing you to. 
The burritos are bigger than Boloco though, so its a touch call. 
In some people's opinion, these restaurants are the same. False.
There's a reason that Boloco is usually packed and Qdoba looks empty most of the time.
It's qdoba. College food. The good thing is they open late.

Typical qdoba. The service is decent and there can be a line at prime hours. I like that they have free guac but the cost for a meal is a bit higher than other more authentic mexican restaurants. I don't understand the craze for the queso sauces, i never get it.
Flavorless.  My friend got sicked after eating one of their taco salads.  Just take a stroll over to El Pelon, or if you're lazy, at least go to Boloco nearby.
I like this place mainly because it's another choose compared to chipotle. Nachos are good, just wished they out more quantity on them that's all .

I was going to eat here yesterday, but decided not to.  A woman was mopping.  Then she stopped mopping and proceeded to the food counter as if she were going to handle whatever food I were to order.  She had not changed her plastic gloves since handling the mop.  I do not believe I am excessively fussy in thinking that one does not touch a mop handle and then handle people's food.  The gloves are not expensive.  Change as often as need be!

I am a fan of Qdoba and this is a good location.  It's a great place to eat for any college students because it is affordable and you get big portions.  Guac and queso don't cost extra which is awesome.  Sometimes there is a big line but it always seems to move fairly quickly.

It is quite safe to say that I've been to this Qdoba more than 50 times throughout my college years. 

Most of times, I liked my food. (my favorite) Chicken nacho is awesome :D and burrito's usually good. Chicken burrito with extra hot sauce is so delicious :)

I had only one bad experience at this place. I placed an order online and went there to pick up my food at scheduled time, and the employee had no idea that somebody placed order online so I had to wait for another 15 minutes. 

Well, but one bad experience doesn't really take away good reputations that have been built for 5 years, so I still like this place :)

Qdoba is one of my favorite places to get my burrito/bowl fix. This was my first time dining in this specific one. The service was quick and prompt despite the amount of people waiting in line. I ordered a vegetarian burrito bowl and everything was quite flavorful except the roasted vegetables (a medley of red and green bell peppers). It lacked the taste I was expecting and it was quite bland, too. 

The interior of this place is nice and spacious, so finding a seat was definitely no problem. There were window seats, booth seats, and table-and-chair seats. For a place this spacious, the noise level wasn't bad at all, and the music they played was very modern and "up-to-date" (you could say) and not distracting at all.
The food is pretty good, especially the rice bowl! The service is equally bad. If not a native speaker, they cringe at every sauce pronounced wrong.

Lived next to Qdoba for 4 years while I was at college. Needless to say I was there a lot! Service is always quick even when there is a line at lunch time. The ingredients are always extremely fresh and their burritos are excellent. It's also great when your on the fly! You can also watch sporting events here; they will pull down the screen and you can sit there and have a few beers!

Their queso makes their bowls taste better as compared to other fast-food Mexican places. Steak is tasty and their chips+guacamole is nice, too. The people there are very nice, but that could be because I always greet them, and I speak Spanish.

I think that perhaps for Boston this is fine.

Coming from Southern California, I think it is terrible. Guacamole that tastes like green sour cream? Rice that is flavorless? Nearly seven dollars for a burrito?

Several veggie options make it a place to return to, especially when busy.

I go to qdoba a lot (mostly for convenience), and always get the same thing (burrito & a cookie), and I must say, they are incredibly inconsistent! 

Some days, the ingredients all taste fresh, the burrito is wrapped nicely, the cookies are soft and chewy and there's new bottles of Chilula sauce ready at your disposal. 

The next trip, the ingredients all taste old, the chicken is under/over cooked, they put too much of something or not enough of something else, your burrito falls apart after one bite, the cookies are burnt, and there's nothing but crusty Chilula sauce bottles strewn about the store. 

When they're on their game - it's a good time, when they're not ... then you'll wish you went elsewhere.

The staff is always super nice though, so they get bonus points for that.

The worst part of this qdoba is the staff. The are the rudest people on this planet.
They don't understand anything called customer service. Me and my friends went there and they dont even know how to talk to their customers. The worst place ever to go.

FIRST TIME.....AND MY LAST TIME. Scottsdale Rd & Indian School location: OVERPRICED SO-SO FOOD..... not impressive on any level..... bottom line: not worth the money or the time. We would have been much better off going to Chipolte just up the street at Camelback and Scottsdale. The cheese tasted a little strange and cheap and it was just an all around unimpressive. I even went to the counter and asked whom I could give my comments to, only to be handed a card with a webaddress on it.... I mean, REALLY?!? And as we were leave some fat balding white guy outside asked how it was and I said "hmmmm, OK", to which he showed very little interest in knowing why...... which just goes to show you they have no real concern or interest in listing to people that have put down some hard earned money to actually eat there.......... hopefully the next restaurant that moves in will have better food and show a little concern.

Qdoba's your standard Mexican Burrito joint, with this particular establishment being located on Northeastern University's campus.  Based on taste, the food is pretty good, as their ingredients taste fresh and are prepared to order. However, usually by the end of your meal, your burrito/quesadilla gets very sloppy, as the juices from the meat and sauces seep through the thin, steamed tortillas used in all of Qdoba's dishes. I'll still visit  based on the taste and how close it is to my apartment, but in my opinion, Qdoba is just "okay."

Fairly unsatisfying. A plus is that the ingredients seem to be somewhat fresh, but this is the simplest, blandest Mexican food around. It's mall Mexican food, meaning no taste and a piling on of sour cream, guacamole, cheese, and all the typical crap. You really don't get a whole lot for your money, as a burrito and a drink is around 8 dollars. Get your ass over to Pelon Taqueria, that's where it's at. It's only a short. 10 minute walk through the Fens and it has more authentic, more complexly-flavored Mexican food like limed onions, plantains, fish tacoes, etc.

NOT AUTHENTIC!!!!

I got a vegetarian burrito. Bland, bland, tasteless. Rice had no flavor, guacamole was lacking salt, beans were lacking flavor, cheese was just mush... never coming back again!!

My experience with burritos comes down to one factor: how well it is wrapped. 

The ingredients at this location tasted good, but the burrito that I was given was bursting, and not wrapped very well. They didn't seem to pack it down tightly, so when I went to bite it it would burst. Other than that small inconvenience it was good.

If you don't care for the wrap, you can get a bowl or a salad, so its not that big of a deal.  I found it a little bit pricey, simply because I got guacamole added, but that is true of any burrito place you go and add guac. 

If it had been wrapped better I don't think I would have a problem giving this three stars, as they do accomplish what they set out to do. A quickly served, good tasting meal.

Yeah, I know. This isn't Tacos Lupita or El Triunfo or Anna's or Boca Grande. It's the fast food equivalent of burritos. It's not spicy or particularly exciting. However, I still find myself eating here. 

Why? 

Because I love baby-sized-burritos. I'm talking the size of an actual baby, or maybe just a baby's head. If I'm jonesing for burritos (which happens more often than you'd think), I usually hit up Qdoba or Boloco across the street. Regardless, I like big-ass burritos in my tummy. Nom. If I had my choice I'd totes pick Anna's but sadly, there's no Anna's near work. What's that all about? 

I'm not a fan of their prices. $7 for an (admittedly big) burrito? Lame. It's even lamer that they have to gringo-fy the toppings, like calling pico de gallo "mild salsa". Even lamer-er if they put shredded cheese on your bidness. The only time I got cheese on my grilled chicken burrito, I got a mouthful of tortilla, sour cream, and bland ol' cheddar. Do not want. 

It's not authentic, blah blah blah....but give me Qdoba or Boloco any day (if I can't have my first choice of fast-food Mexican) over Taco Bell. At least it's a hefty step up, and as a result I'm far less likely to become host to a tapeworm and/or spend my days and nights praying to the porcelain god. Ay, no es bueno!

People need to realize that this is a Mexican fast food chain, not an authentic restaurant run by an old Mexican lady who doesn't speak English and just cooks all day at the restaurant like she cooks for her grandchildren. Obviously it's not authentic or of the highest quality, but sometimes you just have those cravings for some quick, mediocre Mexican food, and this is what places like Qdoba are good for. What something better? Take a 10 minute walk to El Pelon.

Though I do want to note (and this is also why I'm giving only a 2-star "Meh. I've experienced better" rather than a 3-star "A-OK"): I do not think their guac is made with real avocados. How I know this? I'm mildly allergic to avocados, but do not get a reaction when I eat Qdoba's guacamole. Guacamole is made with avocados. Anything else might be called something along the lines of "guacamole style dip", but not guacamole. I just feel like stuff like this isn't okay, fast food chain or family run business.
Just a good bite when you are in a hurry.   Quick friendly service. Food is what u would expect it to be just average.

Great food, great service. Bathrooms are clean. The burrito is pretty good and it comes with free guac, which is a one up on Chipotle. TVs play mostly sports channels. The restaurant is close to Northeastern and has a good student crowd.

Meh, been there many times, but lately I only order quesadilla.
The rest all taste pretty much the same.

So, I came here with Jenni after not being able to get into the MFA for a special exhibit that was sold out. So we decided to get lunch instead. Wanting to try something new and different, I decided to do Qdoba instead of ABP. 

Now... I like Mexican foods and I love burritos, but please note that although, it says Mexican Grill outside, it is not your authentic Mexican restaurant so SHUT UP and stop crying about it. You're an idiot for thinking it is. 

I got the pork burrito and it was amazing! The pork was so tender and juicy. Topped it off with my sour cream, salsa, beans, rice, guac, etc. Deeee-lish--ciouuussss..... I ate that big ass burrito up so quickly, you'd blink and it'd be gone. 

P.S. They also sell alcoholic beverages during the day! BONUS POINTS! Even though I just had a snapple. 

P.P.S. They have Mexican Salad Hats! (that's what we called them when we were in h.s.) These are those tortilla bowls that are shaped like a hat if you turn them the other way around. Well they're deep fried (in h.s. anyway) and are awesome filled with everything. I will have to try theirs the next time I'm there. I've never seen this done anywhere else since h.s. cafeteria.
