Qdoba is great if youre not looking for authentic mexican food but rather American-mexican food. I like to call it a cross between chipotle and moes!

Been to many different locations, but this one in particular is not up to Qdoba's standards. Food did not appear fresh, serving was minimal, salty black beans? And to top it off finding pieces of avocado shells on my guacamole? C'mon do better.
Average Mexican food. The rice can sometimes be salty. The chips very from lime flavored to bland and stale.  The salad without the greasy shell is tolerable.
This is such a terrible place. The people here are so unfriendly and lack of coordination. They are very unprofessional and do not take your order seriously. Plus all my steaks are burn.

I've been here maybe two dozen times over the last four years because it is super convenient when your on campus for classes. I normally go every once in a while just to mix it up from just boloco BUT I recently realized that the attitude of qdoba employees,  as a whole, sucks. Every other time I go there is some mistake with either my order or someone is blatantly rude to a customer(normally not me) I always brush it off thinking that maybe he or she is having a bad day but then I realized that this happens ALL THE TIME. The food isn't that good, and its way overpriced for the quality/quantity.

I really hate that this place doesn't make real burritos. None of their food actually tastes like real Mexican food. The way they cook and make all their ingredients that goes into everything is poorly made. No flavor, no pizazz, no nothing. Most of the time I feel like I'm eating a roll of mush, and by the way they poorly wrap their burritos because mine almost always falls apart. I'm only giving this place more than one star because they at least usually get my order right, and i don't find interesting things in my food.

Huge burritos. It was really nice and satisfying after swim practice to eat one...or as much of one as I could possibly eat. I was actually pretty surprised by this- I wasn't expecting much at all. I like that they have a choice of wheat tortillas and brown rice, as well as a variety of meat and salsa. I didn't like the inability to choose the size of the burrito (it's like Chipotle in that manner), and the price was not okay. I used my dining dollars from Northeastern, but still. I paid $9.18 for a steak burrito with guac. In California, you could get that for $5 and definitely under $7. Apart from that, the taste wasn't bad. Not the best burrito I've ever had, but pretty good.

I've also gotten their burrito bowls - also pretty good. Honestly, now that they have free guac it's basically like Chipotle (and probably cheaper).

Shame on B.U. for getting rid of Taco Bell on Comm Ave.  They claimed that the food was inferior.  So they replaced it with a frickin' Starbucks (there's something new) So, if I wanted Mexican food, I now have to go to Qdoba.  I went to Qdoba for lunch, I was in the mood for a ground beef taco.  They had it, but I had to purchase the 3 set- o.k.., fine. I watched her "scoop" a tiny spoonful of beef onto my tacos, I showed allot of restraint not to say something.  I bit into it.  It was like a salt lick for a horse.  It was so danged salty I took advantage of the respond website on the receipt to let them know how I felt  (besides dizzy and horse-like from the salt lick)  
Now we may get on Taco Bell because they only have 33% beef in their beef, but  dag, at least they make it taste better than this, and it's less fattening :)   The Taco Bell location , which was forced out by B.U.  was the first TB franchise in Boston; the last city to pick up TB over 30 years ago.  Only because that franchise would not honor the B.U. card is why I am subjected
 to Qdoba.  Oh yeah, the next time I went to Q, with some friends, a bird flew in and made lunch pretty exciting and to this day I can't remember what I had.   Somebody bring back TACO BELL to Kenmore area!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Line can get super long and there doesn't seem to be enough people working behind the counter. Still, Qdoba is yummy and cheap, and seating here is abundant. This location is super convenient to my office too.
Slow service! Waited in line for 20 minutes. Signs all over the place saying no lettuce yet they're right across the street from a small market. Smh

Hot damn this place has good burritos. Things are HUGE. The only downside is that this place is kind of like an Olive Garden.. but Mexican.. by that I mean the food is usually really good but it's not truly authentic ethnic cuisine.

But hell, I'm a college kid looking to grab some cheap food for a couple bucks. Do I care? Not really. Does it taste good? Yeah. Are there sh*ttons of college kids in here all the time? Pretty much. Is the staff cool? Damn straight.

Might I say that whoever thought of the name for this place.... what did you smoke?

If you like taco salads, go to this place. Wicked good taco shell salads.  SO fresh and SO good. Pretty good variety of ingredients, and tasty. Plus, they serve beer. Definitely not attempting to be authentic Mexican, so if that's what you want, go somewhere else. But, they're really good for what they specialize in. 

Atmosphere can be noisy, but it's a clean place and is decorated brightly.

I've never had a bad experience here. (knock on wood)

PS - College students, they take Fenway Cash and the Huskies Card and all that other good stuff.

I really loved the various taco combinations and flavors. The choices rival most fast food Mexican restaurants. However, the service was insanely slow due to two new-hires so I did not factor that into my review. I would highly recommend this spot for some fast Mexican food. Try the 9 special tacos!

First of all the food is OK, and I have been here for several times a week. But today, when I was ordering for my favorite mexican gumbo, there only two of us in the line, the attendant just rush for choosing the toppings for me, even "busier" than lunch time. she even didn't pay attention to what I have chosen and just throw the bowl to cashier. I have to let the cashier to help add my toppings.

WORST MEXICAN FOOD EVER!

Gummy tortilla...Why do you steam it? 
Why rice in the burrito? Trying to hide the flavorless diced beef?
Is that what they think is a burrito shape? It looks more like a BAG OF RICE!!
I hate taco bell, but even they are much better.

we were at Northeastern and had an interview  so had 40 min for a quick bite. I asked everyone for directions to a local awesome hole in the wall nearby..no one had a clue so we walked to Qdoba. It was clean and neat. Service was fast and the servers were most polite. My teen ordered a grilled chicken burrito. They will it with anything you want. I had a chicken quesadilla with hand mashed guac. Honestly it was pretty darn good for fast food.

So I absolutely love Qdoba. Best spicy queso sauce and surprisingly delicious nachos. This location is especially nice too. Minus a star though because every time I go in the guy who rings me up profusely hits on me. I call this bad customer service.

I do enjoy the food here WHEN the staff will actually meet my requests. I hate cilantro and always ask if they can make me a burrito with plain rice, which never involves anything more than grabbing a scoop from in back. Occasionally they'll be willing, but most of the time I get an attitude-filled "uhhh, no?"

I am always incredibly polite and yet I'm treated as a huge inconvenience. I understand not being able to get me some plain rice during rush time, but when I'm the only person in line? 

I wish I wanted to eat here more often but the attitude from the staff makes me hesitant.
The staff are very pleasant and I've created interesting mini-friendships that make ordering burritos more interesting. Free guac is awesome.
The food here is pretty average at least the offer real drinks no HFCS.The mango salad was fine.

Yea, Qdoba is good. The location is excellent as a NEU student and I have used their bathroom as a non-patron in the past (though I can't remember why I didn't just go to the Marino Center). 

I *know* I live in a city where you can get burritos from places that aren't run by evil chain corporations.

I *know* this food isn't authentic.

I *know* there's a lot of annoying students in here.

Don't care. I love me a naked chicken burrito or Mexican gumbo and I don't think anyone needs to go out of their way if they're looking to wet their whistle. Qdoba is A-OK, if not a little better when I'm jonesin'

The food was amazing! Their burritos are super high in calories, but you go there for the taste of their delicious food. Not to think about how many calories you are consuming, right? The employees rush you a bit, but what can you expect when you have a line of hungry college students out the door? I recommend this place if you are in the area, and the line is worth the wait! Peace to the world!

If you're really hankering Mexican food-- well, this place might satisfy your urge but will still leave you unsatisfied. It probably is good considering we're in Boston, but I'm from CA and so was disappointed.

The veggie burrito was worth coming back for-- especially when compared to Boloco next door which is just gagilicious.

To those who give this place bad ratings because its not "authentic":  Well duh of course not, but it shouldn't get bad reviews for that.  Yeah its not authentic, but they are still flavorful burritos.

In terms of this location, really depends whos making the burrito.  Most of the time its fine, but every once in a while theres someone whos either new or stubborn and either does not listen to what you want or destroys the burrito in the wrapping process.

Other than that, good place to get a burrito around NEU, rather tasty if you get the right thing.

Food here is good but managment and staff need better customer service skills. Not very friendly, and the lady at the register didnt give us our change back. Granted, it was only $0.39 but we watched her repeateadly not give anyone thier coin change back. I understand they probably dont make much in tips, but completley not even giving it back to the consumer is staight theft. We were too appaled to confront anyone, and let it go. But we will not be returning to this location anytime soon. Pay attention to how much money you get back!

The queso sauce is really nice. I get there kiss gumbo which is much cheaper and it's enough for one person. 

Also, their 'kraft for 2' allows two small portions and it's a lot of food.

Well I have been here a few times and to summarize it is very unpredictable.  I have had way salty rice in my burrito, tasteless beans and other times the tortilla was just too gummy.  I prefer eating elsewhere.

This Qdoba is solid.  Actually, it's better than that.  I've never left feeling like I wasted time or money.  The burritos have great ingredients and  are made with quality and care.  It's not the most authentic place, but I enjoy eating there.  The quesedillas are great, you probably won't find too many places in Boston with great quesedillas, but that's mainly because the Mexican food "bar" in Boston is not that high.  In any case, if I want a burrito or quesedilla somewhere close to where I live, this is usually the first place that comes to mind.  There's also Bolocco, but that's not the best place in terms of eating enjoyment.  Bolocco's strength is originality and making burritos that are actually healthy (or close to it).  

Qdoba is a nationwide chain, so it's not a local joint by any means.  However, I think it's worth a try for anyone in the neighborhood.  Their pico de gallo is especially great, in my opinion.  It's definitely a far cry from authentic Mexican food, but if you're in Mission Hill or Fenway I highly recommend checking this place out for a quick bite.  The quantities are all right, could be more, but it's better than Chipotle, Bolocco or any of the other burrito chains in this specific area that I've encountered.
Food is bad i ordered somechicken  quesadilla and sauce  the did not put chiken or sauce on the side and bad customer service
價格便宜且份量大，食物及用餐環境都很乾淨、餐廳的座位很多非常適合朋友或家人等一群人一起來用餐、店員的服務態度也非常的親切且迅速，位置離美術館非常近走路就能到達，我會非常樂意再來一次。

Very vegan/plant based friendly now that they have the impossible protein!!! Love it! Staff always nice. Seasonal mango salsa and tortilla strips are delicious. Affordable. Highly recommend for vegans & vegetarians!!! Much better than Taco Bell now.

Excitedly went to try this place for lunch one day, expecting a Chipotle-like experience. Ordered a bowl and Mexican coke, took it back to a table and sat down to eat. Literally on my second bite, I pulled out a piece of thick black hair deeply nestled underneath the rice and beans. I went back to the counter to show it to them and got a half-hearted apology, someone then quickly whisked the bowl away and the manager appeared. He asked if I wanted them to remake my bowl. I said I'm cool just give me my money back please. And he goes, "ok, and don't worry we won't charge you for the coke." And that's the story of my first and last time at Qdoba. Chipotle, it is not.

5 stars not necessarily for the food (of course it's good, but it's Qdoba, can't be compared to higher end joints which I know people will sometimes make unwarranted criticisms about based on that) but I just want to say that even the smallest interactions that staff has with guests makes a difference. I would assume she is either a shift leader or the GM, but I came in tonight and the woman who was obviously running the show behind the counter was so nice, very helpful, seemed to have great relationships w staff. We interacted for maybe a minute, tops, and I think that says a lot that I got such a wonderful impression of her. The other staff were also really nice and helpful. Things that would normally go unnoticed, but I am a waitress and I know how hard we all work in the industry to give our guests a good experience, and I just want y'all to know that your smiles and your paying attention to guests needs really does go a long way. Your kindness doesn't go to waste!

The bowl that I got was a lot smaller than Chipotle's or any other Mexican counter serve food place. The cheese dip was very underwhelming and was also pretty expensive. The steak in the bowl was good but other than that it wasn't very good. The drink machine is a coke freestyle so it is great. I wouldn't recommend this place if any other place similar is around, but if you're in a tight spot and craving Mexican then it will do.

Without getting into specifics, I'll just share that I will not be returning to this location.  There's no reason to leave a restaurant feeling demeaned by the staff.  Bummer since I frequently work at Northeastern.
About what you'd expect from a food court vendor. Basic fare for decent prices. The salsa selection's pretty good.

Food is decent for what it is. The issue here is the staff. They mean well but they are very uncoordinated. The last handful of times I've been here, I had to wait much longer than what is standard. This could be due to understaffing (employees are scrambling to make in-person orders AND delivery orders) or a lack of training.

The manager on staff tonight was horrendous. I went in for a quick meal which turned into 25 minutes of me waiting around and not being served. I could tell that they were understaffed and needed some help as the online ordering continued to roll In. Instead of handling the online orders and the in-store customers, the manager informed the in-store customers that the online orders came first. She said that we would have to wait, so my friends and I left. As we were leaving she smirked and said have a nice night, see you back here next time. It was unprofessional and quite rude. Qdoba needs to do a better job in their hiring process.

HERES A LITTLE TRICK. Order a burrito bowl with the tortilla on the side. You get way more food and you can also make your own little burritos in the process. Free guac and queso makes it super worth and is one of my favorite spots to go to on Northeastern's campus.

This is the first time I've been to a Qdoba. It was 9pm, it was open, we were hungry and wanted something quick before our long drive back to Jersey. 
The concept is very similar to Chipotle, where I go a lot. You pick from tacos, bowls, burrito; then add rice, protein and your toppings. 
The toppings were also very similar to Chipotle. There's the brown rice/white rice, beans, protein, pico de gallo, various salsa options, cheese, sour cream, etc. Unlike Chipotle, the guac here is included in the price and there is the melted queso options here as well. 

Maybe because it was late, but the food at Chipotle looks a little fresher although it's very similar for the most part.

The cashier sold us on the 2 meals for $22 but afterwards, I don't think we should have gotten it especially since we didn't really want the drinks and extra chips.
This is a standard/typical Qdoba. They move you through the line pretty quickly and are reasonably friendly. The restaurant is always clean. It's a solid fast-ish food option.
Some employees are good, but many have a lazy and shitty attitude.  After dealing with that, you'll get mediocre food.  Go to Amelia's down the street for a better tasting, faster experience.

Pretty good but nothing special. Definitely not my favorite Tex-mex place so far. The picante ranch sauce was really good and you can't find that anywhere else in Boston. Don't order the cheese dip tho... it's just broccoli soup. See attached picture. I would go again but wouldn't choose it.

What a great first time quick dining experience and so close to the MFA. Very pleased with the selection of toppings and freshness of salad., And best of all I was pleased to see Impossible Beef as a protein option! 
 And for a "fast food" kind of place the booth seating was 
very comfortable.

I know Qdoba isn't fine cuisine but I still like it. However, this location over-salts their food. All I taste when I order from this location is overwhelming saltiness. It's too bad because I would come here all the time otherwise. Instead, I have to trek to Qdoba Commonwealth.

Not shooting for the stars are they?! Qdoba has commercialised mexican food way too much. It's like eating out of a can. I really hope they get some authentic flavors. But have to rely on this place as it is the closest to college to get a quick lunch

One of the worst experiences ever. I ordered a veggie burrito. The only vegetable they had was grilled pepper. The wrap was pasty and stuck to the roof of my mouth, disgusting. The floor of the restaurant was dirty and littered. There was no toilet paper in the women's bathroom. When i told the cashier he looked at me like i was speaking a foreign language.  I love fast food burritos but this was horrible. Will never go back again.

I was looking for places to eat past 9 and this restaurant was nearby and open. The selection is simple, similar to chipotle if you have been there before. The employees were friendly, patient, and respectful. The service was quick and the quantity was generous. 

I usually use 3 stars on food quality and quantity and this met 2 because the quality of the food was at best medicore. For its price, the quantity was good. I had a bowl of chicken with various sides and if I had the ingredients, I would have made something similar or even better. I would go again just a quick night snack or for lunch.

I would give them 5 stars because I have literally gone here for years. What's holding me back is the stank employees they keep hiring these young people with no real work ethic and they suckkkk!!!! They literally give u half scoop of everything and a handful of chips for queso. Like I have all this queso left over and no chips like wtf! I'm sick of the attitudes there they need to do better when hiring people.

This qudoba is the worst I have been to. Arrogant and Very very lazy staff. I paid for the guacamole and the guy was so lazy that instead of replacing the empty bin with new bin of guacamole, he just added minute quantities left over in that bin. I shall never visit this place again. This is not the qudoba I know.

This restaurant was pretty good, but I'm a big boy and I need a lot of food. I got a burrito bowl, which tasted amazing but I feel like the portion was a little small. It is a little pricey for the amount of food you get, but the flavors are awesome. I would go again! (Cheese dip isn't the best)

I've ordered from here on Uber eats a few times. Last time I ordered the tortilla soup, which comes with the soup on the side and your choice of add-ins. When it arrived the soup was missing so I was left with a bowl of rice, cheese, and corn. They also forgot to send my tortilla chips. 
Tonight I decided to try again because I was craving the soup. Yet again- it was forgotten. 
I understand things happen and mistakes are made but when the soup is the MAIN part of the order how do you forget that more than once??

Stop by here since I happened to work nearby that day figuring they have an attractive menu. Lots of young college students here since northeastern university is across the street . I ordered the protein bowl which was stuffed to the top with chickens and all the ingredients that comes with it. I didn't like the flavoring of the chicken and rice that much . I would say el Pelón or Los amigos have better ingredients and flavor.

I've always loved Qdoba, but I love it even more now that they offer free extras. I love being able to pile on two types of queso and guac. It makes me feel free. I can't believe Boloco across the street is still in business with this Qdoba that gives you twice the amount of food for the same price.

My only complaint about this place is that if the burrito maker only puts a little bit of salsa on my burrito, and I ask for a little bit more, they put a huge spoonful on so that it clearly overpowers everything else in the burrito. I don't know if they do this to spite people that ask for more than they originally give, but it's kind of a bummer.

They got one of those sweet Coke machines where you can add flavors and make weird things. I suggest eating in the restaurant just so you get multiple cups of fun pop.

This is my favorite place on campus, mostly because they give you so much food for $8. Definitely get the burrito bowl and a bag of chips. The amount of food will blow your mind.

Whenever I visit the Museum of Fine Arts, I always make a lunch stop at Qdoba.

Located just off the campus of Northeastern University, and a few blocks away from the MFA, this Qdoba has exceptional service and quality ingredients.  I'm particularly fond of the Signature burritos.

It's funny because I originally wasn't a big fan of the Qdoba chain, but the Signature burritos really turned me on to them -- particularly the Queso burrito and typically the monthly special.  I haven't had a bad Signature one yet.

Location-wise, it's right off the T (Northeastern stop, Green Line) and serves up an excellent lunch that will fill you for hours as you burn off its calories while looking at high art.

LOVE this Chipotle... it's across the street from my office and is a weekly lunchtime 'must have' for me.  The food is ALWAYS fresh and delicious.  A burrito bowl will feed me (well) at lunch and I'll have enough left over for a light dinner.  
Some folks have complained about the line... it's true there are many times the line is (literally) out the door BUT that's because the food is great, relatively healthy (skip the burrito skin and save calories), and this location is surrounded by many large office buildings.  So yeah, there's gonna be a big crowd at lunch.  The employees are friendly though and do their best to keep the crowd moving.  
Chipotle is soooo far superior to Moe's and Willy's... not really even a comparison!

I am not really a chain restaurant person.  I am also really not a fast food person.  And I am NOT laboring under the delusion that Chipotle is a "Mexican food" restaurant (news flash: neither are Moe's or Willy's).

However, in the Mexican-esque fast food restaurant niche, I think Chipotle is the best of the bunch.  Their meat and beans taste fresher and more flavorful than their counterparts at Willy's and Moe's as does the mild tomato salsa (which is actually pico de gallo).  And their guac is delicious, while Willy's and Moe's serve guac that is... ehhhhhh.

Yes, it is horribly fattening, but if you order the "burrito bol" (a burrito without its massive tortilla shell) it's not quite as caloric.  And you can at least delude yourself into thinking that it's slightly more healthful than eating a Big Mac and fries...  at least it TASTES like food, right?

The lines at this location can be HORRENDOUS on a weekday lunch hour.  However, you can call in your order ahead of time (and sometimes during really busy lunch rushes they have a person who takes your order while you're waiting in line).

Overall, Chipotle is a good place to grab a cheap lunch sometimes.  I know it's not "real" Mexican food, and I'm not even sure it's "real" food at all...  but it's a guilty pleasure for me.

Chipotle is so, so good to me.  I love the quality meats and veggies and the rice is delicious.  They are not stingy with the ingredients and employees are always friendly.  

This one is so busy though.  The line is long most of the time and this will deter me on many occasions.  I would never fault them for being so good at what they do, that everyone wants it all the time.  However, a hungry person facing a line can and will deflate said person. That would be me.  

Still, I love the food and feel sure I will be back to stand in line to get a chicken burrito bowl.  I'll just have to down a protein bar while I wait to keep the hunger beast in check, lol.

Don't like rudeness people who reach over my food bullshit management.if u as a paying customer and u ask 4 fresh food u should get it u talk to management they should fix the problem and accommodate there customers.
This place is pretty great, as are most. And as I mentioned to my wife today, I feel good eating here, knowing the meats are ethically sourced. A better alternative to Moe's and the like.
Good Food, but for some reason when I ask for white rice, they put brown rice in my bowl. Three times in a row. It's like they don't understand me not wanting brown rice.

Very disappointed! Something is off with their recipes ... Not sure if it's the rice, chicken, corn, or something else. I always get a chicken burrito bowl and love it... But was surprised when I visited this location that the burrito bowl didn't taste like the bowls at the 8 other chipotle locations I've visited.  I also gave them a second chance and it still was not right!

Lunch hour rush time service was outstanding!

It was 12:15pm on Thursday and the line was ALMOST out the door.
But we waited less than 5 min to be serviced. I was very impressed at how smooth their food line was. 

From the "Are you eating here or to go?" to the "Your total comes to..." the employees are fast, friendly, and efficient.

Best service I have ever had at Chipotle!!!!
Great service and always fresh. Service is mostly fast. And guess what if they have a line they work faster. Amazing concept others could learn.
Chipotle line was long but moved briskly as I went through and got through it. Food was delicious, as always. Well done, once again.

Its Chipotle. You know its all about those burrito bowls. 

This was my first time at this location and I almost didn't eat there.  

There was a fly flying around in the area where they prep your bowl.  I was starving and since they weren't actually landing on the food, I decided to just go with the flow and placed my order. 

Goodness gracious, I was charged $1.95 for guacamole.  Why am I being charged extra for guac at a place that serves "Mexican" food?  I will probably never request guacamole again, as this is got to be the biggest rip off in the joint.  I mean you can buy avocados for less than a dollar when you are buying them in bulk as I'm sure this place does, so they are making 1000% profit off this up-charge.

This location sells some beer and I think I saw someone with a margarita, but we were sitting outside on the patio, so it may have been one that she smuggled in for herself.  I can only image how much a margarita would cost if they charge you $2 extra for guacamole. 

Most of the other reviews speak of how pack this place normally is.  That wasn't the case for me.  I walked in and was next in the serving line and there were plenty of tables for me to choose from.  Admittedly, I was there right at 5 pm on a Thursday, so it possible that at that time of the day, most folks are stuck in traffic on 285. I suggest online ordering if you are going during lunch time or other times when it would normally be busy.

How do you run out of salad dressing AND chips? Every time I come to this location they don't have something. I really wish there was another chipotle in the Smyrna/ Vinings area. This location makes me never want to eat at Chipotle again.

- Crazy long lines during the work week that start well before noon.
- They use only one register which means the lines get backed up fast.
- Orders messed up.
- Broken tables out on the patio, all of them dirty. 
- you're probably thinking "The to-go line will be a better option" you would be wrong! The to-go line is almost longer than the regular line because of the 1 register issue. 
- undercooked rice, no trash cans outside.
- catering boxes on top of tables where people would normally be sitting.
- Togo line was so long and backed up the regular line causing order confusion and pandemonium. Had to hammer this point home.

I used to be pretty ambivalent about Chipotle in the past, then I started my new job up in this part of town, and found it was my coworkers favorite place to go and got hooked. My goto item is always a burrito bowl, all the ingredients are so fresh and its a lot of food for the money. Plus, as a recently converted vegan I find its the easiest thing to put together a vegan bowl that's quite healthy and definitely cheap when I don't bring lunch of my own into work. 

I will warn people though that this place is always PACKED at lunchtime, but fear not, the line moves reasonably fast, and since most people take theirs to go, there's almost always going to be a place to sit as long as you don't have more than 4 people.

There is always a long line which gives the impression theyre handing out free burritos. The line moves fairly slow... Depending on the time and day. Honestly I feel like they need another Chipotle in this area. However,  customer service is awful. My boyfriend got chicken and the young woman gave half a scoop... He asked if he could get more and she said it was extra.. He paid it but I thought that wasn't fair. 

The last time I ate here I got food poisoning and was sick for the days... Missed work and everything. I know it was from this place because it was the first thing I had eaten all day and within hours I was throwing it all up. 

A friend of mine who works in the restaurant industry advised me that if I get sick from a restaurant that I should call them and let them know so that they are aware... Next time I will. I was an avid Chipotle eater but I haven't been in 3 months and don't plan on going back anytime soon.

It doesn't get much better than a burrito bowl from Chipotle. You can easily make yours vegetarian or vegan if you'd like, too, which is a major bonus. They have fresh, quality ingredients and the guac is some of the best!

If you plan to go to this location for lunch, be prepared to wait in line! It's well worth it though...and now I'm craving Chipotle, thanks a lot!

Cleanliness is not a top priority. I have gone to this location several times. At first, I thought they just couldn't keep up with the crowd.  Having been in the establishment recently at a less busy time, however, I now realize that the seating area is always filthy. Garbages were overflowing and food and trash on several tables. Food can be excellent, but walking in makes me lose the craving almost instantaneously.

Long lines are nothing new for this chipotle but lines that don't move is new. It seemed like the saturday crew is not that interested in service. After 10 minutes where the line did not move one step and the line crew were not moving (no one even at register) I decided to visit chick fil a. Chipotle is pretty fattening so I guess they are doing me a favor.
Mostly just reviewing this spot to get closer to a mathematical bell curve goin. However, the staff here is super crappy so they might even justify one star.

Love chipotle. I haven't been to one in a while but I will tell you I won't be coming back to this location. First they didn't have cilantro in their rice. As I move along the line they also don't have crunchy tacos. Move further along the line and they insult me with this concoction of mashed tomatoes that they are trying to pass of as PICO de gallo. The girls that have me al this info ofcourse all young looked at me like I was totally wrong for wanting what are usual ingredients in my ChipotLe taco. Management needs to get their sh** together. The meat and everything else do curse was excellent. But service and lack of ingredients..... A big thumbs down.

It's Chipotle - there's not a lot that can go wrong. This location never skimps on the meat or cheese and seems to move people through quickly at peak hours. Parking in the area can get a little hectic but nothing too bad to handle (it's Atlanta). Outdoor seating is nice at this location as well.
no pork okay they like local and all nstur as long but no salad dressing why bother serving salad place was filthy
I love eating at chipotle but this location always has long line which moves very slow!!

Legit with the portions. Crispy lettuce, cheese shredded with only the finest of tools, meat bomb, veggies too. All kinds of salsa, guac stays looking green and fresh, and the tortillas are the only thing pressed in this location. Employees do their thing and keep the line moving without the sass so big up to them.

Food is great!  But the service sucks.  I just got dinner and the cashier was too busy chatting it up with her friends to even tell me my total much less say hello.  The dining area was pretty dirty.  You could tell no one was attempting to keep the tables wiped down and floors swept.  I appreciate the concept - organic meats, fresh ingredients, etc...but that's the only thing this location has going for it.

Waited over 20 minutes on the line and I did not make any significant progress to making an order.  It took one patron from the time he requested an order to the register 6:10 seconds. And there were 14 people ahead of me so do the math. This location lacks awareness toward operating in an efficient manner.  Even though it was a holiday, I experienced their lack of efficiency in the past.  Hence why I had to mention my horrible experience on yelp.
Customer service sucks. ..they never smile. ..throw your food together and something is always out. ..worst chipotle ever! !!

During lunch, Chipotle has lines out the door at every restaurant, even in AZ, where you can get some of the best Mexican in the country. This speaks volumes about the quality and taste of the food at Chipotle. I do avoid the rice, which I understand is cooked in butter,  but otherwise, everything is fresh and as healthy as you'd expect. Their Barbacoa is just amazing.

Online ordering is the best time saver here.  The food is always fresh and good. But it's always crowded.  Order online or with their iPhone app and walk straight to the counter when you get there.  Their guacamole is delicious, too!
Booooo!! Out of corn and guacamole?!?? Why did you even bother opening today?? My bowl felt so inadequate and no discount was offered. This, my friends, was a sad-sad day in America

This place is amazing, one of my favorite restaurants in Atlanta. The reason for four stars is because of the looming fear of E. Coli, but the food is so good it's worth the risk! Check out this place if you are looking for a quick, casual, amazing dinner!

Get a chicken burrito bowl with a mix of brown & white rice. Green peppers & onions. Black beans. Corn salsa & Cheese. 

Eat it.

Love your life.

the worst chipotle i've ever been to in my life!! dirty counter tops, cooks cutting on dirty tables, chicken in the sofritas, cheese mixed in the guacamole, tomatoes & corn!

how can you serve food in such a dirty setting? it was the worst thing ive ever seen! why cant the workers serve & clean? it wasn't even busy when i came in.

i had to ask for the counter to be wiped off,  and for gloves to be changed because i'm vegan. i watched them make my food everything looked okay, i got home and had cheese in my guacamole, corn & tomatoes so disgusting!

this is not okay! so many people are lactose intolerant and have dairy allergies why in the world is there cheese and sour cream in your vegetables ?

Would rate them higher but the lines are always to the door and at times around the whole seating area. No parking available. It's a good problem to have and it's time to expand, add a second location or a drive thru. C'mon guys the Jamaican place next door has bowls and no waiting.
Very very slow, it couldn't be slower. Always long lines, and no WiFi.

Every time I come or call they never have any pork. It's been 5 times now and I would think if they always run out they would supply it more if it's so popular. Another thing is that I wish they would put a note on the door to let us know they ran out of certain items instead of waiting that long line.

Chipotle is an excellent place to go for fast, fresh healthy food. Even when the line is unbearably long, it goes incredibly fast. The longest one I'd seen had an employee going through the line and allowing you to order and pay while in line before getting to the counter, which was pretty cool. Although the decor is fairly minimalist, the packaging is pretty fun to read, as is the newsletter they come out with. I'm looking forward to them bringing in brown rice. They're using it in test kitchens right now.

There is ALMOST no negative review for this place, except that the line for lunch is always super long, but I'm guessing because their food is AMAZING! You pretty much make your own dish and they put it together for you. Prices are affordable and you get a lot off food for the price. They always have lemons available in case you want to put it in your water . Love having my lunch at Chipotle. Life is burritoful .

I love Tex Mex. I love burritos, tacos, chips, guacamole, and salsa, but I do not love Chipotle, especially this location. The food is lackluster, and the customer is meh. I am never impressed. Give me Willy's any day.

On a good day, this location is okay.  The space is bigger than Kennesaw, but sometimes can be hard to park and have somewhere to sit.  Bigger groups tend to eat at this location, which take up some of the seating.  The food is still good like any other Chipotle, but the workers can be a little tricky.  There's one particular girl that works the register that can have an attitude for no reason.  I'm thinking to myself if Chipotle is too busy for you, go find another job.  It's easy (but not really).  

Anyway...food is still good.  Make sure you voice any concerns or additional things you want.  Make sure the sweet tea is actually sweet before sitting down and make sure you skip the peak time because they are always PACKED!!

Love Chipotle--visited several locations in different cities.  If only for their food, they would have a customer for life.  It's my unfortunate luck, however that the Cobb Parkway location is the only Chipotle within 15 miles of my house (think 285 traffic, YUCK).  My disdain has nothing to do with the food, atmosphere, or the customer service--it is the WAIT.  Months ago, it would have been nothing for me to grab lunch at Chipotle multiple times per week.  But the long lines have gotten consistently worse.  As bad as it sounds, I wish the customers would turn away to encourage the owners to improve their wait time.  The Galleria Parkway (within a stone's throw) is one of Georgia's busiest work complexes.  You would think a food-service business would be more conscientious about wait times especially during lunch hour to be able to capitalize on all those hungry office workers.  I see a consistent theme in the most recent posts, so perhaps the owners will take notice.

Routinely disappointed. I have been coming to this location for about 6-7 months now and I have only grown more and more frustrated over that period of time, to the point now where I refuse to return here. Tonight I placed an online order about an hour and ten minutes before picking up. When you place an online order a phone number is required with their reasoning being "we will contact you if there are any questions/inquiries regarding your order." It is now 2 minutes before my scheduled pickup time, I am standing at the unmanned register while witnessing one of the employees shout out the following to the ~10 or so people standing in line: "we are out of chicken, lettuce, guacamole, corn salsa, and guacamole." I will elaborate on this stocking issue in a moment. Everyone in line the proceeded to turn around and walk out of the restaurant. Keep in mind that this is 30 minutes before closing. How they expect to serve people for the remainder of their shift is beyond me. So here I am, finally being acknowledged at the register with a, "can I help you?" while at the same time my phone starts ringing. One of the employees in back was calling me to inform me that they couldn't fulfill my order. Really? It had been well over an hour since I placed my order. They decide to wait until I have already driven to their location and am standing at the register, after I have already learned of their shortcoming, to call me and give me the heads up that they can't fulfill my order. Had I received this notification early enough I could have picked up food somewhere else, no big deal. However at this point the only other options I'd consider for a quick fix meal late at night are closed. 

This is not the first time this has happened, but rather it is a reoccurring issue. I never encountered the problem of this location running out of several key ingredients until about two months ago, and since then my girlfriend and I joke about it every time I place an online order or talk about picking something up. "Make sure you have a backup plan." Well it strikes again. How can a store that consistently has a 20+ minute line wait seemingly so often be unprepared to complete a shift fully stocked on ingredients? This has happened at least four times in the year 2015 already, and it has come to the point where I only try this location once every two weeks anyways (so who knows how often it is happening otherwise!). 

Long lines, inconsistent portions (be careful who is prepping your bowl that day when you decide to spend $1.80 on guacamole, chances are you'll get shorted), inability to maintain stock levels (only can confirm this being an issue for final hour of operation but is a routine problem), lack of consideration/attentiveness with online orders in calling me promptly regarding their inability to complete my order, I am done with this location. I love the brand and will continue to be a customer at other locations but never again on Cobb Parkway. I have given them far too many chances.

**Quick edit: I gave this location 2 stars simply because they have given me many a great service in the past. That, however, all seemed to end right around the time the calendar turned to 2015. Such a shame.

Good food .....excellent quality .....

But one suggestion - u guys need a drive thru ....i came there 13 times and have driven past it to another food place seeing the long lines .

Stopped in here tonight with my boyfriend and everything was fine until I got to the cashier Desiree . Her attitude was a little scary and professionalism was non existent . It had nothing to do with the volume of the store . She didn't speak , she snatched debit cards , demeanor and energy was just completely off . Maybe this kid was having a bad night hopefully management can have a chit chat with her so that she doesn't get told off by a guest or Deter business with her crappy attitude.

This place is ALWAYS  crowded!  I order online so I can walk in, go straight to the cash register, pick up my food and walk out.  I NEVER stand in that line that wraps halfway around the dining area.  The food is good and the steak is better than it used to be.   Seems like it's better cuts of beef, not stuff I have to spit out because after chewing, it doesn't break down. IJS...

Let's be clear.  Listening to people argue about Chipotle being "good Mexican food" is like listening to midgets argue about who's tallest.  Amusing, yet misguided.  Chipotle is not Mexican food.  It is a McDonald's-owned attempt to assemble a set of ingredients, wrapped in tortillas in a way that resembles cuisine you might find in Mexico.  That's all.

You may ask, why four stars?  Because Chipotle is pretty darned good for fast food.  The ingredients are reasonably fresh and tasty and the final product is affordable and tastes nice.  People agree on tis one; this particular Chipotle always has a line, even at 8pm or later.  Expect to stand in line for a few minutes at lunch.  Good food, and good service - the cashiers are always friendly (bonus points for that).

This location is in a plaza next to Chickfila and old navy. Food and service is just like any other chipotle. However, if you are in a rush, do not come to this location. This location is consistently really busy and the line is always craaaaaaaazy long. Don't be surprised if you are waiting over 20 minutes in line. I came here on Sunday at 7:30 and the line was just ridiculous. Tip: order through their app and pick up there...

I haven't been to Chipotle in years and would not been there had Jason's Deli not closed at 6pm on Sunday.  The line was very long and I was optimistic that our visit would be a great experience.  I could not have been more wrong.  

I'm not sure where to even start.  Unbussed tables, overflowing trash cans?  How about the restaurant being out of chips?  Yes, really.  The worst part is that when I asked for chips w my son's quesadilla, the response was "No chips."  I thought that the quesadilla (with very little cheese and a few pieces of chicken) didn't come with chips.  Since we weren't mind readers or Jedi's, I asked for chips at the register where we were informed that they were OUT of chips.  Inexcusable. 
A Mexican restaurant was out of chips.  

Next, let's discuss the "salad."  They were out of corn and cheese and the manager had to get more.  What's worse-there was no salad dressing and when I asked for it, the staff appeared to be put off by my request.  I just wanted salad dressing.  

The water was even bad and tasted like plastic.  This a feat not accomplished by many restaurants.  

There was no apology or even a second thought given.  I will never go back to this location and likely never any Chipotle period.
This location is very busy, but the food is good, strongly prefer online order! Online order is always hassle free.

Today, I experienced the hugest disappointment!! My boyfriend and I made our weekly visit to Chipotle on our lunch break. As soon as I took the lid off of my burrito bowl, I discovered a bug, resembling a gnat, perched atop my lettuce. When I took it back, the manager honestly informed me that  "this kind of thing happens from time to time because we don't use pesticides in our food". I returned to my seat, and not 10 seconds later my boyfriend discovered a bug in his lettuce! This is a huge disappointment. My love for this place was increased during yesterday's visit (yes, we love(d) it that much) when I discovered that they acquired brown rice. Now just that quick its gone! Sad to say, my affair with Chipotle has now ended and I am definitely mourning the loss. I get the organic thing, but Geez! I don't want it THAT organic! Just thought I'd share the experience.
Slowest Chipotle that I have ever been to. There were maybe 5 people in front of me and it took 45 minutes because they kept prioritizing online orders. Never coming to this one again! Stay away!

I absolutely LOVE Chipotle, but for some reason this location is constantly out of items and has a ridiculously long line every time I go there.  I don't understand why the management team wouldn't try to implement more lean practices to be more efficient and understand their demand so they can order enough food for their location and not run out!  Literally every time it's either, we are out of dressing or cheese and last time it was steak!  I think I'm done going to this location.  I'd rather drive an extra thirty minutes to another location if I have to so I can enjoy my meal.

I usually don't write reviews unless I have an exceptionally great experience or in this case a horrible one. If I could give zero stars I would! I visited this location on 11/12/2016 at 8:34pm. Like most Chipotle locations, the line was extremely long but we stood in it anyway. Once I got to the front I noticed the line workers very unhappy. The first guy I encountered asked me what I wanted and I told him. His next question I couldn't make out what he said so I asked him to repeat it. He proceeded to give ALL kinds of attitude as if I was bothering him to repeat the question. (Question was.. for here or to go?) The lady next to me noticed his attitude also and said something. As we traveled down the line more and more attitude was given. They were all bothered! I wanted cheese and there was NONE in the container on the line so I asked did they have more cheese... Needless to say I was wrong to ask. The guy snatched the container and went to the back to get more not saying a word! Literally bothered by doing their job. Then I get to the register and tell her I have two orders. She only rings one up and had to go through an entire new transaction because she wasn't paying attention. Overall, worse Chipotle experience EVER!! Won't be back to this one! Customer service is key in keeping customers!

This is going to be a very sad admission...but my boyfriend and I used to eat here 5 or 6 times a week. We shared our favorite bowl and are STUFFED, but left wanting more. Great for tex-mex. We no longer eat here because of the soybean oil in EVERYTHING and getting a bit tired of the taste.

Pros:
-Healthier and more responsible meats and veggies (although don't be fooled, it's not all good)
-Consistency is not the word. Yes the veggies, rice, etc are freshly prepared and therefore have a slight natural variance each time, but it's always good and you know what to expect. 
-Too cheap for so much food
-FAST, friendly service

Cons:
-Soybean oil
-Not open late enough (This is not a con, I just have a mean jones for some Chipotle after 10PM.)
-Need a little work on their packaging to make a bit more environmentally friendly. i.e. compostable take out dinnerware

Suggestion: 1/2 portion bowls please

This is a really good place to eat. The meats are cooked well, wait times are small, and lots of options. You can get things made the way you want and looks fresh. The only thing with me is I will want to try stuff I don't know is good, so that has led me to create some untasty combinations- so I would recommend you ask them for a sample which they are more than willing to accommodate.

Pleasant experience; clean place. Decently priced food for the quality and amount given. That's all I'm looking for in a fast food chain. This location didn't stand out or impress me, but it's where I first got the steak salad. And also where I found smoked Tabasco sauce. SO GOOD. 

Add it to whatever you're having and that spicy bbq will do wonders. I think I smothered my salad with a fourth of that bottle. My housemate went out and got a bottle from Publix right after xD We use it in our homemade wraps. YUMM. 

Chicken burrito is a safe bet to get. I recommend the steak salad, with lots of tomato salsa. I like the fact that you can ask them to pile on more. Burritos are almost impossible to hold in just one hand. It's an art eating those huge things without spilling. 

Good place for a quick bite, fast food with friends. I've been there around 6-7pm, and only had a couple people in front.

Don't order online.  The store was a mess and they were out of ice, forks and courtesy. They cater to customers inside only.  I ordered my food and when I got there to pick up, 2 other people were waiting before I got there for their online order.  The cashier was texting and refused to help the others. They didn't give us all our ingredients, ran out of forks, didn't give us salad dressing for our salads.

There was an actual puddle of sewage leaking through the wall onto the floor where people line up to order. A "wet floor" sign had been casually placed next to the puddle. My buddy bit into his burrito and almost broke his tooth on a rock the size of the diamond in Kim Kardashian's engagement ring.  I love chipotle, but this location is a little gross
Chipotle is my favorite Tex-Mex chain. I love getting their bowls! I am rarely ever disappointed by them. So, when I'm craving a bowl, it's so easy to just find the nearest Chipotle nearby.

The bathrooms are absolutely disgusting!! I hope the kitchen is not the same. I can't tell they haven't been properly clean in days. The food seasoning in this location is tasteless.  Come on guys, don't damage the brand.

I've eaten at Chipotle for more than ten years. Love the food value. I love the consistent taste all over the country. Except today. We had ordered 3 chicken bowls. The chicken and rice were bland and not tasty. Ive never had a complaint before but this location is by far the worst tasting Chipotle I've experienced and I eaten at no less than 20.  Please investigate.  Overall id rank an average Chipotle 4.2/5 stars based on value of food for the price and taste. We ate at 230pm.

Love this place.
Love the fresh or what appears to be fresh food. 

Dont love the lines. 
Dont google the calories!

Get the Fajita Chicken Bol. Its so yummy.
Their Guac is pretty good but expensive for such a tiny cup or slop if you get it in your Bol.

Overall this place is good quick eats for a TON of food.
Moes Blows and the name "Willys" creeps me out. 

Chipotle is where its at...

If you have never been to Chipotle don't youtube South Park/Chipotle Blood Stains. 

you're doing it right now. :) its hilarious and totally not true. kinda.

Chipotle is that great quick Mexican food fix when on the go. This was a working lunch after missing breakfast and knowing it was going to be a while before the day ended. The food was and is always made fast. The portions are huge, so this will surly satisfy your hunger. It's a busy place so know what you want because the line moves fast. Food was great. I choose this over Taco Bell for a Mexican lunch quick fix any day . Well worth the money. Had a chicken bowl only thing missing was the "patron". It was a working lunch so hey.......I will live......

This chipotle has some of the worst customer service. I know the lines are long, but do you really have to have an attitude about it? I asked for extra lettuce and the employee just threw it onto my bowl as if I asked for 1st and last month's rent! Jeez!!

To top it off, they were out of chicken!!!! How do you run out of chicken at Chipotle??? I really want to know!! So myself and 4 other people decided to wait on chicken. 
The poor guy in the back was chopping up the chicken so fast and I know his hand was burning, the chicken had just come off the grill!

Unfortunately, his chopping was in vain. One of the people in front of me noticed the chicken was pink inside.........she cancelled her order because the employees then had to throw all of the chicken away and start over. 
Chile I cancelled my order too. I haven't been back and that was 2-3 months ago.

Stopped in for a burrito bowl to go for lunch. There were four or five people in line in front of me when I arrived but the line moved extremely quickly. Not just an assembly line, these folks were On. Zip, zip, zip, what do you want, what beans, what protein, which veggies, which salsa and do you want a drink? Blam!

Ugh, I love Chipotle, but this particular location is really disappointing. The staff is always a mess -- they all seem more interested in goofing off and talking to each other rather than be polite and attentive to the customers. Today was probably my last straw and although I live right next to this location, I doubt I'll be coming back. As I was enjoying my poorly prepared salad bowl at home, I chomped down on a pretty big piece of steak in my VEGETARIAN bowl. I choose to go to Chipotle because of their veggie friendly options and I shouldn't have to wonder whether or not my food will have steak in it. Needless to say, finding a piece of steak in your vegetarian meal is not the same as finding an onion ring in your basket of fries.

For fast food this is about as healthy as it gets other than the tortilla.  

Always go for the bowl or a couple Tacos. The mild salsa and corn salsa are my favorite paired with the fajita veggies and brown rice. Yummmmm. 

This location is very close to a lot of office parks so expect a terrible wait. Recommendation is order online, pay, and go pick up at the register.

So came in to Atlanta to visit friends. We decided on chipotle because they had never been. To my surprise we had horrible service. There was this really tall light skin girl helping us and she was quite unpleasant. They felt the food was pretty good but paired with that service they would likely not come back to this location.

EXTREMELY SLOW!!!!!!
I love Chipotle but this location is so slow. The chicken is usually burnt. The food is good, but you're waiting 30 minutes to get a salad bowl. It's ridiculous.

I love Chipotle, but I HATE this location.

The employees are incredibly slow, unprofessional, and inconsistent.  It's an absolute frenzy regardless of the time of day. Despite this appearance of moving fast,  the service is anything but.  Unlike the majority of Chipotles I've been to, you will always find yourself standing, waiting mid-order here.  

The preparation area is also unclean.  I always end up cringing when, inevitably, my burrito touches the counter.

Avoid this location if you can.  Hopefully, it will get a new manager and get its act together.

If I could give this place negative stars I would.

Chipotle (this location) gave my pregnant wife, my 5 year old daughter, and I all food poisoning. It was the worst night of our lives. My wife ended up going to the hospital. 

When we called chipotle and told them what happened, they were unprofessional and showed no remorse. Denied our claim and we ended up paying a $750 hospital bill in the end. 

This place should not be allowed to serve food to people. They should be shut down. Do not eat here!

it's always super busy and the lines can be long. Parking isn't the best because there are many other restaurants nearby. They are fast and the portions are great.  The don't skimp on the kids meals either. Most won't give salsa unless charging, but they do.  Everything is fresh and hot.  My favorite location.

I am giving Chipotle five stars because not only is this burrito joint delicious, but they also make sure that they are serving you quality ingredients. Know what you are putting in your mouth! Avoid those sketch places that offer 89 cents tacos and burritos with mystery meat and come here instead. You can get a burrito bowl with all the fixin's for 6 bucks. That is not bad at all. I also really enjoy how clean the place looks inside, because of the design and the stainless steel used throughout.

This location is solid (like most CMGs), but the line is almost always out the door.  The wait can be far too long most days as well.  Meaning, it doesn't seem like the line moves very quickly. Other than that, that food is pretty good.

Just recently moved to Georgia, and being that chipotles are pretty much everywhere, I already love it and love going in to get their burritos and guacamole (one of the best guacamoles out there) 
Unfortunately this location, yesterday Wednesday (10/19/2016), the good stars are for quick moving and small line, but they served very small portions and move along so quick they ignore requests, and when I got chips they were so hard and stale tasting it was absolutely disgusting to keep eating them with guacamole. 
I don't know if I could visit this location again or if chipotle has just gone downhill.

I visited this Chipotle location yesterday. I have never been more disgusted with the way I was treated at an establishment in my life! I am appalled at the way my boyfriend and I were spoken to by one of the employees last night. 

We came in to order food. I ordered a burrito bowl. The gentleman preparing the tortillas and serving the rice, beans, and meat was very polite. The girl that was then serving the remaining ingredients was extremely rude. It was obvious that she didn't want to be there. She was sloppily throwing ingredients into my bowl (guac in the corner, sour cream in the other corner, soupy tomato salsa that she couldn't care to drain) she was trying to rush so fast (no line when we arrived) that she wasn't even listening to what I was asking for... That was just the beginning. 

My boyfriend, Who was right behind me, ordered a quesarito. Again, the same girl who was being sloppy with my food (and his because she had to scoop off ingredients since she decided she wasn't going to listen to his order either) began to wrap his quesarito. while she is doing this all of the contents of the quesarito fell out and she was unable to close it. This was no longer a burrito of any kind. She then tried to cover it up by putting the side that was open on the bottom and covering it up with aluminum foil. (We are aware that sometimes this is something that happens. In most cases, the chipotle employee will a) ask if you would like it remade, or b) automatically grab a new tortilla and transfer the contents to the new one without the customer having to ask. Once we realized she was trying to cover it up, my boyfriend asked her if she could remake it. Her immediate snappy response was "I CANT HELP IT IF IT RIPS!" We both said we know that but clearly it needs to be remade. It wasn't even a burrito anymore. The two women who were in line behind us agreed saying they would not have accepted that either. The associate then goes "well do you want me to put it in a bowl?!... Do you want  new aluminum foil?!" To which my boyfriend replied "no I would like a quesarito" ..... because this is what he asked for in the beginning. She spent more time going back and forth with us over not remaking the food than it would have actually taken to prepare another quesadilla for the quesarito. (Let me just say that my boyfriend orders this every time we go to chipotle... It is always wrapped properly. We have never had a problem before. She just clearly didn't want to do it) 

So then I suggested to her that it should be prepared again but this time, they could probably go a little lighter on the rice and beans because there was a lot. Her next smart response (WITH EXTREME ATTITUDE) was "Oh so you want less food?" ... At that point I decided I was done speaking with her. I told my boyfriend that I wanted to leave. The only reason we stayed was because he really wanted the food that we came in there for..... The girl then just storms off and says something Like "you deal with them" to another associate who then comes to continue our order (at this point there is a line. The two ladies who were in agreement with me that were behind us had both completed their orders and checked out by this point) the associate who took over our order (not sure if she was a manager or not.) then says "do you want me to put this in a bowl" smh.... AGAIN, NO we would just like a quesarito.... FINALLY, They prepared a new one and this time it was prepared correctly and we were finally able to leave. A 3rd girl rang us up and she was very polite. At no point did we ever receive an apology for the way we were treated. It was ridiculous. I love chipotle as much as the next person but I am done with that location.

Everything I don't like about coming here can be solved by ordering ahead using the Chipotle app. Even when I do get stuck in the line, it goes pretty quickly (maybe 10 minutes at most) and it's usually worth the wait.

I go back and forth between the two types of beef. Most days I'm in the mood for barbacoa. Other days I'm a steak guy. Either way I can get my fix here (sometimes with a sweet tea).

Their summer loyalty program was part of my incentive to come here at least every weekend. It's over and I think I ended up getting 3 free burritos out of it (after buying 50+ during the same time). If anyone at Chipotle's corporate office is reading this, I think you guys came out ahead and should think about bringing Chiptopia back.

We had the barbacoa salad and burrito bowls. These chain Tex-mex places are all about service and the quality of the meat. The people making my meal were fast and efficient, not wasting my time with pleasantries. The barbacoa meat was delicious and I would get it again. Btw, the table we sat at was a little dirty.
EFFICIENT. So fast, so professional, so kind, so clean! Delightful people, SO SO SO SO AWESOME (as always) on the food! Be here!

I visited this location with a few of my friends. Good food, only that the people there just started off our night there terrible.

Their was a wait for the black beans, since they had run out of them and were cooking more, so I ordered before my friends since I only eat pinto. I noticed that my burrito looked smaller than the ones I've ordered in past Chipotle's I have eaten at. Once we all got to our table, I saw that my burrito out of the four of us was smaller than the rest. I went and told management that how was I getting a smaller one when they were the same and paid the same. They gave me another one, but later another one of my friends found a hair in his burrito.

Hope next time I am in the area and want some Mexican food they can do a better job.
Stopped in for a burrito bowl. This location is pretty consistent to me... Its usually packed but clean, friendly attentive staff, and my food has always been fresh. No complaints

Extremely unpleased. I got a steak burrito bowl and I don't think I can chew enough to bite through this steak. Terrible quality and then they add a cost to everything. A few chips with a bowl isn't a huge thing to ask. If you are going to charge top dollar please have top quality.

I go to this Chipotle because it's the closest to where I live. That's it. Even though there is always a line, they are always sloppy, impatient and roll their eyes at you when you ask from something more than what they added to your dish. There needs to be another location opened nearby or they need to hire staff that can handle the amount of customers.

Poor customer service skills and dirty. Asked them to change their gloves. This older Hispanic lady made big deal about it.  Not only was she making a big deal but she was wiping the counter with nothing but  her gloves. That is unsanitary and cross contamination.  

Told the cash register girl that there wasn't any soap in men's restroom. She said ok. Went back after I was done eating 30 min later, still no soap.  

Very disappointed in Chipotles downhill slope in regards to customer service and cleanliness.  I've observed this at multiple locations throughout Atlanta in the past year.  I will not be a returning customer.

This Chipotle location is just poorly managed.  The staff is rude and uncaring, seemingly wanting all the customers to just go away.  They are careless in preparation of the food and more than once I have been charged incorrectly for my meal. Tonight I ordered a carnitas bowl for dinner.  Literally half of the pork they gave me was fat and I had to pick it out of my dish.  They had dropped quite a few peppers and onions from the adjoining dish into the carnitas bowl so I also had to pick these out.  Come on folks, take pride in your work and take care of your customers.  I'm done with this place.

I have eaten at this Chipotle for years now. Used to be one of my favorite spots despite sometimes the line being so long at certain hours. This place has really gone down hill with the quality of food. It's a shame really because this place used to be so good, and now it is just straight up disgusting most of the time, and the honey vinaigrette sauce is so inconsistent just like the food is now. Don't waste you're time or money. However one of the managers Tyler who works there is a boss. Give that mother f***** a raise!

I am a big fan of Chipotle, even comparing to the queso option at Moes or Willys (I love chipotles tofu)....however I visited my friends in Atlanta passing through to Orlando, and we decided to grab lunch at this location. It took nearly thirty minutes for me to even get talked to, and that was with only like six people in front of me. Passed that, I saw not one person smiling or talking to guests. The dining room was filthy and they had two people "cleaning up tables". This was at 1:45pm on July 2. (So you can figure out who this was) but these two people were flinging the food on the tables left from guests all over the chair. That's ridiculous and lazy. As I say in all my reviews, I'm in the FB and hospitality industry. Guest services is my daily life. I will never return here at this location. Drive the extra distance to Buckhead.

Yay! I'm a fan.

I try not to jump on bandwagons, but I couldn't even help myself with this one. After a waaaay too long visit with my home mortgage guy, my stomach was just about hitting my back. After leaving his office, I went over to this Chipotle to pick up an order I'd hastily placed online. Well, the order never went through, so the lady just had them make my order right on the spot, and yes, the line was LONG at 9:50 P.M.

I ordered the infamous "bowl". I got chicken, lettuce, guacamole, white beans, cheese, corn and mild salsa. Now, this bowl was a pretty darn good size, but why so much lettuce? Next time, I will stand by the window & let them know how much lettuce I like, because there was more of that than anything else. But it was still SO GOOD. I don't know what the spices/seasonings are, but it was so tasty, I finished that bowl in every bit of 5-8 minutes. =) So, yeah, I don't do ridiculously long lines but I'll hit these folks up when the crowds die down.

I frequent this location because it's close to my job. The staff is polite and they move the line pretty fast during rush hours. Every now and then the veggies aren't cooked. Parking is a cluster because I think there are too many businesses in a small part of the parking lot. Hint: some shifts are more generous with the portions than others!

We've been to this location a couple times and you can tell they are doing something right when their is a line out the door around 10:55am before they open at 11! 

The staff could use a little more friendliness, but they make your food correctly and are very quick. That's the important part. 

Not much to say about a Chipotle. (fast food chain) Not a lot of options to add to your meals but with what they have the food is always delicious and fresh. I am IN LOVE with their salads.
Always a long line. Pretty slow. Be prepared for a long wait no matter what time.  Other than that the food is good.

I've been coming to this Chipotle for the last few days since I've been trying to eat healthier. I've noticed a consistent pattern of organized chaos with the people that work here. I always come after the lunch rush to avoid the true insanity that seems to exist at every Chipotle at lunch time. This way you avoid the office orders for 10 by the person just in front of you when you've built up such anticipation and hunger from standing in line 30 minutes. lol Today it wasn't so bad, I just got behind the woman that decided she wanted all of her toppings individually placed in cups so nothing touched her food. O_o I have to give credit to the girl that helped her for not having an attitude.

My first major issue was I ordered a salad bowl with chicken and barbacoa knowing I'd be charged more. When the guy went to put the chicken in there was barely half a spoon of chicken left in the container, he asked about more but it was going to be a little while. Why are you running completely out of meat and it's still a steady flow of customers coming in? Anyway, He proceeded to place barbacoa on top and my bowl moved to the next person. While the person was adding my toppings, there was a girl that kept reaching over my bowl to take or add things to the line, she literally put her armpit over my bowl at least 3 times, not her arm, her armpit and would apologize each time. She reached 4 times total over my bowl. That's not sanitary. When my bowl was passed to the cashier, I was charged for double meat. For not even half a spoonful of meat? "It was a full serving." Ok, whatever, I only eat at Chipotle like once a week, I don't know what a serving looks like. But I do know what an empty container when you've run out of chicken looks like! I paid it, but I decided to write a review and that next time I will ask to speak to a manager. It's Chipotle and it tastes delicious and I'll probably be back later this week because the next Chipotle is like 15 miles away, but I'll be watching closely.

Visited this location on a busy weekday evening and even though there were a lot of people coming in, the wait wasn't long at all.  Service is fast and the employees nice and well organized. In my opinion, this location's best attribute is the size of the outdoor seating.  It's much bigger here than other Chipotle's I've visited. I got to enjoy a great burrito bowl (barbacoa) outside as the sun went down over suburban Atlanta.  Great experience overall.
This is an average Chipotle with great food in an ok price but the lines are long every day

It seems this will be my last Chipotle visit as the steak has been super dry for the last coupla visits. The persons fixing the steak bowls have had an attitude everytime I ask when will the next round of steak will be ready. Ciao Chipotle, it used to be nice to eat there.
There's ALWAYS one topping missing from the menu at this location. Today is was guac. Last time it was cheese. I just don't get it! Lol!

Haven't been to this location in about 7 months but it has certainly went downhill since then.  The restaurant looked dirty, the food area needed to be wiped down, and the customer service was spotty. The cashier was friendly but the ladies working the food line weren't.  One even huffed and puffed because another co-worker was taking his time relieving her of her shift.  Pretty bad attitudes from them.

The food was off as well.  The chips were stale and the guacamole was poorly done.

A horrible experience! 
Unenthusiastic employees.
I had to ask for cheese multiple times before she understood what I was asking for.

This is not what I expect from my favorite fast food destination.

Cobb County Chipotle... do better!!!!

Next!!!!!

Always a long line but they make the most filling bowls.  I never have to get them the side eye for skimping on the barbacoa.  I go between 11-11:20 or after the lunch crowd.  Parking is a bit tough but that's not their fault.  One of my favorite locations.

This location always runs out something or has a "shortage" of something. Why at 2 pm in the afternoon you've already run out of vinaigrette dressing or chips? It's absolutely ridiculous! The location off of Roswell Road is always fully stocked. Do better!

I would give Chipotle in general a 4-5 rating, but this particular Chipotle gets a little lower rating. Normally I am greeted with happy(ish) or at least faking it employees. This particular employee was incredibly rude. I sometimes get swamped at my job too but in my opinion, this doesn't give you the right to be rude to people who are keeping your business going- AKA the patrons. Also, the parking is dreadful. Seriously awful!!!

Ok. On to the food. It took me a good year of eating Chipotle before I found the combination that was so amazing I couldn't pass up. 
My combination (feel free to try! )
bowl: rice, chicken or steak, fajita veggies, sour cream, cheese, corn salsa, hot salsa, pico de gallo. Can't be beat.
I love Chipotle, but this location is slow, slow, slow!  Some type of training or staffing problem that they need to address.

Long lines and long waiting is expected here but the service more than makes up for it. Can say how nice the people are and how clean the seating area always is. Plus, never an issue with getting the best sweet tea in town. Love this place!!!

Terrible visit. ZERO STARS. They do not know how to properly prepare the food. My burrito was not wrapped at all making it impossible to eat, all of the contents spilled out. I called the restaurant back to let them know about their unacceptable service and the person on the phone had to have been the same idiot that threw the food in the bag. She had no remorse, did not care or offer an apology at all, and did not offer to comp my meal, nothing. This was a waste of my hard earned money. Also, parking at this location is very difficult. Save yourself the hastle and skip this shithole.

Chipotle is one of my go-to restaurants for lunch/dinner because their food tastes great, is hormone free/local when possible, and is relatively healthy and substantial for "fast food". I always get a version of a steak burrito bowl and when i'm being "bad" I'll get their delicious chips (beware, these have 450 calories).

I will say that this is the busiest Chipotle in the Southeast and you will almost always have to wait in line for a substantial amount of time. However, the end result of the food and friendly service is generally worth it if you're not in a big rush. Also, this means that your food is always completely fresh because they have to replenish their ingredients much more quickly.
No lemonade or iced tea. Sprite tasted like water. Food was good. Preparation below standard.

I like Chipotle and consider it to be perhaps the best fast-food type restaurant around, but this Chipotle is anything but fast during peak or near-peak hours, which is when we usually visit. We have had to wait for rice, and on more than one occasion, brown rice was unavailable unless willing to wait at least 15 min. Have not had to wait near as long at other Chipotle's. However, the food has always been very good, with good options for healthy eating, vegetarian or otherwise. Unless you order ahead or don't mind standing in line for 15min or more, avoid this one during peak hours.

Love this place. Of all the Chipotles around, this one is the best in my opinion. Very quick service and they're not shy on the amount. Keep in mind this place is almost always packed. There is outdoor seating though so, weather permitting, there is some expansion. So delicious!
