no complaints about the quality of food here. the staff prep your order with a smile. the only knock about this location is the super long line! i've been here a few times already at different times during the day and on all occasions, the line was extremely long; 20 min wait on average. nonetheless, good food and good service.

This Chipotle is CRAZY BUSY all the time. So if you're reading this and want a quick lunch, be ready to wait 15-20 minutes in line.

They definitely move people through their line, but as Kathleen M. says, it is BUSY. All. the. time.
I give Chipotle 5 stars. This location, 1. Rude employees, long lines and usually dirty. Really ruins the experience of delishness.

I must say that I enjoy eating Chipotle. In case you did not know, Chipotle is the first and only restaurant to go completely no-GMO. This location has the official sign to prove it! They pride themselves on severing sustainable meat and fresh veggies from local farmers! For that reason I recommend chipotle and encourage others to eat it as well. 

However, I am only giving THIS Chipotle 3 stars because I know that this was NOT Steve Ells's vision.

My neighborhood Chipotle is failing due to lack of cleanliness, inconsistency, and poor customer service. I understand being busy, but please be busy with a smile on your face. This location does not set the standard for fast casual dining.  It's definitely good to see a line, However, it also means that the staff could be a little more efficient. There is always a long line here, always! 

My strategy was to arrive right at 11am when the store opened for lunch, first problem was that the door didn't actually open until 11:03 and people were already waiting outside.  Why not open the door 5 minutes early instead? Second problem, why was the customer service not friendly during the opening hour? I'd like to suggest offering coffee for the employee so that they are a little more friendly at 11am.

Although I can't give any additional stars I would recommend that you try chipotle to form your own opinion, then let me know what you think. My past few experiences here on Cobb parkway were just mediocre.

My main complaint is that although I ordered online and arrived on time to pick up my online order, they could not seem to find my order. I waited 30 minutes and could have ordered out of the regular line faster than ordering online which is supposed to speed up the process. This was frustrating seeing as it was lunch time. When I received my order it was correct and I was able to enjoy my meal, but I don't know if the wait was worth it.

Very quick service, good food, and well priced for the amount of food. This chipotle is located off Cobb parkway next to chick fil A and corner bakery. I came for a quick dinner because I've been craving chipotle for a while since we don't have one in Chattanooga. Please change that. 
The line was a good 6-7 people deep but it took no time to get through it. I ordered a salad bowl with half chicken and steak with all of the goodies. The bowl was piled high. Eeek so excited. I also ordered some chips and queso to go since that was something that would be easy to eat while I'm driving but sadly i wasn't too impressed with it. The queso isn't your normal white cheese queso but it's a cheddar queso and it has peppers in it which i liked. It was fairly watery in my opinion and was just not what i expected. My chips also didn't taste fresh. That's something i wouldn't get again. I was also really disappointed because i didn't get any of the awesome vinaigrette for my salad. It's my favorite. Oh well there's always next time. The food was so fresh and still delicious without it but the vinaigrette does make it top notch in my opinion.

Like any Chipotle that you go to be prepared for a wait! If you make it to this location before 8 there's a good chance that only a few people will be waiting in line (by a few, I mean 5 or 6 people ahead of you). I had to give them 4 stars because sometimes my food isn't as hot as I would like it to be. The service is great and they always remember me and try to keep up with my very unique order.

Love me some chipotle burritos. if you've never had it...get it. And i promise you'll want another one.

Beware: their burritos are HUGE! so come hungry.

They were very slow, and the line was getting bigger and bigger. I feel like they are all inexperienced because they are all young and need a better leader or Manager pushing them to move faster. Oh and one of the girls made my burrito into a cubed blob . Meanwhile all of this was happening, everyone's food was just there in the counter getting cold

My Chipotle obsession has definitely been taken down a notch ever since my first encounter with this magnificent new-born baby sized burrito chain.  The first one I had ever been to was on Connecticut Ave in DC...this was like 9 yrs ago!  I remember it being like middle of the week around 8:00 and it was packed out!  I have probably literally been to over 20 different locations in the U.S. and they are all pretty much the same.  I chose to review this location since it is closest to my house and I frequent here the most...I've taken it down to about once every 6 weeks or so.  All of the staff here is very friendly, ingredients always fresh, and I never leave disappointed!

I don't write many reviews but the experience was horrible. Fist time going to this location and last. Haven't been to a Chiptole in months but I was excited. Visited around 8pm on a Sunday and the line was wrapped around the restaurant. After 15 mins i reached the front where I the food bar was visibly soiled. Nobody had attempted to wipe down or change gloves between orders. I had to shout aloud my ingredients because the girl couldn't hear or understand. When I cashed out and went to the soda fountain there was ice everywhere. Food was below luke warm when I got home. Just a below acceptable experience.

First let me say when they have all the toppings the food is great. More than 90% of the time when I come here they are out of a few dofferent items.. Tonight I came to get a veggie burrito bowl to go. The door said "sorry we are out of chips" (In my head I'm thinking coooool not ordering chips, always am squinting as I walk up to door hoping it doesnt say out of guac or salsa, I ALWAYS expect it to read out of ......). I order a burrito bowl with veggies n a side of guac ( guac is free with veggie bowl, I guess in place of meat). They are out of chopped veggies and also out of guac...this is what my bowl is primarily made of and guac is 2 extra dollars if not included in bowl, so I am getting ripped off majorly if my veggie bowl has no veggies or guac!  I got upset and asked to speak with manager and let him know that it always seems they are out of something when I come here, I have expressed this many times to this same manager who is always very pleasant to speak with but he has blamed it on the previous nights prep team, today it was the delivery truck, whatever it is I wish they would fix it. Its almost to the point where I feel the need to call them ahead of time to make sure they have all the toppings available and that is not how a restaurant should operate! I lived in Duluth and went to the Chipolte off of Pleasant Hill for many years and never had this problem!!! The manager gave me 2 buy one get one coupons which is pretty pointless to me bc I live alone ( dnt enjoy chipolte warmed up) work in Woodstock and there is no Chipolte close for me and a coworker to take advantage of this coupon. I never write reviews and I feel bad to bash this location because the manager is always so nice but I have been coming to this location over a year and this is an ongoing issue!!! One last thing the employees seem miserable!!! They know how busy it gets and if they dont enjoy the fast pace enviorment then they should work elsewhere, its like you are bothering them to ask for something. As noted earlier Managers are always nice.

First let me warn you, this shopping plaza is always crowded so it's a challenge to find parking.  Then, when you get inside, you may have to go back outside just to make your way to the end of the line for ordering.  The staff at Chipotle must drink gallons of energy drinks just to keep up - they're always rushing you to order! order! order!  They don't listen to you when you ARE ordering because they're adrenaline is pumping so fast.  Just have a lot of patience when you go here.

12:30 pm lunch time and the service is slow they are out of steak and chicken and when I ask "how long will the steak take" the girl behind the counter said... "don't know we ran out and it's cooking but we have pork ready" 
Fine I will do the pork and after all of that there are no utensils. 

Really... come on.

I'm pretty sure this Chipolte always has a line. I went around 2:30 on a Saturday and the line was 3/4 to the door.

I understand completely what it is like to work in a very busy fast food environment, but that's no excuse for providing lackluster service. The lady who first took the order was acting like she was just herding cattle around. She was sloppy because of this and really didn't provide good service. The rest of the team seemed a little bit nicer, but you could also tell them seemed overwhelmed. 

Otherwise, the burritos are pretty good. They definitely have fresh ingredients, but I wish they had more selection.

This location used to be really good, not sure what happened. The ladies on the serving lines were not pleasant at all. They were sloping the food
On the plate in the least desirable way possible. Their attitudes were really terrible. I paid and got halfway up the road before I realized my burrito bowl had saturated the bottom of the container and the juice from the corn ( that was not drained off) was all over my seats. The bag was soaked and ripped. It was a mess. Then I get home and the rice is not cooked completely (never had this issue). I would never return to this location.

I travel a lot and go here many times a year.  I will eat at this place at least once in the week I am there.  It is very busy so sometimes I will order online.

Always friendly with good portions.  It's how Chipotle should work.  Kudos to this Chipotle.  Thanks.

I dont understand why this place stays so busy....you would think by the way this place is PACKED  the food would be amazing.

It's pretty much bland tex-mex served cafeteria style.  I sometimes end up eating here because I always have coworkers that LOVE this place, so I usually just go and it is a way to fill my belly, but nothing spectacular.

The most bland burrito I have ever had. Pork had no flavor whatsoever, as well as salsa and paltry few other toppings available. Not worth the 7$ I paid. This is what a burrito would taste like if they served them on a plane...The music sounded like what you would hear at a trendy clothing store, and was very loud.

If it's 10:50am, and I see no one in line, and you say you open at eleven, and I decide to wait outside because the weather is nice:  1) don't lock the door behind me, and 2) don't unlock it later with already a dozen people in line. (Where did they come from?  The place was empty a moment ago.  Why weren't they out enjoying the weather with me?)  And once I'm finally at the counter, placing an order of delicious Chipotle food for myself and my friends, please don't act like you're doing me a favor.  Especially when you're skimping on my burrito.  I want the thing to be bulging at the seams--as I've come to expect.  I mean, I appreciate the well-oiled machine you seem to have at this store, but I'd hate to be inconveniencing you or anything.  I remain a fan of the food, but I can do without the attitude.
The worst customer service! Trash on the floor! Slow! My first AND last visit to this location.

I love chipotle. The barbacoa burrito is the best. They've had some issues in certain stores in the past, but I never had any problems so all has been forgiven on my end. 

But this location is a hit or miss. And recently it's been more miss. The line is long during lunch hours and I'm totally fine with that. But this time I had to repeat myself several times because the person taking my order was not focused. I had to wait for them to make more fajita vegetables, which I was fine with. But when the fresh stuff came out, the lady dumped the oily leftovers from the pan on my burrito and put the fresh stuff in. I didn't even get any of it. (Why did I even have to wait, then?) 

The amount of meat I got was less than can fit in my palm. And maybe everyone needs retraining as to how to wrap burritos better. I actually would've been fine with all of that if everyone had been present, making eye contact, and responding to me. But you could tell everyone was distracted. (I dealt with 4 different ppl as I walked down the line.) Maybe they need to hire more people? Idk. 

Next time, I'll go to the chick fil a right beside it.

This location is a complete mess.  This might have been the last time I eat Chipotle, and that says a lot because I've been a defender of the brand for over a decade.

Most times when we go in, the line is out the door.  The employees look overwhelmed, and the dining area is an absolute disaster.  Tables that NO ONE wants to sit at, and the trash is overflowing.  We've tried doing to-go orders from here, but they have consistently left items off of the order or just flat out prepared the items incorrectly.  We even tried delivery, and they simply failed to pack my daughter's kid's meal. Oh, and they are ALWAYS out of something.

We went tonight, and the line wasn't bad, but the restaurant looked to be in shambles.  This was at 4:40pm....not even dinner time yet.  Had they not cleaned since lunch?  Trash overflowing, dirty tables...simply disgusting.  No forks. This is why everyone gets it to go.  To top the whole visit off, they were out of peppers and onions (again, BEFORE the dinner rush), AND our three meals are basically inedible because the rice tastes ONLY of lime juice.

I want it to be clear how much of a fan of Chipotle I have been over the years, and how I've tried to stick through the rough visits over the past few months, but I just don't think I can.  This place needs a complete overhaul, and it is really embarrassing on a lot of levels.  Consumers will only put up with so much, and we really are reaching our breaking point with this circus of a restaurant.  Chipotle used to be (I mean years ago) so consistently delicious and FAST.  What in the world has happened?

650 calories , its the best Burrito I prefer,
Also love the taste and quick service as well !!

Red headed bearded guy on the service line is a total jerk. Je should be reprimanded for the way he talks to people. It's also not sanitary for him to have all of that hair hovering over the food. #timetofindanewchipotle

I decided to try chipotles because i heard good things about it and after visiting this location i was hooked. The food was fresh and great.  A week after i visited i was craving it again;however, Chipotles isn't close by my house. I decided to go to Willys, which was no comparison and tried Moe's the next day which was worse.. There is no place like Chipotles.

I love doing mobile orders. My card is already set up in their system, which really makes it convenient. I placed an order at 9:31pm to be ready at 9:45pm. Then all I have to do is rush there to pick up before closing time at 10pm.  

My order never really varies. I get a salad with chicken, but the toppings change depending on how clean I'm eating at the time. My most unhealthy days include white rice, black beans, sautéed onions/peppers, corn salsa, pico, sour cream, and cheese. When I'm eating clean I just lose the cheese and sour cream and I promise it's just as good. Just make sure you get a chipotle salad dressing or 2. Now that's what makes the meal. 

The total is about $7 and it's always enough for 2 meals. Stores well in the fridge and I just pop in the microwave when it's time to eat again. This location gets 4stars just because there is something noticeable different the way the perimeter mall location seasons their chicken that makes it tastier, but I live over here so I have to settle for this most of the time.

I love Chipotle food, but their location and their parking lot make this particular restaurant awful. Too congested, too many blindspots, and too many fast food chains next to it. Not worth driving to this location.
First for me - out of guacamole? Tomatoes? Seems like an inventory and forecasting issue. They really need 'The Profit' here. Can't ride on fresh ingredients soley.

Chipotle has really created a monster out of me. 

The lines are literally anywhere from 15-50 people every single time I visit (which is pretty damn often). 

Solution? Online ordering! Not just any online ordering, a process that is worthy of a Nobel Peace prize. 

Check it out-- all you have to do is create you account and you're set. You can save your favorite meals/combos, and it even remembers the last thing you ordered. You can also save your credit card info so that you don't even have to bother with paying in-store. Then you can select your pickup times (as soon as 10 minutes!). This is really helpful during the dreadful lunch rush where you end up spending 3/4 of your lunch period driving and standing in line. 

Trust me, it's such as great feeling to waltz in, bypass the neverending line of hungry Chipotle-grubbers, give your name to the cashier, and BAM! Food! It's always hot and fresh and ready on time. They have not failed me yet. 

Chip, chip, chooraaayy!!

Usually i don't go to any fast foods, i don't like them. I like to seat at my table, and have my homemade pasta :)

But sometimes i like to eat a burrito, and chipotle is really good! Even the place doesn't look like a typical fast food, it's like.... modern! 

I don't know if the food is real mexican (i'm italian :)  ), anyway i like it!


p.s.: i can't rate a fast food more than 3 star :)

Chipotle is always busy but surprisingly last Friday around 2:30 it wasn't, with only 3 of us in line. Which is why I was more disappointed by the lack of respect and customer service an older gentleman got. The gentleman in front of me, tells the server it's his 1st time in Chipotle and doesn't know how to order, plus he has a $5 certificate of some sort. The server misheard him when he asked for a burrito and gave him a bowl. The server closer to the register gave him attitude the whole time she was preparing his meal. When he requested for the tortilla. She then turns around and tells the cashier in Spanish "ugh he now wants a burrito" as if it was the gentleman's fault.  She rolls her eyes, asks in Spanish for a tortilla then dumps his bowl into the tortilla by the register. It was obvious he was confused by this. This is not how you treat customers especially older ones.

I've noticed that if I don't go at the right times and/or get the right people, my burrito bowl is HORRIBLY skimped on.  I mean sometimes I'll get heaping tong-fuls of meat and then sometimes just a drizzle.  Then they wanna give me a half a dollop of sour cream and a half-hearted sprinkle of cheese.  I'm getting sick of this.  I know they recognize me.  What's the deal Chipotle?  Offenders I WILL learn your names and expose you to the Yelp community.

Worst Chipotle I've ever been to. People who made online orders piling up around the register while the line to order was wrapped around the restaurant before 6pm. I waited for close to 45 minutes before I got my food. The workers were chatting with each other and texting behind the counter without paying any attention to the customers. Every table nasty.. I could go on. It's unfortunate that this is the closest one to where I live.
Tried it when they first opened & was not thrilled with the burito. Years later and the burito bowl is a favorite of mine.

We eat at various chipotle locations about once a week.  This particular location was beyond filthy. The ladies bathroom toilet appeared to have not been cleaned in weeks, no paper towels.  All 5 trash cans by the door were completely full before 6pm.  Left from lunch rush?  
The food wasn't nearly warm enough. 

It's a shame management doesn't keep up with the cleanliness of the restaurant when it's clear people enjoy the food.
Pretty disappointed to go to this location tonight and find they were out of chicken, black beans, and chips.

I've been eating here once a week on ny lunch break for almost 2 years. The line is always long but moves quickly(I order online and pickup now anyways). The food is always fresh, they always fill up my bowl, and it is always consistently good. I think Chipotle is much better than Moes.

The food is good and  the restaurant is clean. My biggest complaint is how SLOW the service is. I've been here multiple times and have walked out the door because of the line. I've seen other customers do the same thing. 
I'm standing in line now and see the cashier just standing there waiting on the food line. 
Improve your time of delivery and I will give 4 stars.

MOLD alert!!!
This place has a mold issue.  Those that wait in line will see the moisture in their bottom right side on the steel panels.  This will be the last time I come here, so beware

I used to hate Chipotle. They gave no free chips, and their selection of burrito stuffings was lacking. What a load of crap. Therefore, I always ventured to Willy's for my chain-restaurant, Southwestern styled burrito (don't get me started about Moe's--the worst of the 3). 

Recently, I've been going to Chipotle a lot more--due to my wife's urgings. And it's starting to grow on me. Actually it grew on me a lot. I prefer this place to Willy's now. 

Why? The meats taste slightly better. I love their pork. Also, they serve steamed rice with their burrito (although I doubt it's healthier for you, they probably use a ton of salt in their steamed rice). Some people hate the rice, I love the rice because I'm Asian.

They also give a choice between fajita style or beans style. I always choose fajita because I don't like to fart too much. And they have corn as a stuffing item. That also gives it an interesting taste and texture. Also, make sure to pay extra to get the guacamole in your burrito. That is the finishing touch. 

Now I don't mind the non-free chips. It's probably healthier for me not to eat those. But that's stretching it because these burritos, no matter which franchise you go to (Willy's, Chipotle, Moe's), is probably bad for you.

But hey, at least they taste good.

By far the worst Chipotle I have ever tried to visit. Major sporting event had just let out and line was long, but there was no urgency in the workers. At times only one person fillings orders. They kept running out of food and multiple times they completely stopped serving those in line to fulfill mobile orders. After.nearly 45 minutes my family gave up. WILL NEVER VISIT THIS CHIPOTLE EVER AGAIN.
Got a burrito bowl. The steak was too undercooked to eat. The rice was hard. Didn't get a receipt even. Forgot to give me the chips. When I got the chips, the chips were soggy. Disgusting.

Food is usually really good here, but at least half the time, the employees screw something up. They are rude. An example, on one occasion I went to pick up lunch for three or four people in my office. I interneted in the order for an hour and a half later, wired and went to pick it up at the prescribed time. Fifteen minutes of waiting in the online pickup line gets me to the register only to be informed that oops they hadn't started it because it was too big and I wanted to pay in store... Made me mad, but I see the reasoning... though I'm sure it was against company policy, if not an outright lie. Then I want to spliT it three ways (the company wasn't paying and we were busy, so I took everyone's cash or card), and they tell me no dice. I had to get a manager out there and waste another five or ten minutes just to pay them and have them act like I was the jerk. This is standard there. I've been there numerous times where the workers were lazy, unresponsive and unhappy to be there... won't help you out. I've waited tables, so I'm not some crazy demanding customer... always nice, usually even tip at a place like that, never complain or get mad except here. Today my wife goes back,.for the first time in forever, and they screw up her order, and wrong it up wrong... but I guess the old saying goes,"fool me for the umpteenth time, shame on me." The place needs a manager who has a good attitude so the employees will have one. I have to go to Moe's now for a convenient burrito that I won't like as much, but at least they're good people.
Stopped in to pick up dinner a few nights ago. The place was clean and efficient and the food was tasty. Solid fast food stop.

With all natural ingredients and a long line most of the time is worth the wait. Weather your getting the bowl or a burrito or a salad you'll send your tastebuds through the roof! I come here when I want a treat, a healthy treat I might add. The chips and guacamole are awesome but I think there can me a little too much salt on the chips.... The guac is amazing on burritos you much try it... The ppl preparing the food and taking your orders are polite and smiling always. I love this place... Makes for a nice sunny day or even a date.. Everyone loves this place....
They are as friendly as they can be. Its a busy location & the line moves pretty fast. Fresh ingredients & the guacamole is pretty good.

Chipotle is one of my favorite restaurants but this location is AWFUL! We've been going here for a year now hoping that our next visit will be better than the last! I can't remember the last time our food tasted good, warm, and fresh! 

-restaurant is filthy and not well kept
-rice is usually cold & stale tasting (and is never made with a consistent flavor of lime and cilantro
- chicken is often burnt, dried out, or cold
- they frequently undertook the beans 
-lines are ridiculously long and super SLOW moving- I recall waiting 40 minutes a few weeks ago
- trash cans are often over-flowing and napkins and utensils are rarely stocked


This location is a huge disappointment, unfortunately. I will not be going back.

Visited this location last night , the food was mediocre. I had tacos and a burrito, the meat wasn't seasoned very bland tasting. My burrito was filled with more rice than anything, you couldn't even detect the little bit of meat in there. It tasted like just a rice burrito. It was disappointing.
Very slow! Speed up service! There is no sense of urgency from the employees! They need extra help or something or at least people that move faster!

This was our second attempt to eat here, we tried a few months ago and the line was snaked around the restaurant so we ended up at Pollo Tropical. This time when we arrived there was no line, we were served quickly by polite employees though the cashier seemed a little flustered. My husband and I both had a tray to carry and were ushering our little ones while I was scanning the dining area for a place to sit. Any booth that was not occupied was covered in food, I finally found one clean looking table and we sat to eat. My husband and I enjoyed the food, commenting on the obvious freshness but we agreed we would not go out of our way to get it again. 
I took my daughter to the restroom and on my return, informed my husband that I would not be returning to that particular Chipotle, the ladies room was disgusting, only the fact that my 4 year old's situation was urgent induced me to use it. When we were leaving, my husband went to use the men's room and immediately returned and said "I will go find a run down gas station, it will be cleaner". He has worked in manufacturing and has been in some intense factories, if he couldn't handle it, it must have been really bad!

I usually have great service and fresh ingredients at 9/10 Chipotles I visit. Unfortunately, this location has let me down over and over. I've visited 3x and each time, they're either out of chips, out of the chile-lime vinagrette, or even out of soda flavors. 

The line is always out the door but not due to the popularity. It's mostly a backed up line with super slow service! The tables are always a mess as there's hardly anyone wiping them down or resetting chairs.

First time customer. The steak burrito was good and the guacamole and chips were terrific. Good food, not too expensive. Kinda like Zaxby's.
For "fast food", it was delicious and the food was pretty fresh.  I definitely recommend this restaurant.
They have an iPhone app to place orders with.  I didn't have time to try it while I was visiting Atlanta but that is pretty cool.

A Chipotle is a Chipotle is a Chipotle, no doubt about that. They're pretty cookie cutter, and this one does the job. But daaaang, is it crowded. All. the. time. And the line doesn't move especially fast. And sometimes you'll find more unclean tables than clean ones. 

But the burrito bowl is always tasty, and I love that they at least try to use humanely raised meat. And if you avoid the tortilla, rice, cheese, and sour cream, you can end up with a decently healthy meal. 

But $1.80 for a small scoop of guacamole?! Asinine. It's half the price at Willy's.
Horrible service, line ultra slow and rude cashiers. Spent over 30 mins in line. Dont come to this location

The food is usually very good, but the line usually sucks unless you get there before 11:40 or after 12:40... They do have online ordering capabilities which is very nice and convenient, but I find whenever I order online I get a bit less quality (more fillers like rice and beans and less meat). I've tried this many times and more often than not I find the online orders are lower quality. I'm a fan - like I said I love the food, I just wish it was easier to get a meal from them on my lunch break.

Horrible service, line ultra slow and rude cashiers. Spent over 30 mins in line. Dont come to this loc

Decided to give this location another chance, ordered online and came to pick up. They said it would be ready at 6. I'm here, it's not ready, they can't find the order. Looks like they are just starting to put it together. Rude employees and bad organization

I LOVE the steak Bowl. The steak has a little kick to it. I add the Pico and Corn Salsa and it's usually spicy enough.  This location isn't as consistent as the one in Buckhead on Piedmont.  A big complaint my coworkers had was no free chips.  That's fine by me.  Enough calories in the bowl.  I don't need more!

Online ordering is pointless. Ordering exactly what you want and how you want it would be great if that's what you actually got. Seems like they read the tickets and say "I'm going to throw something entirely different in your bowl and you'll be long gone before you realize it's wrong".

Maybe it's just me, but Chipotle is going downhill.  Biggest complain is the chip, too salty and stale.  Then the steak on my burrito bowl is way too chewy.  Don't get me wrong, the ingredients are still fresh.  But like some folks mentioned here, this particular Chipotle is not too clean.  Staffs are still very nice.  Way too packed with lots people leaving due to long waits, me included for several times.
This is ridiculous, the burritos are getting smaller everyday. I ordered two burritos and both of them came out looking like they've been shrunk.

Portions are super small... Even asked for a bit more and they gave me like two extra pieces of meat... Ingredients weren't ready for service even when it was out for a while, no one started on replenishing them until after it was asked for...

Overall, way too small portions...

This honestly was the worst chipotle experience I've ever had. First of all, when I walked in, the line was extremely long (as expected with dinner). However,what I didn't expect is that it would take 30 minutes for me to even get up front to order. It seemed as if they were short staffed. I got a carnitas salad for both my sister and I and when I asked for guac it was extremely brown (see my photo) like there wasn't enough lime juice. They were running out and didn't put the normal scoop so asked for the normal amount and the girl just stared at me. I also got a side of queso and requested the salad dressing. As I was checking out I could tell the cashier was mad about something because when a customer mentioned she forgot his chips she very loudly said "Jesus Christ" stormed into the back and re-emerged with a bag of chips.

As I was checking out she almost forgot the queso and i asked her to put it in my bag and she said "WHAT ELSE"

Ready to leave she gave me my change and I left. 

When we got to my sisters place it was a domino effect of wrong:
The salad dressing wasn't in the bag
The guac was brown
The carnitas were dangerously cold
And the queso was extremely gritty 
After a few bites I could tell how much water was in the bottom of the bowl from the watery rice and carnitas
Our chips had zero lime juice

I will never go back to this location. AWFUL

Out of chicken, chorizo and steak due to a technical difficulty? Why even open? This was an utter disappointment and in all my years of traveling around eating at different locations this was a first for me.
The only time I ate there, most of my food fell out of the tortilla.  Didn't like the overloading taste of the cilantro, either.

Much to my surprise this was delicious. Sunday lunch was packed. Be prepared to wait in line. The salad with chicken was good and typical of these places you pick what you want.  They had a decent selection of toppings but not as many options as Willy's. Good quick service place.

*disclaimer: not about the food* 

I don't typically go to Chipotle but I recently tried the Sofritas, so I wanted them tonight. When I approached the counter, along with other guests, I heard one of the cooks (with a long blonde hair in a ponytail) chastising the gentleman preparing the bowls on the front line for giving full scoops of meat for our entrees. The man in the front responded to the cook about giving little scoops and the cook responded "that's the point." As a customer waiting to be served, I can only imagine that this man was proposing that he was to "skimp" on the amount of meat that we were paying for and it would be quite unsettling if that's the "Chipotle" way. But beyond that, I found it to be quite unprofessional to address another employee that way in front of customers. That's beyond shameful and I also hope that isn't how employees are treated in this company. The gentleman was clearly bothered by the cook's comment and he walked away from the front line because of them. I don't think that I will be back to this location due to the unprofessionalism of the employees.

Always dependable - Chipotle.  This place stays busy, always a line.  But the food is always good.

Dependable.
Food and service were good. However, it looks like they have not cleaned the men restroom for weeks.

About 6 months ago i got frozen corn and hadn't returned until today and guess what. ..i got frozen corn again! !! Soon as i get out of work I will be returning 4 a refund and never coming back! !! This place is a joke. ..
every single time i come to this location they have "run out of soft flour tacos. like come on..... every single time. the inventory manager is clearlu clueless on how to do their job.
Nothing is worse than under seasoned food. This particular location never seems to put any salt in the guacamole or the rice. Makes for a sad burrito.

I placed a delivery order, and when I received my order I was missing the queso blanco I paid for and the tortilla chips I ordered were completely stale and inedible. When I tried to call the location where I ordered from, they wouldn't pick up at all. Bad food and terrible service

I'm a big Chipotle fan, but this is the worst I've been in. Trash was all over the floor, tables were dirty, and garbage cans were overflowing....and to make matters worse, the place smelled like a landfill. Time for new management.

Worst chipotle. They're always out of something. Today there is a sign on their door saying they're out of both corn salsa and fajita veggies. Every time I come here it's something else. Last time I came I had to wait 15 minutes for them to make chicken. Another time they didn't have guacamole. Get it together please. I drove here on my lunch break.

There is pure crack in Chipotle food.  I am a believer and no one can tell me different.  Why else would I need it in my life so bad?  Why else would the mere mention of the name send me into convulsions?  What other food I ask you can you eat for lunch and then turn around and crave even more for dinner?  

There is no money in my bank account because of Chipotle.  It doesn't help that I live a mile away, no not at all.  

In response to a previous reviewer, the food IS real.  If you look on the website the do take pride in supplying the best food they can.  The spicy barbacoa meat is my fav.  They heap it so high I can take half of it off and have an additional two meals later.  

At this particular location, the staff have always been SUPER friendly, nice, and accomodating.  I even got free guacamole once!  That's bananas!.. or avocados..  

Anyways.  If I wasn't poor I'd go snatch up some Chipotle right now.  

Chip chip, chooraaaayyy!!!! Can I give this 10 stars?

I recently order from this store, and my order was the worst. I normally don't order online but due to the Covid 19 situation I had no choice. I ordered 3 bowls my order I had extra chicken and extra cheese which I paid extra for. When I got home to eat I see that I had neither. My wife then check her bowl which she had the Barbacoa meat and her meat wasn't cut up or nothing. The meat should have been pull meat but it was one big piece of meat. I spoke to the manager and she offered to remake my order but after the experience I will never go back to this location ever again

Want to give zero stars! Ordered at 7:10pm through the app. Food was delivered at 7:45pm. The store gave the driver the wrong order. After 8 calls to get in contact with the store, a "supervisor" answered. When I explained that they delivered the wrong order, I was told they could remake the food or call corporate to get a refund in 3-5 business days. I told them to remake the order, BUT I had to pick it up myself despite paying for it to be delivered. Furthermore, when I arrived to pick up my food at 830pm- it was cold and they were out of guacamole that was to be with my order from an hr and a half ago. 

Absolutely will be contacting corporate to not only get a full refund but to make sure the necessary changes in the lack of customer service is fixed! The fact that there are hundreds of reviews of which are all similar in nature, should tell corporate it is time to either shut this location down or to fire everyone and start a clean slate! This store is HORRIBLE.

Line was ridiculously long and slow. Finally got to make the order only to see the serving stations were disgusting and dirty. The dirtiest location i've ever been to. The guac was brown and flavorless, the rice was flavorless and the pico actually just tasted like fresh tomatoes. They really need to hire a new chef ASAP.

This chipotle is so slow! At one point no one was behind the counter to help anyone. After our food was done, we stood by the register for a bit bc no one was there. Also, the workers were rude. Overall, just bad.
It used to be good. Now the quality got drastically reduced along with behavior of the peoples/servers. The quantity of meat (chicken) also reduced significantly.

This review is specific to the 2973 B Cobb Pkwy, Atlanta, GA location.

We are Chipotle regulars, so when passing through the Atlanta area we located this one for lunch. We were hungry and our tastebuds were ready for it. It was well past the lunch rush, and apparently they had been slammed, because as we approached the front door we were greeted with a huge overflowing trash can (for the outside eating area). It was literally packed down and spilling into a huge pile of trash on the floor, which people had to step through to get in. As we entered, we again saw several overflowing trash receptacles and trash on the floor surrounding them all. There was also trash all over tables and the floor in the dining area. (I suppose, because people figured what's the point of trying to put in the trash bin). It smelled bad and there was no visible employee making any effort to clean.

Since we had been on the road many hours, I needed to use the restroom before ordering. Big mistake. Disgusting and piled up with trash, dirty toilets, sinks, floors... everything. But the on a positive note... there was hot water, soap and paper towels. At this point, I decided the kitchen would obviously be equally repuslive, and I completely lost my appetite.  I decided to go next door to the Corner Bakery Cafe, which was clean, had no line and very friendly staff. I got one of the best salads I have had in a long time. 

My teenage son and nephew decided to stay at Chipotle and they said it was edible, but definitely not what they hoped for. 

Management: hire extra staff for the rush hours, train them how to clean and maintain to an acceptable level, and have a little more pride in your restaurant.

Yo these people don't ever answer the phone ... Every time I call them, multiple times. Idk who's manger here but they need to get fired for letting this kind of customer service happen. I don't wanna hear about it being "too busy" Bc I've seen super busy Chipotle's answer the phone while I've been in line... literally just trying to add a vinegarette side with lemons to my order I already placed with postmates... I'm so mad

Typical Chipotle. It's basically identical to all the other locations I've ever been.

However, if you're in a hurry, I advise going elsewhere as there's always a long line and it moves rather slowly. They really need to double the number of people on the food assembly line, especially during lunch.

I like Chipotle in general but this particular one is awful. The turn over of managers is too frequent and the problems are too many to have them not know about the previous problems. If you have a choice, go to a different Chipotle.

This was the worst experience. I placed an order on the app at 7:00 and it was to be ready at 7:15. I got there at 7:10 and didn't get my food until 7:50. I would not recommend this location to anyone. They continued to make orders for the people in line and didn't start making my food until I asked about it. I was waiting with many other people that placed orders on the app. The guy in front of me said his order was supposed to be ready at 7:00 and he left when I did. This is not how you run a restaurant. I would suggest a better system for orders placed in the app. I will not be returning to this location.

save your money!!!!!!!! save your money!!!! this chipotle is absolutely disgusting. rice had no taste at all!! none!!! the black beans were dry.  the taste all together was dismal. just so gross. please dont go here please!!!!!!!  save yourself the trouble. this location needs to be shutdown immediately, sorry not sorry!

Food is good, but if you get a bowl large bag of chips should come with it. I don't like that you have to pay for a chip bag with veggie bowl. Wish they had more choices like portabello mushrooms, red onions, spinach and vegan cheese. More of a REAL VEGAN options not cooked near meat. Love the new organic drinks, wish Chipotle wasn't a la carte and we have combo options. Becomes expensive close to twenty dollars just for bowl with queso, chips and drinks. I love Moe's because of their better options and free chips, but I love Chipotle lime chips.
Cold food. Dirty smelly bathrooms. Empty hand sanitizers. In a place known for transmitting viruses to its customers? Not good for Chipotle.

Service was poor, burrito was wrapped horribly. Definitely would not recommend this place to anybody. I'm NEVER the one to ever put in a review but this has been my second time going here and it was so busy (not because of how popular it is, but because of how slow they are). My friend put in a QR code to get some free chips and guacamole and they still charged him for it...

All week I couldn't stop thinking about going to Chipotle. When I finally got there I couldn't help but be very disappointed. We were welcomed with a sign on the door that read they were out of guacamole! We didn't let that stop us. We walked inside and the line was insane (typical but usually moves fast in other Chipotles). When we finally got to the front we were greeted by two very unfriendly workers that were moving in slow motion. Our food was not up to regular- Chipotle- standards. My rice was crunchy from being undercooked. My chips were hard and old. Will probably not be visiting this location again.

Ordered on app and drove to location to pick up... order to be ready 15 minutes from the time the order was placed... get to location for pick up not ready... thirty minutes later ... YES... thirty minutes later when i ask for my money to be refunded. Since food has not even been started I am told that i have to call corporate???? Umm no... you have not fulfilled my order nor started it. Finally someone got a supervisor and money was refunded... 

It seems this locations has no organization nor a supervisor to give direction. App orders are made in a make shift area that is not organized and all items are transported from the main food area open for cross contamination from what I can see. 

Corporate needs to get a hold of this location to improve on turn over on food delivery  - people do not want to wait 30+ minutes for their food.

Hair Strands Found in Food!! I've visited this chipotle several times as it is closest to me. I usually purchase the bowl which does not disappoint; however, this time I purchased the bowl with the plan to include it in my meal prep for the next 2 days. This involved actually taking the contents out of its original bowl and placing it in a white plate. To my surprise I noticed several hair stands in my bowl as I was eating. Honestly I'm ok with 1 or 2 small strand la but 5-7, ABSOLUTELY NOT!! I would've probably never noticed it until the food was placed on the plate which caused the strands to stand out. Not sure if this happens often as I've never noticed hair in my food before but I suggest taking the contents out of their container and unto a plate and pick through the food to make sure it's clean. I don't believe they wear hair nets, just hats. Also, I would've explained this to the manager but they weren't answering phone calls.

I'm not coming back till quarantine is over. I decided. Like wtf is this the guacamole is brown they didn't even fill the bowl they sprinkle cheese and there's no way to customize your order online and what little they give you is limited. Really I want my money back

Giving this three stars due to how dirty it was inside the Chipotle. The gentleman who made my burrito was awesome.  The woman ringing me up was a different story. I asked her if people ever say anything about how dirty it is in here and she said no. She said when it's busy they have no time to clean up, said they just can't be stopping to clean up. I'm like yea, okay. She should have had a better response. There were me and two other people in line, wasn't busy at all. The bean juice looked so dry that it seemed as though it had been sitting for a while. The rice and meat were everywhere. I would think they would do a better job of keeping things tidy. I've been to places that were ten times busier and they managed to keep it clean. Also, I've worked in food service before, a restaurant looking clean is a huge plus in my book. Just something to think about if visiting this location.

I did a mobile order which makes it convenient. When I arrived, my food still wasn't ready and I arrived a few minutes after the order time. I just figured they were busy. I still got my food and it was great. BUT, the store itself was disgusting. Most of the tables had not been wiped off and here food remains all over the place. It was the same with the patio area. The floor had napkins and food all over it and all the trash can we're full to overflowing. It made no sense that this store has gotten worse. I hope management gets it together and get the place looking better.

Chipotle is awesome.  This location is extremely busy because it's in the Cumberland mall area.  The line is long most of the time. 
The best thing you can do is Order Online for any location.  I still had to wait here,  but it's just easier.
Parking is horrible so be prepared to park at a distance and walk. 
This location is clean and well staffed to keep the line moving. 
Been here three times since working in the area and when ordering my burrito bowl it's been overflowing with yumminess.  No complaints.

Oh gosh, the worst customer service especially during lunch. Like McDonalds sub-par level of service. The only person smiling was the young lady at the register. I'm kind of disappointed to even eat my food. I'm not even the type of person to leave bad reviews, but the management needs to know and make efforts to do better.

I'm always a fan of Chipotle's food, but OMG this location is always PACKED!  It must have taken 20+ minutes to get through the line at 7:30 at night on a Saturday.  WOW.  And they even had 5 people on the line!

I'm a fan of the chicken, steak and carnitas.  I'm usually a burrito bowl fan, but this trip I got the tacos.  I was pleasantly surprised and wondered why I had not tried them before.  I got the brown cilantro rice, steak, corn salsa, cheese, guacamole, sour cream and lettuce.  They do charge extra for the guac, but I don't mind because it is quite delicious.

I skipped the side order of chips (since I ended up with 3 flour tortillas by picking tacos), but got an iced tea.  However, both tea urns had sweet tea in them - RUDE.  Someone was not paying attention in the kitchen.  Usually not a fan of sweet tea, I didn't mind it so much since the steak is so spicy.

This location is kept super clean.  They turn over the tables quickly and someone is always coming through the dining room and making sure the tables have been wiped down and ready for the next group to sit down.  Despite the delays in getting to the front to order, everything else they do is quick and on point.  Plus, they have a good-sized dining room to accomodate and a lot of outside seating - which is great unless it's raining.

How do you run out of guacamole on National Avocado Day?! This location is ALWAYS out of guac, or something,  or several things smh. One time they ran out of cheese. Almost every item on the menu has cheese on it! This location is pathetic & needs to do better. It really sucks because they don't seem to care and it's the closest one to the house smh.
Terrible service and manager is very rude. When they messed up my DoorDash order they sent me this.

Oh Chipotle, I've missed you.

Walked in right before the long lines started, hurray for me. Place was clean, service was quick. 

Got the veggie burrito filled with rice, beans, cheese, lettuce, banana peppers, jalapenos, corn salsa, hot salsa, and crack. 

Added chips and salsa, and that was lunch and dinner. Awesome.

This is my first time coming to a Chipotle and it was quite the experience. My coworker mentioned earlier that week that he had been there and so when Friday our payday came, we decided to get some tasty food from Chipotle. We went during the rush around noonish. Lots and lots of people were there, but the line moved fast. Please know what the heck you are going to order before hand if at all possible. The people taking my order and fixing my order looked a little bothered that I did not know how to order. 
I was glad that was over and excited to try it. I have heard about the guac and wanted some. It seems to me that with some orders guac should be included, but that is just my opinion. We arrived back at the office and I dived in. The food was very tasty especially the guac. I really will go back for the guac. It was just shy of mine and mine is wonderful if you ask me:)

This store is great. The Chorizo is always delicious, the team is always incredibly attentive, and they're always smiling! This store is one of my favorite stores as you can tell that the team works well together through a clean store and the effortless teamwork that's put forth on the line. 

Couldn't ask for a better Chipotle across the street from my work.

WORST wait time I have ever experienced. I waited 35 minutes for a burrito bowl. Insane. It was one girl holding up the line. She honestly looked stoned out of her mind. Surprised if she doesn't get fired soon. Go to the chipotle off Howell Mill. Only ten minutes from this area and FAST!

I was not impressed with the customer service at this location. It seems it's a social club for teenagers and young 20's workers. I stood in line waiting to be greeted by the man for a few minutes. At least acknowledge your customer. Horrible

What's less than one star. I tried to give them another chance but they don't seem to understand online order.  I had made an order to be ready at 545. I got there at 555. No bag with my name on it ready. I asked the lady. She said ok. Then proceeded to ignore me and work on everyone order but mine. I asked again and stated I do not have my order. She asked the name again. She ignored it. I asked again she replies I don't see it. I said my full name again she found it finally. Then waited to check someone else out then hand my order to the back. 5 orders were done before he started on my order. I walked in with a couple who waited in line and we left at the same time. Brett is who printed the receipt at 5:58 pm. DO NOT come here unless you have time to waste due to the lack of customer service or urgency or care for online orders also check the order because the lady in front of me was missing a drink and she stated they were out but was going to let her walk out without it.

This place is ALWAYS a disaster now - the "line" is soooo dirty!!!  I understand the line of people can be longer but this is horrible and 2nd time I have seen it like this.  Time to NEVER come back to this

I think I'm finally done with Chipotle at this location...maybe period. The quality of food has gone down DRAMATICALLY. Under cooked rice and tomato salsa that is basically chopped tomatoes. Overall the bowl had NO flavor. Disappointing.

Very poor customer service! A friend of mine came over and had gotten a burrito bowl with saffrito as her protein. When she opened it,  it was just rice and veggies,  they forgot her saffrito. We went back and I was going to order food also,  after waiting in the line for 20 minutes,  we reach the make your order station and she shows her bowl and receipt explaining what happened and the guy tells her to take it to the cashier. As she is doing that I am putting together my bowl and she had spoken with the cashier but my friend was still waiting there with her original order and no assistance. after I check out,  we asked the cashier she said she believed the order was coming up but continued to ignore us and rang people up. At this point we had been there over 30 minutes and no one assisted her. I ask for the manager,  who comes and write in front of us "whispers" to the cashier what's the problem... She pointed to us and said ask them like we were not a foot away from them. He asked and as we were explaining,  apparently he saw the order that was sitting there and just handed it to us. No apology,  didn't even finish explaining what happened. Very disappointed in the customer service. This place is around the corner from my place and I will never go there again.

I absolutely love me some Chipotle and have visited multiple locations, but this one is by far my favorite one. I con to this at least 3 times a month and other locations makes my monthly trip to Chipotle approach 10 times month... literally.

The staff is nice and the food is always fresh! This place will always get five stars  from me!

P.S. if you ask, you can get double and triple meat

The customer service here sucks. I love chipotle. I have been a guest at this location for a little over 2 years. But today is the day I want to express how I truly feel. 

It's 2:30pm April 3, 2016. 

The girl who usually works the register is the first person I see starting my meal. She is fast paced, friendly, energetic. She is the only person who truly cares about the guests that walk through the door. 

However, the other employees working with her are absolutely rude. They do not smile, they do not make eye contact. They are unprofessional. I could feel the tension. I simply asked "how's your day going?" And in response I received "is that all for you today?" The lady in line next to me started giggling. I felt embarrassed and quickly paid for my meal to leave. This is the last time I visit this location. I'd rather drive a few extra miles to avoid this crew.

I frequent this chipotle as it is right by my work and apartment. I have worked in the food industry for years and never have I written a review, but when I find a cockroach in my meal I have to say something. What I thought was a piece of rice turned out to be the dead bug. I was already half way through my bowl and was sick to my stomach. Threw the rest away, obviously. This place needs a major cleaning and I will NOT be back.

Very disappointing.  The counters where the food was being prepared had not been wiped down in hours.  There were no clean tables in the restaurant.  The area where the drinks were to be served, was just disgusting.

We were there on a Monday night around 8 PM.  Even the grounds around the restaurant were filthy.Service was very slow even though there were many employees behind the counter.  

In everything that Chipotle has endured in the past, frankly it was shocking that there was so little attention to cleanliness.  We won't be back to this location.
We were hungry and this food was very good. The place is not fancy, some of the tables were dirty but the employees were courteous and it was a good value

UPDATE: they must of got a stern talking to, because it's 100x better this time, this is how it normally is and how it should be thanks 

I'm not coming back till quarantine is over. I decided. Like wtf is this the guacamole is brown they didn't even fill the bowl they sprinkle cheese and there's no way to customize your order online and what little they give you is limited. Really I want my money back

The girl working the veggies was extremely rude. I asked a question and she threw my food across the counter and ignored me. I was super shocked. The other guy mouthed "I'm sorry". Huh in the back was working the grill and blew his nose without washing his hands, me and my co-worker just looked at each other in disgust. Who is managing this place?

Everyone HAS a mask but I watched as multiple employees had their masks all the way below their chins.  One was unwrapping fresh food, while doing so.  A few others didn't cover their noses. Full with the mask.  Needless to say, my hot food will be heated again at home.  

I'll suffer the loss of the guacamole (that part stings a little).  I'd have requested a refund but, sadly, it didn't really look like anyone was in charge.

After giving this location 3 chances, this is by far the WORST Chipotle location I've ever been to. The first time I ordered a chicken burrito online and when I got here to pick it up, not only did they not make my order, but they were out of chicken AND steak....and they would not give me a refund. The machine is always down and I can't scan my rewards, use gift cards, etc. And the store itself is always dirty. Just a mess.

This location is the absolute the worst. Every single time that I ordered from them, something is wrong. Or is missing something from our order OR even if I've already ordered and paid from the app, when I got to the place THEY're closed without any notification. This is ridiculous.

Worst! 
Drove out of the way to get here. 
Waited in line 46 mins before I got my food. Only 8 people in front of me, but in between each person they were filling 5-10 to go orders. Infuriating.
Slowest service. Inexperienced prep line. Dirty bathrooms. Trash cans overflowing. Not good.

This place is crazy busy and for it to be this busy why oh why are there dirty tables that aren't being cleaned at all and even when we want to skip the line it takes 40 mins for two veggie bowls and chips and guacamole.

I can't give this Chipotle location ZERO stars or I would!  Steak was out, but fresh was "being cut"... 15 minutes later while two other entrees were being held hostage, there was enough for my two soggy soft tacos that had been sitting with fajita veggies in them.  I got attitude when I asked if I could get two fresh tortillas, even though they were visibily disintegrating.  This location's policy is that they can't cut a quesadilla, even though they were completely out of plastic knives for the customer to do it themself.  My kid's large cheese quesadilla then wasn't even melted, so they completely remade it 8 mins later.   No large lids; I overheard a man get irate that they couldn't provide a lid for his online (soft drink) order that he was about to transport in his car.  He asked about a refund, and they stated "they weren't allowed to do refunds, you have to contact corporate"!  Also out of chips, and two employees were debating on who should announce it to the 12+ and growing line out the door... neither did.

We should have walked out.  I'll never return, and Chipotle should close this franchise location.

Crowded and disgusting. A bunch of kids working there telling each other to shut up while the tattooed manager looks on. Running out of everything, dishes piling up and the patio littered with trash. An overall ratchet vibe. I bought the food and threw it away because despite the score the place didn't look clean. There was food all over the counters, the guacamole was brown and the sour cream had cheese in it. The trash cans were spilling over. Won't be stopping at this location ever again.

THE worst Chipotle experience and possibly one of the worst food experiences I've had. I don't know what is it about this shopping center that just sucks out all the service and good out of restaurants. 

I placed an order at 5:30pm for 6:00pm pickup. I arrive at 6:00pm, and the restaurant is a hot mess inside. The line of walk up customers is all around the inside of the building. There's only one cashier who's ringing them up and addressing pickup orders. There's already 2 people ahead of me still waiting on their food, and they said it's been like that for a while. 10 minutes passed and the cashier finally asked me what my name was. She eventually goes over to the receipt orders and gives it to the line prep member. It was not until 6:20pm that I finally have the food in hand. I should have just lined up in the first place; this completely defeated the purpose of ordering ahead to "skip" the line. I laughed when I looked back at my e-mail confirmation and saw "guaranteed" time of 6:00pm. 

During my 20 minute wait, I saw several customers walking back because they were missing items. I also saw complaints about the store being out of napkins, ice, and hot sauce. It was looked like a tornado came through parts of it, just messy all around. And throughout my interaction with the staff, never got a sorry or apology. Just hurriedly handed me my bag and off to the next person. It didn't seem like a manager was around either. No one to direct things, just a bunch of drones working non-stop (to their credit). 

I'll never come back to this location. I just had a much more pleasant mobile order the previous week at another Chipotle, so this is clearly a poorly ran location.

This place is pretty good n convenient as once a year we have a convention at the renaissance hotel. 

Place is nice and clean, the staff are quick and getting your order ready. 

The only thing is, their customer service need some improvement. They all look like they don't wanna be there, or they are just over it. Putting on a smile does go along way. I like that the food is consistent and they keep the line moving but don't be a grouch about it.  

That is why I'm giving this 3 stars instead of 4/5 cuz there is some room for improvement on customer service.

I LOVE THIS PLACE!!  I've been eating chipotle for almost as long as I can remember, I've been to so many locations. By far this is the best location I've been to.  The food here is outstanding along with great customer service, you can't beat it.

I've yet to step into this location and have a pleasant experience. I'm not quite sure who the manager is (considering I've yet to EVER see one) but good lord they need to be terminated and leave management positions as a whole. I've never come across such a poorly run, poorly maintained restaurant. I would never in my life eat at the dining room of this chipotle because I've yet to see it cleaned...... ever. You're guaranteed to wait in line at least 30 minutes and if you order online ahead of time there's a 50/50 chance they'll completely mess up your order. This has been ongoing for several months and nothing seems to change. The employees are unpleasant and they seem to struggle balancing online orders and people waiting in line. They need help and their manager seems to be nonexistent. We have no other options for chipotle in the area so we are forced to keep going back. Someone please help this chipotle turn things around

The appearance and condition of the Chipotle is absolutely disgusting. With all of the bad press, Chipotle has received over the last recent years, this location doesn't help.

It was so nasty from door to checkout, I didn't even want to order. But, it didn't stop me from making a few snaps before I left. 

We all know Chipotle is always slammed packed with customers, so it will not always be in pristine condition. This place had not been cleaned, swept, tables wiped down at least all day. I don't know how those dining in were able to do so. 

The food counters were spilling over with food. They ran out of lettuce. It was about 9:30 or 10. They close at 11, daily. I just hoped a shipment was coming in before the next day's lunch shift. I will not return to this location. I was completely turned off from the lack of cleanliness.

So I made this order off DoorDash at 8:45 Pm and when I tell you this is the 3rd time they missed my SALAD DRESSING & GUACAMOLE  

Seriously never going there or ordering food from this chipotle location. Very disappointed.
My door dash driver has been waiting at the store for over an hour because they're so far behind but still accepting orders.
Every time I visit this location it take a good 30-45 minutes to get through the line. It's always a mess and staff is rude, this is the slowest one I've ever been to!

Don't order on the App past 10, they won't have steak or chicken available and you'll end up finding out once you get there, they close at 11 but only make enough steak and chicken to last them till 10:15ish. Other than that, pretty fast and friendly team, other than not receiving the food i ordered through the app never really have had a bad customer service experience. Birds out on the patio love chips.

The worst chipotle in America!!! Whoever franchised this location is for sure putting more money in then it's actually making. The staff are all rude and sloppy. They throw your food together and damn near don't close the tops. Just a bad look for the company all together

What is the deal? 
Thought there must be something special about Chipotle given all the hype. It was unacceptably awful!!!
Arrived at appointed time to pick up food. No food for me or the other 25 people waiting for their to go orders. Not knowing, I asked the guy next to me "Is there something wrong?" He said: "Sometime it's ok, sometimes not".
I was about to find out what he meant. I checked the bag to insure everything was there. I looked at the labels saying "Two Tacos...." on the little aluminum trays. Problem was when we got home there was only one (more like a half of a taco) taco in the containers.
The queso was filled with flour and pretty inedible. The guacamole and chips were good. So dinner tonight was some chips and quacamole. 
All for only $23.
Terrible!
If you want anything resembling edible Mexican food, Chipotle isn't for you.

Be careful, they'll put ingredients on your burrito that cost extra and won't tell you they cost extra. I've been here twice recently. Both times, they pile all the cheese and sour cream in one spot. They add so little chicken that I just ate an entire burrito and didn't taste chicken at all. What happened to Chipotle?

I wish I had read these reviews before I visited. Every bad review that is left here is absolutely correct! From the cleanliness or lack there of to the lying manager and sorry customer service. I placed an online order for pickup at 12:15. Of course I had to wait when I got there along with 10 other people. I could've probably went through the regular line and got my food faster than the "convenient online ordering". After waiting while on a 30 minute lunch break, I came back to work to the wrong order. Label was correct but what was inside was not! I ordered a veggie bowl and received chicken and if you don't eat meat you know how upsetting this can be. I called the store literally 30 times, no one answered. By this time my lunch break is over, I haven't eaten and no one cares enough about their customers to answer the phone. Because no one answered, I drove back to the store. When I returned to the zoo of a restaurant, the manager told me he could not do a refund because I placed my order online.. LIES! He told me to call 1800CHIPOTLE to receive a refund.. LIES! 1-800-CHI-POTL is a hotline for catering and they direct any issues you have to the store. There is no customer service number to speak to a live person. When I came back in the store to confront them of their lies, suddenly they can refund my money through email from said manager Rebecca that never even came to the front to speak to me, she kept sending some nervous cashier that could barely keep up her line. I was told I would receive a refund in 3-5 days with no documentation of this being true, but if I don't.. guess who'll be back.
Their queso is very lame.  Tastes pretty much like Tostitos' chile con queso and that's not a compliment.  The Barbacoa beef should be checked for large pieces of fat.

So I got Chipotle for dinner for us on 7/24/2020; 7/30/2020; & 8/3/2020 and all those times the salsa is soggy and watered down, the chips are stale with no lime salt on them, and I had huge hunks of avocado in my bowl like the guac wasn't mixed good. It's really sad, because I've been a fan of Chipotle since they first opened years ago, but lately the food hasn't been good. 2973 Cobb Pkwy SE
Unit B
Atlanta, GA 30339
United States
This is the location we visited all three times. And I ordered thru the app so I have the receipts. The quality of the food is terrible and it makes no sense because I used to love this location.

I don't usually post many reviews of fast food yet the experiences I have had at this location have convinced me otherwise. The food at this location is subpar at best. The rice can be crunchy as a rock sometimes and the lettuce tastes as though it's been cycled day after day. If you are truly in desperate need of Tex mex cuisine and you find yourself stuck at this location you will most definitely walk out wishing you just went to the Chic Fila across the parking lot. The food is passable as edible but what makes this location the worst chipotle in existence is the atrocious customer service. If I could relate the customer service to anything I would say it's about the same level of customer service as a Popeyes. If you ever wanted to pay for your food and be given an attitude for coming in and inconveniencing the workers from their daily lives then by all means please come in to this location. The manager sits back and watches this disrespect cross his line and fails to lift a finger to reprimand his unruly employees. I would recommend for anyone wanting decent chipotle to avoid this location as though they were the last option. Go to anything else and you will be immensely happier with the service and food. Overall I'm surprised this location hasn't been turned into a Popeyes considering how rude they are to their customers.

If you know what i know you will never step foot in this location ever. Worse experience ever. The customer service deserves a negative star. And i went into this location around 8:45, knowing they do not close til 11. They were out of everything, did not have anything refilled. They had the worse attitude and the girl at the register pretty much turned her head on me and through the bag at me. No receipt or nothing. I work in customer service so i know how you should be treated. If i can do anything to better this location i will try my mite to have everyone fired here and start over with a whole new staff.

And the place it self was super disgusting. Like how are they even still open. There's no way they are passing inspection. Maybe you need to get DHEC out here.

The restaurant was in complete disarray and dirty. The trash was overflowing outside and almost overflowing inside. The outside patio had trash everywhere and the tables needed to be wiped off, as there was leftover food on them. There were birds everywhere eating the leftover food. The drink/utensil station had utensils and napkins everywhere (extremely messy) and needing refilling. The drink machine was overflowing with ice in the portion that collects any fallen liquid. I was told there were no trays left as you're normally given when dining in, but there were plenty of trays that the cashier just had not collected from the space above the trashcan. The restaurant was not busy, having only 5-6 patrons in there and I was the only person in line. And the food was lukewarm and the rice had no cilantro and was not seasoned and clumpy. I was very dissatisfied with my experience. 

I contacted Chipotle corporate and hope to receive a response back. I will provide an update if/when I do. In reading some the reviews, other patrons have had similar experiences. I will not return to this location.

Ok, I love me some Chipotle and I know I don't have any business eating rice.  I have gastro issues and rice makes my tummy swell, but for some reason I can't seem to stay away.  

The food here is extremely fresh.  The only complaint that I have is that the workers are pretty messy when serving the rice.  For the most part the guac is always available and the beans are cooked just right.  

I typically order via the app and my food is ready when I arrive.  This service is extremely helpful when you are in a hurry.  I pay via the app and I don't have to wait in a long line.  

I wish the team members would pay more attention to the soda area.  It can get a bit messy at times when the store is busy.  

Overall I like this spot, the food is great and I enjoy sitting and eating my meal alone.  I will definitely be back because I'm hooked.  If you are in the area, you should try it as well!

Older white guy at the register- might've been the manager- was a complete dick. All the staff are straight up rude, hostile, and clearly not well trained enough to deal with a simple lunch rush. Having worked in a restaurant myself, I know it's really not THAT hard being somewhat nice to customers. Try harder.

The food tastes the same. Nothing unique. But why it got a 2star was the customer service especially from the cashier was horrible with a splash of attitude. If I am going to pay money, I do not need any attitude to come with my food. This has not been the first time. I will most likely not go back, it's not like I can't get the same type of food and taste for cheaper at moe's or Willy's.

Really disappointed in this location. For starters the cook in the back was on the phone while the line was wrapped around the restaurant, which if they were not out of   Guacamole, chips,  &vinaigrette would have been looked over. On top of that, a guy Assuming an employee or a friend of the staff came in while the line was still wrapped around the restaurant and told the staff to make his order ahead of the paying customers waiting in line and about 10 mobile orders waiting to be made. Which they did! This is extremely DISTASTEFUL  I hope for better service next time.

They either need an entirely new crew or they need to just shut this location down. Unfortunately, it is close to my home and job so I go here by default. The only reason it gets one star is because I like the food. The restaurant is always dirty, the food stations are always low or out of something, and the majority of the employees have horrible attitudes. What's up with giving a friggin tablespoon of meat?? If I wanted a vegetarian bowl, I would've ordered one! They are very inconsistent with the different amounts of meat they give. The chips are ALWAYS stale! Who is the manager at this establishment and why don't these kids wear name tags?! Maybe if they did, there would be some accountability and less attitude.

I've always been a big fan of Chipotle, but this particular location is subpar at best.  Queso was cold, food tasted awful and the chips tasted like they were cooked three weeks ago.  What a waste of a cheat meal..... and to top it off, the cashier sneezed, didn't wash her hands and bagged my food and swiped my card..... it's flu season for heavens sake.
Sloooowest Chipotle ever! Never not a giant line because understaffed or slow moving workers.

If I could give them a zero I would. No fresh ingredients available and the brown rice is hard like rocks! I tried to call and speak with the manager but the phone until the message system picked up. Never going to that location ever again. This was my first and final visit!

Stopped in for a quick lunch on a Saturday afternoon. My meal was fine and the usual line moved quickly. However, my husband and I went to use the restrooms and they were so FILTHY we both walked out at the same time. I haven't seen a restroom so negligent in a long time. Based on the existing reviews, it seems cleanliness is a real issue at this location. Management needs to pay attention to all the recurring themes about cleanliness. I will not be back.

I love chipotle and have probably been to over 100 Chipotle's and this is one of the worst ones by far. I've thought about writing this review every time I'm here but I had a order for 3:45 and I'm still waiting at 4:18. Who ever the owner or store manager is you need some new staff and need to sit around and make sure they do their job. It's ridiculous at this point I've been here over 20 times and it's the same thing every time.

Last Friday I went to this location & they were out of corn, chipotle vinaigrette, sour cream, to name a few. The last two months every time I go in there, they are out of something. I plan to contact the mgr., I manage a restaurant so not quite sure what the problem is. This is a high volume store, let's order more product please
