My husband and I ordered two bowls through door dash at around 8pm on a Sunday. Half of our toppings were missing (sour cream, salsas, pick de Gallo) including the guacamole! I could do without the salsas but when we paid extra for guacamole, I expect it to be there. Even the lettuce we added, there were only sprinklings. Door dash was able to give us credit back for one of the bowls but since we ordered for delivery, I don't think Chipotle would have been able to rectify the situation. We will not be ordering through door dash or online from this location in the future. Reading the other reviews, we probably will not be visiting them in store either...

DO NOT EVEN CONSIDER GOING TO THIS LOCATION! There's a better one down the road in Buckhead that will offer better customer service and quality food. I only come here occasionally and each time I'm reminded of why this is never my first choice. Long lines, always out of something, and poor employees is what keeps me away. On 6/20/19 I had an employee tell me I need to be a man and speak up?? I clearly said I wanted a bowl to go. I didn't see the need for any disrespect when she did not even know me. I just laughed and kept it moving. This is my first review on any place in my 20 years of life and I felt like I needed to do this to help others avoid this sh*tty place.

Terrible first experience here! I recently started a new job in the area and decided to come for lunch bc they don't have a Chipotle where I'm from. I understand it was very busy bc of the lunch rush, but the employees at this location were just awful. Especially the cashier working at the time, she was extremely rude to both me and my friend and was even arguing with my friend about her meal bc of a mistake by the fault of her own coworkers. She was throwing our food around and literally threw the bags at us. Never greeted us, never told us to have a good day, just a horrible attitude. She should not be working at the register if she's going to be acting like that towards paying customers. I tried to get her name but she wasn't wearing a name tag. Will most likely never return to this location; it's a shame bc the food is actually amazing!

Food too salty!!! I feel like my blood pressure just rose 20%.  Underwhelmed with this location but thought I'd give it another try after last time when they lost my online order & had run out of guacamole. Workers could smile every once in awhile as well. Will try to avoid this location in the future.

Slow and unreliable. Third time I've made mobile orders as demanded by the restaurant and they still get backed up. There was one time previously that my mobile order took an additional hour to come out. Pathetic.

This location is the absolute worst. Every single time my husband and I order from them, something is completely wrong or just totally missing from our order. This has happened at least the past 3 times we have ordered from them. Unacceptable.

Went in Sunday match 3rd and got a burrito. The white guy with the red eye (if you've seen him before you know) was so upset that I started to top my burrito off with the lettuce and end with pico. He started yelling "YOU WENT BACKWARDS" then I just stood there and he said again "YOU REALLY WENT BACKWARDS" like It hurt him so much.... Just put the toppings on the burrito why are you so mad ? Lol. I just stood there smiling because he looked so dumb. So now that I know it bothers them I'm gonna do it every time. Stop hiring weirdos and this place would be a lot better. Also the food was not the best. Guacamole was not good and I had more tortilla then anything else.

Have been enjoying this particular Chipotle location for almost a decade, I would guess. The early days of Covid and modified operations were clunky, with some issues of quality and freshness. Also, so issues of time management around fulfilling orders. They got it worked out, but issues of freshness and cooking have cropped up again. The last burrito bowls we have ordered (weekly for the last month) have had consistently undercooked rice. Blechhh. Nothing like crunchy rice. GROSS. Plan better, slow down. Quality control and the eating experience matters!

Second time in a row this Chipotle has messed up my order. I ordered from them via DoorDash. Very simple order. Bowl with veggie fajita peppers, corn, black beans and guacamole. Nothing else. Last week they added a ton of cheese. I am vegan and specifically put no cheese. DoorDash gave me a five buck credit. Today they omitted the fajita peppers all together and added a ton of chicken. I called Chipotle directly several times and the phone rings several times before finally going to a busy signal and disconnecting. This is no way to operate a business. I would not recommend this place to anyone. Get your act together Chipotle!
This location continues to struggle with quality. Lettuce was brown, Guac was brown. Came after lunch and was busy. We've been here a bunch, this location not on a good trajectory.

My family and I love Chipotle. That is until I entered this location. What a terrible experience. The line was long, the service was slow, and the team behind the counter did not seem to be very well trained. Then, when we looked around, the garbages well over flowing and the bathrooms very dirty. Wow! Is there no one in charge? What a lousy experience.

Not sure I will ever go to Chipotle thanks to this location.  Received a bowl that I will call along came a spider...yes there was a live spider in my bowl.  When I returned girl at counter was rude and asked if I wanted another.  No ma'am im disgusted she then tells me to take the bag because "we cant do nun wit dat" well neither can I...ugh

This is the worst Chipotle that I've ever been. I ordered a togo bowl of brown rice, and the rice was not cooked AT ALL. I came home, and I could not eat the bowl. Everything looks dirty and disorganized.

The app is great for ordering ahead and picking up since you can't eat inside. One suggestion: have the person bringing out the order to the shelf call out names if there is a large group of people waiting. My order was ready 25 minutes late so I had a lot of time waiting and watching people. After every group of bags coming out from the kitchen, without fail,  there would be that one customer touching every bag looking for their name and a big group of people would herd around the shelf before the guy even unloaded the bags he brought out. Gross! Maybe update the app to where it would tell you that your bag is sitting on the shelf waiting or simply ask the employee to crowd control & call out names.

The order ahead is a nice convenience but it's turning out that there would be a lot less people breathing on top of each other by just using the regular line.
This is the absolute worst chipotle location. I will drive out of my way to not ever go to this location again

Just went to pick up my food, and found several employees wearing their masks on their necks, what's the purpose of wearing a mask if they're not covering their mouths and noses when preparing the food! Not coming back to this location! So disappointed!

I'm torn to write about this Chipotle location.  I've been coming here for several years and today I saw some unsanitary practices that grossed me out.

I know it's fast food and I like the fact that I can see how they are preparing the food.  I love their food and that it's healthier alternative.

Today, the servers/preparers were goofing around (nothing wrong with that) and were grabbing each others' arms etc.  But then NONE of them changed their gloves.  They all went back touching /serving food.  Hello - GROSS!!!

The cashier must have seen my face and asked...I told her and she made me a new salad.  The person behind me felt the same way.   Yet even after  this being brought to her attention she didn't ask the 4 servers to change the gloves.    

So if Chipotle is pitching good healthy food for you then why aren't they serving it in a SANITARY manner?

Delicious food at a great price!

First off anyone who actually eats in store has to be a sadomasochist. This place is insanely busy and noisy. There's always a long line. I always order and pay online and pick mine up.

Food:
The tacos are small but delicious. I always get the burrito bowl. It's the size of a small baby and so good! My favorite meat is with the pork. Last time they were out of pork at 11:30 a.m. So one star off for that. I add guac to mine. It's fresh and delicious!

Ordering/Picking up:
Easy peasy. I order and pay online. I go straight to the register for pickup and bypass all the fools waiting in line. 

Service:
The register people are super nice. I don't know how they handle everything so well with the noisiness and constant customers. 

Parking:
It stinks. I try and pickup around 11:30ish.

Walked in at 1205 pm. Employees were inside screaming and yelling but no one helped me. After 5 minutes a female came out and told me they were not open. When I asked why she laughed at me. If they were closed probably should have their doors locked. Ridiculous.

There's no warning that they're taking online orders. Okay cool maybe the machine isn't working right whatever. I'm now 10 minutes past the time my order is to be ready. That would be cool too if orders placed after mine were served already. The employees don't say anything at all. The restrooms are disgusting. Y'all aren't giving any customer service so the least you can do is clean the restroom. And now that I have my order it's incorrect. Luckily im gone because the I would've definitely gave them hell for it. Will be calling anyone that can come check for health violations or anything of the sort. Thanks

Terrible service. As soon as I walk in I see the people making the food with the masks around their chin. Then a guy comes and tells me I can only order online. Being reasonable I start walking out to put in my order until he starts telling me if I pay with cash he'll go make me my food. I only had my card and he tells me if I have cash he'll hook me up with a discount. Everything seems super sketchy about this place, I'd rather go somewhere else.
The app is great, but don't bother showing up for 10-15 minutes AFTER your assigned pickup time. This location is consistently SLOW. Poorly staffed or managed.

Came here for today's Cobb UYE.  We came after 1pm in hopes of avoiding the lunch hour crowd, but this store was still slammed.  The line wrapped around the entire inside of the restaurant and stayed that way even when we made our way to the cash register.  Busiest chain burrito place I've eaten at.  The line moved at a reasonable pace.  The burritos here are huge and not bad.  Pretty simple menu with all the standard choices of meats and ingredients.  The parking lot can get very busy with all the restaurants nearby, especially the Chick-fil-A and LongHorn next door.
This location is SO SLOW. Ordered my food for pickup at 7:30 and 30 minutes later still no food. That's absolutely ridiculous. Won't be returning.

I just got back from a cruise to the Bahamas and a flight from Miami...I'm very tired and so ready to just eat and get some rest. I ordered my food via the app so I could swing by and get it before going home on the way from the airport. The young lady at the counter had a lil trouble pulling up the order and then asked me to write out my order for me and my boyfriend again which I couldn't understand why... So I asked for a refund because what's the point in using the app if I did that. This was going to be a terrible experience, however Malik jumped in and apologized for the inconvenience. Not only did he refund my money, but he also offered to still make my order that he found in the system right away. This was a great example of turning a bad situation around into a great show of customer service. I apologize to the young lady and Malik but I truly appreciate the end result. Great Job Chipotle!!!

The amount of joy it brings me to write a wonderful review for this restaurant is unparalleled.

While Panera is your typical corporate establishment and not very Austin-y at all, their employees embody what it means to be a small business by being cordial and ever so helpful.

I went to brunch here on Sunday with some friends after church, and it took us a LONG time to decide what we want. The cashiers asked us if we were ready, and after we said not yet, they were very patient and didn't give us a single stare (you know the one I'm talking about). 

When I went to order, I got the Pick Two with a Grilled Cheese and Broccoli Cheddar soup. For my side, I asked if I would be able to get a bagel instead of chips or a baguette, and they said yes! They even gave me green onion & chive shmear for FREE! I'm fairly certain that's not SOP, but I was elated to get that kind of customer service from them, and that merits a five star all by itself.

Combine that with a comfortable seating area and free wi-fi (seems to be becoming standard for most places) and a good hearty THREE PART meal for less than $7, and I walked out of there a full and happy camper, most definitely headed back there soon!
The managers are always really nice to me! The other day they were slammed and they really took care of business. Keep it up. I know it can be hard when y'all are busy!

Okay, Panera's food isn't bad, and the people who work there are nice, but there are things they could have done to make it more memorable. Granted, you go to Panera when you're in a rush. You don't care about memorable lol. But the baguette with my salad was chewy and definitely stale. And while it's great to get more food than you expect, I'm pretty sure I ordered a "you pick two" which means a half salad and a mini cup of soup. And they gave me two full portions of both and changed the cost of my dish as well. So I ended up paying more than what I intended. 
Keep it in mind when you go to Panera after 7!

Foreign object in my salad.
This place was a frequent lunch spot for me until Today, where I found a piece of carton in my steak blue cheese salad. The manager apologized (I had to wait 7 min to hear from him, so I guess there are more important things for him that this) and he gave me half a salad back...  The sous chef apologized as well. Check the picture and make your own conclusion.

This place always seems to be dirty and unkept even though there were very few people here at this time. Also, order took almost 10 minutes even though they are not busy unlike other Paneras. This location has problems.

Can I give this yuppy hang out less than one star?  Ordered french onion soup "sorry sir we discontinued that" darn that's why I come here. Oh well I'll have a half a roast beef with....sorry sir  we discontinued roast beef. Ah shit well I'll have a coke. Sorry sir no coke we have Pepsi.

You can not get any better than Panera's food, service and atmosphere. A great place to study and talk with friends. It is one of the best I have found to help me do well in my classes online especially when your classmates are from other states. 

The managers are friendly and willing to work with customers on order problems to help fulfill the customer satisfaction. This place has become a second home away from home over sitting at a library, bookstore, or a coffee shop. 

It does not cost much to eat there you can just order a drink, food or pastry items that all suit your fancy. The staff is friendly and will greet you with a smile once you come in and out of the place.  Though this location is larger for booths you have to come in earlier to get a booth to sit down and study otherwise you have to use a bigger table to spread out your work. 

Overall, I have been going to this location for over a year and I had no problems with their food or service.

Friendly servers, nice location. I come here after work sometimes and it has always been up to my standards of panera. For a national food chain it not such a bad place and this one is bettered by it's location on 360. I haven't come here to do the study group experience but have put in my mp3 earbuds and listened to audio books while I eat. A pretty relaxing place and the salads are one of the better that I've had for a "fast food" style restaurant.

I'm extremely disappointed with the level of customer service I received. I just left because when I tried to order a soufflé at 1042am was told I couldn't because they stopped making them at 10am. Correct me if I'm wrong but nowhere on the menu does it say when they stop making them. But that is beside the point, when I told the guy at the register that I kind of didn't want anything anymore he just said "hmmm, sorry." I would have expected him to suggest another item on the menu to retain my business and to be a little bit more apologetic. It would appear to me that on a Saturday morning the management team would ensure, based off sales reports, that enough soufflés are be available. I probably would have tried something else if he would have suggested it but with his poor customer service I had no choice but to leave. This is not the first time they run out of soufflés at this location on a Saturday morning. So, Einstein Bagels won my business today. They also had run out of an item but were to quick to ask if I wouldn't mind waiting while some more came out of the oven. I hope this is not the way Panera really wants to be represented.

This location is usually very hectic. Not only I had to wait 20 min for them to pour two soups to go, the lady who gave me my order was rude to me when I asked if I could get a second slice of bread for my second soup. I told her I couldn't add it to my order via the kiosk. She yelled at me with attitude "YES, YOU CAN!" and said that I'll have to pay additional 75 cents for it next time. I don't appreciate people yelling at me after a long wait at the restaurant...AND my order was wrong when came home and checked it.

I like Panera, but really I only get a bagel and an iced tea here (a handful of times I've had the iced coffee).  There isn't much to review on just that!  I have to ask them to toast the bagel twice because I like it crispy on the outside, which they are happy to do.

Definitely sign up for the rewards card; even just getting a bagel here and there has added up to dollars off of drinks or free iced coffees (which I otherwise would not have tried).

I've been to other locations of Panera before, and was delighted by their breakfast pastries and coffee, so when I found out there was a location going up near me, I thought I'd try out the lunch/dinner menu as well.

I can't remember what sandwich I ordered... some forgettable turkey sandwich, with a bowl of broccoli cheddar soup, and an apple. My first complaint about this restaurant is it's poor layout. You pay for your food at the counter, and they hand you a cup for the fountain drink/tea pitchers, and then the fountain is NOWHERE to be seen! I seriously looked all over and couldn't find it. 5 minutes later, I figured out it was way down on the other end of the store, behind a wall. Who the hell designed that? I also saw many other customers looking around, just as confused as I was. And not once did either of the teenagers working behind the counter notice or respond to our expressions of confusion and offer help.

My second beef with this place is that they have the offering of an apple as a side to your entree. Which is fine, and tempting, especially if you have guilt about just eating a sandwich and cheese soup. But when I went to pick up my plate from the counter, there was just a whole apple that had been plunked down on my plate, waiting to roll off onto the ground during the walk back to the table. It may sound juvenile to ask a restaurant to cut an apple for you, but the only utensil I had was a butter knife. Uhh, okay? Once I finally dug into my apple the old-fashioned way, I found out it was mealy and warm inside. Yuck!

I still stand by the fact that their pastries and breakfast offerings are good, but for my money, the lunch/dinner menu is over priced and underwhelming.

Just got home with my rapid pickup order and found that they left off the chicken on my Greek salad.  Shoulda checked the order when I picked it up but oh well.  Sad day no protein for me.  4 stars because I really enjoy Panera bread usually but I'll just stick to dining in from now on.  They have great coffee and good place for WiFi w/lots of outlets.  Not their fault some moron forgot to put chicken on my salad.  :/
Always delicious. Wish they would stock the Potato Soup reguarlarly though. The Mac and cheese is always good.

I've been to many Paneras and I've never been so displeased. When I ordered at the counter to go, the lady kindly let me know they would call my name. They have a shelf now for online orders so you can differentiate which is a to-go order while you're present and online orders. I waited 15 minutes while other people got their named called and after I asked where my order was, the man pointed to the shelf and scoffed. First of all, that is very unprofessional. I don't care if it's busy. I'll wait patiently for my order but don't make me feel like an idiot because YOU (the business) made a mistake. On top of that, my salad was wilty and my soup did not have the correct toppings. I will NEVER go to this location again. I will make sure my business (20 us of) orders from lakeline.

No wonder Newks came to existence! What happened to this place? Salad dressing was obviously not hand made and from a container. Yuk! Ham and Swiss had loads of unnecessary mayo and mustard glop. This place can't get anymore CHAIN. I'm going back to supporting local restaurants. They have superior quality than this overpriced crap. Only good thing was service. Very helpful.
Love the soufflés!!  The new mini cakes are sweetness without all the calories great deal
4 stars for the best mac n cheese i've ever had!! Yum..

So Panera is my secret love. Everyone who knows me knows I love to eat local and as natural as possible. I don't know about the ingredients at Panera, but it is a chain, which usually means I won't go there. But I do. Weekly. sigh.

I always get the same thing: creamy tomato soup with a baguette. I love the tomato soup. It is delicious and comforting. I usually get a small half salad with it. The salads are hit or miss, the soups are really what shine in my opinion. Then there's the egg souffles. If you make it early enough to get one (they sell out fast), these are OMG awesome! I really don't want to know anything about the calorie count on these babies because they are a perfect lunch entree. Kind of a combination of a quiche and a croissant. That's the best description I have, definitely worth trying.

Every single staff member I have encountered has been friendly and helpful. They've given me good advice, and the few times I've had an issue it's been remedied immediately with an apology.

Panera is lucky it's one of the few places near my office with this type of fair. And maybe I'm a bit lucky too, because otherwise, I wouldn't have tried their food and found a great place to spend a lunch break.

This place is my pit stop before work. I am guilty of eating a chocolate bagel almost everyday on the way to work. :) shh 

If you have to go for lunch get there before 11:30 or you wont find a seat.

This place is always clean, and seems to be pretty quick for the most part. Very consistent food service, fresh coffee, including iced coffee, brewed iced tea... Broccoli cheddar soup in a bread bowl is awesome!  Asiago cheese bagel with cream cheese: awesome. Consistently good for star service

I've been under the weather for couple of days now, so I asked my son to pick me up something before he went out and about doing whatever teenagers do now a day's (sigh). At least he's taking care of me before he goes anywhere else.

 Soup:  I wanted some New England clam chowder, but they only serve that on Friday's. Bummer! So I asked my son to pick me up cream of chicken & wild rice and one more soup, whatever they think is good.  Their suggestion was French onion and he said that it's the most popular one. The soup came with a sour dough bread bowl. He told me to dump all the soup in the bread bowl then eat it from the bowl, so I did. I don't care much for the bread bowl though. I think my son brought it for me just to try it out. The soup itself was very good but as soon as I got to the bread part that started to melt in with the soup it gave me the sourdough taste, which I don't like.

Call me weird but I don't like French onion soup that much. There was just soup and onion. Duh, its onion soup what do you expect right? The soup reminded me of brown gravy spice mix that you put in brown gravy sauce for mash potatoes or beef tips. It's good but not great.
 
Bakery: I was craving desert, so I asked my son to pick me up a pastry ring from Panera. His friend works there and he brought home a pastry ring one day and said that it was free because they were going to throw it away anyway. It's nice to know that they bake everything fresh every day. Good advertising in a way I think. Because of that free pastry ring I now know about Panera and want to try some more of their pastries. It's a fluted ring, baked with cherry, apple and cheese filling. Mm, mm, mmh good! I like it because it is a small size, not the big size that you normally see everywhere else. I can eat all three fillings without feeling guilty about it.

I can't wait for that new one on 183 and Lake Line by Mattress Firm to open up. I'm a fan of some of their soups and the baked goods from Panera so far. : )
It's a Panera, so you may already know what you are getting into when you head here. The baked goods and rest of the menu are all terrific, though a bit on the oily/greasy side for me.

Tunafish sandwich.... I'm not partial to the sweet and overly drippy tuna salad they made... Turkey and Bacon on bread? creamy chicken with wild rice, mush, Really? and then the pecan twist and choco cookie that tastes processed, like they opened a package, nuked it and then re wrapped to sell.  If my dog made this I'd be impressed but this was from a famous sandwich place known for their bread which it was not even impressive in itself.  I was so disappointed especially with the cost of the food itself. I hate to say it but my grocery store makes better tuna salad than this place did. Sigh, never again.

FINALLY tried Panera....
For the cost and recommendations I wasn't too impressed.
Was told I MUST try the mac & Cheese... eh, it was just ok and the Turkey panini was bland in my opinion.
I DID like the fact I could get an apple instead chips - it was refreshing.

I told the gentleman at the counter it was my first visit - He and the staff were VERY polite and patient even though it was in the middle of the lunch rush.

Location is good - parking is a pain

I WISH Kitchen Door would come back dag nabbit
Terrible! Didnt have butter and got my order wrong twice in the same sitting. Would not recommend this location.

While not a fan of most of their food, the Broccoli Cheddar Soup in a bread bowl keeps me coming back.  It is probably the only thing I ever order, but I love it - down to the last bits of soup soaked up in the top piece of the bread bowl.

Aside from the broccoli soup, all other items I've tried in the past have been mediocre.  Nothing that I would order again.  Service at times is a bit slow from the order taking process to food delivery to the table.
parking is limited, but as expected, the wifi seemed stable and the food was great. Lots of office workers come here during lunch.

Love me some Panera! Yummy options and cannot beat the freshness. My favorites include the spicy thai salad, broccoli cheddar soup, chicken and wild rice soup, soba broth bowl and their cranberry walnut bread. I've stopped by for breakfast too and love their buns! The kiosk system is so effective and efficient I need it everywhere.

It's a busy one.. but then again everything in the arboretum seems to be busy.  However it was quick and effective.. my only complain was the parking.. since this panera is on the corner of a strip there is not much spots available. As always staff is friendly.

Man can live off bread alone! Panera! This place is great. I like the fact that they include the amount of calories of the items on the menu is great. Free Wi Fi, cozy seating. Nothing but nice things to say.

@PaneraBread

My experience with this location this past week (order #11423489):

- Placed order online for a company meeting in Austin later that week. $60 worth of food; website said they don't deliver to my company's office in Austin, even though the admin there has them deliver all the time

- My co-worker called them the day prior to change to delivery, which Panera was cool with

- On the day of, they were supposed to deliver at 11am. As of 11:30, we hadn't gotten a call or anything (e.g., if someone got lost en route)

- We called them; turns out our food (a mix of sandwiches, soups and salads) was just sitting on their counter with a note that said 'do not deliver'

- We didn't get our food delivered until around 12:30, so soups were cold and sandwich breads were soggy.

No apology, no discount for future purchases for our trouble, nothing.
 
Absolutely unacceptable. I will never use any Panera again for delivery, personally or professionally.
Thanks for my total carb overload. Nap time. I cant help that your potato soup is so addictive!
other locations gave larger selections but all panera food is yummy

To make a very long story short, I came in with a Panera gift card.  I asked the cashier to check how much was on the gift card.  She checked, it was $15.  I ordered and tried to pay with my Panera gift card.  It wouldn't register when I swiped it.  It wouldn't register when the cashier swiped it.  She said I couldn't use my gift card.  

Yes, I was not able to use a valid Panera gift card at Panera.  She tried to brush me aside by saying, it doesn't work.  You can't use it.  How do you want to pay? This has never happened to me before.  I asked why, etc...  noting that this was a really bad business practice.  She insisted- I couldn't use the Giftcard to pay for my meal.  I couldn't believe what I was hearing.  I have a Giftcard for your restaurant.  We just proved it has $ on it.  Why can't I use it?  She insists, "No, it won't work.  It won't swipe.  You can't use it."  

As this was happening, the line behind me grew and grew.  The cashier said she was the manager and I needed to contact the company about the gift card.  I asked again- does the Panera Giftcard have money on it? "Yes," she said.  I couldn't believe the lack of customer service here.  

After quite a bit of time going back and forth, the line is growing.  She ends up comping my meal.  So, I sit down and wait.  I wait and wait.  Nothing.  No meal comes.  Finally, I get up to ask what's going on. The staff had never received my order.  I had waited so long by that time.  It was an exhausting experience.  Finally my food came out.  All in all it was a super terrible experience.  When you have a gift card, it's embarrassing to have it "not work" for no reason at all.  Worse, it's awful for the cashier/manager to insist the gift card has money on it, but not be able to use it. Panera, get it right next time!

Every experience I've had has been a 1 or a 2, but I'm giving them a 3 because I know I'm doing it wrong. I know I need to be ordering the soup. But shame on me, I never have. I get the sandwiches (yawn) or a salad (boring in a bowl), but never the soups. Next time I'm there I promise I'll get soup.

Watch these people. I phoned them at 7:50 to ask them about online ordering and at 8:00 -- after the website had taken my credit card information - I got a "delivery time not available' and I was invited to choose a time tomorrow morning.  And there is no way to cancel the order once it's taken your card. And they stopped answering the phone; the message asked me to leave a message and then I got a 'voice mail box filled'.  I don't recommend ordering online. It seems very buggy and insecure.

Panera is my go to choice when I want a cheap lunch that is tasty and semi-healthy.  The sour dough bread bowls are a staple with a thick chewy consistency that I love.  Any of their soups are safe although the Broccoli Cheddar is probably the best.

Their sandwiches are pretty average but the Chipotle Chicken sandwich is decent.  Same thing applies to their salads which are good but normally soaked with dressing.

Panera bagels are great too although this location sells out fast of some types so you may way to pick them up before lunchtime.

I went here for a late lunch and recieved great service!  The food was reasonably priced and everyone working was friendly.  Four stars because the only diet drink offered is Pepsi and there were open tables but they were dirty and needed to be wiped off.

First time ever eating here and just was not impressed.  I was not sure what to order and told the girl taking my order is was my first time. She just stared back at me like hurry the fuck up. 

The floors were dirty and there was a yellow bucket catching water from a leak. 

I'm sorry if I'm going to spend 22 dollars on a pb&j, half of a sandwich(that I finished in 3 bites), a cup of bland corn chowder, and 2 drinks. I expect to at least have a clean comfortable environment to eat in. #neveragain

When I read the menu, contemplating which delicious sounding sandwich to order, or which salad sounded the best, I had such high hopes. With descriptions such as "smoked cheddar & sun-dried tomato ale mustard grilled hot on our Artisan Three Cheese bread", I believed I had found a gourmet sandwich shop. However, I picked up my plate and discovered a glorified grilled cheese with government cheese, chopped turkey meat product, and fake "grill" marks. Way to sell me a piece of shit sandwich for $7. F@*# you, Panera, and your yuppie-organic-snotty-white-people customer base.

After visiting this location and joining the panera club. I figured i should write a review.  The establishment is always clean and the staff is friendly.  I typically go to Panera bread to do homework. They have plenty of power outlets and WIFI.
The WIFI could be faster though, but its probably slow due to the 20 people on it streaming music, etc.
the food is good just a little pricey on what you get we got the pick 2 it was good but pricey  but anyway the service was good  crowded though but good food

I arrived at this Panera location at 4:30 pm. The establishment was empty. As a novice the menu board was confusing to me so the cashier directed me to the paper menu. The paper menu didn't exactly describe what came with the various options (either). I conceded and simply ordered a whole, flat bread turkey sandwich that arrived with a medium sized dry piece of baguette bread (?) and no utensils. The avocado wasn't sliced. It came cut in quarter size and immediately fell out of my sandwich. The turkey and bread were fresh and delicious, but overpriced IMO. The carpeted floors were filthy with bits of food and crumbs. The men's room was filthy and the urinal was out of order. I won't revisit this location - ever.

The food is not so bad but after hearing the manager chew out one of the employees right in front of everyone, I lost my appetite,  Did not get the nasty and unprofessional managers name or I would have reported her to their head office.
She berated that poor girl to no avail. I do not support that kind of management
and will never again support this restaurant.

Everything is pretty much amazing... I love all their teas they have available, I love their salads - I usually get a half salad and half sandwich and it makes my day - literally. Be sure to sign up for their rewards card! :)
Great French breakfast, big fan, Family friendly, I started with them 24 years ago in Europe.

I love panera, but this location is just meh.  Every time i've ordered something to go it is wrong.  Whether it's the wrong side item, the wrong sandwich, or the wrong soup, it is still wrong.  My advice is to fully check your order before you leave.

At the bottom Panera's receipt it's written that "Your order should be correct every time,if it's not,we'll fix it right away & give you a free treat".. Based on my recent experience, it should be changed to "Your order should be correct every time,if it's not, WE DON'T CARE"

I placed a to-go order of Creamy Tomato Soup with Baguette which was supposed to be ready by 7:48 PM. I drove 30 minutes from home and reached the store around 8 and didn't find my order in pickup area. So I waited...... 
Then my order was handed over to me .. I headed out and thought of checking the order once. Found chips not baguette (as I ordered that), went back and told the associate that I ordered the baguette not chips.. He took a baguette and literally threw it down the bag. His rude behaviour made me think of simply leaving my order and get out. Not a single word of apology... I reached home and my wife opened the order and found no breadcrumbs in it or on the side...Is it wrong to expect the right order ? 
I then called the store to talk about this. One of the associate picked up the phone and I told her about my experience. She told me that her manager is busy and will call me back to discuss. That's the end of it.. Being Panera (and not any local bakery store), I expected a call from the Manager as promised but nothing.. Nada... I waited for 2-3 days and then realized that Panera is standing up to its message on the receipt.. " ...... WE DON'T CARE".

I have always liked going to Panera but this experience has made me think otherwise.

Update: Assistant Manager reached out to me after I posted the complaint on panera's website and apologized for this.

I had an overall great experience. I ordered through the fast lane kiosk which was very simple and efficient since I was able to skip the long line. I was served my food within 3 minutes and ordered the flatbread Mediterranean. It was delicious but my only complaint is the serving portion was pretty small. Overall the experience was good. 4/5

This place is my favorite lunch place! Who can resist a fresh bakery/cafe?? Fresh bread for your sandwich-what's better than that???

Oh, I live the soup. I mean i love the soup. I have mine in a bread bowl, YUMMY. The pastries behind the glass are so tempting!!

It's a great lunch place to bring associates or the girlfriends. My hubby actually really likes this place because he can get in and out in no time. I would say similar to La Madeline but a different feel inside.

WiFi is available and the seating is comfy. Fresh bread and pastries are ready to take home after your meal...I LOVE PANERA!!

Panera is great for breakfast or lunch. It is always quick and the food is consistently good. Their bagels are very good, especially the cinnamon crunch, but be aware that they charge for cream cheese. Their coffee is always super hot, so much so that we sit there adding ice to it until it is drinkable.

For lunch, I like their salads and soups. They also have good cookies and pastries. Everything on the menu has calorie counts, sometimes a good thing, sometimes bad. 

Get a panera card and earn free coffee and pastries. It's free and they can look it up by your phone number so you don't have to have it with you.
Lots of area for seating and it's self service. Food is generally good and tasty.

This is probably my favorite place to eat.  I eat there every single weekend for lunch, sometimes even taking home for dinner also.  The bread is freshly baked and it is a comfortable atmosphere for someone to sit there alone reading and eating lunch.

Fresh Bread Made Daily! Can I say more.

I go to this place almost weekly. If they had one in Pflugerville who knows how many times I would hit this place

Asiago Cheese Bagel good stuff.
Cobblestone is to die for. I want one now. apple streusel and white icing.
Mediterranean Veggie I am a meat eater. The bread on this sandwich makes up for no meat. Tomato Basil bread. refreshing sandwich.
Strawberry Poppyseed & Chicken Salad. I am not really a salad person. I love this salad. Fruit instead tomatoes. I am not dressing person however this dress match perfectly. 
Another good one is Turkey Artichoke Hot Panini. Once again I am not into Articokes. This another great sandwich surprise.
tricks Ask for Apple to be sliced.

Friend of mine loves the Turkey Artichoke & the Asiago Roast Beef sandwiches. She like that Asiago Roast Beef has horseradish sauce. She does not have to bring her own.

Con: I wish they had more bread/chip free sides. Sides choices Baguette, Chips or Apple.  I am not into this Apple thing.

Atmosphere. Wonderful. I go before the lunch crowd. It is not too loud. I love the windows. Always there are people on the internet or reading.
This place is mediocre; the coffee is at least hot. The quiche is decent and really the only reason I gave it 3 stars.

I ordered a rapid pickup order for a chicken cesar salad. Sent my assistant to go pick it up and when we get the order back here and I open the salad its the completely wrong salad on top of that has things I am allergic to in it so I am out a lunch entirely. I called the 855# in which their customer service gave me a refund promptly but that doesn't solve the fact that this cafe messed up my order and since we had to drive all the way down there to pick it up, I don't have time to go back out and get a lunch. Unbelievable poor service to get the wrong food.
Food is regular Panera food. No surprises there. However, service lags way behind other Paneras I regularly visit. They seemed to be understaffed; overworked, low energy.

I have been a fan of Panera for about 20 years. My wife and I discovered it when we were living in Missouri in the 90's and it was called the St. Louis Bread Company. I'm writing this review because the company has noticeably started growing downhill, at least at this Austin location. I think the employees simply don't care anymore. It's funny, but the food itself seems just fine. The quality is still there as far as I can tell. However, the place is just filthy and completely disorganized. Here's the list of things I noticed. 

I arrived around 7pm and the place had almost no customers. Nobody in line. There were about 6 self-serve kiosks and about 6 registers. None of the kiosks had any pagers to take to your table and nobody was stationed at the registers. I stood in front of a register for a few minutes before somebody noticed me, and of course they had to go get somebody else to help me. In the meantime I noticed some of the bakery items were just plopped down without much work to remove cooking sheets or arrange in front of the proper price tags and descriptions. 

After I ordered (clearly interrupting the cashier's dinner break) I made my way over to the coffee. One pot was labeled "freshly brewed at 12pm" -- 7 hours old. Trash was everywhere on the floor and I literally could not find one clean table in the place. The trash can was full and the employees had covered up the trash "hole" with a dirty upside-down plate. There was a small bucket with rags floating in the water on top of the trash can, presumably to wipe down the tables. I cleaned off my own table and drank my coffee and ate a pastry. Again, food was fine. The employees here seemed to be just hanging out with 1-2 folks really trying to slowly get the place back together. In the hour I was there, I saw one guy carrying a huge stack of dirty plates to be washed and the same guy running a vacuum. Everybody else seemed to be just out of sight in the kitchen hanging out and talking. I literally overheard a guy joking, "if you could just do all my work for me then I can just hang out and do nothing all day."  I had to order some takeout for my daughter before I left, and I was again waiting for a long time before somebody noticed me. The one kid who was cleaning the restaurant and restocking the drink station with lids saw me and took my order. Another employee walked by and made no attempt to help him (poor guy who was helping me was holding 3 bags of lids and struggling to balance them while taking my order).  

I grabbed some butter packets out of a tub by the coffee, and there was trash in it!  On my way out, I noticed the vestibule was full of leaves and trash, and the doormat was rolled up and pushed to the side. (Maybe somebody was going to sweep and lost interest?). I really did NOT want to attempt the rest room based on how dirty the rest of the place was. I'm glad I skipped it. 

It's really sad when a place like this with decent food just completely stops caring about taking care of the restaurant. I 100% blame the management for not training the employees and giving them a sense of pride in providing a clean, welcome environment for the customers. 

This is not the only Panera location in Austin where I've noticed this problem. Lakeline and Bee Cave Galleria are not much better. Shout out to Cedar Park 1431 for looking good and having attentive employees. 

I hope Panera will visit the Austin locations and work on turning it back around. Just keep it clean and maybe attempt to tidy up and look presentable!  I don't want to see cardboard boxes of back stock piled up everywhere. Wipe down surfaces and pick up trash, for pete's sake. If it doesn't turn around, I'll find another restaurant for coffee and pastries.

My friend and I decided to stop in for a sandwich after shopping.  There were not many customers and they were not busy.  Several workers were doing busy work and ignored us.  I was about ready to leave when finally someone walked two feet and asked us what we wanted.  We ordered.  When our order came, the person slammed the plates down and when my companion asked for extra butter, he grunted and left.  He did return with the butter.  The sandwiches were put together by a two year old.  All lumped together and very sloppy.  Was not impressed.  Way overpriced.  Don't think I will return.  There are better places to spend my money.  I found it ironic that they had a sign on the door coming in saying they were hiring people with a smile.  Smiles were very rare that particular evening.

The mac and cheese here is to die for. I want to eat it everyday with every meal. So good! The Bacon Turkey Bravo was delicious. The tomato basil bread they use was so soft. It might change the way I make sandwiches for the rest of my life. Also, smoked gouda should be on all sandwiches forever. They have free wifi and plenty of people were there holding business meetings and studying. It would be a nice place to go and grab some real food while you're studying or telecommuting. The staff was friendly. My complaint? It's kind of pricey for half a sandwich and a cup of soup. But it's a damn good sandwich and cup of soup.

This is the best location in the area.  Craig, Greg and Christina ROCK!!  The food is super fresh and when I call for a pick up order with all my "special requests" they always get it right!  The service at this location could be compared to a 5 star restaurant!  I'm totally addicted to the Shrimp Soba Noodle salad!!!
The food is good, but overpriced for what it is.  I only come here when I'm at Gateway and don't have time to go somewhere else.
This cracka fugging told the popo to crap n da panini maker.  Made a shitty sandwhich. I ate it anyways futh the police.

Wow super disappointed in this particular Panera. I came out for lunch with my mom. We ordered an extra baguette (besides the one that was included with our meal). We noticed the piece was super burnt so when my mom took it up to the front the manager, Greg Cox, handed us a back a small piece of bread. When my mom commented that our other piece was bigger he replied "well beggars can't be choosers" so I went up to the front counter and asked him how we were beggars when I PAID for an extra baguette. To which he replied "oh I told your mom I was kidding" sorry not an acceptable joke. Not sure how this guy made it to a manager position but because of him and his rude comment I'll pass on Panera.

Wow, totally disappointed in Panera tonight. Seems like this place is going downhill quickly. Here are the things that they didn't have (just what I overheard and asked about): baguette (what??? Every meal comes with one), pulled chicken, a number of soups, and there were more. The tomatoes in my salad were FROZEN!  Wide didn't get her chips. Others were going up and complaining.   Line was out the door--manager offering apologies but kitchen staff yelling. Bad night maybe, but I've come here since it opened and it's just getting worse. Too bad, I really enjoy Panera. This location is tough, guessing it might not be here too much longer.
This place is outstanding. Think Starbucks on steroids, with better food and unbelievably, a better atmosphere. Customer service is always outstanding and the sandwiches are the best around.

I've been to panera bread for their food several times and it's just not enough for me to write a review about it. It's all pretty decent and great for brunch/lunch. 

I wanted to tell you however, that you got to try out their pumpkin muffin and chai tea latte. Both are just heavenly!!!! :) I first fell in love with chai tea after I tried Panera's! But it's a hit or miss, depending on your barista. I went a second time in North Carolina and the chai tea just didn't taste the same. But they cant go wrong with the pumpkin muffin!

When I've worked through through lunch and am so exhausted and frustrated that I don't have the energy to cook that fabulously planned meal that I went out of my way to purchase all the ingredients for but I'm too hungry to make it... I go to Panera.  

The Bacon Turkey Bravo is always there for me.  It's reliably good each time and that tomato basil bread is killer.  If it weren't $8 a loaf, I'd buy it as my weekly sandwich bread for the house.  On my most recent trip to Panera (360/183 location), my Bacon Turkey Bravo was delivered in top form.  On that day, the Panera sandwich artist outdid himself.  My sandwich arrived looking like a sample used for print ads.  It was huge, had evenly distributed toppings, and was just beautiful.  

Yes, I did complement the sandwich artists and received very strange looks from them in the process.  But credit was due.

UPDATE: since I last wrote I've fallen victim to the kick ass food at least four more times (please don't compare the dates, it's embarrassing).  We take our laptops for the free wifi and eat breakfast (ANYTHING is good) and then stay for lunch- it's an awesome replacement for our office and the music is elevator-y but I've got earbuds so hooray!

I would normally give this place a 5 star review, but the incident that I had with them this week makes them lose a star... :-(

I really love the food here and the pastries are yummy too! I was just a little annoyed when I went in to get my favorite sandwich, Asiago Roast Beef, and when I got home it was on white bread and not the asiago demi that it usually comes on! It is called asiago for a reason, and I really hate plain white bread. I wish that they would have said something to me about it, so I could have told them to make me something else or put it on something besides white bread, instead of assuming that that was going to be ok with me. I did call and spoke the manager, he handled it ok. I am not sure if he understand how annoyed I was that I stood right there and he didn't say anything about them being out of the bread, but anyway... I went in a couple of days later and the day manager was super sweet and handled the whole situation great! So I am very happy about that.

I am not going to let that incident stop me from going back. I love this place. I really enjoy that the calories are posted right next to the item on the menu and the scones (I don't wanna know the calories to) are so good!

I had a bagel there and it was super great too! I also, love the frequent buyer card that gives you discounts and free stuff the more that you go in!

This Panera is great! I got a salad along with some creamy tomato soup. I forgot to order a drink and went to go buy one but the girl just gave me a free drink! Places like Panera go above and beyond in their service!

The initial service was good. After the food was brought out, we had to search for an employee to ask for some butter for the roll that came with my pasta. They had a prepackaged spread, not real butter. My butternut ravioli must have been microwaved; some ravioli were hot and others cold. Two people ate for $30.00. That is not a good value for the quality of the food. Jason's Deli has better quality and quantity for the dollar. Will not return, very disappointing.

If we ever have to deal with that chick Karen Norsh again we'd rather shoot ourselves in the head. Hey Panera, get a decent staff instead of rude idiots! Your other places are great but we'll never bring our family back here again due to this one lady (she said her name Karen Norsh) being so unduly rude to our kids who were evidently sitting in the wrong place. Then she blamed us for dropping her tray on the floor. Huh, OUR fault. We think not. This chick is unhinged.

I had the onion soup and a southwest flatbread with iced green tea and blueberry scones. The onion soup was too salty but otherwise pretty tasty. The flatbread was mediocre with dry chicken and overly sweet sauce. The green ice tea is more like starbucks' passion fruit iced green tea - not bad but surprising. The scone was too sweet and dry. Overall rather disappointing.

Happy eating!

Friday noonish, short lines, food served quickly.  Caeser chicken salad substandard, not much flavor, a few wafer thin slices of chicken, portion size for both half and full small.  Chicken avocado sandwich bland.  Not the Panera of a few years ago.  I am left with the impression that they are cutting back on food quality and portion size.

Wonderful food - awful service! Disorganized, complaining staff; add to that heat your own pastry in a dirty microwave! Waited forever for a latte & hot chocolate since their coffee station processes orders according to who is glaring at them instead of how the orders come in! Buzzer apparently just gets you food from the kitchen, not your entire order. To top it off no vanilla in vanilla latte & don't forget to mix your own chocolate or you'll just be drinking hot milk!
counter service. sandwiches, soups and salads. Bakery with sweet and savory breads. small patio outside, wifi and sometimes crowded parking.
its a was a great lunch. great customer service. very fast pace café and the food is amazing.

Half  a sandwich (on a small loaf bread size)  and an apple should not cost $8. 

I'm sorry but  these are not lunch prices. Maybe in  NYC or Beverley. Hills, not in Cedar freaking park Texas.
Went today around 3pm had green goddess salad it was delicious! It wasn't busy during this time.

We visit this location all the time because it is the closest Panera to us. I'll start by saying this location is ALWAYS running out of pastries, especially cookies. Two out of three visits they are out of the candy cookies by 6:00 p.m. I would say about 50% of the time the experience had is a negative one. One time we were  waiting at our table for our order for over 25 minutes. I went  up to the counter and could see our order on the screen in red counting up from the time we made our order. Other new, green tickets were being delivered left and right. The person behind the counter never acknowledged me standing there until I literally grabbed her attention to get a manager. They had somehow skipped our order over. The bus boy delivering the trays I guess didn't have the sense to notice our ticket on the board for an excessive amount of time. The manager made it up by comping us for our meal. He was very nice. This was the worst experience we had. Other times the food is fresh and delicious. Compared to other Panera's I've been to, this place is ran very poorly. With it's perfect location and amount of traffic this store receives, I would think Panera would keep more of an eye on this store. It's a consistent mess. Thank God they put in the self service tablets. I have left the store after standing in line for an excessive amount of time due to not having enough cashiers. We left again tonight because they had NO cookies except lemon drops. This was at 6:30 p.m.

I really like the Panera food chain. I love their food for the most part. But I've been turned off by the Turkey Artichoke hot sandwich here - so I recommend everything else - because I love everything else. This place is your genuine Panera article with the comfortable seating and the artwork. The location is saving the Gateway complex - otherwise, the building would be lonely.

We had lunch at this restaurant on Tuesday and had to listen to the general manager (Greg), screaming and cussing at the poor employees all through our meal. I felt so sorry for the employees, who in my opinion were doing the best that they could. It was appalling to hear and made our lunch very unpleasant! Shame on him!!!! Get a different job Greg!

Nothing to see here, please move along, is what I was thinking when I was waiting on a client who asked to meet at Panera.  It isn't that is it horrible, I only had a coffee, it was more along the lines of the place had no soul.  All the folks who worked there were nice enough and smiled and were polite.  It seemed like a want to be Starbucks with food?.. I dunno, I wouldn't go out of my way to go back.
When you order a full salad I guess you need to order extra dressing because they only give you less than a third small cup of dressing.

I like Panera but this location has disappointed me on two visits. 
It's dirty...really surprising. Dirty floors and my silverware was dirty on my last visit.
Their club card seems to slow everything down at the cash register...super annoying. 
I won't be back.

When you go to a chain you expect the same food every time. Beyond disappointed with everything! Ordered 2 sandwiches. They were out of the cheese, sandwich bread, baggettes. Got the food and the Italian was not correct with different meats and dressing. Top it all off with the fact that it took 15 minutes to get the food and we had to watch the 6 people behind us get their food and leave while we stood there!
The food is fantastic, healthy and tasty.  The professional staff compliment this ambience.

The restaurant is busy, the employees are flustered, the manager, Kelsey, is shouting at her employees behind the counter, having an attitude with each customer she speaks to, she is complaining to her employees how hungry she is and how badly she wants to go home, they're out of baguettes AND dinner rolls (this place is called Panera BREAD), the floors are filthy...I'll make a sandwich at home next time.

I like the quality of ingredients and this place was PACKED.  The sweet tea was AWESOME but the Broccoli Cheese Soup was pretty thin.  I really like the location, the outdoor seating and the speed in which we got our food, even as busy as it was.

I added some pictures of our food and the location, it's just noisy enough to have a business lunch without people eavesdropping, it's clean and parking isn't *too* bad.  

I do NOT appreciate busing my own table at $10 a head for a sandwich though, I'd rather pay a buck more and have a bus boy or a two bucks less and bus it myself.

I was a frequent visitor to a Panera location in the Bay Area, and I was a happy customer there. However, this location is a big let down in comparison. Whenever I order hot tea, the self-serve hot water is either cold, or has a coffee after-taste. Today the hot water is missing all together. The bathroom is old and dirty. The food is a toss-up--- sometimes it's just fine, but a few times the bread was stale. 

On the plus side, the automated kiosks make ordering fast and easy. However, I suggest finding other restaurant options.

I submitted this as a comment on the P-B website as well.
My Rapid Pickup Orders always seems late.
Sandwiches are always sloppily assembled.
This AM, I waited 8 minutes beyond when it was due to be ready for a Rapid Pickup Order. No one ever approached me to ask why I was waiting. I finally approached an attendant at the main counter. He checked only to come and tell me they online ordering system was down and my order was never made.
Bad service.
After repeated late order, sloppy assembly and this morning's very poor customer service, I have deleted the APP from my phone.
I won't be back again.
BTW, no response from the company yet.
Fast service even at lunch time! Love the fast lane kiosks to do own orders too! So happy to be near a Panera again for my favorite salads!

It's a chain, but it's better then 90% of the chains out there. Fresh baked bread and cookies, sign me up. 

The food at Panera is okay, nothing really to write home about in my opinion. I always go for the tomato and mozzarella sandwich. The prices are right, but the quantities are small, so you might need seconds or a mid-afternoon snack.

This location is clean and pretty nice. Parking here is not the easiest, neither is getting in and out of the lot.

This is great stuff as usual.  I'd give it 3.5 stars, but it's a chain, so I don't often think about going back, so...yeah, three stars.  But they're great.

I had a quick spinach and bacon souffle for $3.99 (before tax) at around 7AM.  They hadn't made any spinach and artichoke souffles yet, which was my first order, but how can you complain about a freshly made souffle with bacon?  Only thing was that the egg to bread ratio could have skewed more toward the egg...but you know, it was tasty and crispy on the outside.

I might just get something else while I'm (still) here.

Soup and salad combo woohoo! We decided to stop by after doing some Costco errands. Their self-ordering kiosks are SO MUCH MORE EFFICIENT and fun to order from. Selecting meals was pretty easy: pick what you want, customize your order if you'd like, grab a tracker (so they know where to bring your food to), pay and find a table and wait for the staff to bring your order to you.

We ordered a soup/salad combo with low-fat chicken noodle soup and a half order of Asian sesame chicken salad customized with wonton strips, cucumbers, extra side of basil pesto dressing and tomato wedges. Side was a bag of chips. Hubby got a bowl of their chicken and wild rice soup with a side of bakery pastry. A scone!

Food came and tasted like it always does from Panera: fresh and delicious. Soup was hot and salad was not too soggy with dressing since they put them in small containers on top of the salad. Very nice flavor to the dressing. Hubby's soup came out nice and fresh as well.

Will definitely come back for healthy eating options when we are in the area!

I LOVE PANERA BEAD.

Ever single Panera that I've gone to has been amazing. I always order their half broccoli cheddar soup, half smoked turkey breast sandwich (without onions) for under $7 with tax. I am completely obsessed with this place and we order out from Panera at work at least once a month (possibly once a week). The environment is very casual and still nice with free wifi (woot woot!) so you can come here to eat and still get work done.

Come to Panera ...they're AMAZING.
Nobody does bread like Panera---actually nobody does food like Panera. No complaints whatsoever about this location. I LOVE Panera.
Love this place! Broccoli cheese soup and roasted turkey artichoke sandwich was delicious. They have a pick 2 option for 7.99. Clean. Quick. Love the tropical hibiscus tea. Good service.

The sandwich/soup/salad menu is pretty good, but what I love most about Panera is that I can purchase a loaf of their delicious tomato-basil bread. It's a little under $4 and they slice it for you--choice of thick or thin. There are other breads available by loaf, but the tomato-basil bread is so amazing. I usually go to Panera just to purchase bread, then I make my own sandwich at home. Still, I've enjoyed all the food I've had when dining in.

Lunchtime soups, sandwiches and salads... it's hard to stand out from the crowd in this field, but Panera manages nicely. Nothing transcendent, just consistently good food, good choices and good, efficient service that's a cut above most others. Gotta love a thorough offering of light and healthy options as well as choices that are hearty without ranging much into the usual bacon-and-ranch calorie minefield. Can be crowded, but service generally remains quick and efficient.
I am hooked on the BBQ chicken salad. Keep up the good menu and the amazing customer service. The line moves at a steady pace so we are never waiting for long to place an order.

Sometimes I nice person. And today was not one of those days. Today, in efforts to try and con some friends into helping me move at the end of the month, I took them to Panera for lunch (hey, I never claimed to be rich). 

Panera has awesome sandwiches. I love sandwiches more than I love my own family (and that sentence is in no way an effort to be amusing) and Panera always gets it right.  Today, I had their Chicken Tortilla soup in a sourdough bread bowl. They even gave me the bread that was cut out of the bowl so that I could then dip it IN THE SOUP! This is truly a day to be valued.  The soup itself was adequate but I've had much better. Nonetheless, it was flavorful and while I prefer their sandwiches, I would not write off this soup.

Also, after I scooped up the soupy bread remains, I then used the bread carcass as a puppet like Audrey II from Little Shop of Horrors (FEED ME, SEYMOUR!). It's hands down the perfect use for that left over bread skeleton.

Good mozzarella and tomato sandwich but I just don't understand why restraunts feel they can get away with charging so much for a vegetarian sandwich? This is not nearly as substantial as the meat counterpart yet costs the same. To be fair most restraunts do this but dare to be different! The counter wait is always long and unorganized.

Not a good experience today at all. Stopped in at 7;30 to get my co-worker and myself two breakfast sandwiches to-go. Ordering went smoothly. No lines when I walked in at all. I waited about 10 minutes and Izzy said my sandwiches would be "right out" He said they had to make eggs. Maybe 5-7 minutes later he hands me a bag, I check it....one sandwich. Showed him my receipt and he apologized. He began making another sandwich. Then he realized they were out of bacon. I watched several guys walking around with clipboards as a line began to form up front. One of the guys with clipboards noticed the line and yelled to the back for another girl. Actually yelled and sounded really angry and rude. He then blew by me and asked if I had been helped. I knew this fool saw me waiting along time already. All of a sudden he is going to yell and act like he is doing something by asking if I have been helped. You know I have been helped. You know I have been waiting a long time. Meanwhile Izzy is running around trying to figure out how to get some bacon. I feel sorry for all the people that just walked in the door. So it's prime time busy breakfast time....there are no eggs, no bacon....one guy that seemed brand new making everything, a manager that has no idea how to make a good decision, step-in and take over getting the customers helped and I waited 37 minutes for two breakfast sandwiches. One was cold with egg shells and bacon bits. See my photo of my $4.18 cent sandwich. Cold eggs with egg shells....yum...no salt or pepper. I was also 10 minutes late to work. Maybe this was an off day, but I think the goal in this area is to get people to stop before going to the office and lunch time right?Who is going to wait that long? I could understand if they were busy, but there was nobody ahead of me. Something is really missing here if there aren't the least bit prepared to make a simple breakfast sandwich at 7:30 in the morning. I can't go back....

This place is pretty consistent, except for last night.  Not a booth in the place was clean and there was some employee drama behind the counter.  The fourth star comes from the other 99 visits that were near flawless.  I like the choice of bread, apple or chips for the side.
Usually great! Friendly staff. Not too long of a wait for your food. I always get the soup and salad combos. So good. Last time my bread bowl was really soggy though. Haven't been back yet

Why do I keep doing this to myself?
I have tried this location again after several bad experiences a few months ago.
I use Rapid Pickup because the location is about a mile from my office and I'm in very early.
Yesterday - I arrived but no order was ready. I stood for a short time. No one acknowledged me at the pickup counter so I asked.
The woman said the grill wasn't turned on. I wrongly took that  as "I am turning it on now...." No luck. I waited for about two minutes and ask, "How long before it's ready?'
She replied, "I have no idea."  Instead of debating it, I immediately asked for a refund, got it and left.
Why I tried again this morning, I don't know.
I arrived. No order. I waited. No acknowledgment from those behind the pickup counter although they had time to talk about the party, the party bus and the costs.
I went to the front counter. Asked. She said she would check. About a minute later she came back with a bag. 
Her: "I think this is it." I looked questioningly - you think? 
Me: "Can someone check?"
Her: "It should be."
Me as I took the bad and set it on the counter: "I don't think a 'should be' is OK if I'm paying for something."
It was the right order....although when I got to the office I realized it was very sloppy.
I'm done.

Ordered the Frontega Chicken Pannini. Out of the six ingredients that go inside the focaccia bread, 2 were missing: no chipotle mayo, no fresh basil. I dislike chain restaurants to begin with. Add in incompetence, and it pretty much seals the deal that there are much better local options to go to (like Little Deli on Woodrow Ave).

It's like an oversized Starbucks with a bigger menu but without the quality or staff members who know customer service.  You can use Wifi and hang out with a little more privacy than most coffee shops, but the food is just okay and overpriced.

The real difficulty of giving a positive review is in the salads: the Whole Foods not 200 yards from their front door has maybe the best salads (and selection) that I've had in Austin.

Recommendations:

* The smoothies are consistent
* The bagels and cream cheese are solid
* The breakfast food tends to be better but they don't serve that all day
The morning manager, Sara, is a shining example of customer service. Panera, hang on to that one! She represents your brand amazingly!!!!
Worst excuse of a sandwich place. When you pay $10 for a sandwich,you expect more than two pieces od meat!...never again!!!

Really great brunch buffet with lots of options (both healthy AND naughty). Bottomless mimosas were heavy on the champagne, which is how I like them, BRAVO! Great omelette station and fresh waffles. My 3 year old loved the pancakes with fresh strawberries and whipped cream. Our service was also wonderful. Our first time here and we will return for brunch again.

I was very happy to discover that Panera was still serving breakfast past 10:30. The food was quickly prepared and served right to the table. I ordered the egg white sandwich with avocado and cheddar. The sandwich was a little bland but after adding a little chalula sauce it was perfect. This particular location was very clean and the workers were very polite. For a chain restaurant you can count on Panera to have fresh ingredients and a variety of healthy choices. You can purchase cold pressed juices from Panera now.
This used to be a very good restaurant but now the quality and quantity are barely mediocre and the staff is short handed.  Don't bother coming here again.

SUPER EXPENSIVE for SMALL PORTIONS.  We went to Panera recently since it was a cold day and wanted to order soup.  I got a cup of soup and half sandwich.  WOW, pricey!  my cup of soup was good but the sandwich was tiny.  and i paid $5.39 for just the tiny/half portion for just the sandwich!  the soup was an additional $4 or so. and a bag of chips was included  WOW.  Iced Tea was $2.50.  Just saying we will not go back, our lunch very expensive for not much food.

Panera, Ho! Hum!

My lunch and my wife's snack were just about nothing.  The success reflected in their stock price and public image is not justified.

Their business model must call for targeting a notch above mediocrity.  Really, the experience wasn't much at all.

Let's start with my wife's Pecan Twist.  Her reaction was "where are the pecans?". There actually was one pecan on a cinnamon twist, so I suggested that they rename it Twist That Was Next To The One With Pecans.

Now for my sandwich.  It was Chicken Caesar on 3-cheese bread (a "Signature" menu item).  First, it didn't taste like anything.  Unless, of course, you count the taste that remained in my mouth for hours after I ate it.  The bread was about the size of my hand; a scoop of chicken was in the middle; this was topped with grated parmesan, lettuce, tomato and too much red onion.  Picture a flat sandwich with a very big lump in the middle.

I just got it.  The sandwich was completely tasteless because I removed the onions.

Paid $9 for a smallish sandwich that was cold and tasteless. It looked like they just tossed the insides down from  10 feet above.  Big dollop of mayo right in the middle, turkey and cheese and avocado just strewn haphazardly on the bread.  The bread was dry.  A small bag of chips came with the sandwich.  That's it. $9 that I could have spent elsewhere, leftovers included. 

Oh. Add another $2 for the shortbread cookie.  I got this for free as a birthday cookie, which was honestly the only reason I thought I would try Panera again after so many years.  Who doesn't like a cookie?  And it was good (and big--maybe bigger than my sandwich!) and that is why this review is not one star but a whole 2. 

As for the dining accommodations--nothing looked too clean or taken care of. And they weren't too busy so that was no excuse. Lots of people standing around when they could have been busy cleaning up and refilling empty tea containers.  

I should have looked a little more closely at all that first and just left.  The cookie wasn't worth it.  

Ok. Maybe just left with the cookie to go.  

Despite that, though, I don't plan on returning.

The Panera formula is one that works. If you've been to one, you know what the formula is and what to expect.

I'm taking the time to write this particular review because the edict has come down to all of the cashiers at this Panera store that Rewards Card Membership is more important than the actual sale of food. Seriously, it's like Gamestop and pre-orders in here: They want me as a rewards card member, and they want me as one now. I'm sure that the cashiers don't want to have to say this, and that they know it's a pain in the ass for everyone involved, but I like being able to go to Panera every now and then and not have this question hammered down my throat, and then deal with the awkwardness of refusing it and completing my order as quickly as possible so that neither of us spend the rest of the day openly weeping. I don't know how better to send the message to Panera's management that this policy is a bad idea than leaving a lukewarm review for their restaraunt.

I had more to say but I'm running out of tissues.
DeAnna is great! Wonderful personality to greet you. All staff and managers were really accommodating, helpful and friendly!

Been here three times!

New employee with new company, I brought bagels for the staff last week. Everyone loved the variety of bagels, the different cream cheeses too. Fabulous staff, very helpful. Get in and out quick. Great sandwiches too!

Highest recommendation!

Up:
Great food
Great staff
Great prices

Down:  
None!

Question: why is the sign always off in the mornings?????

Salad was completely yellow! Asked for them to redo it.. Had the same thing happen again" yellow salad"! I was a little disappointed being that it was my first time going to a Panera. Bread was hard as a rock too! Left as an unhappy customer.
Great food and amazing bagels! BUT every time my wife and I go in to get a dozen or so bagels, the cashier's attitudes give us the feeling as if we are wasting his or her time.

Not impressed.

We haven't even received our order yet.

Not clean.  All the tables were dirty and stuff on the floor.  The customer service was very impersonal.  My girlfriend asked for water and got a quickly spoken, and unclear answer.  Asking a different person, she got the exact same type of response - like they're trained to be rude and confusing.

They're not busy, so the lack of cleanliness, the slowness, of the service, and the rudeness, I can't recommend this place.

Dear Panera,

Thank you for being the best little sandwich chain in the greater Austin area.  If I could afford to eat out every day, I would stop by for lunch daily, but the truth is I can't.  For now I'll just visit you as much as I possibly can!

The Chicken Chipotle sandwich makes my taste buds do back flips.  The Asian Chicken Salad and Fiji Apple Salad are delightfully flavorful and your green tea is always sweet, yet light and refreshing!
To top this off, Justin, a manager, Bo, a cashier as well as all of the other employees, including the cooks, are always friendly and courteous!

Keep making great food and providing excellent service and I'll definitely keep coming back!

III  (''''\/''''')   IIIIIIIII  IIIIIIII   III      III   IIIIIIIIII  IIIIIIIIII  IIIIIIIII   
III   \       /    III   III  II    II   IIIIII   III   III        III     III  II     II   
III    \     /     IIIIIIII   IIIIIIII   III  III III   IIIIIIIII  IIIIIIIIIII  IIIIIIIII

III       \/       III        II     II  III    IIIII   IIIIIIIIII III   IIII   II     II   

Sincerely,
Verna S.
i came here with my aunt to work on some things. free wifi. the staff is nice. and food was just enough to keep us energized during the time we were here.

It's chain food, so I don't understand 4 star ratings.  It delivers decent chain food if you're in a hurry and don't have other options.   Lettuce is generally not crispy fresh, dressings and soups are salty.  Baked goods are very tasty tho.

I just had lunch here today.  Panera is consistently great!  I had two of my favorites, the Fuji Apple Salad and Cream of Chicken and Wild Rice soup.  I love to pick up lunch here or bagels for work.  Great place, I will be going back for sure.

Let me start off by saying....I love breakfast and brunch, they also have really great salads and the mac and cheese is the best I have ever had (if your a fan too...you HAVE GOT to try it).  And now, their breakfast.....I LOVE the mini souffles, soft fluffy egg supported in a buttery, crispy croissant, with 4 different choices to pick from (spinach artichoke, sausage & gouda, 4 cheese, & spinach & bacon) ...wow.  And their bagels...especially the asiago bagel and the cinnamon crunch bagel are delicious!! 

I would not recommend the bacon, egg, and cheese sandwich, its a little pricey for what you end up getting, and your sammy is more egg than anything else in it.
