Which brings me to the final part of my review.  Although, their food quality is a 5 star all the way, some of their items are very pricey for what you get.  I for one, would not mind paying $6-7 for a b-fast sammy if you made it with equal amounts of ingredients...otherwise, I had to remove half the egg to even get a taste of the bacon.  But, don't let that turn you off this place, I havent tried their pasta dishes yet, but its on my list.  This is only my personal opinion and recommendations.  Its a great lunch place to grab something and run back to work too!!

I met a friend here for lunch several weeks ago, and it was fabulous!  My history with Panera was limited to a breakfast pastry several months ago, so my first time ordering a meal.

It was pretty busy when we arrived, but the staff was efficient at getting the customers moved through.  The gentlemen that served me was absolutely top notch!  His station was at the far end of the counter--furthest from the end of the line.  He came around to where I could see him and motioned that he was ready to assist me.  Professionalism in spades.  Well dressed, tidy, presentable, great manner---didn't feel like I was eating at a fast food place at all.  I was incredibly impressed.  Their drink station isn't readily visible from the counter, so he made a point of giving us a heads up about where it was.  The same staff member brought our food to us, and we got to enjoy his professional service again.  Seriously, folks.  Food service members everywhere could take lessons.

I ordered the Roasted Turkey and Cranberry Flatbread.  Wow.  Granted, I don't eat out very often at all, but this was absolutely heavenly!  It was so good, I want to go back and get it again.

Two thumbs up!  Awesome service.  Awesome food.

Now I remember why we don't eat Panera anymore, it's a rip off.  

After many years, we decided to try it again, the need for just simple soup and sandwich motivated us to give another shot.

The restaurant appears new, well designed and very modern.  Just steps inside several kiosks await to order and pay with just a few buttons pushed and a credit card swipe.  Great idea, especially for regulars.  Since we were not familiar with the menu, we ordered at the counter with the help of a very friendly staff member.

With a short wait, our buzzer rang and our food was delivered.  This is where the problem begins, with the food.  Between the two of us, we ordered a cup of chicken noodle soup, a cup of french onion,  a chicken salad sandwich, and steak and cheese sandwich.  We both tasted it all, and we both concluded, it was all terrible.

The french onion soup was sweet with little flavor.  Chicken noodle, almost no flavor and what little there was, didn't taste like chicken.  Two ounces of chicken salad on the sandwich was flavorless.  And the worst item, the steak and cheese sandwich had a funny taste, and unfortunately, a strange after taste that lingered.  The best part of the sandwich, there was little of it.  I would guess maybe 3 or 4 ounces.

What a rip.

I've seen Panera in about every new lifestyle shopping center that is built in this country - normally when a mall or shopping center has a remodel - they put one of these in  but never actually went to one until one opened up nearby... this place is confusing as it looks nice inside with nice tables and seating but ordering seems to be hell. like you are at mc donald's- but unlike mc donald's or other fast food places - there are no pictures or numbers to order from and you just feel pressured to order something to make it all go away and let the mounds of hungry people behind you put in their orders... plus it always seems to be over 10$ for a sandwich and drink - for so-so quality ... i could go to san francisco bakery and cafe or little deli - pay the same price and get a really good sandwich and a friendlier - and - local atmosphere.

Everything looks nice and clean at this location
I love it, btw they have better coffee than starsucks,.. Yes , STARSUCKS

I really love the food at Panera, but the personal is not quite friendly. They gave me not what I ordered. It was a misunderstanding so I came back to change it and the cashier started talking to me in very rude way. I asked for a manger and she just laughed at me. The manager apologized but not the girl who was rude to me. I really didn't like that experience. It is not the way customers suppose to be treated.
They took away my favorite: Asian Sesame Chicken Salad. They were out of most breads, including baguettes and most bakery items. Disappointing.

I was able to order a catered lunch for a dozen people and have it ready in under an hour! The gentleman who helped was very prompt & courteous especially given the short notice. He even made the menu which had multiple types of sandwiches, salad, chips, cookies, & lemonade! Will use Panera again when I need to cater a quick, painless lunch.

Oh Panera, why did you get my chicken thai salad wrong? I mean corn and beans in my hair salad make no sense. I rate it four start because I'm addicted to this salad. That's all I go here for. Well the bagels are good but I don't know if that's frozen like most of their products. The salads are at least fresh. I was disappointed when I opened my bag and gaunt corn and beans in my salad. I mean don't get me wrong, I still ate it and I love those veggies too but I wanted my edamame. Maybe next tune they'll get it right.

Although the food is good, is it too much to ask to get a little soup with my bread bowl?  They give me an extra side of bread, as if I didn't have enough carbs in my meal, but didn't fill my small cup of soup to the top.  When I asked if I could get a bowl size of soup instead I was told it was IMPOSSIBLE!  I even offered to pay extra for more soup, but was told no.  Needless to say Panera lost all of my future business today.

I used to be a big fan of Panera, but I must say I think my last few experiences have given me enough reason to not return. 

Suffice it to say, prices seem on a steady climb while food palatability seems to be trending ever downward. I love that Panera is trying to remove junk (artificial ingredients, colors, etc.) from its food, and I'd happily support that, but the food is just no good anymore. 

Admittedly, I haven't visited Panera in a long time, but today I bought a meal, fountain drink and coffee mug "for here" for $17.60. I'm serious. Almost $20 for a meal, drink, and coffee. At Panera. For that, I could've gone next door to Whole Foods for significantly more, and significantly better quality food. Food that I could've EATEN. 

I ordered the Wonton Broth bowl for the first time today, and I couldn't eat more than 1 bite. For that matter, I couldn't stand having it at the table with me, the smell of it was just atrocious. -- And I love asian -and asian-inspired- foods. I've never met an asian food I couldn't at least power through, if I paid for it.  --- And I've had fish head soup.

Anyways. I dropped the uneaten bowl off in the disposal area and went to get something else, since I was still hungry. I ended up just getting a chocolate croissant. I joked with the girl at the register about how I was not AT ALL a fan of the wonton soup, so I was just going to get dessert. Despite my protests, she went to tell the manager...and he walked straight past me without a word. I paid $9 for a bowl I couldn't even stand the smell of. The manager didn't care. I bought my croissant (another $2.79) and went back to my seat.

Then I went to get a mug of coffee to drink with my croissant. Wouldn't you know it, both urns left out for the afternoon are empty. I asked for some Decaf to be made, and they made some.

Anyways, this felt like a total waste of $20 and I will not be returning. For that much I can get 2 really good meals, drinks and dessert from Whole foods next door.

I know that Panera is a soulless corporate chain, but growing up in a smaller city where that rules, I have grown to love Panera.

My go-to sandwich is the Asiago Roast Beef, which this location delivered to perfection. Their chips are always good, and a Clausen style pickle spear to finish it off is a nice touch.

The waiting area in this restaurant is a little bit awkward for to-go orders, so they could improve on that, but otherwise it was a very good experience.

My $6 turkey BLT was an abomination. It was about the size of the palm of my hand and the ingredients were as fresh as the sandwich was large. The staff didn't know any of the ingredients in food on the menu. I'd ask for my money back, but now I'm 11 miles away, forced to eat the bitter bread of discontent and tell of it over the yelpisphere.

When ordering, the service is always great, but the tables aren't always clean. I usually get the pick two onion soup and bacon turkey bravo. The chips are good. The wifi is great if you need a place to sit and work.

It's Panera.  You know what it is.  It's no worse or better than any other Panera I've been to, and I've been to many Paneras, spanning six states.  Yes, it's a chain, but that doesn't automatically make it a lesser establishment, not necessarily.

Panera was originally called St. Louis Bread Company (and still is, if you go to StL), so to me it's sort of a little slice of home, when I feel like escaping Austin but can't.  "Corporate" or "chain" are often used as pejoratives, even by me, but I give Panera a free pass just for being so reliably good.

Assuming you're well acquainted with Panera, I don't know what you need to hear about this particular location except the layout of the interior.  It's a pretty good-size Panera, with two walls completely covered in panel windows facing 360 and the parking lot, north and west (so you know which way the sunlight is going to come in).  Lots of tables, and the more lounge-like chairs are off in the far corner, kind of tucked away for good reading.  Usually, I just bring my laptop, order a bagel and coffee, and watch the sunset.

If you've never been to a Panera anywhere, then it's about time you did, and I'll tell you what to expect:

Hot paninis or cold sandwiches, various soups, and salads.  Sides include a baguette, apple, or chips (I think a spear pickle is included with all of them).  Lots of bagels and cream cheeses to choose from, cookies, scones, stuff like that.  And, of course, the bread.  You can order a loaf of any kind of bread to go, which makes a great item to bring to a party.  You can also order soup... in a bowl MADE OF bread, and how many places can say that?

They have great pumpkin spice lattes in the fall, but other than that I usually just stick to the black coffee, so I don't know about their other drinks.  The iced green tea is good.

Really, I'd give it 5 stars except I'm sometimes disappointed in their coffee, and this goes for all locations.  It's like a plague upon all Panera franchises.  They're good about brewing fresh pots every 90 minutes or so, but sometimes it's burned.  And honestly, I'm tired of the same choices: light, dark, or hazelnut?  Yes, there is a fourth option, which is the decaf, but I never touch the stuff.  The very idea of decaffeinated coffee is an abomination, an affront to nature.  Why it isn't outlawed is beyond my comprehension.

But seriously, why hazelnut?  I mean, don't get me wrong.  It's a good flavor.  But the only flavored grounds they ever have?  No experimentation with other flavors?  What about cinnamon, snickerdoodle, or chocolate?  What about Highlander Grog?!  No, it's always the same old hazelnut.  For the most part, the same goes for the rest of the menu: they found something that worked, and haven't changed it in years.

The other thing that holds back a five-star rating is the ambient music.  All Paneras have this kind of cheap, generic jazz playing at all times, which is part of the vibe.  It's upbeat, and it's okay, but you're never going to be treated to some really, really good jazz.  Panera jazz is its own type of jazz.  It's all part of the predictable Panera package.

That's a chain restaurant for you.  It's a two-edged sword.  On one hand, it's reliable, you always know what to expect, and if that's what you're in the mood for, you can COUNT on it, without disappointment.  On the other hand, the three choices of coffee do get old, and the palate eventually gets bored and wants to wander and discover new things.  Panera's hazelnut is good, though, for what it is.

Your coffee experience will vary depending on who brewed it and when it was brewed, but they helpfully display the exact time it was brewed.  I seem to have the worst luck, because lately every time I go it's already cooled down too much even as soon as it comes out of the thermos.  That, I hate.  Their coffee simply isn't good enough to be likable when it approaches room temperature, I'm sorry.

If you have more of a sweet tooth, I used to order and recommend the frozen caramel espresso.  It's quite a rush, and it tastes like happy.

For soups, I have to recommend French Onion.  It also comes with Gruyere and Asiago croutons, which add a lot to the flavor.  Order it with a baguette, so you can tear it into little pieces for dipping.  Mmm-mmmm.

For the paninis, I tend to go with the Smokehouse Turkey.  Very good on a cold day. 

Really, everything on the menu is practically a clinically-proven combination of complementary flavors.  But my favorite item on the entire menu is the Bacon Turkey Bravo sandwich!  Smoked turkey breast, bacon, smoked Gouda, lettuce, tomatoes, and their signature dressing, all on my favorite bread, Tomato Basil.  The bread alone is flavorful enough to be a meal, but the decision to go with smoked Gouda for the cheese was a stroke of genius.  My favorite sandwich ever.

Just don't get your hopes up about the coffee.

Wow... it's been a long time since I've gotten to add a business on Yelp! First to review is rare these days!

Panera has really great bread, really good sandwich's, and really delicious desserts. I'm strictly a lunch eater here... this place makes a great sandwich. Maybe the best in North Austin...

The problem is you can spend 20 dollars for two people to eat lunch pretty easily. Not a place for a lunch on the cheap. 

They have breakfast, coffee, bagels, bread, etc... but I've only been here for the sandwich's But since the bread is what makes their sandwich's so good I'm assuming their other bread type menu items are great. 

If you're looking for a good sandwich and no hassle I would stop by Panera. If you're seeking more of a local feel then I would look elsewhere.

I will say this... they have some of the best Chai Tea in Austin.

Was all set to really like this place since I'd had an occasion to try one in Fayetteville, AR a couple weeks ago. Although the pastries I had at that time were great, I'd say my lunch at this new North Austin location was nothing more than average. I had a roast beef sandwich. It had cheddar, onion and a creamy horseradish sauce on it. The bread was the best part of the sandwich. The roast beef was way too overdone for my liking. I prefer it when there's at least some pink to a roast beef sandwich; theirs had none.

I'd also prefer to have at least one or two other choices for sides with my sandwich. The only option was potato chips, which I don't really like. I would have preferred pasta salad, potato salad or fruit...none of these options were available.

My wife had a chicken and fuji apple salad. I think we were both under the impression the salad would have apple pieces in it....To be fair, it does have apple pieces, but those pieces are in the form of dehydrated apple chips, the kind you'd find in a batch of trail mix. The taste was really strange. The chicken was really good though. Too bad that was the only part of the salad I liked.

Lastly, I had a caramel nut brownie. The brownie was dry and the flavor was average at best.

I would have given this place only 2 stars if I didn't feel fairly confident I can find something else there that I'll like. My mother-in-law loves the pannini sandwich that has turkey and artichokes on it, so I'll try that next time.

If it sucks next time, I won't go there again.
I love the products here, but am APPALLED  that you run out of your souffles at 9:30am on a Sunday. That's not good planning IMO. Could do better!

I think Panera would get more 5 stars by folks if it wasn't a chain. Another reviewer described Panera as a "soul-less corporate chain", but I don't think that's necessarily fair to Panera. Just because a restaurant has such a good thing going that it's profitable to duplicate that good thing elsewhere, doesn't make it soul-less.

I'm giving them 5 stars for being one of the most comfortable places to go in Austin to eat a good meal and get on pretty reliable WiFi. The soups are darn good, the tea has a good taste to it, and there are a lot of options. The pastries are pretty good, although I rarely partake. The bagels are good, too. I rarely order anything else so I can't speak to the sandwiches that folks seem to complain about on these reviews. 

Also - the staff are really friendly and are obviously trained to please customers. Paige gets props for being consistently friendly and on the ball and is a credit to the restaurant. I know that fast-casual restaurant jobs at chain restaurants are not long term careers necessarily, so I appreciate the consistent attempts to be pleasant and helpful by all of the staff even during the lunch rush. 

I'm glad there are a few Paneras in Austin.

other than standing for 5 minutes without being acknowledged with no one else is line I would say everything was just ok... Well the BBQ chicken mac & cheese didn't have any BBQ flavor.. Nothing to yell about just average..Not a good visit.

Another story of success going to people's heads.  Our one visit to this store during our lifetimes!  We placed our order.  They completely lost my wife's order, and they brought me just one item I had ordered, and my wife spent the next ten minutes trying to track down the rest of it.
Once I got my panini, I opened it up to take a look, and it appeared to be just a little cheese on top of bread, no steak.  However, upon lifting up some of the cheese, voila!, there was some steak.  So we paid $7 for a sandwich that consisted of bread and cheese, with a tiny bit of steak thrown in.
This store treats customers like we are there to serve them, not the other way around.  To me, if customer service is not your top priority, nothing else you do matters.  I don't know about the other stores around Austin and Round Rock, but I would avoid this one at all costs.

I moved here from Indiana (I am not FROM there, I was there for school, to be clear).  The only thing they had in the middle of the corn, blonds, and occasional cow was the university, and 4 bars.  For real.  I was understandably eager to skip town ASAP, but when I got to Austin, I couldn't find soup. Why would I be trying to find soup right?  That's dumb!  But I like a good, wholesome, hearty and flavorful soup, and that's the one other thing Indiana had: Panera.  Of course, it was freezing a good part of the year, so you sometimes wanted to pour a bowl of soup into your pants *and* eat soup, then have ice cream, then eat a pastry, because all there was to do there was eat and grow like 6 pant sizes.

I digress.  Austin is at soup temperature most times, but regardless I have a special place in my heart for the chicken noodle and french onion soups at Panera.  Their other vegetarian soups are also happiness-making, and the service at this location is great.  There's usually a clump of folks against the wall, trying to decide what to order before looking ready for one of the like 20 people fielding orders at the cash registers.  The Mediterranean sandwich is yummadelicious and I'd sooner get any of the sandwiches than a salad to go with my soup in the Pick 2 special. The salads can be smallish.

I know, I know. You got me. Look, it's a chain. Okay. Anyway, whatever; I'm already getting frustrated. I don't want to argue with you. But I haven't seen a local spot offer such variety in soups and sandwiches for me to pick from. Until that happens, I'm going to hit up that free wifi and grab a nice warm bowl of soup to eat under the AC.  Afternoon delight.

I've been to this Panera a few times, but this review is based only on my last visit.  I placed a call-in order and when I came to pick it up it wasn't ready.  I was totally fine with that.  The cashier immediately handed me a free large drink and apologized and I was like...oh ok, cool, cool.  So I hung out by the pick-up counter and after a minute or so the guy back there told me they were out of my Summer Corn Chowder.  I was a little bummed...but still not angry or upset at all.  I gave him a substitute soup and all of a sudden the cashier from before came rushing at me with an enormous coffee cake and shoved it into my arms saying "I'm so sorry for the wait--please take this free of charge!"  So I skipped out of Panera today with some free drinks and a free cake all because I had to wait like...six minutes!  Just wanted to say thanks to cashier Devin (I think) for being so nice.  

I will say that my Shrimp Salad Sammie was a little bland...but I mean it's a chain.  Good days and bad.  I love bread and I love cheese and pastries and everything Panera stands for, so let's be real I'm gonna be back no matter what happens to me there.  

Fab job today Team Panera!  Thanks for brightening my day.

Ham and cheese sandwiches should probably be made with ham, guys.

Ordered a sandwich online. Took my HILARIOUSLY brief lunch break to go get my sandwich. Got back to the office to find? No fucking ham. Seriously?

I have no more lunch break left to leave my office to go correct this shit. 
Panera said they would refund my money (they did), and deliver a new sandwich to my office (45 minutes and counting, and my office is less than a mile from the cafe . . . ). 
We'll see if they come through.

UPDATE:
The fixed sandwich is TWICE the size of the original (french baguette). Looks like the fixed sandwich is a full baguette, and the original is only half.

So the question is: Did I get MORE sandwich because I complained (and they royally fucked up)? Or is this the CORRECT sandwich size?

I don't much care for being cheated.
My first time using the Rapid Pick-up order feature and it was awesome! Order and pay online, drive there and it was ready for me to grab and go! Excellent soup and salad for lunch.

Hooray for a Panera location close to my house--it's about time!  This store isn't the cleanest (hello, stains on the carpet) but I can't complain about the food. Well, except that they've been out of the Tomato Basil bread a few times.  My friend, however, does have the right to complain.  She and I both ordered the same exact thing--Turkey Bacon Bravo sandwich--and her sandwich was at least 50% smaller due to the size of the bread.  They should've been embarrassed to serve it to her!  When she asked them about it, they said that my bread was bigger because I had gotten the last two pieces of one loaf, so the next loaf that they used was smaller, hence the miniscule pieces.  LAME.  The food is amazing and incredibly fresh.  Why can't I make a sandwich as awesome as they can?  I have sandwich envy.

I'm so glad to have a Panera across the street from me, but my god, this place has the absolute SLOWEST service I've ever experienced. The food isn't bad and is up to par for sure, but I don't understand how it can take 10-15 minutes for a breakfast sandwich on a Saturday when there are three people in there! Show me where the ingredients are and I'll make it myself! Makes me miss the Lakeline one, but I'm too addicted to the hazelnut coffee with cream and 2 sugar in the raw packets to give this place up. I'll be back, reluctantly.

Sorry, haven't tried the bread at this one yet. But they have lots and lots of seating (comfy), and outlets too - plus free wireless! Score. Has much potential to be a new home-away-from home, and the coffee is affordable too ($1.70 for a small).

Sometimes you just want a change of pace from the groovy heart-of-Austin cafes.
Great Customer Service, The Panera Perks Card Is A Must Have! Great Everything ;)

"They mess up my order way too often..." said another commenter.  Exactly the problem.  Over and over again.  Then when you ask them to fix it, they explain how you should have placed your order differently because "please add American cheese" is apparently way too complicated for them to understand.  Soups are great, sandwiches only work if you order it EXACTLY as shown.  And they need customer service training for the food expediters.
Odd situations have happened to me here Lol But, they have always come in with a save. Awesome lunch, quick pick-up service, wonderful managers!

This is a large Panera, which means most of the time the WiFi barely works at all.

Aside from the Summer when it's too hot, the outdoor seating is far enough from the street to be pleasant and not noisy.

I have a Panera card that they swipe every time I buy something but it doesn't seem to have any benefit at all.

A favorite stop in the mornings! I like that you can get nearly anything off the menu at 6:45 am. And the vegetarian choices? Awesome! I also enjoy the rewards program; it's like having a pal that buys your meal or treat once in a while. 
And last, but certainly not least, the employees at this location are so friendly!

I always crave Panera on cold days. Gotta love bread bowls!!!!

Panera = Happy Lunch!!!

Pretty much your average Panera with lots of seating. Decently priced yet uninspiring sandwiches. My order gets messed up way too often. How did my side of chips turn into the tiniest little apple I've ever seen. At least give full-sized apples! Also I get confused when the staff tries to deliver my food to me as my buzzer goes off. How can they keep track of my location that well with so many people around?

This is a Pepsi establishment. That means no Diet Coke (no one drinks Diet Pepsi). Fortunately there is the always-fantastic Dr Pepper.

I love Panera's breakfast items - especially the cinnamon crunch bagel.  There are big windows in the dining area that makes it light and open and they have a lot of booths that have plugs for your computer.  It is a wonderful relaxing place to work in the morning or meet with friends.

Good food, good prices, decent ambiance

I was pleasantly surprised upon entering this restaurant.  I haven't been to a Panera for about 10 years, and I wasn't expecting much. The atmosphere (especially behind the counter) is wonderful, however. I really enjoyed seeing (and smelling) all the fresh breads and pastries upon entering. There's nothing like a whiff of fresh bread at lunch time....

I ordered the tuna salad and some chips. The tuna was made with quality ingredients and came with tomato, lettuce and onion. It was of much higher quality than say.. a Subway. The bread was excellent - a type of wheat - that you could tell was amazingly fresh. It was still warm even!  The chips were generic potato chips, but were not as unhealthy as Lay's or something like that. The sandwich and chips were about $7.50.

The ambiance was nice enough for a sandwich shop. The colors were warm and earthy, and the seating was comfortable. It wasn't too loud but the atmosphere wasn't dead either. There's always a bit of hustle and bustle behind the counter because they're baking. I enjoy watching this process and seeing this activity. It's much more enjoyable than... again, a Subway where all you see is some old bread sitting in a warming oven.

The staff at the restaurant was also very pleasant. The manager came by to ask how everything was, and it was great, and he moved on.  The woman behind the counter was nice enough as well. She put the drink my friend ordered on my tab since all I wanted was water - saved us a buck or so. I really appreciated that.

I have absolutely no complaints about this location, and I expect we'll be back!

I know it's a chain but at the end of the day it's all about consistency and customer service, for me. 
Every time I walk-in I'm greeted with a friendly smile and someone is always willing to answer whatever questions I might have.

I ordered the bacon egg and cheese sandwich and a couple of coffee. I was then asked if I'd like to purchase a pastry for only $.99 more because I was on their Panera rewards club. I didn't get it but it was nice to know that there are perks available for people who frequent this establishment. 

I got their hazelnut coffee, which is amazing and my sandwich was ready before I could finish stirring in my sugar and cream. 
The cashier noticed that my hands were a little fool so help grab my sandwich and followed me to the table. She then asked if there's anything else she could do before she walked away. 
About two seconds after I was done with my sandwich one of the managers walked by and asked how everything was and if you could take my empty plate. 
Seems that everything they are doing is what people should be doing on every day basis but sadly in Austin, it sometimes can be hard to find great customer service.

My first visit to this place. Ordered a bread bowl since they looked good. Didn't receive the bread bowl. The soup wasn't anything I'd order again. Not enough flavor. They did comp me a pastry. I got a cheese danish. So, so good. I would be back for that pastry alone.

Horrible.  They Really don't have their act together. I ordered a cup of chicken noodle soup and a roll with butter. The soup was lukewarm and the bread was hard as a rock, although it's not meant to be.  I went to the counter to complain about the bread and, By the way, no butter. I was told to put the bread in the microwave. REALLY?  The bread was so darned old they wanted me to nuke it?  A nice man who was a member of the staff who delivered food said he would get me another. He did. When he took the old bread, he said, "This really IS hard".  The soup was so bland (and warm) that I went in search for salt. My search was not rewarded.

      Another woman started to get iced coffee from their machine, but it was very "light" in color.  She tasted it and found that it was iced tea.  The waitstaff didn't seem to believe her, so the staff person poured some herself and tasted it.  Realizing it was indeed, tea, she re-made the contents of the dispenser.  

      Management seems to have been absent from this Panera.  The staff needs training, although each one was very polite.

     Oh, and by the time I got a packet of butter, I had to use the end of my soup spoon to spread it. No knife!

I've been a long time Panera fan since my high school days but man have they gone down hill over the years. I still enjoy the atmosphere but I can no longer defend their prices and quality.

Food here is expensive. Period. There's no way around it. $7 for a tiny sandwich? $10 for a small bowl of pasta? And no, the quality does NOT justify the cost. Worst of all, they no longer allow bagel substitution as a side item! What a bummer. 

Quantity is the other problem. Their bowls look big but they never fill it up all the way. I've always liked their Napa Almond Chicken Salad sandwich but it's just a small scoop of chicken salad placed on a regular square slice of white bread. I got their Chicken Tortellini Alfredo in large a few weeks ago and I honestly thought they gave me the small portion by mistake (I even brought it back to the counter). It's just sad.

Oh, and do yourself a favor and DO NOT get their new "broth bowls". They're a joke. I tried their Soba Noodle Bowl with Chicken and it was the smallest portion of noodle I've ever had. Again, deceptively large bowl but unfortunately, it's only about 1/4 filled. As for the taste, it's just... regular soup. It's so normal that I can't think of an adjective to describe it. Don't be fooled, there's nothing Japanese about it. It's actually kind of insulting that they've added soba into this "broth". And guess what, it cost $13 with the chicken add-on!!!

So yeah, I'm out. I don't foresee myself coming back often anymore, which is sad. Austin, please open a Mod Market or something.

Wow this Panera is horrible. I got the frontega chicken panini for $8 and I ended up throwing away half bc it wasn't worth it. It comes w fresh basil, there was literally a tiny piece of basil on the entire sandwich (see picture), the cheese was barely melted and the sandwich was just not good. My side was an apple that looked like it had just gotten bounced off the floor before they put it on my plate. Much better options in Austin.

Convient area, but generally understaffed, and definitely not trained well. So sad for customers and employees. When an employee has no idea how to run register, and hes to keep asking for help. Because her trading is on the job using US, our orders and our time to practice on. 
 Not good for lunch time quickness at all!
Inconsistent. I love something one day, and can't get it made or even REMADE CORRECT  the next day? I DON'T HAVE TIME ON MY LUNCH BREAK FOR THIS. Why do I come here and waste my money and time when there are so many other great places? oh ya location
My picture of the non-cleaned table(s) says it all.

Customer service has been lacking the last three times we've gone in. I think staff has said a total of 5 words in that time. Also, it does not appear that attention is paid to orders. As seen below, the bread ordered was croissant. What was received is the most baguette-looking croissant I have ever seen.

Panera robbed me of some chicken soup.

My wife ordered a cup of soup while I ordered a bowl.

The bowl DISH is bigger but the portions were the same. Robbed.

I stopped into Panera while the incompetent people at Sprint upstairs were busy erasing all my personal and business contacts from my phone for a routine software fix. More on that later. 

I ordered the "Get Two" special that should have been around $6, but I ordered two "signature" dishes, and it upped the price. With a drink, the meal came to $11. 

The half-sandwich was a turkey club with applewood smoked bacon and smoked Gouda. It was supposed to come on tomato basil bread, but they were out. Fine with me, I wanted sourdough anyway. I elected to have the small bowl of Vermont Cheddar mac and cheese being advertised on all the huge billboards. My side? More bread, a French baguette. 

Other than the fact that I was sitting down to essentially a heaping, malicious pile of carbs that would eventually make me bust my designer belts, the meal was OK. It wasn't exactly a filling meal, to me it was more like light fare. Light fare is great, but $11 can get me a real meal anywhere else. For what you get, it's a little pricey. 

The spread on the sandwich was not as flavorful as I expected, but it was passable. The mac and cheese was my favorite part, what with the tangy white cheddar. I'd definitely reorder it, maybe as the entire meal. The baguette? Meh, whatever. Kinda dry. And they gave me whole wheat, but it's fine. 

I appreciated the atmosphere; it was clean, with tasteful bread-themed decorations. The staff was friendly, and even the bus boy asked me how my evening was going. 

I think the only thing that really pissed me off was that they used Pepsi products. Couldn't even get a DIET Dr. Pepper. Suck.

The food here is pretty good, but I continue to be amazed at the incompetence of the workers.  Mostly teenagers who have not been given near enough training by their managers, who are usually nowhere to be seen.  Last week we were informed that they couldn't toast a bagel because their toaster had been broken for 3 days.  And when it is working , you have to remind them what the difference between 'toasted' and 'warm' is.  Today I asked them to toast the bagels so they are a little brown on top and was told "I'll try."  If you order something to go don't even think about leaving without checking the bag or you most likely will be sorry when you get home. If you order a latte, make sure the order taker tells the person making the drinks or you will wait forever.  I could provide lots more examples but you should experience the idiocy yourself.

You like soup and salad for lunch?  How about a sandwich and a salad?  Maybe you  just want a sandwich.  Or maybe you wanna say eff it to that diet and just eat a sexy pastry instead!  Whatever floats your boat, man, just come eat here!

This place has it going on.  I went with the half a sandwich and side salad option.  I subbed the Tomato Basil bread instead of the honey wheat 'cause I'm crazy like that.  And as I stared down at what looked like mounds of pillowy goodness (not my boobs, guys, I'm talkin bread here) I almost shed a tear because I knew that first bite was gonna be awesome.  And it was!

Not to mention that my salad was excellent.  There's some sort of specialness that Panera puts into every one of their vinaigrettes.  EVERY single one is freakin' fantastic; I especially like the Fuji Apple one.  And even though I forgot to order the vinaigrette on the side today, all was good with the world because Panera doesn't use a heavy hand when tossing my salad (again, mind out of the gutter, please)!

So yeah, if you're looking for a lunch that comes with a very happy ending then I suggest you come here, and often.

Have had consistent issues when I have food delivered.  They serve their full sized salads in a plastic shaped bowl and every time I have received it they only fill it halfway with a great deal of space between salad and lid.  The last time I called I was told "the manager made it himself with the proper portions" and to leave my number so that he could call me back sometime after 1:30 PM.  It's been over a week and I have yet to receive that call.

Overall, if Panera can't handle providing a full bowl for their full sized salad.  Then they need to get a different bowl so their "proper portions" can fill up to the brim of something.

I don't consider 2 hours to deliver a sandwhich "rapid".
Yesterday I desired just a simple turkey sandwich.  I considered Jimmy John's but wanted a more homestyle bread.  So I decided to order from the Panera that is 1.4 miles from my office. Order placed at 1:43PM.  I was given a delivery window of 30-45 mins.  Around 3PM- I called- no sandwhich and thier VM was full.  Then a coworker starts calling on my behalf as I am with customers.  Still no sandwhich.  At 4:15, the sandwhich finally arrives- my office is closed and I am about to go out to see another customer!  The young delivery man with a piercing through his nose says, "It's not my fault."  And the young man fails to take ownership of the error. I asked for the name of his manager and he stammers that he doesn't know it!  He was an Panera Employee mind you!  He was wearing a shirt and a name tag from Panera.  
To make matters worse- it was my birthday- thank you Panera for being so bad at your jobs that you cannot get a sandwhich delivered within 1.4 miles.

I use rapid pick up when I order, and it seems like there's always something missing when I get home. This time was the last straw... I ordered one of the really cute pumpkin cookies, and the photo here is what I received. Ugliest cookie I've ever seen, and NOWHERE NEAR what it is supposed to look like. What happened here, Panera??
Had a meeting here this morning and grabbed a cup of coffee and pecan roll.  I was more than happy with both.

Went in to buy some loaves of fresh bread for a party. It was 12:30pm and there were exactly two random loaves left. I asked when they'd have more ready and what kind would they have. The man working was really snippy and said that was all the bread left for the entire day. He continued saying that most people come in at 7am to buy their loaves so by noon they're usually out. Wow. Seriously? Panera used to be a bakery. I don't know but, if it was my "bakery" and I was open til 9pm and I was sold out of BREAD by noon, I might bake more bread. That coupled with the attitude from the dude behind the counter, I won't go back to Panera ever.

Panera isn't the best place ever, but it's consistently delicious and is a quick option when you want a tasty sandwich or salad. They also have these little quiche things for breakfast that are out of this world. Carbs carbs carbs. Mmmm

This is all you need to know: half greek chicken salad, broccoli cheese soup, and a baguette.   Not a huge fan of their sandwiches, but I love their salads, soups, and their cookies are ridici-good (especially the brownie cookie thing I had - so flippin' awesome!!!).

Bonus points for: full nutrition facts on the website, and salads that aren't over 1000 calories (because please, if I wanted a 1000 calorie meal, it would not be a salad - it better be fried, smothered in cheese, and dipped in ranch).  However, some of their sandwiches ARE, and they really don't seem to be worth the calories.

Not a negative to me, but potentially to some - portions are not huge.  If you're ravenous, you might consider going elsewhere or ordering an extra side.

First time coming to this panera and it was a terrible experience. My bread was as hard as a rock. Tasted stale so I couldn't even eat then. Then I bit into my sandwich and it tasted weird. I looked inside and my bacon was brown and green. Looks like mold. Disgusting.

Underwhelming.  I get it that this place is a chain, but it's not one I frequent and I was recently reminded why.  The bread is truly the standout here so I can see why it's in the name - Panera BREAD.  Problem is, the bread is needlessly ruined and the bits in between the bread on their sandwiches are lacklustre at best. This location packages their sandwiches with a pickle and that's not listed anywhere on the ordering system / menu, and the pickle's juice seeps all over the butcher paper in which they wrap their product, thus ruining the lovely bread.  Beyond that, the meats are bland and taste only of salt, and the bacon is comically bad.  The soups here are the way to go, but there are so many better options around for good soup so you'd be better off at one of them.

I came to Panera just to buy a gift card for a Christmas present. I saw they were advertising a $50 card, get a $10.00 card free. Woohoo. I just gifted to myself. The assistant manager was not understanding what I was trying to do. She thought I was using the gift card to place an order. I was trying to buy a gift card for $50.00 I gave her cash and she gave me change back. Then she asks me if I'm paying with a credit card. I already gave her $50.00 and she gave me change back. Then after all of that, the register didn't print a receipt. I don't want to give a gift card without some proof that there's $50.00 on it. I wasn't confident that the assistant manger knew what she was doing. I will be calling the number on the back of the card to be sure that the balance is actually $50.00

What a pathetic salad.  This was my third trip to Panera, and I was trying to figure out if they got 3 or 4 stars before I wrote my review.  Well, after eating that salad I can firmly give them two stars.

Grilled chicken caesar salad.  The lettuce had too much of the white core, and not enough leaf.  The dressing was bland and lacked much flavor.  The chicken was soggy and unpalatable.  The croutons were chewy.  (yes, the bread place didn't know how to make a crunch crouton)

They get two stars because the two meals I had before were okay.  If this had been my first trip they would have gotten one star and I would have written them off as a bad salad and sandwich shop trying to be high end.

You will get one more chance, Panera.... but it won't be a salad!

There is a young black woman named Trissa at this location being racist to white patrons. She brought our orders (one in each hand) and after placing them on the table she asked: "Is there anything I can help you with?" To which I replied: "I also ordered a Mocha," she replied with a condescending voice and rude attitude: "WELL, I ONLY HAVE TWO HANDS." I was willing to let it go, but once we were finished she came back and asked: "Can I remove your plates?" I said: "Sure, thanks! And then she rudely asked: "CAN YOU PUT YOUR NAPKIN ON THE PLATE?" I told her: "No." Got up and reported it to her manager.

Worst experience ever. Tried coming here for breakfast. Waited over 20 for a bagel with cream cheese. When presenting my complaint to manager Martin, he was very rude and basically said "sorry but we have other costumers we are trying to take care of too."

Worst costumer service and employees that aren't properly trained.

Without a doubt the worst grilled cheese sandwich of my life, bar none! It had a total of about 2 inches of bread and one measly slice of cheese. And to top it off, it was not grilled! It was toasted in an oven and the cheese was burned. I have never been a fan of Panera and once again that is substantiated.  At least they refunded my money.

I came to this location during my lunch and ordered the pick 2 with a sandwich and mac.  Everything went smoothly at first, up until I was standing in the back watching them bake my sandwich.  The lady was taking it out the oven and it flipped over, with the top part of my sandwich hanging on the black rod in the back of the oven.  I watched her use 2 different utensils to (literally) poke at, and scrape, the top of my sandwich off the lever, then she proceeds to put it on top of the bottom half and box it up.

The guy who checks the orders saw this too and didn't say anything.  So I asked her directly, since I saw the whole thing, why she would serve that and she said "there's nothing wrong with it".  I don't know what world she comes from, but in my world, you remake the sandwich, which I had them do.  Then when it was remade, she just puts it by my bag and the order checker guy didn't even try to repackage it.  So I did it myself.

Those 2 people are crap.  Hence the 2 star review.  I'll just go to another Panera where the people making food and checking orders have more common sense.
For the business traveller, this is a great place to grab a decent, solid breakfast. The staff is really nice, and the food is good to boot.

thought I would read reviews before I went to Panera. Did not go after reading them. Sounds like this place or location needs to be closed down. came here from Houston which has very good restaurants from fast food up. So far Austin has been the pits for eating out. Other people I have met here that are from other cities agree. Are people so laid back and weird here that they can't run a decent eatery, even a franchise that lays out how to do everything out for them!

I need to start this review by noting that I am reviewing this place as a work/study AND bakery/restaurant. 

The good:
Atmosphere: The atmosphere here is one of the best for opening up the laptop and getting work done. Nice large windows, well lit and open interior, some outdoor seating, electrical outlets, and free wi-fi. 

Chicken and mushroom soup - great creamy soup with some meatiness to it. 

Dessert selection is very wide for the pastry lover (look at this as good or bad. muahahahaaa!). Decent scones, coffee cake, muffins, muffin tops, cookies, etc. 

The bad points:
Hours: it closes at 9pm.... this is too early to close. 

Soups are rotated. I really only like 1 or 2 of the soups, so if they rotate them out, it's just about enough to make me go to a different location. 

Parking: the lot is shared with REI, a movie theater's overflow, Whole Food's overflow... you get the picture.

Why would you have an "Associate Trainer" training personnel when they have no sense of good customer service?

I walked up to one of the two registers (wrong one apparently) and noticed 2 men standing off to my left on the other side of the 2nd register.  I looked over and the older of the two gave me a head jerk and motioned me over.  No smile, No "I can help you over here ma'am"  A HEAD JERK!!  
I asked for a Cesar Salad and he said something to me which I didn't hear and responded "What's that"?  With the most Snarky attitude, he said, well, it's a whole salad vs a half salad.  
I hope that the young people he's training don't get the impression that it's ok to be rude to clients

I'm a huge fan of Panera but this is the worst location that I've ever been to. Arrived about 5:00 on a week night and it wasn't crowded. We placed our order & the girl behind the counter seemed new, not a problem but she seemed to be struggling and finally asked for help. We went to the drink station to get our drinks & it was dirty. As we went to find a place to sit there were only a few people eating so plenty of places to sit but then we noticed lots of dirty tables. We cleaned our own booth with a few napkins as there wasn't anybody to ask to wipe up the table. Our order arrived & it was wrong so they corrected the order & it took a while. It was for a grain bowl nothing that complicated. We finished our dinner & my husband went to use the men's room. No paper towels so he came out by drink station to look for a few napkins. They were all empty. As we finished up we did notice a girl starting to wipe up & clear a few tables. Our food was ok but portions were really small! We've eaten at several locations, even out of state, and this is by far one of the worst restaurants we've been to. We will not give up on Panera but will never eat here again.

I met a client here for lunch - ordered the half Italian sandwich and half Greek salad.  They handed me a buzzer and off we went to sit.  About 15 minutes later I hear my name being yelled out that my order was ready.  I walked over to the food counter and picked it up myself.  No big deal, but why bother giving me a buzzer that doesn't work? 

I really wish I had taken pictures.  The romaine was soggy, the one small tomato quarter was soggy as were the "pickled" onions - kalamata olives you ask?  Yes, there were two of them and they tasted fine.  The sandwich, well, the only part that was half anything was the bread.  The meat was so thin it was barely noticeable. There was one tiny sprig of arugula and a small dot of basil mayo in the middle of the bread, it wasn't even spread out.  It was horribly dry and tasteless.  All in all it was a waste.  I could have gotten a better salad and sandwich at a gas station.
Fav. place to study and get coffee besides starbucks @ Barnes & Noble. I love panera's coffee. Staff here are super nice. Like the seating, interior decor, and free wifi!

I came to Panera just to buy a gift card for a Christmas present. I saw they were advertising a $50 card, get a $10.00 card free. Woohoo. I just gifted to myself. The assistant manager was not understanding what I was trying to do. She thought I was using the gift card to place an order. I was trying to buy a gift card for $50.00 I gave her cash and she gave me change back. Then she asks me if I'm paying with a credit card. I already gave her $50.00 and she gave me change back. Then after all of that, the register didn't print a receipt. I don't want to give a gift card without some proof that there's $50.00 on it. I wasn't confident that the assistant manger knew what she was doing. I will be calling the number on the back of the card to be sure that the balance is actually $50.00. 
So I'm back at Panera, and I have to say. A year later, shitty service. A little common human decency would be appreciated. Sorry I couldn't remember the phone number attached to my Panera Account. I've changed my number a few times. But apparently he only had patience for me to try one number. That's okay. I will NOT be back here again. And I would like to change my two stars to ZERO stars. Rude employee.

I don't get the hype. Smells like burned soup inside and everything seems priced higher than it's worth. Saw a person preparing soup by putting a frozen bag in a machine. If you're into microwaved food this is definitely the place for you.

Visited today after my daughters soccer game, parking lot jammed packed HOWEVER panera nearly EMPTY and i figured out why ! 
1. When ordering for myself, husband & 2 kids @ LUNCH i nearly fell over when our total was 79.00 i immediately questioned it . 3 of us had ordered a soup & sandwich & other a soup and salad this wasn t even with drinks yet it took me helping the cashier over every bit of 5 minutes redoing order to utilize the pick 2 combo option if you will. I asked her why she hadn t done the combos to begin with ? She shrugged & smiled ‍
I returned to purchase chips for my youngest stood at counter no less than 4 minutes while 2 employees walked behind counter i was standing at to grab supplies not once looking up , this happened again when i had to return to counter to get salad dressing they had forgot i unknowingly asked for ranch they don t have ranch however this time after waiting @ counter  i had to eventually go to area where servers get food to deliver to tables 3 employees with backs to me all turned around and WALKED AROUND ME vs asking if i needed anything, i was laughed at as i was told they don t have regular ranch . Just overall a cluster fuck & horrible customer service !
Overpriced not that great food... My iced chai latte tasted like it was spiked with some sort of hipster cleaning solution.  Thank God I used a gift card and didn't have use my own money

I normally LOVE Panera bread but went to this location the other day and had the absolute worst experience. I ordered a pick two with a simple Mac-n-cheese and salad. It took way longer then expected to come out and was terrible. The guy who gave us our food complained that we came in an HOUR before they closed and just handed us our food and left. The Mac-n-cheese was the smallest portion I have ever received and was freezing cold. On top of all of this, every single plate and utensil that was given to us was DIRTY. so disappointed.

Took a star because cashier was on the phone, checking something and not even looking at me, while I was in line with my little one waiting. I was like are you serious on the phone . Ands she mumbled I have kids . Well I am happy for you, but it's awkward since you are on the register on the clock. I hope management will look into that or train team. Food is good as always.

Came here for dinner on a weeknight. Ordered a pick 2 with half chicken avocado sandwich and half Thai salad. (Don't remember the exact names.) The portions were well sized; I was comfortably satisfied after finishing. Service was quick and polite, and the food tasted good. The sandwich was nice and hot, and the salad had a good mix of flavors, maybe a little heavy on the dressing. Would definitely come back again!

I can't believe this place is as crowded every day as it was when I went last Thursday.  I'd never eaten there before, but I'd spied it several times on various trips to the worthless Sprint store upstairs.  Last Thursday, a friend wanted to try it, so I met her and some other people.

We got there early, so the lines weren't very long yet, but you'd think they were with how exhausted and annoyed the counter boy acted.  Everything he said to me was spoken in a bored, sing-songy tone.  I ordered the Get Two with a roast beef sammich (sub mayo for horseradish, no onions), and potato soup.  I also got a choice of apple or potato chips, and I chose the apple.  I completely forgot to order a drink while I was standing there, but Counter Boy advised me that water cups were available at the drink station.  That's when the little cheapskate in me came out.  I filled my water cup with iced tea and went to town.

It didn't take long for my order to come out.  And you could be deceased but still wake up to get your order because they give you one of those annoying coaster pagers to alert you.  Those things are super loud and irritating when they're sitting on a wooden table.  I'd almost rather hear fingernails on a chalkboard.  Or even Yoko Ono singing show tunes.

Anyway, I thought the half sammich was Smurf small, which made me realize that ordering a full sammich for around $6-7 wouldn't be worth it.  As it was, I think I paid about $8 for my grub, which was fair.

Note:  *Cheddar cheese does not taste good with roast beef.  Swiss is much better.*  And the romaine lettuce didn't taste right in combination with the other ingredients.  The bread was too soft for my taste; I prefer a crunch to mine, so the sammich was altogether forgettable.  The soup and apple, however, were decent.  But it's extremely hard to mess up an apple.  The soup is what saved this place from my two-star wrath.  Well, that and my easily-stolen iced tea.

There's a wafer-thin possibility I might go back and try some other soup, but I'll never again mess about with their sammiches.  Them things ain't even passable; they're pass-byable.

Usually when I charge my Tesla I hit (super expensive) Whole foods, last visit i decided to do PB instead, mistake. I put my order in on the little tablet, it kept asking me if i wanna join the reward club or whatever so i went thru typing all my info, then it asks u to slide a card, what card? I slide my debit card and: ERROR, so i do this all again.. ERROR, so I go up to the counter, no other customers around, I wait 10 minutes until an employee FINALLY comes over I tell her what happened, she says I need a panera card for the last part so she gives me a new one, i go waste my time again, swipe the Panera Card at the end... ERROR again. After I get my food, no receipt, I go up to counter cuz i need it for work, seems like an impossible task, I said "I need to eat while I can, if u FINALLY can print it for me I'll be at that table". I would probably never go here again.

Short & sweet review for you guys

Pros: 
-food was good
-wait was not long
-calm ambiance 

Cons:
-epitome of the term "skimp", I specifically ordered arugula in my panini, and what did they give me? REFER to picture 
-lukewarm macaroni 
-overpriced

Horrible customer service! Email indicated a 12:48-12:58 pm delivery & at 1:12 pm I called Panera to obtain status & the manager said he was not going to force his drivers to hurry with today's rainy weather & hung up. Then I get an email at 1:14 pm that the order is en route! I'll never order from here again. DO NOT ORDER FROM PANERA! Manager was a jerk!!!!

I eat here occasionally b/c it's close to work and I can count on a couple of the soups being good so I usually get a pick 2 with half a sandwich or salad. Today I tried the modern caprese sandwich - I do not recommend it. It is served hot - pls don't call it caprese if it's served hot - that doesn't make it "modern", it just makes it not caprese. It was the skimpiest amount of food on a sandwich I've ever seen. I had to take off the top piece of bread and eat it open faced or all I would've tasted would've been bread. There was so little mozzarella that I could barely even taste it under the weird tomato confit. And where was the white bean hummus and balsamic glaze? Very disappointing to spend $13 on so little food. That and the cup of soup did not fill me up. I got it to go or I definitely would've sent it back.
I go to Panera when I want to enjoy my own company. The atmosphere is relaxing- it doesn't feel like they're rushing you out. The food is hit or miss, but it is reliably mediocre.

This was my first time at this Panera location. Place an order from pick-up. Thankfully I checked the bag before I left due to past experiences with other Panera locations. This one was no different. I got a baguette instead of an apple, the wrong type of bread on my sandwich, and no type of greens or lettuce on my sandwich. I asked the person over the counter about the lettuce and he said they were out of emerald greens. I said okay and then asked about my soda cup. He pointed me to the man at the register, where I had to wait for someone to finish ordering before I could ask him if I could just get a cup since they were behind the register. After filling it up, I walked past a half-eaten salad bowl. I realized there was no way they could be out of all greens so I went to the counter and asked if they had literally any type of lettuce. The same man as before started listing different types of lettuce that they had like spinach, romaine, etc. I'm not sure why he didn't tell me that to begin with, I would've taken anything. After he gave me a cup of romaine, I got home and realized I got some sort of cheesy bread instead of sourdough. And I ordered sourdough online because they are ALWAYS out of croissants. For how overpriced Panera is, you'd think they would get your order right and not be out of half their items, including 90% of the bakery. First and last time going to this Panera location. I only went because I had a $10 gift card, which of course didn't cover all of it because of the insane prices.

If you're a fan of lighter fare like soups and sandwiches, Panera is a phenomenal option.  There's a pretty extensive menu, the service is quick, and the food is healthy and above average in quality.  Also, there's a variety of sandwich sizes and combinations to appeal to almost every appetite and health/diet need.

There's also an excellent self-service drink area with a variety of coffees, teas, and soft drinks for all tastes. (Although, fair warning, they're Pepsi products for the soft drinks.)

There's one major factor holding Panera back from that fifth star of excellence.  Namely, Panera's menu board gives you the name of the salad, sandwich, etc -- but zero idea of what's included with the meal.  You have to use their online ordering/app to get an idea of what comes on the sandwich/salad before you order.
First time at this location.  Came in for coffee.  Out of Dark Roast.  More than 5 min to get someone's attention and make more.  Not a quick stop.  Hope they do better.

This place was good around a year or 2 ago. Now the staff is extremely lazy when I went here recently. Employees are either walking around like zombies doing nothing. They forgot I got 2 cookies and gave me one. Didn't read directions and put turkey in my sandwich when we put no turkey. The food tastes hell of a lot worst. And all the drinks are extremely watered down. This place has really gone downhill in the last few years. And how do they run out of bread? A one star review is being generous. Get better employees that actually give 2 shits about work.

What can I say about Panera that hasn't already been said?

Free WI-FI and unlimited coffee and tea..Half a sandwich and a cup of soup, Green Tea iced and a small piece of bread.  It's filling and it tastes fresh.

Panera was voted one of the healthiest places you can eat out, but with the recent addition of their white cheddar mac&cheese, it's probably one of the unhealthiest now.  However, damn, it's so ridiculously delicious.

Clearly this location sucks compared to other Paneras I've been to. 

I picked up my order from rapid pick up a few minutes after the suggested ready time. Got home a few minutes later and noticed that my chipotle chicken sandwich was completely cold. Didn't think much of it because it tasted fine and I couldn't be bothered to complain about it.

Half an hour later, I discover I have food poisoning and it's almost definitely the sandwich. It was only 30-40 minutes between the time that I ordered online and when I ate the sandwich. If proper food safety guidelines were followed, I don't think I'd have gotten sick from food sitting out in that timeframe. Clearly it was out for longer than that. 

I'm extremely disappointed with this experience and don't think I'll return to this location after this. Quality has gone WAY down while prices have skyrocketed. It's unacceptable.

ordered a catering order from here for my company last minute ans they pulled through
o called that morning for 50 bagels and they were ready in about an hour! the choose a great assortment and even carried them out to my car for me 
however i did ask for one muffin (and was charged) however they forgot to add it which bring them down to 4 stars
favorite bagel was the cinnamon crunch one and amazing cream cheeses

Panera is usually a good choice but I could have had a much better experience here. They brought my wife's breakfast order and took the table pager, so I assumed my order was on the way. I was wrong. They forgot to bring my order so after 10 minutes I had to go ask about it. I had a soufflé, which the guy took out of a food warmer. I assumed that it would at least be warm. I was wrong. I don't want to complain unnecessarily but I expected better from Panera. I won't be back.

It's the first weekend in June 2020 and Panera is open again in a social distanced way.  You can eat inside which is why I am reviewing the restaurant. Panera puts some light horseradish sauce on their steak sandwiches which should not bother anyone. The sandwich bread is very light. The sandwich is filling without any heaviness afterwards.  They also had their fresh bagels and fresh pastries to go available which are made overnight at the restaurant. There were less than 10 other diners in the restaurant at any given time during my lunchtime Friday visit. It's good to have a decent place to get something to eat where we can sit down even when it is a nothing special chain restaurant.  After 100 days of not being allowed to do the things we enjoy I find that it is the little things that count: decent food, a place to sit and eat in peace with air conditioning, a calming environment with nice music and friendly people (despite their covered faces).
2nd time this month in a panera to meet someone for coffee. So done. Unimpressive unfriendly service- and jazz to which to commit suicide.

Last weekend I order a meal for delivery which included among other items, an  Everything Bagel and Honey Walnut Cream Cheese.  Received everything but these two items. I tried to text them to the number on which they prompted me that the order was on it's way but that did not work. I looked on the website for a phone number which also did not work. I had to send an email to customer service. When I heard from them they said that they could not send those items to me and that they could credit me for $3.00 off my next order which is less than I paid for the two items. I am beyond disappointed, I am angry that they are unwilling to make things right and deliver these items to me. It's no wonder that they have such poor reviews. It's really sad.  I remember a few years ago they were one of my favorite places to eat. Not again!!

i love this place....sitting here right now by the window with the rain, coffee, delicious apple salad and baked potato soup! The friendliest service from Wes (seth roagan look alike) . I like this place!

I really like coming here for lunch.  The soups are always really yummy.  The sandwiches are fabulous.  I recently had the  sun-dried tomato/mozzarella panini....oh, I was so in heaven!  In fact, I've had all the panini's and they are all excellent.  What really gives t his place a five star rating is that there's a reward card you can get that allows you to earn freebies...i've gotten some free cookies, coffee, etc.  what a nice surprise!

Y'all I am not a major chain fan, but Panera has some decent food and some of the better bagels in town. That said, the jewel here is really the service. The manager, Ryan, goes above and beyond to make sure everything checks out for the customers. In a world where 2020 has been a mess, seeing that kind of customer service will matter for a long time to come.
Thanks Panera. And thanks Ryan.

Onion soup in a bread bowl is my all time favorite at Panera. Unfortunately they have it available only after 11am for some reason. This particular location took over 20 minutes to get food ready, coffee machine "was cleaning itself" therefore it took 30 minutes to prep it, well despite great food service need some improvement so 3 stars instead of 5.

I've been a frequent Panera patron for many years now, if I have a chance I would prefer to stop here over other chain coffee spots. 

This location however, is pretty awful. this is my second time to visit and definitely that last. The register workers are fine, its the food runners/floaters/makers of food that seem to really hate their job, as the portioning/attitude here is quite ridiculous. I ordered a Cha latte that came in a medium cup but the actual amount couldn't fill up a small cup. It was also not made correct. When I tried to return the chip they give with your order on it, b/c they failed to get it the first time, I was yelled at from across the store by a food runner and told unless I had a food order that I needed to have a seat! I'm a grown ass man trying to do your job, not a kid. So you give me half of what I order, I do your job, and you yell at me/tell me to sit?! Not to mention when I was brought my bagel that I ordered later, it was dropped on my table as if it was on fire and before I even had to say thanks, the food runner was gone, this place feels more like a Dennys than a Panera.

had the chicken chipotle avacado sandwich - wanted a pannini - not listed on their menu in the store as a pannini like some items on the menu have the word 'pannini' next to them - but  the staff said it was - and it was very good - bread just right - crunchy but not overdone, not too thick, a bit buttery - chicken was shredded / sliced but not wimpy and taste was fine - however could not taste any chipotle - and the only other spices were a small amount of diced red pepper - maybe they forgot the chipotle?  also had coffee (above average) and a big almost warm chocolate chip cookie from the tray marked 'warm from the oven'- yummers

YUMMY, delicious! I had never been here,  passed by many times and just looked like a snooty establishment, especially with a name like that! Who do they think they are? Well they are better than Subway & worth the prices! I couldn't decide what I wanted,  so I ordered the Napa Almond Chicken Salad Sandwich! Nice small chunks of chicken, thinly sliced, very thinly sliced almonds, believe me! The chicken had some sauce or dressing,  it wasn't mayo, the menu reads,  special dressing,  that was good! You need a moist sandwich, so you won't choke! It also had small bits of celery and seedless grapes! It had the perfect taste of sweetness with no salt or acidity.  The tomatoes were even good, and I hate tomatoes! It was served between 2 slices of Sesame Semolina Bread,  that was also great!  You can order a whole or half of a sandwich, I had the whole with a side of chips. I need to come back and try another sandwich, and for you healthy people,  the chicken they use has no antibiotics!  Join Panera Rewards to get your free pastry! Hell, I got the Texas sized cinnamon role,  which I heated up! Loved it all!  They have many pastries to chose from, plus soups and salads!

Standard starbucks, but home to a thriving college population. One of the busier starbucls I've seen in the evening with plenty of students and young professionals, but a great place to hang out. Nothing out of the ordinary about their drinks, if you've drank one cup of starbucks coffee, you've drunk them all. Interior space is well done, and it's nice and warm on a cold winter day.

After having visited several starbucks in the area, I am further convinced that the Davis Square store hosts the friendliest and most capable staff!

I used to be a fairly devoted Deisel fan, but since venturing over across the street, I find the atmosphere to be a nice change from the warehouse feel of Deisel. Once I tried the pumpkin spice lattes at Starbucks I started venturing over more often, and now I'll admit, i'm kind of hooked. 

Believe me, I'll be back at Deisel for the many wonderful menu items they offer, and to get up to date on the latest hipster fashions, but for now, i'm gonna try to find a spot by the fire at Starbucks.

So bad that I'm logging onto Yelp to leave a review for a Starbucks, which by definition should be consistent and predictable. I drink Starbucks' hazelnut latte like it's my religion and they messed it up twice in a row. First it was too bitter and then it had no flavor. The Barista offered to remake it and did so in less than 30s so I'm not sure what she did beyond frothing the milk. I threw it, of course.

The fireplace is broken and has been for years!

Not sure why they won't deal with this. It would be so much nicer if they would just fix it. Otherwise it's a pretty good Starbucks, though as others have said,  bathrooms could use more attention.
The Wi-Fi at this location is unusable. I went there to grab a latte and send a few emails, but had to give up after waiting for more than 10 minutes for a single web page refresh.

I hate to write a review of starbucks, but I have to give a shout out to my homies Dev and Dave. Dev runs a tight ship, and it's actually a rather nice starbucks. 

Fireplace, lots of seating, bookshelf (with books and games).

Apparently they also do a lot of special events here as well.
Place is good, but the free internet is waaaay too slow. I checked the download speed, it is 0.04 Mbps. But I bypassed this by purchasing Diesel cafes internet plan.
Service was fine but honestly it's so cold in this Starbucks that I could barely move my fingers. I came to do work, but had to leave. Other customers echoed my sentiments

As far as Starbucks go, this one is quite nice.  When the weather's cold, there's a gas fireplace inside surrounded by a bunch of comfy chairs that makes for a nice place to read.  When the weather's nice, there's outdoor seating available so you can enjoy the foot traffic through Davis Sq.  Only complaint is that getting a seat can sometimes be difficult.

BEST. STAFF. EVER.

(also the hottest.  mmm, steam my milk any day!)

My favorite Starbucks in Boston. It's in Davis Square, my favorite square in Boston. It's big, it's open late enough, it's got at least two Baristas and one cashier every day, and... They've got reliable WiFi! It's busy all the time, unless the Tufts students are at the bar (which is after 5:30pm usually). Besides that, it's got a fireplace and a patio for goodness sakes! Come on! That's seasonally perfect. Globalism be damned!!!

This place is alwayssss crowded. Good luck trying to find a seat if you arrive with  anyone else. I wish they had more small tables, but their setup fits a lot of people. Their bathrooms are kinda grimy and require a passcode. Still, I've always had a decent experience studying here. Their music is on point! Especially their holiday music :) Also, the cashier yesterday was one of the nicest I've encountered. And they even have a fireplace!

Ordinarily I don't frequent Starbucks.  My coffee comes from my girlfriend, work, or small cafe-type places, like the fine vegan lesbian establishment right across the street.

To cut to the quick, this Starbucks is the nicest I have seen.  Spacious, comfy chairs, quiet, and a nice view of Elm street.  It's air conditioned, has lots of table space and has free wi-fi, so there's no shortage of laptop/latte lifer folk here.  The woman next to me is working on her knitting.

It's Starbucks.  You're going to get the same drinks and food you could get at any Starbucks, which isn't bad.  If you're in for new drinks and quirky atmosphere, Diesel Cafe is 10 feet away.  If you need a Caramel machiatto and the means to Yelp about it immediately, this is your place.

It's specious, bathrooms are  clean. Often gets crowded because internet is free. In a way it's a cyber cafe. Better than other starbucks within 5 miles radius but lacking the ruling class of the city i.e., wealth and genius. Looks like a socialist hub. It's near a subway entrance and gets young  crowd from the nearby area.

Would have been at least  4 stars before the recent remodeling! Bleh. New manager= new seating, much less comfortable then before. No more open mic night which brought a lot of local musicians/artists to Davis Sq to chill and meet each other. they even took down the photos of the local musicians. now this Bux mainly caters to the working crowd it seems, with the window bar like seating appealing to those staring at a laptop screen for hours. This just isnt the comfy starbucks that made me not dislike starbux so much anymore, the atmosphere doesn't welcome those who want to meet  friends and laugh over lattes. I'm sad.

I will just say that I hate this place because they opened across the street from the Diesel Cafe, a non-corporate local coffee shop with real Davis Square flavor to it, plenty of space and great coffee.

This Starbucks features ultra-corporate coffee which tastes like poop, has funny names, and is overprices. It's not particularly large and is part of the selling-out and corporatization of Davis Square.

I have never seen so many macbooks lined up in one place in my life. Seriously, maybe fifteen or twenty at a time all along the longwood table down the middle of the store. People paying for coffee to use wifi. Unbeleivable business model. Good coffee. Fast line.
Trending down...once comfy, now messy leaning towards a little stinky.

Since moving from Spring Hill (Central Street area) to Davis Square, this has been my main Starbucks. I used to frequent the Somerville Avenue one just outside Porter Square.  The staff here are pretty friendly and I don't have any complaints about them.

I love how they remodeled the place creating the much needed more space for patrons. I do miss however the community book and boardgame section they used to have. Always busy, but the line never stays long, even on the way to work there's time to stop in for a latte.

The downside of course is being a corporation where everything has to be uniform, I wish they had better food options, and didn't have to shout the orders to each other. The staff can be too fast sometimes and I tell one person my order and when I get to the register (four of five people ahead of me) they already put it in and I wanted to add money to my gift carf first and use the gift card (free soy milk! and points towards free drink people). Not a big deal they can just delete the order, add the money, redo the order. It just happens pretty much all the time. Slow down and enojy the aroma of coffee :-P

As someone who used to work in a chain coffee shop I can appreciate how stress free, how clean, and how smooth this store is run. Its why I keep coming back again and again. Not really their fault, but I wish the city and the owners of Somerville Courtyard (where they are located) did a better job of enforcing the private area policy. I can't sit there and play guitar with an open case to collect change and sell cds, but the vagrants panhandle incessantly at the outdoor seating area which is usually a pigsty. I recommend staying inside where its cleaner and quieter.

In general I'm not a Starbucks person but the Starbucks in Davis has so much more to it than coffee I find myself going there to do everything from meet up with people, read a book, or do work on my computer. Aside from the waitstaff being almost abnormally pleasant (which I'm pretty sure they have to be) the place has a fireplace. What can I say, I love fireplaces and  a working fireplace in a Starbucks takes that Starbucks to a whole other level for me. It also has seating for every kind of coffee drinker.
