No, we're out of those too!  I don't understand how a store that only serves donuts can be sold out by 11 am. .....no explanation from the giggly girl at the counter......she seemed perplexed too!  Where are Dunkin Donuts made- onsite or off?  Couldn't be onsite because the donut makers would be making more!  So, where are these donuts coming from?  Kind of hard to figure out how this happens and sadly, it's not the first time.  So we walked next door to Mighty Fine and bought some breakfast tacos.  I would suggest that you ask your employees to do better than shrug and giggle when they run out of a customer's favorite donut.  Kinda makes you not wanna go back.

The iced coffee drinks have definitely gone downhill. I used to frequent DD more often, but the last 5 or so times I have gone to a DD they mess up the drink order or add way too much sugar. 

My recent visit was to finally try the new Beyond Sausage breakfast sandwich. On the first day of national release last month, they were out of stock. Well, I finally got to try it but the staff were kind of unhelpful and sketchy about it. They said they didn't have anymore and they were about to close. Then the guy in the drive-thru said he could "figure something out." I was a little scared of what he was "figuring out" but he handed us two Beyond Sausage sandwiches. They were pretty solid. Not an everyday thing but all right. 

Also, they have reduced their operating hours. DD used to be open til at least 11pm on some or most nights. They are now only open at the latest to 9pm. I asked the staff about this and they said they were just not getting enough business to stay open. I guess some folks are not as interested in doughnuts anymore. Go figure.
I ordered 2 raspberry jelly donuts which had nothing in them! Sad state when Dunkin can't fill the donuts.

Putrid.  Grotesque.  Awful.  

I got a plain glazed donut, took one bite and had to spit it out.  I was literally gagging.  People actually eat these donuts...on purpose?  

Don't even get me started on their coffee...maybe I'm a coffee snob but this coffee is worse than Folgers.

As someone who lived in New England for many years, this Dunkin location is such a disappointment. The only consistent thing here is that my order will be wrong, so I've tried doing mobile orders ahead of time, but somehow my orders are still not right. Most recently, the gal at the register wastes a long queue of cars time by texting on her phone while we're all waiting, instead of making sure the order is correct. 

The drive thru is convenient but you're better off visiting one of the locally owned coffee and donut shops nearby for a better overall experience.

I am from Massachusetts where there's a Dunkin Donuts on every block! As I traveled  (drove) down to Texas from Mass I would hit up Dunkin Donuts when we came across one. Once we left New England it was terrible! They don't understand simple ordering terms from up North and the service wasn't that good..

Now that that rant is over. I was very pleasantly surprised with this location! They got my order right, it tasted perfect. I've always been a sucker for their donuts. I have been to this location a couple times and have been happy. It is out of my way so I don't go often. I will definitely stop again when I am in that area.

Tried again this morning. What a waste of time&trouble (traffic). Every time come here, there's no donuts, well a few nobody wants.Same response, once they are gone,that's it.Really? 9am., open till 9pm.Not sure if they don't want more business or the workers are just being rude.

The afternoon crew needs to learn how to brew coffee.  The last three time I've been here past 10AM, the coffee was disgusting.  It tasted like sour, dirty water.  On the third time, I went back (after getting all the way to work) and ordered an iced coffee.  When I got to the window, I told her the last coffee she gave me was gross and undrinkable.  She replaced it but it tasted worse than the last one.  I am giving two stars due to the morning crew being able to make coffee.  I have contacted Dunkin Donuts via corporate customer service and have to hear anything back from them.  I tried calling the actual location to speak to a manager but NO ONE picked up the two times I called them.  I guess I'm not the only one who has experienced this, based on other reviews.

Felt like I was stepping into a club on Sunday morning at 8:45 am - super fun! Music was loud but great genre. Donuts were cold & hard but oh well. Columbian Coffee was outstanding. Matcha tea was only half filled in my cup?!?!??!?!?! Hmmmm, not sure if I'd return.

I have given this location multiple chances and almost every time it's a disappointment. Being from CT, I'd expect them to know what a "regular" coffee is (not black). Hell, Starbucks brainwashed us with all of their sizes why can't we just order a coffee in every Dunkin' like we can back home? Today was a simple TOASTED bagel w/ cream cheese... but no. Manager / franchise owner must not understand what Dunkin' is all about.

The most frustrating part of going to this Dunkin' is the inconsistency. I can understand the difficulty that the team here is experiencing with drive-through only, renovations, and working during COVID, but as someone who loves this chain, this location either hits the mark perfectly or completely drops the ball. 

Most of my poor experiences are on weekends when the line of cars stretches well into the street. The stress of the line creates a rush to move cars quickly I get that, but I can't tell you how frustrating it is as a customer to sit in your car for 20-30 mins for coffee, breakfast sandwiches and donuts only to pull away and find missing items, coffee that tastes absolutely awful and is undrinkable, stale donuts, and cold breakfast sandwiches.

Quality control issues aside, you work with products that folks have serious allergies to and putting the wrong ingredients into your coffee can put people in danger. Most food chains and other Dunkin' locations print stickers on their cups to highlight add-ins/changes - I've had many visits here where they don't use them and my order is usually wrong without them. Please use these stickers and take the time to make sure the orders you put together are correct in the drive-through lane.
Fastest drive thru in Austin plus great service!!!

Their customer service kind of sucks. I've gone there for coffee and breakfast sandwiches whenever I am running late many times. Every time I go the cashiers are always hostile. They don't have any manners or any sort of kindness. Their energy just tells you to f*** off. Krispy Kreme might not be great but I at least feel respected there.

Horrible service and poor work ethic.  Free advice,  try greeting your customers when they walk in.  I was the only customer in the store and was completely ignored by all the employees while trying to get service.  Go to krispy kreme or super doughnut instead.
This is the smelliest fast food joint I've ever been too. Service was terrible, I stood in line  for 15 minutes and there were only 3 people working there. Don't waste your time.
Avoid like the plague this Wendy's location. Pathetic service. It's called fast food for a reason!

Yeah... this is a terrible Wendy's. There's a lot of chain restaurants in the area, not too far from Disney, but this is one of the worst. It's poorly run, dirty, and slow. Among other problems: They got our order wrong. They needed a manager to give us a refund; we paid with credit and got a refund in lose change, including a stack of quarters. They ran out of soda cup lids. It was kind of dirty. Food was OK; typical Wendy's stuff.
This place is ghetto as hell. Rude people. I'm talking straight up ghetto ass rude! Dirty and they don't listen to your order which leaves things out.
The food was nasty and incorrect. Employees really out here working for minimum wage w/ minimum effort.

One star is hard to even click for this "restaurant" I waited in line for a frosty and a side salad for 23 minutes, before I finally spoke up and complained about the wait for my take out.  After taking this order home, I was disappointed to find out that the salad was incorrect and there was no dressing. To add, establishment is unsanitary and needs to be inspected. Wendy's should spend less time trying to see how much bacon they can fit into a sandwich and spend that time fixing their service.
Slow and uninterested service, mediocre food, and a FILTHY dining room. One of the worst service experiences on our Orlando trip. Avoid at all costs!

What can you always expect from a fast food joint.. This one is the same ...Fresh, hot, fast! The basic needs from a fast food restaurant! Couldn't really understand the guy in the drive through but my order was right but they forgot my small fries. Went back and the guy apologized and gave me a large for my inconvenience!

The drive through was prompt and accurate making sure our order was good. Food was hot and fresh but they were out of certain items that night making our choices more limited to just burgers with no special sauce and chicken nuggets.

On my only visit to this place, I thought it looked kinda dirty. There was a huge line to order food and only one cashier open. After that, it took another long wait to get my food. At least on that particular day, the place seemed to be understaffed, not sure if its a common thing here.

And the whole place is really loud, with tons of people unable to have a conversation without screaming. Not to mention the savages who refuse to clean up after themselves, leaving tables overflowing with garbage.

Wendy's have some really nice burgers, but this location was subpar, in my opinion, and there are much nicer alternatives close by (Chick fil A, McD's, Taco Bell, hell, even that 7-Eleven across the street can't be this bad).

Cons:
30 minute wait to order food
10 minute wait to receive the food
Dirty drink station
Dirty tables
Sticky floors 

Pros:
We didn't get sick from the food

Most Wendy's are pretty similar. There are even a few which are quite nice. This however is the first example I've seen far below the norm. Seriously, unless you are a frog looking for flies buzzing around while you wait for your slowly served and incorrect order, just stay away.

If you are in a hurry do NOT go here. Slowest service ever. Friendly staff but understaffed. Bad management!!! Always wait in a slow moving, long line. We have been to many Wendy's that are great because my boys love it but they are so under staffed and slow here. I guess management doesn't  care since it is in a tourist area and they don't need repeat business. We have only been to this location a few times and every time I come back I remember why we rarely come to this location.

I dont eat fast food but disney has terrible food so we ate here. Really good burger.  Better then the ones back in my state...yall do right on the cheese. Tons of cheese and thicker patties i feel like. 

Quick service
Soda machine that u can get any drink. Idk the name of the machine but yall know. Grape sprite machine or vanilla root beer. Love those

I was impressed with how clean this place was. I was surprised by the the pictures on here from others when I searched to write a review. Maybe those reviews helped them work on the staff, because the manger is definitely a working and helpful manager and very nice as well as his staff. The food tastes better than the Wendy's where I'm from. The order was correct and the fries fresh and hot. Also they have Raspberry Powerade. This is a good place.

Worst Wendy's I've been to. There's always trash everywhere and the employees never seem to care about it. They take a long time for simple orders and the cashiers typically don't know what to do half the time. The only bright side is the CM frostie

I had to wait to get to my car to write this rave review as they didn't have any napkins out. If I could give 0 stars that would have still been too high for this experience.  To start the wait was long but acceptable as it's a long weekend.  The issue was trying to find any clean table to eat at.  Luckily before they ran out of napkins we were able to get some and clean our own table.  The waiting to get our food was a disaster as they called us up and when we went they didn't have it ready.  They also were out of apple slices and strawberries for the kids and just through in fries without asking.  They also didn't have the Italian dressing either. Did I mention this was after I had to tell the manager that he may want to have the guy sweeping the floor stop doing that so that he could throw away the trash that was already over flowing over the trash can.  Literally it was all over the place.  It took about 5 minutes for the about 22 year old manager to get someone to do that.  The last straw was when we found a hair in my daughters nuggets.  Wait there was also one in her fries that we didn't ask for.  Needless to say I won't be coming back to this Wendy's and I am pretty sure we are scarred for all Wendy's moving forward.  This place wAs disgusting.  As one guy in line next to me said, this place is a f'en nightmare.

Was on vacation fromMiami with the family and their kids, it was around 930pm 07/08/2017 and stopped to get food to go from the inside lobby. The line was very long and only one cashier that looked to uninterested in what she was doing. Manager was preparing trays and kept asking cashier to help which was letting the line grow uncontrollably and making those in the line wait longer. Half the line left and by the time it was my turn they no longer had full portion salads. Cashier was purposely putting away cups slowly so that people would wait longer and leave. Even if my life depended on it I will never return to this location.

I've been here multiple times and it has never been a good or quick experience. This place is always packed, and they never have enough staff to serve their customers well. The trash is overflowing. There's only one register open, and one person putting orders together. The kiosks are broken. For a place that receives plenty of business due to their proximity to Disney, you'd think that they're used to only serving 4 people a day.

It's Wendy's... All I expect is consistency and halfway decent service. Well in the one shot this place got they blew it. How hard is it to take an order when I'm standing there, right in front of you, telling you what I want on my burger?  Then as I stand there with my Frostys melting I have to ask three different people to get me my damn lemonade?!?

Awful service.

After watching my 4 friends spend almost $400 at a restaurant on the Disney campus, I skipped the indecipherable menu for a jaunt through the ever-dependable Wendy's drive-thru. With a coupon, my husband and I enjoyed 2 spicy chicken sandwiches and fries for less than $6--about 2% of what our friends spent on their over priced, under-impressive meal. Totally worth the money.

Location is garbage. They have self serve kiosks where you can order a double stack 4 for $4. However this is only if you use a card. If you want to order it at the counter they tell you they don't have it. So if you pay cash there is a different menu available to you?
If I could give 0 stars I would've. The owner of this franchise should be ashamed. Horrendous customer service, slow wait times,  and mediocre quality of food.

Do yourself a favor and go right next door to Chick-fil-A instead! I came here once on a Sunday, because Chick-fil-A was closed. I was looking for a QUICK bite to eat because I didnt feel like cooking so I thought why not Wendys? .... worst decision ever! I got my small frosty when I was done ordering but I had to wait 45 MINUTES for my 8 nuggets and a medium fries! NO EXAGGERATIONS.. so not cool. By the time my food was ready, my frosty was melted and I only get a frosty to eat it together with my fries.

I couldn't believe how slow this place was. Poor tourists weren't even complaining much because they probably never been to a Wendys before. This is not how other Wendys are, fyi. There was a looong line of us waiting, it was ridiculous! It's not even like they were understaffed or something happened with their fryer.. supposedly this place is notorius for long wait times. I say, close down for a little and hire new staff or train better. The employees here lack a sense of urgency and effenciency. The worst part about the long wait is that the employee didn't apologize for it or at least explain what happened.

I went inside today and had to leave after sitting down. The smell of the place is bad.  Restaurants can smell but cleaning the carpet can help. This place is disgusting.  The food meh

Last visit to this location.

Sigh.  Sadly, I did not read the reviews first.  I mean...it's Wendy's.  The whole point of a chain like this is you get what you expect - the same as all the others.
Sadly, not the case here.  Just move on.  Please read the reviews first and know they aren't lying.

The drive-through took FOREVER.  I looked inside - they weren't busy and the drive-through line was not long (maybe 4 cars).  Once I got my food - it was all old, stale fries, and not warm.

yuck.

We stopped here twice for the kids during a trip to Orlando. The location is convenient for Disney park visitors going to the water parks and Downtown Disney, but we're going to avoid it in the future.

The food service is extremely slow. It took 30 minutes to order and get our food, and they got two sandwich orders wrong -- a spicy chicken sandwich had honey mustard on it instead of mustard and a chicken sandwich that was supposed to be plain had all the condiments.

Even worse, the dining area was not clean. Tables were dirty and in the time we were there, no employees ever came out to take care of them. If that's how the public areas look, what's the kitchen like?
I wish I could give it zero stars!  I ordered the pretzel bacon cheeseburger.  I was disgusted when I bit into it.  The meat was so cold in the middle.  Never again!

I don't know why I keep coming back... it's a continuous wreck of cars and tourists and people having no idea where they are going. Today alone I've invested 30 minutes in the drive thru and I haven't even paid yet- can't get out of the line due to the series of giant 12 person seater vans that parked in the compact spaces therefore blocking the traffic flow to my side and not letting me out. It's not worth this just for a soda and chicken nuggets. Service is so so- nothing special, though I was told when I ordered to "pull around to pay when you have a chance".... what does that even mean? Never had a problem with food, mostly just the insane amount of people here, disregard for traffic and parking laws, and no one does anything about it.

The dining room was filthy, the trash cans were overflowing, the cashiers were uninterested, I got a to-go order when I wanted a dine-in order, they forgot to give me my drink, and the food was incredibly tasteless. This is not a Wendy's I would ever go back to.

Wait Time = 30 Minutes at 11:30PM

 Everyone is tired from their Disney journey and looking for a quick fix. Why not some Wendy's! Yay! Oy!
 Long drive thru line, let's go inside. Somehow the line is longer because there is only one cashier to serve a 20+ person line. Everyone behind the counter is slowly waddling and taking their sweet time to do anything. You can't tell me that rushes like this have never happened before. You easily have 5 employees back there. Pick up the pace, everyone wants to go home or back to their hotel. 
 Standard Wendy's UGH food otherwise.
 Slowest "fast" food I've ever had.
I would put one if I could awful. Messed up order and takes forever. Avoid. Employees don't care at all. Major problems here.

We stopped here after getting out of Disney World late because nothing else was open. The McDonald's was closed for remodeling down the street and we didn't want to venture too far from our hotel.  The drive-thru service was extremely slow. I watched every employee in there doing everything else except help customers. It took 10 minutes to get 3 burgers which had no special requests. 

And for the grand finale.... There were 2 long pieces of black hair on my burger.  I threw up.  This place is disgusting.  Shame on me for not reading the reviews of this place before going to eat there. I feel sick again after having to relive this nightmare via yelp review.

As long as you stick with the drive-thru window, the CP Central Wendy's is okay.  I drove here frequently for lunch from Old Key West / Saratoga Springs (since those resorts lack cast cafeterias) and never had problems getting my food in a timely manner.  

Apparently the dining room is entirely another matter, but compared to the uniformly abysmal service of the MetroWest "Apathetic Wendy's", this may as well be "onstage".

This is the only Wendy's (that I know of) within a 5 mile radius of my office and I was totally craving french fries and a Frosty. 

I know this one is CP Central being right next door to one of their apartment complexes, but you would think after being in this location for years that the management would figure out how to make the inside ordering more efficient. There are no stanchions to indicate a queue, so the line goes from the counter back to the other side of the restaurant, past the garbage cans that are overflowing and have sticky soda all over the floor. There's usually one person taking orders and they wait until the food is ready for the customer that just ordered until they take the order of the next customer. 

All in all, I waited in line for 25 minutes to get one meal and when asking for ketchup packets, they suggested I get ketchup out of the pump dispensers since they were out of packets... which wouldn't have been too bad of a suggestion, but I ordered my meal to go and I don't think open containers of ketchup would fare well in the car. 

I wouldn't recommend this location unless it's a dire Frosty emergency.

I have been to this location a few times and it's always with coworkers not on my own. The service is always pretty much the same. This most recent visit the cashier was not very friendly. She rang up part of my friends order incorrectly and acted like she really didn't care, but thankfully the expeditor righted it for no extra charge. The cashier kind of made me quesiton why I would even want to eat there. 

The food was fresh and the frosty was delicious as always. The restaurant was clean which was nice considering it was lunch time. 

Happy Dining

The fat Hispanic girl at the drive thru forgot my chicken nuggets after she told me everything was in there.  Luckily I check my bag and told her she didn't put it in there.  She gave me attitude and didn't even apologize.

It was our first visit from NYC to Orlando after we checked in to our hotel we went for a fast food and there was a Wendy's across the street. Our cashiers name was Samer he was very friendly and nice. After I ordered a kids meal for my children he offered a frosty for the kids. After we paid he tried to hand them to us one of the managers named Andi came and asked him why did you do that. She snatched them out of his hand and threw them in the garbage. Then he asked another co worker there and he said no you have to give it to them because it comes with a kids meal, he ended up giving us the ice cream. There was bubbles coming out of them like they were gone bad. We ended up throwing them out in the garbage. I will never order anything from Wendy's anymore for the unprofessional act that Andi the manager did. Andi kept on giving us dirty looks. After she gave me my change back she didn't even say thank you. This is lack of service from a manager that is suppose to be handling any problem in the store professional. This was not expected from a manager. The cashier was Samer he was more professional and was smiling and came to the table and apologized to us. It is suppose to be the other way around the manager is suppose to fix any issues in the store but in this location it looks like the other way around.

By far the worst Wendy's I have ever been to! The Coke freestyle machines were out of everything but water on one machine and out of several flavors on the other. My daughter's bacon on her sandwich is raw, my husband ordered a double no onions, gets a single with onions and my burger is too salty to eat. I am not from here but would not recommend this stop to anyone!

Luckily we didn't have a 1.5-star experience here. Having watched the staff handle other orders, however, I can see how that happens. 

The staff just needs a little retraining and to focus more. We had to repeat items as we placed our order- we weren't even in the drive thru. I was asked what kind of sauce I wanted. I asked for sweet 'n' sour, she blindly put BBQ in the bag. We ordered 2 value fries- the cartons were barely filled. If you're going to use a certain size container, fill it!

Otherwise, the food was fresh and tasty. They just need to work on their execution.
It's literally called an Apple Pecan salad.... but mine was missing the pecans.  Boohoo.

I use to live near this Wendy's and they saved me sometimes, specially after long shifts as a Disney CP. The restaurant is kind of dirty and they mess up the orders quite frequently, but they try and it's very cheap, so it's ok...

Tip: they give Disney cast members have a free frosty.

So this place is one of the worst Wendy's I've been to. I ordered and Asiago Ranch with no Tomatoes because well I'm allergic and if eaten will have to go to the hospital it's not because I don't like them. I go to the window to pick up my order and check the sandwich to find out that there was in fact a tomato. The person working the drive thru completely spaced out and forgot my drink as well. I won't be going back.

Stopped in after the parks STARVING and there is a huge line wrapped around the building so we went in and again a HUGE line. Finally got up to the counter and the guy taking our orders literally screwed every single one of our orders up. With me personally he Interrupted me twice and then insisted that I do a 4 for 4 meal (not what I wanted) so I finally was like fine I'll do a 4 for 4. He then proceeded to charge me for everything I order on the 4 for 4 menus separately. So my normal order which is usually $3 should have been $4 bit actually cost me $8 because this guy is a clown. Seriously, skip it and drive to another location for better service and treatment

Wish I could give this place zero stars. Worst customer service I have ever experienced.  The lady at the register had the biggest attitude and was acting as if we were an inconvenience while ordering. They messed up orders in front of mine, hoping ours will be fine, we take it to-go (which was first given to us on a tray as if we were dining in when at the beginning of the order the lady asked if we were dining in or carry out. We drive all the way home and are ready to eat.... and have our order incorrect!!!!! HIGHLY recommend hiring new staff who are properly trained. Never coming here ever again.
Worst Wendy's I've ever been too, took us half an hour to get a 4for4. My schools on campus Wendy's is a million times better stay away from this one
My son is diary free ask for no cheese the person didn't even speak English and gave him cheese when he asked not to have cheese. Louzy service!! Wonder why you are open your reviews stink!!
This place makes Baltimore look like heaven! Filthiest place I've ever eaten- never returning!
Best jr bacon cheese burger I've had from Wendy's yet! I wish they made them like in Brandon FL lol! Fresh and very impressed!
Made me pull up and wait 10 minutes and got my order wrong and undercooked anyways.  I won't be back.  Eating at the gas station is a better option.  I wish Chick-fil-A would open on Sunday

I guess based on the reviews we had a lucky break here today! We stopped after several hours at Disney. We had to circle the building twice to find parking because the available spots I originally saw up front are for compact cars, but no big deal, parking around the back was open & just as convenient. We walked in to a clean restaurant & a short line at the register, & then noted their order kiosks. Of the 3 there, 1 was operating and in use, & the other 2 were not working. Oh well, the line was still short so we didn't wait long to order. Once at the counter, our order was taken by what appeared to be a new employee. He was nice but very slow, & didn't know how to apply our coupon or enter the half chocolate/half vanilla Frosty we wanted & often order without question. Again, no big deal, we weren't in a hurry. Our food was ready fairly quickly, & when we sat our order looked delicious & was accurate - except that the Frosty was vanilla. Not a huge issue, we were pretty hungry & we like vanilla so we just accepted it. The burger & fries were hot, & the Southwest avocado chicken salad was fresh ~ and delicious! Overall this was a positive visit - clean; good service; quick, delicious & (mostly) accurate food - maybe we did get lucky, but I'm happy to return!

Total dump worst Wendy's ever letting down the brand. Dirty, unhygienic, service chaotic and disorganised, no ketchup, no help, dirty tables, no one cares, dropped in second time as next to hotel thought it was a bad night. No just a bad manager and team

Got drink order wrong. Got food order wrong. Took 3 minutes at the window just to get her attention to tell her the drink order was wrong. Spent easily 5-6 min at window. Didn't ask us to pull forward while we were waiting so everyone behind us had to wait. While we were waiting I heard an employee say "well I know you didn't make those 6 wraps so......"
Definitely 1 star. 

She did however fix our issues professionally and apologized. Maybe I'll give two stars. 

Update: just hot back on the highway and realized I have no fork for my salad! We're back to a one star!

I've given this place my last dollar.  
Just visited Wendy's 13480 State Road 535 Lake Buena Vista, FL.  I pulled up to the Drive Thru and there was a car at the speaker, he was waiting to order, not sure how long he had been there.  Waited over 5 minutes, he still hadn't placed his order, was waiting on someone to come on the speaker, 3 more cars pulled behind me.  Waited another 2 minutes before driving around and going inside, three was one person at the counter trying to pick up an order for delivery and was having issues, no one was helping her other than the girl at the counter.  There were 3 people in back, one at the counter, one on the line and one in the drive thru.  2 other emerged from the back, ironically both on their phones, texting or something, they looked like Manager, neither offer any assistance.  Another person had walked in with me from the car behind me and we were both in line waiting another 5 minutes to place an order.  The Delivery girl left after having issues with payment and no help from any manager.  The person who walked in with me placed his order and the girl at the counter walked away, took another 2 minutes to come back and take my order.  It took another 3 minutes for someone to start making my sandwich and which point the girl on the line walked away after pulling out the bun.  Another 2 minutes later she returns from who know where, maybe the bathroom to finish my sandwich.  The Man in front of me got his order promptly, a Big Bag, and finished it by the time I finally got mine.  I had asked twice for my order to go, and it was placed on a tray, I had to remind them again it was to go.  No Napkins, spoon for the chili or any verbal apology for any delay at any point, I wasn't even given a copy of my receipt, probably so I couldn't complain.  I understand if the store is busy, but there was no one in the store other than us 3 and any urgency to live up to the term fast food was never present.  The managers walked from front of house to back of house never offering any help or guidance.  Very disappointed in this location as it is usually busy and takes forever, this time I thought I hit it right because there was no one there, no luck.  I love Wendy's but I won't be going back to this location any longer. Disappointment after Disappointment....  I have given them enough chances to serve their customers promptly, accurately  and with a smile.

This has to be one of the worst Wendy's in the world.  I mean come on everything that happens as this location is terrible.  I have even tried to complain to corporate but they ignore me once I tell them what location it is.  

They have cash registers that do not work, most of the employees can not understand you so they end up messing up the order, they are rude, the lobby is dirty, they usually will get your order wrong, and the mangers are all very rude.  In one case the manger had my pay and then told me that my card may be charge twice because her cash register is broken and it was a known issue.

Anyone reading this review do not go to this Wendys's location.  They should not be open, and it is beyond crazy to me that corporate lets this location act the way it does and ignores people when they complain.  This review is only for this location.
1/5
-Trenton V

Holy yikes this one is kind of a mess. So we headed in cause we were hungry and needed a bite after a few hours in the park. The line was confusing. There are three ordering screens that you can use (one was broken when we were there - pictured), or you can order at the register like normal. The cashier asked us to repeat our order a few times, which was odd cause it was just two chicken nuggets meals with frosties...

Your name is put on the monitor to show where you are on the wait list. They also call your name. It was very slow - like 15 minute wait to get our food. There were several dirty tables (pictured) despite staff standing around behind the register bay not doing anything. 

The food was okay so that was the only saving grace here to bump it from a one-star rating. 

Overall: D
It felt chaotic and just messy. Wouldn't return unless I had to.

I use to live by this Wendy's while working for Disney. It was bad man. All the college kids live right by this Wendy's. From the condiments area not stocked and drinks running out to just pure filth. At night there were long wait lines and unprofessional employees. That was 4 YEARS AGO. I recently visited about a week ago while on vacation, things haven't changed. I'd advise you to eat elsewhere.

1 star only! I did not even eat here. So this place is actually a gas station. Not that they just share a parking lot but they are the same building. SO much so, that the gas stations and Wendys do not have their own bathrooms. YES! This is sickly correct statement. Being on the road the first thing I do I go to the bathroom first and guess what I smell. GAS and what might be burned grease with an oil slick on the floor. It looked and smells so wonderful for a restaurant. Now, that we know that bathroom was dirty I would also like to express how the air in this bathroom smells like fresh burgers. 

I got this thought in my head, is there gas in the meat? Will my burger be flammable? Are truck drivers also tracking oil and burned grease stank smell all over the food side? I tried to brush it off but while waiting in like I thought OMG, These burgers are going to give me gas going down and ill end up with flammable farts from the gas and grease in my burgers. I'm not talking about the grease that comes from cooking the flavor out of burger patties either.

I pulled into the Wendy's lake Buena Vista area and the manager  was named Brandon. I tried to order a chocolate Frosty and he said that their frosty maker was down. I then asked him what time it would be closed and he said 2 AM. I then told him it was only 1:34AM and then he decided to tell me that the frosty machine was closed around 1:30 AM. I asked him, which was it,  do they close the Frosty machine at 2 AM or before 1:30 AM. ? He said they close at around 1:30 AM. Piss poor customer service at best!

Half filled order of cold fries, stale cheeseburger bread, and lots of careless attitude. And why is the manager walking around in a dingy random gray t shirt? Also no gloves handling food, no mask. Really?? Clearly why the employees under her can care less about proper service. Asked them to fix it and I received the annoyance of asking a 10 Yr old to do their homework. Who can I contact to rectify this?

Came here in 12/17/2020 Thursday at 07:47pm and could not believe the mess I was seeing. I get there and there's people waiting by the counter waiting for the meals. The workers looked busy and seemed working at a fast pace. I'm there waiting patiently and no attends me. I go to one of the self serve machines to order but it's broken. I go to the front and see maybe a supervisor and this lady is blaming another employee for a wrong order in front of me. I felt bad for the poor guy. Then I get assisted and they take my order. While waiting a guy and his family come to the register to complain they got the wrong order and the employee does not say sorry just says " what did you guys order? Okay hold on" and a few minutes later gives them the right order and does not say sorry or anything and tells them " just throw away the wrong order over there( points to trash)

I get my order and double checked it because everyone here seemed like they were new or just had too much going on at work. I ordered apple pecan salad. They gave me a south type of dressing and not the pomegranate. No pecans, no forks or napkins. I kindly ask the front employee and she just turns around and grabs the right dressing and pecans and says nothing. 

Just seemed unprofessional here and a bunch of employees running around doing either a lot or they must be new.
Fast & delicious! They were friendly too. Fries were great. I needed to add to my order & they accommodated my request.

Well we were going to grab a bite to eat quickly but had to go to bathroom when we got there and they were disgusting. Garbage everywhere. Toilets were so nasty I wouldnt even go to the bathroom. (Poop and pee all over them)

They took the orders of me and the guy behind me and made us park our cars even when no one else was in line. Seems like a silly waste of time. Everyone inside was frantic for some reason even though they weren't busy. Weird fast food interaction.
My order has been delayed 40 minutes already and my drivers been at the location for quite some time now. Shouldn't take 40 minutes to cook 1 burger and fries.
